text:
I recently bought $50 worth of hair products I was specifically looking for.  While I looked three salespeople were in a conversation a few aisles away.  When I was walking toward the cashier, one asked if I needed any help.  Yes about ten minutes ago!  The first thing the cashier asked me was, "What's your phone number?"  Really?  No "hello", have you found everything you were looking for?"  I responded it was unlisted. She looked panicked and told me it didn't go anywhere.  Then why ask?  She then asked me if I had a daughter?  I could give her phone number.  OMG, totally inappropriate question.  Besides if I'm not giving you my phone number why would I give you my daughter's she assumed I had?  I told her I don't give out personal information.  

I most likely will continue shopping there, but please stop this policy of asking customers for their phone numbers!!

Based on other reviews I see I am not the only one who received horrible service. Walked in and there were two ladies at the front counter, both of them made eye contact and neither one of them acknowledged me. I walked around the store for 10 minutes up and down aisles looking for a particular product, as another sales associate joined the two upfront. I still wasn't greeted nor asked if I need help. I was quickly reminded of why I stopped shopping at Ulta. Back to Sephora I go. I refuse to put money into a business whose sales associates cannot even help me let alone say hello.

I specifically came to this store because it was advertised online they started carrying a particular deodorant that I wanted to try. I walked around the beauty/skincare section roughly for 15 minutes looking for it. Not once was I offered any help and the store was not busy. Two employees held a quick convo in the aisle I was in and still neither one offered help. Having years of work experience in retail, I was disappointed in their workers in a brand new store; typically they have the best employees from other nearby locations open the store and set the standard.
Nonetheless, I will not return to this store due to their poor customer service.

Received a great haircut from Jess.

I needed a quick appt for a work thing, after calling around to a few salons Ulta was the only salon that I could find that was open on Sunday & could schedule me with less than 24 hour notice.

Jess was awesome, she did my hair exactly like I asked & didn't try to talk me out of anything (every stylist I go to try to talk me out of the cut that I want, and I've had the same haircut for 15+ years). I brought in pictures to show how I wanted my bangs & she cut them exactly the way the picture look.

I love the cute. It is easy to style. Looks super clean (especially for long hair). I've had the cut for almost 2 weeks & have received many compliments.

Agree with the other reviews that are unhappy with this location.. I am about to replace all my makeup .. lucky to have several gift cards to help.. this location is so close . I went in Thursday to start looking around .. I was basically ignored and even spent 15 minutes browsing. There was a sales person with a white coat on and was too busy to bothered as she was stocking makeup in the front of the store .. left and decided to come back the next day. a Friday .. even took a ulta bag  from the lobby to show I was getting a few items .. this time at least she yelled to me welcome to ulta but that was it ..it was the same sales clerk and was too busy to come up to me because she was too busy stocking the same exact spot as the day before .. after 10' minutes I left .. with several other ultras are close this one won't get my money

The store is aesthetically well-kept, only because that's all the employees seem to occupy themselves with probably. I felt uncomfortable asking an employee to put on one of the new Tarte bronzers because the two women occupying the Clinique area were way too busy chatting. I literally walked around the same 3 aisles with the sample palette in my hand trying to be patient until I finally said forget it. They don't seem to care about customer service, they lack every sense of retail etiquette. Only when you leave you get a, "have a nice day." 

Also, the woman of color with long braids nearly hit my car after she got off her shift when she cut me off abruptly at a red light. This Ulta location is an awful experience both inside and out. Needless to say, I'll only be going to the one in Springfield Mall from now on.

I stopped by this new location recently and had an overall great experience. The store was clean and the staff members were helpful. I was immediately greeted as soon as I walked in and the staff made sure I was helped but didn't follow me around as I was browsing. I will be coming again soon! It's very conveniently located in a shopping center right by Whole Foods.

The staff are so rude,bad products it's destroyed my hair the worst result you will find in this salon, Save your money and go to a professional salon does not steal your own money and give you a very bad service..

A brand-spanking new Ulta at Ellis Preserve (a Whole foods will soon be there, too.).  Super clean and well organized and only about 6 weeks open.

I was able to pick up some holiday-packaged gift sets (Like Lorac alter-ego lip glosses) for a good value.  Also you can get gift cards.  There is a small skin care spa area and a hair care/hair salon.

This area will be clogged with holiday traffic soon for sure!

It's such a nice location here and the girls that work there are very helpful, especially Destiny. I was in a crunch to buy gifts for a party and she helped me pick great products in a hurry! I love this location better than Plymouth meeting and king of Prussia. It's clean, ample parking, very helpful associates. They just started carrying NARS as well!

The service there was not good. The employees are nothing but liars. They are uneducated, lazy, not smart at all. The first one doesn't know how to handle the customers money, The second one claims that the number never came through, then later, this lazy employee called the manager in which she doesn't have the key to the cash register. After all that, we had left their store because it got mom agitated.
Great looking store.bad customer service! Went in wanting to revamp my makeup and left with two things. Girls weren't helpful, but that could have been due to the color of my skin. Next stop Sephora

It was my first time visiting the store and it was beautiful, clean, and surprisingly not at all busy during my visit. My sole purpose was to buy something in the store that I saw online. This location did not have it, but instead of offering to check another store for me...the employee said "I don't know, we don't have a way to check another store, you'd have to call them." It would have been nice customer service to take a little step to help me. I was prepared to spend around 200 dollars, but instead of getting the other things I had on my list, I decided to take all of my business elsewhere. 
Another staff member stopped me on my way out and offered to call another store for me, but it was too late. I had already started making calls on my phone. Ulta needs a system that allows them to search other stores for product, staff needs to be more helpful in finding products, and the website needs to allow users to see what stores their products online are available at.

Always out of stock of what you know will be popular. Staff useless , I asked her to check stock in the back she went back and literally within 2 minutes came out and said no we have none. At least spend a little more time pretending to look. I went to Exton, Delaware both a bust.

Third and Final trip to this location - visited around Christmas and was once again disappointed by the lack of staff and the attitude of the younger women that work there.  I waited for someone to even look in my direction while I waited in the designated checkout location.  Out of the three cashiers - one was trying to help someone with a return, the second one left the counter to help someone that had a question and the third cashier was nearest to me was on the phone trying to solve a customer issue - she reluctantly hung up from the call and waited on me, never looked at me, mumbled an apology for the wait all without ever making eye contact ever....stock is always low, many shelves are bare and staff is scarce on the sales floor...the staff that is there looks like you are bothering them if you have a question - the Ulta store in Springfield is night and day different - plenty of helpful staff..done with this location !

Great location at Routes 3 and 252. Attentive, helpful customer service; two different associates assisted me with locating a fragrance and color matching some foundation. Well-stocked store with tons of testers and great deals. Pleasantly surprised after reading less than stellar reviews on here.

I don't know why I keep going in this store but the help there doesn't even know where things are in the store. The shelves are never stocked once things are sold out. You can wait weeks to get what you're looking for. Their books that are mailed out have all the good coupons and free gifts to online shoppers only. And a few times I've forgotten the 2.50 or 3.50 coupon in store and regardless that I'm a member there they wont give it to you. So disappointed with Ulta.

I was so happy to find out they put an Ulta in Newtown Square. I live in the area and love Ulta. I have been here several times. I came here on Sunday and the ignorance by the employees this day was the icing on the cake. Every time I come in. I'm never greeted. Employees are always up front talking about their personal lives. When you do need something or you want to leave. They are rude because you interrupted them. You also have to remind them to put your phone number in the POS so you get your points. I asked about NARS make-up they had I was looking for what was back in stock. The girl screamed across the store regarding a lip-gloss. Didn't come help me to talk screamed across the store. That's just pure laziness. I was so mad. I left and said thanks for no help. I had to post. I don't know who the manager is. Do something about the rude behavior, laziness and lack of knowledge on the product. 


*** Update 10/25/2018. ***.  I came back to give 5 stars. There are new people here. They are always helpful and do say Hi to you when you walk in.

I am so happy with my experience here in the Newtown Square Ulta. So knowledgeable and helpful. I highly recommend asking the staff if you are unsure about anything. Obviously with the virus, they can't open testers. I had a nearly empty pressed powder from Mac and that's so far away, so I was trying to find a match in my skin color. I picked Clinique and Claudia helped me with finding a similar product (I would have DEFINITELY bought the wrong powder) and she, within a minute, found the winner. Thanks,  Claudia, for your guidance, and thanks to Ulta for hiring excellent employees and treating them well enough that they visibly enjoy their jobs!
I would add that I live a mile away so I am often at this store, and once they even helped me find my lost phone by calling it for me while I searched my car. When I go to Sephora, I can never get anyone's attention and when I do they are annoyed. Way different experience here.

The difference between the N.S. Ulta and the Springfield Ulta is night and day. There is much more product available at Springfield and the Customer Service is 100% better at Springfield. It's really a shame Ulta's reputation is being damaged because of this one store.

You walk in this store, you look around for what you need, and not one employee asks if you need help. There are at least 5 workers in the floor doing nothing but chatting with each other. I'm staying with the Springfield store for sure.

I was so happy to find out they put an Ulta in Newtown Square. I live in the area and love Ulta. I have been here several times. I came here on Sunday and the ignorance by the employees this day was the icing on the cake. Every time I come in. I'm never greeted. Employees are always up front talking about their personal lives. When you do need something or you want to leave. They are rude because you interrupted them. You also have to remind them to put your phone number in the POS so you get your points. I asked about NARS make-up they had I was looking for what was back in stock. The girl screamed across the store regarding a lip-gloss. Didn't come help me to talk screamed across the store. That's just pure laziness. I was so mad. I left and said thanks for no help. I had to post. I don't know who the manager is. Do something about the rude behavior, laziness and lack of knowledge on the product.

The difference between the N.S. Ulta and the Springfield Ulta is night and day. There is much more product available at Springfield and the Customer Service is 100% better at Springfield. It's really a shame Ulta's reputation is being damaged because of this.

Store is clean, organized, and somewhat well-stocked. What I mean by the latter is that while there are a lot of options for almost any beauty need, there was some bare shelf space where popular items had gone out of stock, particularly in hair care. I could have just caught them before they restocked, but that was my experience. Couldn't get things I went there to buy. 

I read all the unfortunate low-star reviews about the associates before my visit, but visited with an open mind. I was greeted when I went in (one of 2 customers that night). When I had questions, though, I had to go to the registers to ask, because no one was on the floor. Up front, the two associates were talking with one other customer...for a while. Annoying that they felt it appropriate that they both tend to her, and make me wait (I was pressed for time to get to another store before it closed). After a few minutes, one assoc took the customer off down an aisle, and the other remained. She did not approach me after watching me linger for a question all that time, which is not very professional. She was, however, more professional when I approached / spoke to her. 

I asked about availability of any Chanel and Lancôme products, which she said she hopes to be stocking soon. This was great news for locals like me, who don't want to trek to the mall. She said she has tons of customers requesting the two brands, and they should have both in a couple months. She said their Exton store has them, and it's just a matter of time before they do as well. I will check back, and hope to see them in stock soon!

Aside:
When I go to Lancôme at Nordstrom / Neimans (KoP), or call Lancôme's toll free number (800-526-2663), they pronounce it "Lawn-comb" but at Ulta, after I pronounced it that way, the associate made a point of saying "Lan-come" (like the a in "land"), like I was in error. Just annoying when someone "corrects" me with their own mispronunciation. I don't really care how you pronounce it, but if you're going to "toe-may-toe / toe-mah-toe" me, I'll "toe-may-toe / toe-mah-toe" you back.

I went to this store for the first time and asked a sales associate for some advice on a product.  She took me to a VERY expensive option.  When I asked if there was an option that wasn't so overpriced she made me feel like a cheapskate and told me I'd need to go look on the drugstore side of their product selection.  It was clear she didn't care what I as they customer needed, she only cared about selling a $24 tube of eyebrow gel.  I found the exact same product in her store for $8.  Why did she have to make me feel like a cheapskate for wanting value?  BRUTAL

Unfortunately I will have to echo the comments of some of the ladies below me. I came to this location on my lunch break to quickly grab some Mario Badescu products- quickly being the operative word. I found my products and one employee walking by me asked if I was doing okay and let me know I had grabbed a tester by accident. Awesome, that was very nice of her.

When I got to the check out counter, different story. I counted not 1, not 2...but FIVE different employees in the store doing various tasks while ignoring me standing up front. One was merchandising shelves, looked up at me..and kept on merchandising. One walked through an aisle, saw me and kept walking. Not even a "hey we will be with you in a moment"...nothing. I stood there for probably 3-4 minutes waiting for someone to help until I walked over to the girl who was merchandising to ask if she could ring me up. There was NO one else in the store guest wise either.

This is extremely frustrating when I could have ordered this product online directly from Mario Badescu. Next time I'll think again before giving Ulta my business when I can order online.

This Ulta Beauty is great! To be honest, I'm not a fan of the Springfield location so I'm happy to find another ulta in the area that's great. The employees are always very friendly and make check-out a breeze. The store is very easy to navigate and it's spotless inside. I love this location! I've never waited long in line. And, they always have what I need in stock. 

If you're not familiar with Ulta, they sell everything you could ever need beauty wise. You can't go wrong with this Ulta location. Could spend hours in here.... honestly I probably have!

I went to the salon for a hair cut and Meghan was my stylist. She did an ABSOLUTELY amazing job and was full of personality. I got a wash, cut, and blow out all for $27 bucks because it was my first time! I also got a coupon to come back for 20% off anything I have done in the salon which I will be redeeming later this month. I am very excited to find a great salon that is near my house & doesn't cost a million dollars to get something done. 

I have been here for the Benefit Brow Bar as well which I HIGHLY RECOMMEND, if you want your brows to look amazing - it is the best place you can go . I trust them with my life. 

I really can't say anything negative about Ulta. I am surprised at the "rude customer service" complaint because I have only experienced the best here. (plus there is always a coupon so I really REALLY love this place).

OK bye!

Went here to exchange a gift that was given to me for Christmas. My friend who bought if for me payed in cash and even told me she got it from that exact location. I went there today to exchange it for another perfume and they asked if I had a receipt. I said no, it was a gift. And the man rudely looked and me and said," well the isn't it obvious that you can't exchange it?" He made me feel extremely stupid and embarrassed for trying to return the perfume.
Awesome products..awesome salon and awesome people. Love it here at ulta in fairview!

If you are looking for it you will find it here.  To high end make up to drug store makeup.  They have something for everyone.  Very sweet young ladies in there.  Ready to help you out.  Will I return...... absolutely!!!!

Anything Beauty they have it! Everything all in one spot...salon, makeup, skincare, professional hair care products. Love this place. I have always been greeted with a smile and consultants are very knowledgeable about all products.

Took my sister and three nieces shopping for new products today. My foundation and powder were not on display. I interrupted a few chatting employees to ask for assistance. I was told that the products were in the stock room, but they could not retrieve them for me. Reportedly, they were not going to restock until tomorrow, so it was suggested I come back. Don't think I'll be back to spend my money.

I bought an item here and attempted to return it a week later.  The cashier and manager were very rude.  They referred me to a call center who kept insisting that I had not received the correct customer support at the store and the regional manager would call within the week.  I was told that at least 5 times.  It's six months later and I'm still waiting...

Ulta reminds me a little of Sephora. Over in the Metro East we don't have a lot of choices. Out of desperation I will venture over to Sally Beauty or if I need hair color. Ulta has no hair color options. They do however have a salon inside which is nice. They have most options for makeup and hair care products. I haven't came across anyone with knowledge yet though.  So when I'm not getting my MAC on when I go the city you will find me here, getting my second best fix for makeup.

My first visit to this store was great!! I'm really just writing this review to brag about the guy who was so willing to help me and answer my questions, after he was already clocked out! I wish I would've gotten his name!

So here's the thing. I love Ulta. Love all their products and I'm excited that they carry a ton of new stuff like MAC and other brands. I do the majority of my shopping online. 

Here's why I shop online (and why I gave 3 stars): ever since they revamped and remodeled, it is almost too much for me to go into the store because the employees literally do not leave your side. I walked in the other day and literally had three employees at the same time ask me if they could help me find anything. And they don't give up either. They will talk to you till they can't talk anymore. And basically force you into buying something you don't want. 

So that's my one thing about shopping in store. Beware that your "I'm just looking around" won't get them off your back.

This store is JANKY. It is poorly stocked and poorly staffed. The staff members' makeup looks terrible (like clown makeup, I'm sorry). It was difficult to find a mirror or any cleanser to remove sample product from my skin. The tissues are like sandpaper - avoid. The line was very long and runs right up against the Ulta brand products, making it really difficult to browse and sample those products. Signs for sales were inconsistent, making it tough to figure out what exactly was on sale and what the conditions were for the sale.

I'm not sure if it's the way I look but every time I go to this location I'm ignored. Never greeted, or asked if I need help. I've worked in retail before so I understand when things get busy but when the entire staff is up front talking and there's zero customers in the store except myself..I honestly thought someone might come up to me this time. That did not happen. I just never feel welcomed here. again maybe it's just me.

I swung into this location 4 days before Christmas looking for some last minute gifts for my niece and her best friend. I walked in less then 20 minutes after opening and the place was already getting busy. This was my first time in a place like this so it was very overwhelming BUT, multiple employees came right up tp me and showed me to the exact things I was looking for by just a screenshot on my phone. Great customer service, tons and tons and tons and tons of options. I was in and out in less then 15 minutes. If I ever need makeup again this will be the place I go.
feeling like constantly watched and rushed is nooooot good. I went in yesterday and they were on me about things. if I need help I'll definitely come up to you and ask.

I went into the store today because I had a $5 off coupon and I was looking for a drug store bb/cc cream. I walked around for a little looking at higher end products then made my way around to the drug store products. A worker who was super busy (the store was restocking) stopped to ask me if I needed help. After talking for a few minutes and listening to me suggested I go over to the Clinique bar. The girls there were super helpful! They color matched me with a lightweight foundation after she did a section she went and did my full face and even did some concealer. After she finished she made me some samples of the products and gave me a sample of a primer because I mentioned my pores on my nose are huge. All in all super helpful! Not the first time I've had great service here either! Will definitely go back

Being on the far west side, our options for a full scale mall with anchor stores are circle center, Greenwood, and Castleton.  Ulta fortunately carries all the name brand lines of cosmetics saving one from making a trip all the way to the mall for Clinique.  In addition to this, they have every other cosmetic manufacturer, color, shade, or tool needed for application.  A wide range of hair care and fragrances.  It's where the cosmetic counter at the mall and the cosmetic aisle at the drugstore meet.  Everything in one place!

Ok so this review has NOTHING to do with this Ulta location itself because I have never had a bad experience with the actual employees at this Ulta but rather the bare minerals rep that didn't realize I could overhear him talking about me. I went in specifically to buy the new brush to go with the new bare pro foundation. I guess I took the last brush and I guess he thought I had left because I then came around the corner and heard him saying that me taking the last Brush "killed another potential sale"?! I guess because I was only buying the brush and not the foundation with it (that I already own)! I guess he realized I was right on the other side of the wall because he started whispering with another associate. I spend ALOT of time and money in this Ulta (I am a platinum member and have been for YEARS) and I am EXTREMELY upset and disappointed in this kind of behavior.

I had one haircut + style here before and it was ~$60 which was pricey, but prices are dependent on stylists. So this time, I called, asked for a price, and made an appointment. The reason I went back to Ulta was because my hair was so silky soft and pin straight the last time I got my cut (my hair is wavy and poofy normally). My stylist barely talked to me which was fine, I let her do her job. But I could tell she was in a rush to leave... she barely straitened my hair. It was poofy/frizzy when I left. I wanted to cry in my car. I was about to go home and just straiten it myself, but then I noticed a long strand of hair she missed. I went back in and she fixed it and I asked her to actually straiten my hair. I could tell she was annoyed, but whatever, hair is a service you shouldn't settle for. If she wanted to go home, she should have never agreed to book the appointment with me in the first place.

I used to like coming here, but the last handful of visits, I feel like I'm watched like a hawk because they think I'm going to shoplift. Makes me very uncomfortable. I like to browse while taking my time so I can see the variety of products, especially since you can't really see or test out anything while shopping online. I have a credit card with Ulta and I'm also a frequent shopper so it's pretty frustrating and offensive to be treated this way. If I bring my kids in with me (who are older girls), it's even worse with the stares and being watched. Especially if they are calmly and quietly trying any "try me" product, you'd think they were stealing with the looks the staff gives them. The men that work there are especially rude and I've overheard them bad-mouthing customers and complaining about them several times. How they are "so annoying" and discussing all of the "annoying things customers do." I mean, I'm just one small aisle over and they have no qualms with talking loudly about it knowing I can hear them. Very stuck up. The constant hovering while rudely saying "Do you need any help with anything? Still doing ok? Is there something you need? What are you looking for? Still doing ok? Are you still doing ok?" with a complete attitude. If they were being polite and friendly, instead of pushy and inconsiderate, it may be a different story. You get extra stares if you are browsing through the higher-end products. I try to make small talk with the people behind the register while being ringed out because I'm a friendly person, and they act like your bothering them. Just all around a snotty environment that I don't wish to come back to. I'm sure not all of the employees are this way, I have had good experiences with just a couple of the women that work there. But the other unpleasant experiences stand out the most & make me hesitant to return.

I will never go to ulta again. I went in for hairspray and noticed that they had a sale on eyeshadow. Decided to buy that. Found a end cap display with a special going on... if I buy 2 of my hairspray I get a free gift. So I decided to buy 2. Get to the register. She rings up my purchase.. no I how are you, did you find everything ok. Nothing . No big deal. Good customer service is none existent anyway 
After I pay I ask about the free gift. She was like oh we just ran out of those and said to the associate next to her I guess we should probably take that sign down. No offering something else.. nothing. All she said was you can return it..no apologies, nothing
I went to my car. The more I thought about this the madder I got. I took 1 can of the hairspray back in and the expensive eye shadow and told her I wanted to return it 
To make a long story short.. I was very unhappy when I left. Emailed corporate who said I would hear from the GM... I have yet to hear from anyone and that was 2-3 weeks ago! 
My advice... go to Beauty Brands!  Better customer service and better coupons!!

Been getting a little more into different brands and types of makeup so I have made a few brief visits here recently. Liking what I have discovered so far. This location is super easy to get to since its right across from one of the main Metropolis parking lots. I hope to update this review if I do end returning in the future. Here are my current thoughts. 

Pros:
- Tons of selection at all price points
- Lots of coupons and a rewards program, I got a free tube of CK mascara for my birthday!
- Friendly staff whenever I have been here
- Salon with fair prices, haven't tried it yet but I hope to in the future. 

Cons:
- Tons of selection, it can be really overwhelming and staff to provide guidance tends to be minimal.
- Certain brands/styles can be really picked over and sometimes only a few colors are in stock for some brands and types.
- Color samples are hit or miss and can be really old and beat up looking sometimes, but i suppose this happens with destructive shoppers. Even non-sample products can be beat up, be sure to inspect before buying.

Ulta has every brand of make up there is plus their own brand. A large selection of skin care products from reasonable to high end. They are more than just a retailer they also have a brow bar which services include waxing, tinting and eyelash application.
They also have a full service salon and offer extensions, blowouts, color and balayage. There are several facials to chose from. The salon has  eyelash extensions that are long term with the  option to have them filled.  The staff are very willing to help with choosing the right shade of foundation or eyeshadow and apply it prior to purchasing to make sure you like it.

I would give this a four but the two experiences I had within days of each other were beyond different.

First visit December 26th. 5 stars
It was my birthday. My mother had bought me a gift card so after a movie in the mall we stopped by here. I was so overwhelmed walking in. No one seemed to jump to help which was ok. Found the Jaclyn Hill x Morphe and grabbed two palletes (boss bling & armed and gorgeous). I get up to the register and get complimented on my rainbow makeup. Talked to the cashier about different makeup and even grabbed some freebies for my birthday. I loved my first experience here.

Second visit December 28th. Maybe 3 stars
So my sister also got gift cards for Christmas but her vehicle has been broke so we decided to take the kids and head into Ulta. Worse decision of my life. You would think none of these woman had ever seen or had kids. Use walking through made them so bothered. We ended up leaving after the million ugly stares we got. I had my daughter in with me the day before and they acted nothing like the rude asses they were that day. Chose wisely when to go

I am in here constantly and the workers are incredible they always know what will work for you! I ask their advice constantly. They even shade matched my foundation and my skin has never looked more flawless! And the rewards?! Need I say more? They are amazing! They are always willing to help with whatever you need to find whether it be hair or makeup!
Amazing customer service.  They know the products really well and listen to the customers needs. There also so many options for all types of beauty products.  I love shopping here.

This is hands down the worst Ulta location I have ever been to. I wish it didn't exist, I've been an avid Ulta shopper for years, going to this store has made me switch to Sephora. AWFUL customer service, salon run by a rag tag group of beauty school dropouts. WILDLY unprofessional, horribly unskilled.

Went to purchase an eyebrow pencil, apparently someone put an eyeliner in the brow section. I took my receipt back to store to return it & get the brow pencil. They would not let me return it because I wouldnt give them my phone number at check out. I never even used it. They said their cash register wouldnt look it up because no phone. I am not giving my phone# out so they can sell it to a 3rd party or send me unwanted text messages!!! They wouldnt even give me an in store credit. I will NEVER shop at this store again. This is wrong on so many levels. The manager acted like it wasnt me who bought it bc i didnt give my phone#. Ok look it up on your security camera people. I'll take my money elsewhere! I wish i could give 0 stars they deseve it.
Blaire is AMAZING!!! He is literally my miracle worker. I always am so happy with the magic he works on my hair.

So I was excited to learn that this Ulta had opened as there are not any other ones in the surrounding area. However, here are a few observations:
(1) parking lot gets crowded because there are a lot of stores in the shopping center
(2) lines are typically long and cashiers are slow
(3) you normally have to track someone down to help you if you have questions
(4) the salon seems to be doing more booming business than the actual store, so that was good to see that the stylists are probably good
(5) although not a huge ulta I found that they have a nice variety of options

I was so exciting to finally check out the Ulta nearby, I'm a casual shopper here but wanted to become a frequent shopper now that there is an Ulta in my own backyard.  Shortly after entering the store I was very disappointed once I realized I was being followed around by the white security/loss prevention guy. There was a women named Adrienna whom was very helpful, and showed me variety of brands for a specific product I was looking to purchase.  I would have had an awesome shopping experience but I could barely concentrate, I felt as though I did not belong in my own neighborhood!  I stopped shopping at Wynnwood Old Navy three years ago for the same reason, and then stopped shopping at Old Navy all together.  I would hate to add Ulta to the list, but I do know I will no longer shop at this location. I will also be returning my items and repurchasing at Macys where I always have a welcoming shopping experience.

omg !!!!! i love this store and the staff here, todd is amazing, the girl with the beautiful blonde dreads is phenomenal, todd managed a makeup master class, it was so helpful and amazing, i cannot express how wonderful the entire staff was, todd took the time to explain everything makeup  and was so nice and just made my experience so great and memorable, i love this store and this staff so much, i will only come to this ulta and i will always come back to future master classes, thank you so much everyone at city line ulta you are amazing and unforgettable!!!!! love you all!!!!!!!

I visit this location every other Saturday for my
standing appointment with Blair, who is literally a miracle worker. I have followed him as my stylist for 4 years, and drive about 40 minutes to get there because he CARES ABOUT MY HAIR and has so much PASSION for haircare and hair styling. The biggest part is the haircare and hair health. He has never made a product recommendation that I didn't need. I trust him and highly recommend his services.

I also love Todd for my makeup recommendations. Literally always makes me feel like I am the only woman in the store when he is working with me. I address my goals, and he addresses my solution. Also showed me an awesome trick to take my highlight to the next level. 

Kimmy at the Clinique counter is amazing! I had never used these products but did a web-assessment at her counter and she showed me exactly what I should use based on my skincare goals and skin type. She gave me some samples to try at home - no pressure to purchase which I loved, and she checked back on me when I was in the store. Will be purchasing the products, and highly recommend Kimmy for her genuine care of the customer.

In general, I love this location. It's a little piece of heaven for me every other week with my hectic lifestyle as wife, mommy, full time business owner and professional, homeowner...lots going on, but I know when I come to this Ulta, my needs will be met quickly, efficiently, and honestly.

Given this store three chances now to treat me nice when purchasing makeup. No one ever approaches asking to assist me or help me try on foundation shades. First two times I made $200+ purchases regardless of lack of respect or common courtesy from them third time walked out empty handed after coming in with my infant twins and being looked at from afar by two young employees as they talked about "keeping an eye on me" as if I'm a theif. I would suggest to anyone considering this store to drive the extra couple miles to the Sephora in Ardmore as I did after leaving here. At Sephora I was seen as the exhausted mother of newborns that needed help with skincare and given the much deserved respect I deserved as a customer.

A great option for an affordable haircut. Tiffany J did an amazing job! My hair is very curly and I have struggled to find a trusty local stylist who would truly work with curls. The haircut was professional and don't well.

My one complaint would be that I had a 2:45pm appt and my haircut wasn't started until almost an hour later. The salon was pretty busy and Tiffany had a handful of clients there for her. I wasn't in a rush and had a book with me so I was fine to wait this time. The Ulta employees did a great job of checking in on me and making sure I didn't need anything which I appreciated. I am hopeful that there will not be a wait next time. 


*Tiffany will be moving to the new Ulta in the Gallery Mall at the end of September 2019*

I love makeup stores and I especially love ULTA for their vast variety of makeup. You are able to score drugstore products as well as prestige products. However, this review today is for the stylist. A hairstylist by the name of Blair made my hair look flawless. He was very professional and exceeded my wants. Please book with Blair he can do from natural hair to a weave install.

As soon as I walked in I was greeted by one of the Ulta staff (I believe her name was Sarah) she told me everything that was currently discounted and asked if she could help me find anything. I was looking to revamp my whole makeup collection and she helped me find the best products for the best prices that are good for my skin type. She always kept my price point in mind and always asked if I liked her suggestion because we could always get another product. She helped me find foundation, concealer, eye primer, setting spray, powder, bronzer, and highlight both high end and drug store prices. I've shopped at Sephora for years and this experience at Ulta very just as positive and I saved so much money. Thank you so much for your help! Your employee was phenominal

This is a nice Ulta. I have only been here a few times for various products, but I came for a facial this particular time.

I wasn't even aware Ulta did facials until I checked out their beauty services online. Right now I am dealing with a few little breakouts that I'm trying to get under control, and found their facial to be fairly inexpensive at less than $50.

Ulta isn't a spa, so I didn't really know what to expect. I figured I would still gave it a chance because they offer 15% off for first-time skin and hair services customers. 

In the end, I would say that I was pleased with the results. Parise did my facial and she made me feel comfortable about everything she was doing. She explained what the products were and what they were for and also paid attention to the areas where I was having issues. The facial also did not involve extraction, which is a plus! Even without the extraction, I still felt like my pores were opened and cleansed. I think the only critical thing I can say is the area in the back of the store is not all that quiet, because there is no door and the salon is back there. So there is a bit of chatter in the back that took me out of the experience a few times. That said, it wasn't too loud, and at least there is a room you can be in to relax as you get your treatment.

I had my facial yesterday and I wanted to wait until today to give a review to see if the products she applied helped. They actually did! The breakout area on my face is reduced as of this morning. I felt like the facial was worth it, and will probably check out their products when I get my coins together.

Small and doesn't have as many products other stores have. 

Worst part of my visit was that none of the employees who were standing around doing nothing but chit-chatting to each other, offered to help me as I looked around for what I came in for and pretty much ignored my existence. I then noticed they immediately asked to help 2 white ladies who came in about 2 minutes after me. Sad thing was both employees were also POC like me. Avoid this store if possible. Full of lazy workers.
This  location was a total disappointment no or little products available and seemed ghetto compared to other Ultra locations. Will never return to this location

I went to this Ulta after I've been to the store in St. Peters which is way better by the way. I thought all their stores would be the same, but apparently not? I was disappointed with how the selection at this location is very slim compared to the other one. The girls behind the counter were too busy chatting to help me look for a product I was searching for. Finally a girl in the back of the store came to help me but she didn't seem to know where anything was? I left without buying since I was unimpressed with the store and did not have what I was looking for anyway. I'll stay at my other Ulta.
Amina was so helpful and very friendly! I found everything I was looking for thanks to her.

This location is convenient and they have most of the items I need. However, the employees, managers, whomever they are working are almost ALWAYS rude or nasty in some way or another. I hate going here because of the humans who work here. I am not going to jump the gun and call them racist but I certainly won't rule it out either.

If there was a 0 stars I would give it. All of the girls who worked there were very helpful! The manager was awful! I asked for help and not only did he roll his eyes at me but he gave me such attitude. I noticed he also had an attitude with not only the customers but the employees as well! The management in Brentwood is much nicer!

I like this Ulta location better than the one in Brentwood. The employees are always friendly and helpful which is a major bonus! I've been here twice and both times, grabbed what I needed then browse around for some other thing or two and have always been asked if I need help and was greeted when I came in.

There's usually plenty of parking available. The inside is pretty organized by brands and types of beauty product and check-out lines are usually quick-moving.

They have a large area for MAC products and a good other variety of beauty and hair products.  Overall, this is becoming a new go-to Ulta for me.

I hadn't been to this location before and just want to give the manager Rick kudos for helping me revamp (and drastically improve) my makeup routine. He was attentive, knowledgeable and thoughtful. He was training Jasmine (spelling??) and she did great as well! Super helpful, listened to what I needed and presented solutions. I appreciate them both.

I came in with a question about 2x points days and the girl at the register immediately insisted she could not help me in store as she sat on the back counter, while I'm at the register. She was not interested in helping me at all. If you don't want to work with customers or even have an issue with assisting women of color why work here ? The manager was able to get my issue resolved .

Everyone who works at Ulta is very nice, I must say. I do wish that it wasn't so confusing trying to figure out what is on sale in the store vs online only. They also don't have tags that tell you what is on sale that goes along with the app. That makes me have to be in there even longer because I have to use the app in store to make sure I'm getting the best deal. It would also be nice to know if what I am buying is going to work for the in app coupon that is only on "most products", before I get to the register to check out and find that I need to spend $2 more to get my $3.50 off, lol. Yes, I will go grab a $2 lip balm to make that happen! That being said, I spend so long browsing every time I am here and smelling all the scents and wanting everything.

Ulta has a promo: buy $60 of Purology get a free gift. I was told only one free gift per customer though I was buying $200 worth of product (and an additional $150). Back to Sephora where they appreciate a GREAT $$$ customer.

Let me preface my review with this: I am very picky with who cuts my hair. I have trust issues.

Jaclyn is fantastic not only at curbing anxieties, but at cutting hair. My hair used to go down to the small of my back and I wanted to chop it to collar bone length, I was terrified! I had been growing my hair out for years, but I was looking for a change.

Jaclyn gave me her advice and opinion based on the shape of my face and did a wonderful job cutting it with the layering style I like.

A little later, I went back. I wanted to chop it again, this time to the length of my chin. Coming in riddled with anxieties, Jaclyn helped calm me and decide the logistics of the cut. She even remembered me! Similar to the first time I visited, I loved my hair coming out.

Jaclyn not only cares about her clients, but is extremely talented. I will only be seeing her for my haircutting needs in the future!

Two and a half stars I would say. Even though this store is newer than the one on Concord Pike it doesn't have as much inventory. Some of my favorite brands can not be found here. No First Aid Beauty, very limited Philosophy. Also alot of shelves are bare even within Ulta's own brand.

On the plus side the store is a welcome addition to Fashion Center Boulevard. Other than Sephora inside the Christiana Mall and the make up counters at Nordstrom and Macy's, no other dedicated beauty stores exists.

I visited this Ulta location twice in one week. The first time the staff at the register were helpful and patient in helping me use a discount code. The second time I had to return my item to get a different shade. One staff member was very personable and genuinely interested in helping me find the right shade, helping me return my original purchase and placing an order online for the new item because they did not have the shade I needed in-store. I really appreciate the courteous service.

I went here to get eyelash extensions from the benefit cosmetics bar inside. I have been to many New York benefit cosmetics in my life and they are awesome with applying the eyelashes so I figured I would give this one a try. Horrible. My lady made me cry as she applied them and did it in a way I have never had done before. They looked atrocious and were not applied evenly at all. Within a day almost half had fallen off and looked so fake and bad. I love benefit cosmetics but this one was horrendous. The people working there need to learn how to actually do the applications or they should not be allowed to be putting chemicals near peoples eyes.

Very disappointed that I did not receive bonus points as per a recent email.  I questioned the cashier and was told to check online but a week later nothing showed up on my account.  A call to Ulta customer service got lot of apologies but no missing points.  Manager said sorry but bonus offer had expired and nothing he could do.  It hadn't expired when I was in the store and had I known there were issues, I would have called before the expiry date.  I expect employees to know about current offers and also expect Ulta customer service to have the power and desire to make a repeat customer feel appreciated.

I love ulta! When it comes to beauty supply stores this beats any other company. The rewards program is awesome and they always have a coupon for $3.50 off of a $10 purchase. The selection is great and the young ladies working there are actually knowledgeable on the products they carry as well as able to offer specific recommendations for your skin type.

I went to the salon here and got a blowout for my senior pictures. I loved how my hair turned out and really enjoyed the experience. Jaclyn did an amazing job with my hair and even took a few extra minutes to fix a botched haircut from a different salon at no extra charge. I had never gotten a blowout before, but she gave me exactly what I wanted and it turned out great. Would definitely recommend getting a blowout here!

I love Ulta and would way rather shop there than any other beauty store, like sephora. But I took away 2 stars because of how they treat their staff. A coworker of mine told me how when she worked at Ulta they weren't allowed to bring purses to work and showed me the clear bag they were all given to use as a purse at work. Why hire someone that you think would steal? They also have to put green dots on makeup that they own and if you have stuff in your coat pocket, they'll 10/10 ask you to show them what it is. And that's for their EMPLOYEES. I would feel so embarrassed because some of the things I carry in my purse I don't want the world to see. AND I wouldn't want to work for someone who constantly thinks I am stealing.

Been to this ulta many times and it's the only one I go to really. SOOO much better service than sephora. Joanne who does the benefit eye brow waxing seriously has some magic. And Lizzy and the salon does my hair never a bad cut also had Barbara who is the manager and amazing as well. Mary the stylist I've heard very great things too! This ulta is easy to get to if you're on 7south and take the Christiana exit and make a right at the light and straight from there. Never had a experience with cashiers either and I love the rewards system it's pretty easy to get rewards.

I'm really picky about my hair.  I usually go to a salon and it's takes me forever to find someone good! My friend recommended I go to Ulta and after seeing the reviews about Jaclyn on Yelp I was like ok let me try. I booked the appointment and when I showed her an inspiration pic she came thru!!!! I love my end product, I loved her vibes and convo. Just a great experience overall!!! If you want good hair see Jaclyn! I swear she won't disappoint!

I love Ulta even more than I like sephora. They have even more brands, including drug store brands like clairol, cover girl, almay, and they also have the department store brands and others as well. They are the perfect place to give gift cards to the women in your life (if they're into makeup, hair products, nail care and/or perfume). 
They have their own brand, which is cheaper, and they also sell mineral makeup. There are always lots of sales people available and just like Sephora, you can try products before you buy.

This store is amazing! It's a combination of Sephora, Beauty Brands, and the beauty department at Target. They have practically everything - make-up, skincare products, shampoo/conditioner, styling products, hair coloring, nail polish, brushes and combs, plus things like cotton balls and Q-tips. Where else can you buy Maybelline mascara, Redkin shampoo, OPI polish, Bliss moisturizer, and Gillette razors all at the same place? I don't know of anywhere. 

It's true the service is nowhere near what you would find at Sephora or Beauty Brands, so just know that going in. They also don't have the selection of either so if you're doing serious cosmetics or hair products shopping and need assistance then don't go here. But if you're looking for one place you can go to get almost everything you need beauty-wise, then do.

It seems like they have pretty good sales, as well. I picked up a liter of Redkin and Biolage shampoo, both for $14.99. Steal!

I call this the "mean girl" store.  the employees are typically unhelpful, and enjoy talking amongst themselves.  I also cannot believe how dirty the Ulta branded makeup display is.  most of the unopened products are smudged and dirty on the packaging.  I just want to take a sponge and wipe everything clean.  I have complained about this at the store, but no one wants to work to clean it up.  I walked out last week because it was disgusting.  I hate this Ulta store, to put it bluntly.
The sale professional Leia was very knowledgeable about all products! Love this location!  The ombré lip duo is very nice! The Customer service is awesome!

Caitlyn was friendly but didn't really seem to be paying attention to why she was doing or what I wanted during my haircut. She nicked herself which, whatever, stuff happens, but she didn't sanitize her shears or herself after, and went on with another employee about how they never bother sanitizing their cuts!  

Now, the haircut itself.... I had asked for a blunt cut, cutting the back of my head to match the length of my bangs. Blunt cut means All the hair is one length, no layers. After cutting my curls wet and combed straight she then fluffed pulled and and twirled my curls so it still looked blunt and even when I walked out but by the time I got home it was obvious she had not done what I had asked all, because the back is inches longer than the front. My hair is only barely shoulder length so it kind of looks like a mullet now that it's dry. 

I am really annoyed because she kept saying how easy of a request it was and how she didn't have to take very much off.... but she didn't do what I asked at all, as you can see in the photo that is NOT a blunt cut.

I'll admit I walked out feeling satisfied and only was not after it dried, when I wrote this review in lieu of going back to complain, but after this poor of a job she claimed was soooo simple I don't really trust them to attempt to fix it either.

I love Ulta but this location on 1/7/17 had very little customer service. We walked around looking for help. When we got the help, it was not like the experience we have had at other stores. Brentwood location is our favorite!  Ulta offers an abundance of products. Haven't tried the salon.

I saw some pretty good reviews about someone that does eyebrows here so I went out of my way to go try it out.  I heard that ulta does brow mapping so I was super excited for someone to finally "get it right".  
I ended up being super disappointed...  she barely said a word to me and was talking to other employees/ looking outside the whole time.  She took way to much off on one of my eyebrows and left a ton of little hairs underneath that the wAx didn't get.  She only spent a few minutes with me and sent me on my way. Where's the brow mapping at this benefit  bar?? Where's the customer service?
Needless to say I was not happy paying 20 dollars for this service.

I have to say the Brentwood location is my favorite because it is more diverse but I hate the parking situation over there. I have noticed that this location is slowly diversifying. They have a great selection of products from cosmetics, fragrances, styling tools and hair products. The employees are very friendly and seek to find answers for you when they do not know. I love the prices and consistant coupons. Also a huge plus for me is that you are able to try products and if they do not work for you, you can return them. My hair texture is constantly changing and when I find my go to product my hair will let me know it no longer likes the product any more so it's a hassle switching on my go to faves. I love their large selection of Shea Moisture products and mascara brands. Ulta is my go to over Sephora.

I am one who use to shop only at Walmart or Target for cosmetics.  I'm not an over the top makeup user.  Just the basics usually and I'm good to go.

Then one day someone opened me up to the world of Ulta.  Now I don't go there all the time but I usually go there when I know I can get a good deal, usually on the major makeup essentials like concealer, powder, etc.

They send out coupons each month and they will save you a lot of money on your purchases.

I have eyeballed their salon a few times and may go there one of these days.

It is a bummer that there is not one in my neighborhood but when I do know I'll be in the area of one, I'll stop when I know I need items.

Thanks Ulta for opening me up to a new world!!

Best customer service I've had in a while. I went in looking for makeup with no clue where to start and was given free tutorials and samples. I left with a bag full of everything I needed and only spent $50. Seriously awesome!

I stopped into Ulta looking for concealer. Benefit changed the packaging on their Bo-ing concealer since I had previously purchased it and I was totally confused. I needed help but they only had one employee at the register and one back in the salon. There was no one to ask and there were like 6 people milling around and probably everyone needed help. I narrowed it down to two colors and took them both with me to the register and asked her to tell me which she thought was better. I picked out a couple of other things and was on my way. I'll be back but they need more help.

The place is well-stocked with all manner of cosmetics, hair care products, grooming basics, plus there's a salon.

Went Saturday and was clearly lost wandering around the store looking for what I needed. Couldn't find it. Walked, walked, wandered, wandered. Nobody offered to help me, until I was about ready to walk out.

As it turned out, I was standing right by the display of the item I needed, so she didn't have to help that much. But I told her exactly what I needed, she retrieved it, and I checked out pronto adding this purchase to my Ulta Club membership.

Customer service at the store in the bottoms is MUCH better!!!

If Sephora got really drunk and had a torrid one night stand with the cosmetics section at Walgreen's, their baby would be Ulta.

Ulta seems to be split into three sections: 
-the cheap cosmetics on one side,
-the nice cosmetics on the other, and
-a salon in the back

Sales staff will help you pick out the nice cosmetics.  They will give you samples and show you how to put them on.  They will not do that for the cheap cosmetics.

There are also appliances (I don't know, what else would you call flat irons, hair dryers and epilators), fragrances, candles and Ulta brand body washes and shampoos.

A very nice young man spent almost 20 minutes helping me pick out a lip stain, only to find out that they didn't have it in my shade in the nice cosmetic section, nor did they have it in my color in the cheap cosmetic section.  So yeah, Ulta was decent, but not nearly as satisfying a shopping experience as Sephora.  Not nearly as expensive, either.

I just moved to the area a few months ago and have been completely neglecting my brows because I haven't found a good place to go. Then I decided to stop in at the Benefit Brow Bar which is actually inside Ulta Beauty. I've gone to a benefit brow bar before in other cities I've lived in and trusted they were trained and would do a good job but i got way more than I expected! I just blindly called and made an appointment with no idea who would be doing my brows but I got so lucky by chance that I got Leia B. She gave me the brows that I've always wanted but never could articulate or was too scared to ask for fear of them not turning out well. She was so sweet and also showed me some tips with filing in my brows, something I've never really needed so I've never tried to do until now. It's been a few days and I still can't stop staring at my brows! Definitely ask for Leia! You won't be disappointed!

I may single facedly keep that company afloat with my purchases.

Everyone is so friendly and helpful and if you shop the sales and coupon offerings it is pretty economical even for some of the "prestige" brands.

I'm wondering if others who have described customer service as "horrible and unhelpful" managed to find someone who perhaps was leaving employ and showing it. I've been to this location numerous times and always been well treated. Someone else described it as a "mean girl" store and again I've never seen any customer poorly treated, in fact, the opposite.  Maybe I'm just lucky?
Pretty typical Ulta... store is clean and well stocked and whatnot. Haircut was pretty subpar though. Guess you get what you pay for...
The sale professional Leia was very knowledgeable about all products! Love this location!  The ombré lip duo is very nice! The Customer service is awesome!

I've shopped at several different ulta stores and this is by far the worst. Customer service is horrible! This was my second time at this particular location. I did get a friendly hello when I entered but while searching for what I needed no one offered to help which is very unusual as far as all the other ulta locations. While I was looking a woman was returning a product and the manager was just plain rude. The woman was friendly and told her she was not being confrontational but was just trying to understand their policy,  the manager still didn't get it. She just said it was too complicated to explain and it's $1.10 difference so hear you go. So sad I wanted to say something that is how poorly she treated this woman. Anyways still searching and finally settled on something. When I got ready to check out there was another girl up there helping and thankfully I got her. I asked if they could do a price check on two different items bc obviously prices weren't on the package or available where I picked the items up and the stupid manager asked if I would like to step aside and let someone else checkout. Wow! No I want a price check which the other associate did and then I was out of there. 

Afterwards my daughter and I went to Walgreens for a few things and the associate there was so friendly went out of her way to help us and at the end gave us free samples.  

While walking out we both said at the same time- now that is customer service! 

I will never return to this particular ulta again!

Rude beyond belief! I swore off Ulta about a year ago... thought I would give it another try... wrong! They have a 50% off sale on Living Proof in 2 days but I went yesterday with a 20% off coupon because I needed the shampoo and conditioner. Was told the coupon couldn't be used in this item. Even though it was not in the prestige section. So I'll return in 2 days and pay less for what I was willing to buy. Last time I bought this item from Ulta the 20% coupon was accepted. The people at checkout were so rude and she kept my coupon even though I did not use it and didn't give it back !

I'm pretty convinced at this point is that this company's entire business philosophy can be summed up as "If we give them enough free stuff, they won't care if we provide zero customer service."

I've had my fill of being entirely ignored by the Brentwood store so I ventured out here to see if maybe this store was any better. Spoiler: It's not. 

Brentwood at least always has plenty of employees who seem to spend their shifts talking to each other instead of customers. This one was pretty empty when I visited.

The only person helping customers was apparently the store manager. She was nice enough when I talked to her but I only got to talk to her after asking the cashier where to find something. 
I just don't get it. If I go into a Sephora, I immediately have a sales associate trying to help me no matter how dressed up or down I might be.  At Ulta, it doesn't seem like they care. Whether you're here to spend $10 or $100, they'll ignore you equally.

The loyalty program here is pretty great and the online shipping is usually decent so I'll keep shopping with Ulta but I will continue to avoid the stores whenever possible.

I really don't like going to this Ulta. As previously noted, the customer service is subpar to put it nicely. On several occasions, I've come in at fairly slow times and never been asked for help. As someone who works in retail, I know how important that is to sales, so it's surprising that management doesn't encourage customer engagement. 
One particular time, I came in looking for a specific hair tool. After circling the hair tool section about four times, I still couldn't find it and decided to ask somebody (because I had checked online and they said that they had the product in stock). I looked all around, and the only associates were either talking with each other or walking swiftly around. I decided to circle around a couple times, waiting for somebody to notice that I had been there for about 15 minutes now. The more I circled, the more annoyed I got. I decided to leave and go get my tool at the Walmart behind Ulta, which I found in less than 3 minutes of walking in.
Another time, the girl checking me out accidentally scanned the $50 palette I was purchasing twice and I didn't realize until after I got back to my car. When I returned, the girl looked annoyed and didn't offer any sort of apology as she refunded me. Once again, as somebody who works in retail, I can't understand the attitude she had with me and get annoyed that I didn't get an apology. Had I not noticed, I would have been charged $50! I think that's deserving of an apology! Even a quick one! It only takes a second!
On the upside, Marli in the salon is lovely! She's so nice!

Don't get me wrong, I like Ulta.  I used to live by a number of them when I was in another city - they're like Sephora for poor people. But there are none near me so I happened to be running errands in Ballwin for a few other stores that are nowhere near the city.  Went in here looking for a specific conditioner - much like Pat C., I walked around, walking, walking, walking . . . no one asked me if I needed help.  In fact I didn't see an employee until I was ready to leave.  

The two girls at the registered made me stand there waiting while they continued their personal conversation - when they got to a stopping point, one offered to ring me up.  She asked if I had an Ulta rewards card - I do, it's old.  As I mentioned I don't live near one of these stores and haven't been inside one in quite some time.  After a few exclamations of how old my card was and how she wasn't sure if it was work, she rang up my order.

I'd love to have an Ulta near me again but not if it means unhelpful and unfriendly workers. Forget it, I'll go to Target.

The sale professional Leia was very knowledgeable about all products! Love this location!  The ombré lip duo is very nice! The Customer service is awesome!

Love the happy face with a friendly smile on each visited!
Found me so amazing blue lipstick and more at this location.
The makeup is very nice for my  skin tone. 


The special they have ever week are good!
Being in the reward club here is great!
Make a purchase get points toward you saving on future Purchasers.
This is my go to place when I don't order from my own makeup easer.
I'm always happy when I buying makeup from all vendors.
Thank you for being so amazing with great customer service and excellent product.
I will be back for more sales on my products.

Gloria'~

Samantha did such an amazing job cutting my hair!! I have very thick wavy hair & she left it so soft & manageable. She also fixed my at home bangs. Samantha was so friendly & funny, she's definitely my go to now!!

The salon is wonderful! Gloria and Marli have taken me from a brassy mess to a beautiful natural blonde. I've also received facials from Aimee and it was great. My skin was glowing after. Thank you for giving me such a wonderful experience!

Nice, large cosmetic haven for women...gents too. 

Hair: products, accessories, styling tools, full service salon.

Makeup: Beauty Bar services from waxing to full face makeovers. All top brand beauty products from NYX to Smash Box. They have a wide variety of brushes, cleansers, mascara, liners, lipsticks, shadows, concealers, foundations, powders, cream, lashes and whatever else your makeup case needs.

Fragrances: Men & Women scents from Gucci to Taylor Swift.

Customer service is pleasant and there are ladies within reach to answer questions, concerns or give tutorials to any novice.

Enjoy the view,
~Christy

Terrible experience with Samantha at Ulta! Worst customer service experience. Based on previous reviews I am clearly not the first. Avoid at all cost. Oh and they were 45 minutes into the appointment before they even bothered to seat.

Worst place ever. No customer service. The sign on the building says it's going to be reopened on 4/01. Today is 4/11, but the store is closed. I looked at the adjusted store hrs. It's supposed to open to 6 pm today. It's only 4:34 now. Wasted my time trying to come get some stuff.

When I'm not in the mood to deal with the mall, I'll make a trip to Ulta because I know they'll have just what I'm looking for- AND MORE!

The store is well lit and well stocked at all times. Every visit, I'm greeted by friendly staff who are eager to help me find exactly what it is I'm looking for. Not sure where to start? Don't be afraid to just walk around and check out everything they have!

The last time I went into this Ulta I COULD NOT believe how DIRTY the tester areas were!!! You could tell no one had cleaned them in months. I didn't touch anything. No way. It was that bad!How do I know because I work in this field. If anyone knows I do. If you just look at these testers you'd get herpes. Unbelievable. I can't believe they are allowed to get away with that!!!!!! Disgusting. Please Ulta (you all are too good for this) CLEAN YOUR TESTERS. 

Another huge disappointment that has happened twice now...The hairdressers. Terrible. I could explain everything that happened both times but I just don't have that kind of time. Waste of $75 - $100 BOTH times. This is the closest Ulta too me and I love Ulta but it's SO SAD NOW BC I have to buy online instead of going into the store. I always loved going into that Ulta but after years of horrible customer service now all of this I HAVE TOO buy online. :( Please Ulta (at this location) get it together!!

DO NOT GO TO THIS ULTA! 

Horrible experience with hair stylists DEB and MADISON. 

After my usual hair stylist was booked up for the rest of the month, I decided to take a chance with ULTA. 

I came into my noon appointment only to wait 45 min while Madison took in another client at MY appointment time. After my long wait, Deb sat me down and looked at my hair-- pulling and tugging on my ends. After examination, she decided it was far too "damaged" for her to do anything. She told me what I wanted done to my hair would look awful. Angry, I left and I am sure to never return. 

Interestingly, as I made an appointment with a REAL salon the next day, I got my hair done exactly how I wanted it and it turned out beautifully. 

I am so disappointed with ULTA, I went into my appointment excited and left in tears as my excitement was crushed by two stylists who deemed me as inconvenient.

I went in for a face mask and asked to create a new account because I haven't received any points or coupons recently and Lizzie the girl working up front was just amazing. I apparently had three different accounts so she took the time to merge them all to get all my points together. She had such a positive attitude and was so amazing. Lizzie makes me want to keep coming back

Whenever I need a pick me up, I visit Ulta Beauty. I can spend two hours in there perusing the many aisles of cosmetics, shampoos, nail polishes, blow dryers, straighteners, etc. I can't get out of there without spending a small fortune, but that is not because they are over priced. It is because they have so many phenomenal products in one place that it is too hard for me to resist.

I used to go to Macy's or Nordstrom's for all of my cosmetics like Lancôme, Clinique and all my perfumes but they have quite a selection in Ulta and they do take coupons if you get on their mailing list. They also have a rewards program.

If I run out of mascara, it is a lot easier to run in and grab it from Ulta Beauty than it is to park and walk through the mall where at times I end up spending more on clothes because I discovered a good sale. 

There is always someone in Ulta Beauty to help you find what you are looking for. 
If you who need your hair cut, dyed, styled, etc., there is a hair salon in there that I have been meaning to investigate and but I always get so enamored by the product selection that I forget to inquire. Today I came in for mascara and left with way too much! 

Check out my finds for today!  Enjoy!

I visited this location in hopes to make a gift basket for a friend. They have an awesome sale going on right now. (50% off clearance items)

The manager LANNIE POIYER (not sure of correct spelling) was the one that "helped" me. She was very rude and short. Her non verbal cues shouted poor attitude and customer service. She acted as if she didn't want to be there. She rang all the sale items in incorrectly. I thought the price was kind of high when I paid so I double checked everything before I left the parking lot. I noticed I was charged $30 over. I went back in the store and asked for her to fix the issue. 

At this time she was ruder than before. She didn't fully explain what was happening with the "void" or "refund". At that point I felt like she didn't give a damn that she overcharged me or to even explain why she was trying to charge me $26 after reringing everything. I just told her to forget about it and left ALL items returned. If this is the type of customer service Ulta is allowing then I don't even want any parts. I also don't want to buy any makeup from someone with an orange face. That's probably why she was so mad.

Really needed my hair cut and had the husband and son in tow. Sent them off to the mall while I went to see if Ulta salon might have an opening. Luckily, there was an immediate opening (and it was a Saturday late afternoon). I had never been to an Ulta salon before - just looked curiously at it while shopping. The salon workers all seemed pretty friendly. (Thought it was kind of weird that they all had randomly colored hair in pinks/blues/etc. I guess it is close to Easter time...maybe they were trying to market colored dyes?) My hairstylist was Felicia - she had blue tinged, long black hair. She was very nice, made conversation with me, gave me a bottle of water, listened to what I wanted and even recommended a tattoo artist when I asked her about her tattoos. My hair came out exactly how I wanted it (past shoulders, blunt cut with a few layers and some bangs - from all long layers). Then she blew dry it all sexy and ready to go out (too bad I was just going to run errands with the family). I will definitely go back to her again!  Price is probably average for a midrange salon. 

As for the retail side of it. I needed to get some foundation and was determined to get it as I had (also) put this off til the last minute. It took me FOREVER to get help. I walked around and around and around. There were salespeople helping others but also some that weren't who would walk right past me and ask someone else if they needed help (which they always did)! It was very frustrating! After at least 30 mins of this, I finally found a lady with a CK nametag on who said she could help me. She found me a foundation and I finally was able to get out of there.  Great place to get product - but make sure you know what you want before you go in or you may wait too long for help! Sephora and Ulta need to find their happy medium. Seems Sephora always has wayyy too many people wanting to help and Ulta has the opposite. (Which makes me want to go to Sephora for makeup instead.)

I am visiting  from the Reno Nevada  area and  since I use the ulta  salon  in Sparks  Nevada  I thought I'd  be  fine in booking a  appointment  for a  cut and  color.  I was so wrong as it was a horrible  experience.  I  told the stylist  exactly  what  I  wanted and the  only thing she hot right  was the cut. The  color was supposed  to be  a  light blond and  I  now have  a bluish silver  color.  I spent four hours there today  and  since she couldn't  get  the color correct after two processes I got on my cell phone  to the ULTA  salon back in Sparks  to see if they could tell her how they did my hair. I gave her my phone  so she could hear it Direct  from them and I still don't  have  the  color I had back home. I'm  obviously  not  happy  and would think  if you are having  problems  to ask  for assistance but she didn't.  In my opinion  this ulta salon sucks big time and I will never set foot in  that ulta salon  again  . I have  emailed corporate  to see what their response  will be.  Do not go to this ulta  salon unless you don't  care how your hair  turns out.

I love visiting the Salon at Ulta, I have seen Peter and Korrine. Peter did an amazing job at cutting my long layers exactly how I wanted, lots of body and volume and kept my length! I visited Korrine about 3 weeks ago for a big chop, and I couldn't be happier! My hair turned out exactly like the photos I took her. She listened and added so much texture! I'm having so much fun with my new look. I can't wait to go back for a trim to keep the wonderful style fresh! I've also had fun purchasing different shampoos and conditioners to texturizing and volumize my new look. The staff is always friendly and knowledgeable.

Similar to Sephora. 

This store should be avoided if you have a significant other that likes make-up, hair, skin, nails, and smelling great ;) They various brands of make-up (Benefit, ULTA, Bare Minerals, Urban Decay, etc.)  hair products, nail polishes, facial masks/cleansers/toners, and perfumes. WOW right? 

I like this store; however I find that it's difficult to get help when looking for a product in this store (they don't have Benefit's foundation on the sales floor; possibly to avoid theft?) So I frequently have to play hide and seek with the employees here. 

Other than that, their prices are reasonable and the store is very organized.

I stumbled into this ULTA location after a failed attempt at a haircut at Art Hair Studio. I was greeted warmly by Shimane and she luckily had a client reschedule and she was able to give me a walk in cut. She was GREAT! Really professional, precise, and gave me exactly what I wanted. I recommend Shimane for cuts and I will definitely be back to her.
