Think Sephora but without the ability to really try the products that much. I like Ulta for their perfume selection. What I also like and don't like is that the service is rather non-existent but then it is better than having pushy sales people. I have not found any fantastic deals here, but I do like to stop in and refresh and look at the new products. They do have a hair styling area in the back...I cannot comment on their quality since I haven't gotten my hair cut there.

This is for my service at their hair salon. A few days ago I went to a different salon that had 5 star reviews and all reviews mentioned they provided great haircuts for a reasonable price. All I asked were for long layers and basically left with choppy uneven "layers".just a horrible haircut if u can even call it that. 
anyways Katie came to my rescue and fixed my hair. She is really well educated and confident in her technique. She blended my layers, evened out my hair and made it look so much better!!!Plus she did a great blowout. I would absolutely recommend and trust her and they are open on Sunday's. So that's another plus for me!!! Yay

I am an urban decay junkie.  This location has got a fairly good selection.  Store is clean, the staff is friendly and approachable.  They always give a heads up if there are urban decay products on special, or a promotional things going on.

I had popped into this store for small things here and there, but I recently got my hair done here, and it turned out to be a great experience. I made a haircut appointment online and received a call that the stylist I'd chosen no longer worked at that time, so I rescheduled with a new stylist an hour later. When I showed up for my appointment, they told me I was an hour late (apparently the appointment never got changed in their system). I was pretty perturbed because it wasn't my mistake, but the lady was super apologetic and offered to fit me in as soon as she could. I went to Starbucks and had an iced tea, pretty annoyed that my day now centered around this hair appointment. 

When I came back, they had set me up with Elvia, a master stylist, and she was very nice and did an amazing job. We also talked about our dogs, and if you tell me about your dog, I pretty much automatically like you! Although she was a level-3 stylist (they cost more than the others who have less experience), they only charged me the cost of a level-1 for the mixup and gave me a promotional price, which I had no idea was even going on. They really went above and beyond to fix the appointment snafu.

Stephanie at the Ulta Salon is THE BEST!
She always cuts and styles my hair exactly how I've asked her & whenever I need tips on hair products / hair care she helps me. 
She is so sweet, professional, and gentle! 
Truly so happy with every cut & style she has done for me and I will keep coming back.
Thanks, Stephanie, keep doing an amazing job!!!

I'm a big fan of Sephora, but Ulta just might beat them out in the affordability and great deals category. They always have great weekly deals going on, and it looked like a pretty full-service salon in the back of the store. Tip: Check your weekly newspaper ads before visiting, you can usually score a great coupon to use when you check out!
Best ulta in town next to the Oro Valley Location. If you have the chance get your brows done by Brandon at Benefit. Brandon is truly an artist when it comes to waxing and styling brows.
One of my favorite places to shop. Competitive prices, always running specials, have everything I need.

I will just say upfront that I do not buy any beauty products with chemicals, so I stay to the front right of the store and this review is a reflection of that. I buy almost exclusively Tarte products, which are mineral-based. I don't mind ordering from the website, but I do appreciate that they have retail places so I can try on a certain product to make sure the color works, or if I don't have time to wait for it to ship or don't want to pay shipping. 

HOWEVER. I have been frustrated every time I've walked into this section. The Tarte section is always extremely sparse, the testers are gross and old, and I have NEVER been greeted or approached by any employee. I'm not exaggerating. They seem to have representatives walking around, but they must be for a different company because I have never been greeted in that store. The last time I was there it was for over 30 minutes because I went in for a certain color of blush, which they were out of (who knows if they had more in the back) and so I was trying to decide if I should just order online or find a different product all together. 

Tarte really has great product and an amazing mission to create safe and nourishing cosmetics, but Ulta is not a good representative of their brand.

I can always pick up so many items at this ulta and it's never crowded. I grab tarte products, nyx and recently I like pure. I've tried to get in at the hair salon but it's always booked. I'm hoping one day I can visit the eyebrow bar at benefit when I have time to get an appointment

Ulta is a beauty mega store with hair care, nail, makeup, and beauty products in a wide array. This location is very well taken care of and stocked and the employees are knowledgeable and friendly. 

This location also contains a hair salon with the infrequently found trustworthy hair stylist--a young woman named Lindsey who you will recognize by her awesome 1950's pinup hair and ultra-glam style. I'm in my 20's and am forever concerned with mistakenly getting a mom-cut (no offense to you moms out there--I'm just not there yet) or anything else that will fall flat (sometimes literally) because I don't invest much time in primping. Lindsey listened to what styles I liked as well as my hair care routine, played with my hair to get a feel for its texture, and advised me on a few different options that she thought would work. The result was great every time and I appreciated her professional input.

This Ulta told me they were out of a specific eyeshadow palette and that the Ulta on Old Spanish trail was out of stock as well. They asked me to write my name and number down so when the palette did get in stock, they would contact me. Right after going to this Ulta, I visited the one on Old Spanish trail and the eyeshadow palette I wanted was in stock and they had plenty! The Ulta at the mall also never even contacted me to let me know when the palette was in stock, I would rather spend my money and time at the Ulta on Old Spanish Trail.

I am someone with very long hair and who is also petrified of haircuts and change. Elvia was more than incredible. She took the time to explain to me what type of hair styles will and will not look right with my type of hair. She was so patient, understanding and did more than everything she could to make sure I was getting exactly what I was asking for. Can't wait to come back to see her!! 
#happyhair #happygirl

Absolutely look around at other prices for ANYTHING you buy in their store. Most of my hair products I found online for half the price. I felt ripped off and dissatisfied. Will not buy there again except for products I KNOW are the same price there as they are everywhere (like some makeup lines).

I went in to ulta yesterday for the first time. I go in and there's no one around to assist customers. I walked in needing to walk out with foundation that day because that's how low I was on product. Anyways I literally wandered around for like 15 minutes trying to find a foundation that they actually had in stock. Either a color wasn't there or they just didn't have it. There was a line of customers so I waited til the line went down. Line went down, and I literally saw the cashiers just glance at me and pretend they didn't see me. I finally go up to a cashier with blond curly ombré blue hair to ask for help and this lady acted really snobby like I just ruined her day. I asked her if there were any more colors in the dermablend or the stilla foundation and she stated that dermablend is repackaging their product so she didn't know when they'd be stocked. So then she just looks at me. Ok, so I finally get her out from behind her register and she walks me over to stilla and points out their selections. I asked her for recommendations and what was comparable to the makeupforever foundation, and she told me that's at sephora and started to walk away. I asked her about the dermablend and she just sort of walked me over to the direction. Then she just kind of looked at me like she wanted a pat on the back for helping me. And I was just like ok, thanks? And she walked away. So I tried to match the foundation to my skin color and finally just grabbed two and went to the cashier. It was a different girl with long brown hair (thank god) and I asked which matched me better and this lady actually helped me figure it out. So I went home and looked at my foundation in the mirror and it was way too light. Basically the whole trip was a waste of time. I couldn't even exchange the product even if I wanted to because they didn't have many in stock. It was the worst customer service experience and I hate comparing stores, but sephora has never treated me like that. I might consider coming back someday since the last cashier actually attempted to help me, and she's the reason why I put two and not one star.

Just had the worst time trying to get an appointment , the people on the phone are very slow and had to speak to 5 different people with finally not getting an appointment , cannot be less professional .

I shop here at least once a month and 95% of the time the service is great. It always seems to be the same person (Alex) helping me. She's awesome. I very recently got into perfume and am rather selective. I can tell sometimes service people are annoyed at my lack of knowing what I want, but I also want suggestions from real people, not just an article or commercial telling me to buy something. There have been more than 3 times now that something I wanted was out (not even in the back) and I have to wait for another shipment. 
The salon... Oh Jeeze. There is this fellow who does the facial type stuff, and I like him. But DO NOT ever get ur hair cut here. Some girl with faddish orange hair butchered my hair. The manager cut it a week later, barely improved it. I had hair to the bottom of my shoulder blades. Even though I told the 1st girl I wanted a Victoria Beckham type bob, I end up with a to my ears mom bowl cut. After all was said and done, I had to go to a totally different place and get Pink the singers type cut. How u go from pretty darn long hair to it having to be shaved on the back/sides is beyond me. Maybe if that first person would have listened to me and didn't care so much about telling me how she was getting promoted to a master stylist I wouldn't now look like original Justin Bieber in this grow out process.

This rating is mostly for their Salon. I got a haircut/ style from Elvia today for $52. Although it's a bit more then other stylist there her experience was well worth it. After having an unfortunate haircut at a different Salon (Mila's on grant), Elvia was able to repair the damage. I usually get long layers and got a botched job. Thank Goodness Elvia was able to blend in the damage to make my hair look better then decent. I would definitely recommend her services for styles. Elvia spoke from experience and wasn't trying to sell me on particular styles for the money but rather was honest on what would look good. My faith has been restored.

Only gave 3 stars because the store is clean and has nice decor. This was my second time ever at an Ulta store and the first experience I had was great but today I went in for one item and all of the employees were busy so I went to the register to ask a question about the location of a product. The woman looked annoyed, as she had to stop what she was doing to help me. And she simply walked me to the makeup line I was looking for, pointed to it, and left in a hurry. I couldn't even find the specific product because she didn't give me a chance to ask any further questions. I looked for 5 minutes and just left because of the poor customer service.

Very helpful employees! Brandon was very patient and informative. He helped me multiple times, I left with multiple products but didn't feel like he was trying to push anything I didn't want. Helped me get exactly what I needed!

I enjoy the products and the servers on the floor are helpful and pleasant, but there seems to always be an extensive, long line up to pay at the cashier.  It averages 15  to 20 miutes.  How bout cross training the floor people...to keep up witb your sales...

Service is inconsistent.  Sometimes I go in and get frequent offers  for help.   Usually when I am looking at inexpensive items.  Tonight, I was making a very pricey purchase and couldn't get anyone to help me.  After circling the store twice, one person offered but she didn't know about the product. I then waited for another sales girl who said I should ask a different girl.   I finally started my timer  and waited 45 more minutes.   ( I had been saving up to make this purchase and I had an Ulta gift card.).  I actually was able to search 6 or 7 websites to read reviews while I waited. Now I know that I definitely want  the product and that Sephora has it!  

This is a great place to go for a huge selection of products.  You can get some coupon discounts if you are a frequent shopper.  Just don't expect knowledgable staff for more expensive purchases.   

The company needs to provide better training and work to keep their more experienced, savvy, and customer oriented employees.  Also, the traditional mall shopper probably wants to buy from someone with great looking hair and makeup - not the scary side of what 3% of the population thinks is fashionable.

I love ulta. I love their products, rewards, coupons, everything about it. BUT I went to this ultas salon for the first time 2 weeks ago. I paid over $100 for full highlights and toning. I think the prices are fair but not for what you get. First, the hair dresser did not say that toning was $20 more. Instead she just did it and I found out once she handed me the bill. My hair looked hardly lighter since she put a dark toner over the highlights. Secondly, I noticed I had a ton of hair not in foils. Today I went into another salon and was told how she did not even remotely do full highlights. She did the top and sides only but still charged me for full highlights. For what you pay and expect from a company with a well known name, I am extremely disappointed. I will not be going to an ulta salon again.

This review is for their salon services. I had gotten a hair cut elsewhere the week before last (wont name names) and they totally hacked my hair. When I asked the male owner in that establishment about the balayage technique, he proceeded to insult me for not knowing correct technical terms and made me feel stupid in front of other clients. 
Thankfully, I heard about Ulta's recent highlights promotion and decided to give them a try, as I had gotten my hair done there years ago. I also had hopes that they could salvage the whack job the other place had done. I met with Jennifer and she answered all my questions with patience and a sense of humor. They offered water and magazines while I waited and it was overall such a great atmosphere. She did some cute balayage, which seemed like such a hard task for the other place to do, and evened out my bob. Totally saved my hair. Thanks Jen! I'll be back soon : )

Horrible customer service. The staff (except the salon) are not helpful at all. They're all very snooty,stuck up and rude. I've been here multiple occasions and I've gotten terrible service every time. Definitely would rather go to sephora.

jaimie b I disagree. Although I have not had my hair done at Ulta.
Enter the store to the right is High end to the left...Lower. I feel like its a Macymart with an eerie feeling of jail cell as I pass through the two towers of snatch detection. The sales people
are either disinterested or clueless or maybe both. Their stock
is good for some products,poor for others and I "get" that its geared for younger women but I ask myself on my way out past
the twin towers..."Whos YOUR Daddy?"

Great customer service!!

I shopped here several times when I visited Tucson this summer. The selection is fantastic (sooo many tempting things!) and the staff is really friendly and helpful. 

I had a couple of problems using a coupon on the ULTA website (long story..the website simply would not let me use the coupon, no matter what I tried). So I brought the coupon with me into the store, and asked if there was any way I could use it there. Even though it was an online only coupon, the staff was sympathetic, and made sure that they found a way to give me the same discount. That was above and beyond the normal service level and very appreciated!

One of the girls also helped me choose a mascara, and she was very knowledgeable and friendly. 

In contrast, I have also visited Sephora in the Tucson mall and was NOT impressed (though I like the European Sephora shops and Sephora in NYC). The selection was terrible compared to ULTA and the staff was rude and ice cold. After one visit I decided it was ULTA in the Park Place Mall that would get my business during the month I was in Tucson!

Went in today and was lazily greeted at the door, I walked around the shop and found the brand I was looking for. I stood there looking at the brand and trying it one waiting for someone to walk by at offer help. I looked around and couldn't find anyone that was up to help. As I was walking out the people working there were more interested in standing by the register having their own conversations to notice anyone else Around. I'll stick with Sephora !
I got my hair cut/colored at the salon inside and they did pretty good.  The lady listened to what I wanted and she gave me exactly what I asked for.  I'll stop by again next time I'm in town again.
I just had a brow appointment with Brandon what a wonderful experience. He is very professional and helpful.

*Salon review*
Ever since moving to Tucson, I've always been looking for a great salon and I'm so happy that I found this place. I've come here twice (both for color and cut) and I've never been disappointed. If you're looking for knowledgeable and talented hair stylist, definitely come here and ask for Rosana!

I love shopping at Ulta! Sorry Sephora, but this place is more affordable and it has the best of both worlds (drug store cosmetics and name brand cosmetics)! I usually purchase cosmetics from Two Faced, Urban Decay, Anastasia Beverly Hill, and Smashbox. These are all the same brands that Sephora sells, but I can just grab my drug store favorites while I'm at it. The service here has always been great - friendly, knowledgable, and professional! Not once have I not been offered their service or had a bad experience. 

The reason I didn't give them a 5th star is because of their salon service. My hair dresser lacked the appropriate skills to provide me with the specific style I was going for. She ended up cutting my friend's hair and mine the same way. We clearly had different visions on the way we wanted our hair to look, too. Chop chop, snip snip and my long hair is gone. Haha. We live and we learn for next time, right? Overall, I'm not going to let my salon experience ruin my image about this store.

You should be ashamed. Not only for the initial service (I understand mistakes happen) but to CHARGE for this, and CHARGE AGAIN to fix it.... unbelievable!!! Management should be embarrassed at how they handled the situation.

I'm a big fan of all things beauty products. That being said, I also don't like to spend a lot of money on things that I have to replace two months from now. I will splurge on products I think can't be replaced by cheaper alternatives though.

Today, I went to purchase a product by Benefit (which oddly enough was $2 more at the store than online) and I ended up getting a bunch more products in the ULTA brand buy one, get one free section. You can't be that!

I admit, if you don't know what you are looking for it might be a bit overwhelming, but if you know what you want to get ahead of time it's all good.

One of my favorite places to waste time.. The staff is always super friendly and helpful, although they do seem to push certain products whether they are actually good or not. The point system is awesome, great 3.50$ off coupon on the app. I had my hair done at this location too and loved the experience. Every single time I go in here I have NO makeup on and look less than pretty- I never feel judged.
Basically my favorite for GO to beauty stuff. The service/staff is friendly and always have what I need!

The best selection of NYX cosmetics that I have found in tucson.. And they seem to always be on sale, b1g1 50% off! And they offer an ultra rewards card.. Low prices, good products, and benefits!  Can't complain!!  My only gripe is they NEVER have enough cashiers.   I always have to wait about 5 minutes to check out.
Staff really helps and answers questions. Great prices. It's my absolute go to! And they always have some kind of sale going on and that's a great time to try something new.

I love Ulta. The have everything you could want from the haircare products, make up, beautiful make up bags. In fact there are too many wonderful things! 
The staff are very helpful at the Broadway store excel. They make sure to answer every question and help you find everything before walking away.

Do not use their online services, their screwups cost you not them. Bought a pickup order there, their system decided to ship it to an old address,  without verification,  and it was a pickup order. Will never buy from them again.

Why the one star- because of the manager and a couple of staff not all
I started coming here last year; never really went to Ulta until then. After a couple of months one of the girls would remember me and vice versa. Each time she always gives me tips and advice etc
After going for so long at least 3 times if not more a month, I started noticing who was only nice when they wanted to. About 3 of them stand out to me, they're always so nice and explain and actually help with what they can 
I understand it's super busy since its in the mall and it's fast paced, we all want assistance though when it comes down to purchasing these expensive products, it's not like we aren't paying the amount

I was in there earlier, typical interaction with the girl I mentioned earlier, as I was asking about which styling tool to get, I noticed there was a woman looking for a hair dryer but kept walking around. Suddenly the manager looks at our direction about 10 feet away and over the mic says "help this lady"
I didn't react, just told the girl it was ok to go but then to think about it, that was rude ! Why couldn't she help her instead of adding this stress on her staff! I really dislike managers that are like that. An example should be given. There's a difference between leaders and bosses

I've come to Ulta so many times it's not funny (especially for my wallet). I'll admit the service I receive is usually pretty mixed. Some ladies are so nice and extremely helpful, but other's can be very annoyed and you have to chase them down for help. Last night though was a completely different experience. I was floored by one associate. I didn't catch her name, but she helped me try on 6 different foundations, gave me her honest opinion and was extremely knowledgeable. She also got some Clinique on a pad and helped me wipe everything off. Once I chose a foundation color, she then offered to grab me two bottles. She didn't seem bothered or unwilling to help me. I could tell she had a lot of restocking to do, but she still took time to help me. This was the best customer service experience and it makes me want to come back and shop again.
They were the greatest !  My order came in less then a week. Thank your Ulta in this time of COVID isolation.

I was in desperate need of a hair cut a few days before my road trip, I had gone all over town late in the afternoon getting turned away from everyone. Finally I call this store and Alicia was able to fit me in last second! She gave me a great hair cut with layers and amazing customer service! I highly recommend Alicia!

This store is pretty big, which makes my teenage daughter quite happy. There were actually a few benches around the store, which made this tired mama quite happy! The store is clean, well stocked and well maintained. We didn't encounter many employees, but the couple that we did come across were friendly.

I go here, i browse around, then boom! i want everything they have in this place. I'm not a big girly girl type of person, but whenever i enter through their doors I turn into a hoarder. I make sure i go here by myself, coz if i bring along the hubby and/or the son, then my time is short. They have great selections and their own ulta brand is worth your bucks too. People who works here are very helpful too, and will try and cater to whatever specific products you're looking for.

Let me start by saying I've gotten my hair cut here for a year now and had lots of very good experiences. Unfortunately this time I had a not so great one. After about 6 months of growing my hair out to get a different than usual cut, I finally had the length I wanted for a soccer players mullet. My wife was on board, I was excited! We got there for my appointment and showed Rocio some pictures of what I was looking for. She nodded and acknowledged that what I was asking for was long on top, short bangs, shaved sides and long in the back. She put the smock on me and IMEDIATELY PROCEEDED TO CUT ALL OF THE HAIR ON THE BACK OF MY HEAD OFF! I was shocked but it was too late so I didn't say anything. She then accidentaly got my beard with the trimmers and tried to cover it up by saying "are you sure you don't want a little beard trim? I'll do it for free." Again it was too late so I allowed it. She just ran the clippers over my face with the same guard as my head since that's what she bush whacked a chunk of it out with. Afterwards She kept cutting my hair.. and cutting and cutting until eventually I had the hair cut of an 8 year old boy in 2006. My wife also had an appointment for a hair cut at the same time as mine with a different stylist. WhiIe I was waiting I watched Rocio give THE SAME HAIR CUT to a elementary school boy. So long story short, DO NOT GET A MENS CUT FROM ROCIO She will cut it however she sees fit and disregard your actual wishes. I've attached the picture of what I asked for, and a picture of what I left with. Thanks for reading, I hope this helped.

i like ulta, they sell great products that i could get cheaper elsewhere.

Now about the salon, i went to get a simple eyebrow/lip wax it cost 27 + tip and the service was horrible!!!! 

the lady did nothing but complain hauntingly about how bushy my brows were.

 hello, that's why i went to get those caterpillars waxed!

 then when i left and washed off the concealer she put on to cover the redness i noticed she left patches on my lip and over waxed my brows. why pay over 30 to get half waxed?

I walked in for an eyebrow wax without an appointment. We weren't greeted by anyone and, when we found the waxing station, I sat down and waited while the esthetician worked on a customer. I was asked if I had an appointment and I said that I didn't. She told me "that's ok." 

So... I waited for about 15 minutes, being totally ignored. At 12:15, another customer came in with a 12:20 appointment. We left and nobody seemed to notice or care.

I get that I'd need to wait if I didn't have an appointment but it's not hard to tell me that it would be a while so I could decide whether to wait or not. Instead, I wasted my time. I was planning on getting wedding makeup done here but not after being treated so poorly.

Poor form, Ulta. Poor form.

I have been going to Ulta for many, many years, but after my last visit I will not be returning.
At the checkout I selected to print my receipt and was quite insulted to be lectured by the little girl behind the counter on my need to "Save the Planet" and not select a printed receipt. I informed the cashier Layla that I had been a stout recycler for over 30 years and needed the receipt because it was a new, high priced item that might have to be returned.
I DID NOT go to Ulta for a lecture from some little twit who probably drove her car to work (I carpooled) and felt she needed to get her pseudo eco warrior message out to a paying customer who had done more to date to save the planet than she probably will in her entire lifetime!
Every staff member I made eye contact with had a smile and kindly assisted me with my questions and lead me to exactly what I sought.

It's the employees pretending I can't see them following me ALL AROUND THE STORE for me. Like can you be anymore prejudice? But this isn't the first time they've made me feel uncomfortable. My first visit it was a petite white women with dark brown hair. Asking me same question even though she was right behind me every aisle. My recent visit it seems there has been talk. I had returned a perfume that was over $100 but literally smelled like alcohol. So I returned it. This time I enter Ulta, a short white male with dark hair and an open button up continues to ask me questions AFTER another employee already greeted and filled me in on store sale etc. He comes off as the "helpful sales guy" but I was literally watching him switch from each side of the room to watch me everywhere I went. I went by the skincare, he was suddenly reorganizing by the skincare lines. I go to look at face powder he is ALSO fake organizing the powder. Then I'm finally by the perfumes. The little man really thought I wasn't gonna pick up on him standing two aisles over (the aisles are 3-4 ft tall)  PRETENDING TO STARE OFF INTO THE DISTANCE  Immediately I look up at him to call him over and he starts questioning if I "really liked" the perfume I got this time. Like sir? Is this gossip girl or an establishment? Now ironically enough Of course I didn't say anything when I watched a white couple in front of me in the checkout line shove a bunch of foundation concealer n blushes etc in their coat sleeves because lol not my job! I did enjoy my products but if I will be letting people know this location isn't brown skin friendly.

My recent trip to ulta was horrible. I went in thinking I was going to get some shopping done but the associates were just plain rude!!! They had no idea what they were talking about. And they all had an attitude and looked like they were unhappy to be there. From now on I'm doing all my make up purchases at sephora.!

I'm pretty sure the cashier who helped us was Alexandra. She was SO sweet and helpful! I was buying eyeliner and found a gift set without a price in the clearance section. I was just about to check out at that time so I asked the cashier if she could check the price! It was only like $7 for 5 nice eyeliners! Alexandra also took the time to make sure it was the kind of eyeliner I like! 


I've been to a lot of Ultas and this is the best service I've ever received.

This is only a review of the brow bar. I've had nothing but great experiences with the Benefit brow bar in Walnut Creek, Ca., so I wasn't at all nervous coming in. I should have been. I almost got up when the woman used a color that looked nothing like my eyebrows, but I didn't and that was my mistake. Not only did she was my EYELIDS, but she made my eyebrows entirely uneven. She knew this and I knew this, but she clearly didn't know how to fix them and I was worried she'd take them off entirely so I just left. I won't be coming back, and hope this review helps others avoid my experience.

I like this as a closer alternative to Sephora, though they don't carry nearly as many brands or products.  The sales people don't really know their "stuff" so I feel like I have to know exactly what I'm looking for when I go in there.  However, they do offer returns, no questions asked, which is nice because I am picky and don't want to spend $20 on eye shadow unless it's really worth is
Yaletzy cut my hair and did an amazing job. I would recommend her for anyone. Her co worker Cecilia was very helpful as well. Thank you for a great hair cut and great service!

Good selection, feels pretty low-key, no intense sales pressure.

On the other hand, the customer service force is a mixed bag. I have had some pleasant interactions with some employees. But.....when I called to ask about a hair cut/color, the person on the phone was rude and did not  seem very knowledgable about the salon offerings. I also once witnessed the associates at the front desk talking snarkily about a customer. That surely did not leave the best impression.

This does not even deserve 1 star!!! I have never been to an Ulta store before I have always been a loyal Sephora VIB Rouge member but I figured I would see what all the hype was about......1) I agree with what everyone is saying about absolutely horrendous services! They are so rude and Condescending as well. 2) the place is disgusting! 3) out of a lot of supplies 4) a lot of things are out of place so you spend a lot of time searching through everything to try and find that item that is apparently out of stock 5) maybe it was just this time but a lot of things didn't even have prices!!! I needed up just leaving without purchasing anything  but at least I got the store managers card. Never ever coming back!

While I generally find what I need at this store, both the customer service and the clarity of what is and isn't in stock needs work. I have multiple times checked the availability of an item online only to find that it was in fact not in stock when I got to the store. This leads into my second complaint, the way that the workers address customers. Due to the fact that the online availability can be misleading, i called the store in addition to checking online, to see if the NYX matte liquid liner was in stock yet. The woman repeatedly cut me off while talking, and upon telling me that it wasn't in stock, despite the fact that the website said it was, all that she had to say was 'bye.' She didn't ask if I had any more questions, she just hung up the phone. Another instance of bad customer service did not come from rudeness but from ignorance. I'm not sure if the woman attempting to help me one day was new or just under-studied, but I asked her questions about cruelty-free products and am sure that she was making answers up. Id have rather had her refer me to someone else in the store than give me wrong answers. Had I bought something on her recommendation that was not cruelty-free I would have been completely infuriated. While I love the company, this particular store needs to step up its game.

I've been debating on writing what happened to me on Monday October 23, 2017 but I've decided I'm going to share... so my friend and I decided after having dinner at a near by restaurant that we were going to walk around ulta for a little bit just to look around.. so as usual we enter the store and are greeted by people at the registers and we start to look around and as we are looking around a few employees ask us if we need help and we decline letting them know we are just looking around. THEN another employee who I recognize since I come here quite frequently ask us the same question and we decline and then I guess she found a Starbucks cup on one of the makeup displays and BLIRTS out "I didn't know this was a trash can" being totally passive aggressive... me and my friend look over and she told us she wasn't "referring to us" but clearly since we were the only people around she WAS! My friend and I weren't even drinking Starbucks at all btw lol... so after that we just keep looking around and then we are LEAVING THE STORE.... and the same lady basically gets about less then arms length away from me and says "you didn't find what you were looking for" and I say no we were just looking... and she basically walks us out of the store. I felt like she thought we were stealing something which we weren't like I said I spend a lot of my money at ulta why would I steal something? I won't be returning to this location any more just because of this incident. Ulta maybe you should teach your employees to not be so passive aggressive!!!

This store is the worst. Every single time I go, I leave empty handed due to the shelves being in total disarray, a majority of the products open and used (despite there being testers) and entire product lines being sold out. Staff are completely unhelpful, often just testing out makeup on themselves. With sephora so close, I have no desire to shop at ULTA until their store becomes less of a disaster.

there's literally no workers around the store, and they usually only stay in the front register. Even when there's a long line, some of the workers will just be socializing in the front without ringing up the customers. Disappointed by the service.

Had a great experience with Terry Li at the MAC counter a couple of weeks ago. I was looking for budget friendly moisturizer and concealer but after her makeover she convinced me to buy quality. Plus, these products will last a long time. Terry didn't make me feel embarrassed about my routine and I walked out feeling like a million bucks.

I am disappointed with the haircut I received from a hairstylist at this location. The hairstylist was a nice woman but she was very inexperienced in cutting hair and if it wasn't for my constant instructions on how I want my hair she would have done what she thought was good and would have left me with hair that I would have hated. I am just ok with the cut but it could have been executed much much better . I showed her many pictures of the exact haircut that I wanted, which was simple to begin with, but she followed her own suit. I won't be going to Ulta for for hair services any more.

The only reason this is 4/5 stars is because they always run out of the most popular items (like the Becca Ultimate Coverage foundation) and their restocking is not in sync. So, I have to make trips down to the nearest Sephora; however, besides the sell-outs, Ulta being in a very close vicinity to IV is so dangerous. I love how Ulta is a combo if drugstore and high end beauty products with coupons here and there.

Some of these negative reviews really suprise me because the goleta ulta has exceeded my expectations in customer service every single time. Tiffany is new in the salon and shes awesome! She literally changed my "blonde" life after saying "she couldnt live without purple shampoo" I couldnt afford it at the time but I came back weeks later and go the joico shampoo and conditioner...and OMG life changing!!! I would have her do my hair in a heartbeat but Im super close to my current stylist! Another visit..yesterday I stopped by on my way home from work with a birthday gift card to play with. Jacklyn (the clinque manager) was beyond helpful, she answers more questions regarding beauty products that I ever would have expected. She stayed with me from skincare to luxury makeup brands to brushes to hair...and helped me decide on essentials so i didnt go way over my gift card amount. I am a manager at a retail clothing store and I can honestly say, she is a GEM in the retail world! Ulta is very lucky to have her on the team!

I should add that I also shop at sephora pretty frequent and I love both...but recently Ulta is really becoming my favorite
In reguards to the bad reviews about feeling ignored, this is what I have observed between the 2 stores
- sephora usually has a fuller staff to store and customer ratio. Sometimes so many that the look bored because the store is only so big
-ulta is the complete opposite, less staffed bigger store, more customers than availible sales associates... which all i have to say to that is..i get it! Thats how retail is sometimes and I completely understand. But to future customers, if you need help and no one is availible at that mintue...just ask! And i promise you will get service that exceeds your expectations!

The employees and managers are so rude and not helpful. The manager when I asked for help kept on shaking her head at me and being rude. Then on one of my returns they only gave me $15 back off a $29 purchase. So unfair and not right. It truly did make me not wanna ever go there again, I'll just stick to Sephora.

The customer service here is terrible. Nine times out of ten when I go in, I spend 15 minutes just looking for a person who actually works there. About a week ago, I asked a woman for help with finding a toner, I was passed along about 5 different people before one of them actually helped me. She asked me what I was looking for in a toner and I asked her for something more moisturizing and gentle and she replied, "do you even know what a toner is?" and told me that toners weren't moisturizing, and they were meant for exfoliation and removing make up and kept trying to sell me something I didn't want. Today I went in and saw a moisturizing toner while I was looking for pore strips. Ha. Also the pore strips I want are never stocked, and after looking for someone to ask if they had more in the back for like 10 minutes I put everything I was going to buy back and walked out. Going here is not worth it, just find what you need on Amazon.

I love the coupons that Ulta sends in the mail and the products they have, but I have to say this place is a a complete mess. Their products seem to always be out of stock or out of place. Not to mention, it's completely dirty and unorganized. You'll see unwrapped and used products everywhere in the store. I haven't had a bad experience with the people that work there, but I think that management needs to get more organized, keep the place cleaner and keep track of their inventory

I had a very important event to go to and I gave myself an ample amount of time to get my hair done there. I was there for over two hours and the more they worked on my updo the worse it got I literally left in tears. This is one salon I will never go to again.

Go in the store to do your shopping!  The online order system absolutely sucks.  Everything went wrong on a simple 2-item order.  And the customer service department cannot take an order over the phone -- it must be placed by the customer.  I tried two different credit cards and Paypal.  The first rep I talked with (after 60 minutes of trying) gave me a $15 coupon but later when I tried to use it, it didn't seem to take (and she said it would).  The IT department needs to fix the interface!  Terrible service online!

Julianna is exceptional at consulting on hair color and style.  She's colored, cut and styled my hair a number of times and each time I get a lot of positive feedback...that's a plus!  I notice that the dyes she uses don't irritate my scalp either...another plus.

I was in need of new foundation for the summer. I had never been in an Ulta before, but the coupon from the Sunday paper was enough to entice me to stop by during a Costco run. After wandering the store for 20 minutes, I put back the foundation brush I had intended on buying as well and left. The only acknowledgement from an employee came when I was told to move so she could show another customer the display I was looking at. There was no 'please' or 'someone will be right with you'. They seemed to be both understaffed (I saw maybe 5 employees, 1 was on the phone, 2 were talking to each other, 1 at the register, 1 on the floor) and the staff they did have were lacking basic customer service skills. I will definitely be sticking to Sephora in the future.

Tiffany at the salon is amazing! I have known her for years and followed her here from her previous work. She is the only person I'll let touch my hair on the west coast. It always turns out impeccably. I can shower and air dry any haircut she gives me and it is just styled perfectly. Ulta is the luckiest to have her!

Employees were cold and acted both judgmental and weirdly almost suspicious of me. I spent a lot of money and made it clear I was willing to do so and they were unhelpful and overall just odd. Girl at the cash register was also extremely quiet and weird. Older manager-type woman just didn't really want to help me and no one else did either? Confused who is hiring these people or why this is the atmosphere they want. When I got home, my friends all said they had similar experiences there. Sad it wasn't a pleasant shopping experience and won't go back despite the good selection of items.
Sign up for an ulta card. Then keep an eye on your email. Certain days they have awesome deals and specials where you can get free stuff. And in the email you can always get a percent off your bill.

If you want to waste some time while buying cosmetics or personal care items, I have juuuust the place for you! Wanna be late for a movie at the marketplace or spend an unnecessary 25 minutes any day or time of the week? Then visit this place. 

They are woefully understaffed and often have only one humiliated salesperson at the registers at a time. It must be fun to have to help a line of 15 agitated people at once while your manager barks orders at other staff and keeps them away from the registers for no good reason.

Witness the poor saleslady who had to take a "call" from a manager that meant walking away from me while I was about to pay. She tried to explain to the superior on the other end of her headset that she had a line forming and was helping someone but whatever that person wanted was more important. Her embarrassment was palpable. And, I'm sure, genuine. That didn't change the fact that I was held up almost 10 minutes while she did her manager's bidding. What on earth is up with that? 

Other reasons for lack of stars? It's filthy in this location. Gross. NO excuses for that. And they don't know their stock. They have a tester for a PTR product that was discontinued months ago. I asked when it would be back in stock and was told (twice) that it would be in on a specific weekday. Like a chump, I went in three weeks in a row only to find out by a cursory internet search that the item was no longer even being made. SINCE LAST DECEMBER.

Like I said....nearly everything about this location is an utter waste of time. Go to another location, go to Sephora, order from Ulta online. Virtually anything is better than shopping in this store.

Jackie Jackie Jackie!
Jackie has helped me pick out some of my favorite products. She matches me well with foundation and takes my skin's needs into consideration. She knows her stuff and I trust her recommendation. 
You'll find her in the expensive makeup section and, almost guaranteed, she'll engage with you first!

I love plenty of things about Ulta. They have a wide selection of both luxury brand and drugstore brand cosmetics, skincare and hair care all in one place. The staff have been helpful in recommending products and they regularly offer a coupon for $3.50 off most products in their mailer (if you forget yours, just google one on your smartphone and present it at checkout). The bummer is that on more than five occasions they have been out of my regular products. On most of those occasions, the staff couldn't tell me when they would be restocked and blamed the manufacturer. I've finally decided to save myself the aggravation and order them online with Prime.

I cannot say enough good things about this ulta location. About the staff?!Everyone is amazing and incredibly helpful, can't compliment all of the lovely ladies who work at this location enough. I have issues w an annoying long list of allergies and I'm also pretty set on what I like so I always have a lot of questions and everyone is always helpful and patient with me.

Just had a skin care session with Alyssa and I could not have asked for a better experience! She is extremely knowledgeable and friendly. She really cares about her clients and makes the entire appointment relaxing. Can't wait to go again

I'm addicted to makeup, hair care and beauty supplies in general. Ulta usually has what I'm looking for in stock. Only twice was what I wanted out of stock. Service is just okay. Not always available but generally knowledgeable. This is my go to for high end makeup in Goleta

Shout out to Salon Manager Katherine. She does a great job. I'm the type of person that shows what I would like and let her do her thing to make me look good. Sometimes we have an idea that's just not feasible with our hair type. 
She asks questions along the way and I appreciate that but I let her do her magic in hairstyling.  She is professional and understanding and that is why I am a repeat customer from Port Hueneme.
The salon inside the store is clean and the other retail associates stopped to greet me as I was making my way to the back.

My experience at the Hair Salon was amazing! 
I have gone to Carlyle Salon and I thought I was going to get amazing hair because well that's what the reviews led me to believe and I was dead wrong. 
So I went to another salon in downtown and they were okay. 
I was ready to give up and go back to the amazing hair stylists in Orange County when I found Katherine. 
She is such an amazing person and on top of it an amazing hairstylist. I fell in love with her and her work. 
She didn't seem so sure she could make out what I wanted but she tried her best and she made it happen. I love that she put all her attention on my hair and made sure that the process was quick. 
I just can't wait to go back to her in 2 months. She's so beautiful inside and out. 
Don't undermine any salon because you might just find a hidden gem.

For being in such a prime location (the one and only freaking Camino Real shopping center!!!), this store, in my opinion, does not meet the Camino Real standards.

Sure it is new, so it is relatively clean and modern inside. However, what is deceiving is that the store seems so large, you would expect their selection and stock to match up! This is most definitely NOT the case. I would browse the aisles with many of their products no longer on the shelves (if you don't believe me, check out their consistently empty Essie nail polish stand). On the other hand, I do like how they offer CARGO products, because Sephora no longer seems to carry that brand.

Service is pretty meh. Usually check out can be a slow and painful process -- not really sure why. It's always so much faster at Sephora even with Ulta having more people manning the cashiers! The staff are pretty friendly overall, as they circulate the store asking if I'm finding everything okay, but they really need to expedite and make the check out process more efficient.

I got my hair cut with Jessica at the salon, and I had the best experience with her. Going from fairly long hair to pixie is always a big step, but Jessica was excited from the start. She listened to what I wanted, and we worked together to make sure it was a perfect cut for me; funky yet functional style-wise. Even though it's short, she cut it in such a way that I can wear it in a number of different ways and it still looks fabulous. She was a delight, and I've gotten so many enthusiastic compliments on my hair, I cannot thank her enough! She recommended products without being pushy, and suggested the smaller bottles first just to make sure it would work out. No overselling, and very reliable suggestions as I can definitely style my hair at home with ease. I will be going back to her again!!

I rarely give a negative review but this place has consistently been the most frustrating experience for me. I'm a goleta local so the Ulta in the marketplace was anticipated to be a great nearby beauty stop (Sephora is a bit of a trek downtown from ellwood). 

Every time I try to go to this location, I'm horrendously disappointed. The check out line can be 2 people or 15 people but it will take you 30 minutes to get out of the store from the moment you get in line. There are always 1-2 checkers no matter how long the line is and, shockingly, there are plenty of ulta employees standing around, stocking things, while customers wait and wait and wait. Sometimes they are just staring at you. It's horrible service. 

There have been a handful of times I have attempted to wait in line and given up. I've even searched the store for somewhere else to pay or someone to talk to, but to no avail. Inevitably, I exclusively rely on Sephora now or the Ulta up in SLO, because this store is inexcusable.

Update: I just tried this place again and it took thirty minutes to get through a 6-7 person line. I don't understand why this hasn't been addressed. Maybe it's because all of the employees are spending their time on yelp declaring poor reviews "funny." Totally embarrassing customer service.

I've been shopping at this Ulta since it opened and the staff are generally the nicest people, upbeat, inclusive, and helpful. Especially in the Clinique bar. They also seem quite busy. Sure - sometimes when it's busy the line is insane, and sometimes the products are in limbo states of restocking. I'm sure management has its up and downs. In general this is a fine Ulta with nice workers.

I've never written a review before but this is the second time their "good quality" products fail! It's frustrating!! I'm in need of a new eye curler mine just broke has it for a good while so it's understandable. Anyways I send my boyfriend to get me a new one while I'm at work and I told him I'll pay him back later. He goes in and he obviously doesn't know where they are hell I don't even know where they are! But as soon as he find someone to help all they offer him is the most expensive eye curler there. He brings it home and damn thing doesn't even work! We returned and exchanged it for a different a little less expensive the next day the lady (don't remember her name) she's very sweet kind and friendly returns it. We go home and I try it out. AGAIN!! The stupid thing doesn't curl!! We went back to return it and a different lady gives a little attitude, but I mean really it's the second damn time these "great" products fail. We head to Kmart it's cheaper yet still have better quality than ulta! Never going there again!

I went into this Ulta because I was in the city for work. I really needed a new face sunblock and Clinique powder.

When I walked in, I was greeted very fast. The lady that helped me (I forgot here name, ugh) was very knowledgeable and not pushy at all. I told her what I wanted and she knew right away what I wanted. 

Store was very clean and stocked. I'm glad I went in here instead of going all the way to Santa Barbara. This location is very convinient and  has lots of parking!

I felt so bad after how I saw the employees were being treated today had to write a good review. Every time I come in here the gals are always super kind. The Clinique gal helped me so much today and she was coming back and running to the cashe register and coming back to the Clinique area. She was doing her best while the store was unusually full . She did try to explain that they were short staffed today but these college girls were just annoyed that they had to wait in line and were being so rude. Even as I was checking out the girls were right in my space right In front of the debit card machine I had to ask one girl to move so I could pay. For being short staffed and putting up with all the attitude they get all day I'm amazed at how kind the employees are here. The gal named Celeste is always nice too. I feel that this store has bad ratings because we're near a college town and if they don't get help right away there quick to come on here and complain. I live about 6 minutes away and have frequented this store for years. It sucks that these college kids come in with their sorry attitudes and complain about everything. Not once have I had a bad experience at this store.

I went in the other day for the second time since living here. I got there early for a manicure appt I had that afternoon. I decided to browse while I wait. I noticed dirty/gross testers, no associates acknowledged me while I browsed, no one asked if I needed assistance or anything. 

Now I work in retail myself and I understand needing to get your job done with displays or whatever it may be. But really not even a "Hello" or a "Can I help you?" was said so it's just kind of appalling to see poor customer service. I walked through aisles looking at makeup while associates glanced over while continuing their project. 

I was testing makeup on the back of my hand and needed a tissue to wipe it off...I couldn't find a single stand w clean tissues or cotton. There were plenty of used cosmetic supply strewn on displays. It was really off putting. Makeup testers out or dried up/funky smells. 

I had a great experience last year I went there to get my nails done. The girl did everything you would do for a manicure. This time on the other hand was different. When I went in the other day, my nails came out looking like I had painted them quickly before I came into the salon. 

No soaking of nails to soften skin, no pushing back of cuticles..you know the regular routine of a manicure. I felt bad calling back because the the woman who did my nails was SUPER friendly and nice. We had a lovely conversation too. But I didn't feel like she knew what she was doing all the way. 

My nails look awful and I payed $40 total for them to look like I did It myself, which is the whole reason I go to get them done so they look nice. I don't know if I'll be coming back here for services.

I feel like this Ulta location has improved recently. Mostly due to the wonderful customer service from Jackie.  She is a wonderful wealth of knowledge. I think her main focus is on Clinique products but is more than willing to help with other brands. No pushy sales, just really sweet and helpful and knowledgeable. I'm going to start going here more just to seek out her help. Hope they're paying her enough to allow her to stay.

Disappointing service - long lines with no true regard for the customers' time (20 minutes+). No samples and lots of out of stock items, however I am happy they're available so close to IV. Try to make one trip rather than a few.

I work down the street from Ulta, and have walked over on a few lunch hours with my boss or coworkers. Every SINGLE time we have been there, and anyone has purchased something that had a "gift with purchase," not only do they NOT have the gift available, but whoever helps us is rude. This is 4 separate occasions. To add to this, my husband once stopped by on his way to get me, to pick up a surprise for me, at this Ulta location, and had picked up something that said it had a free gift with purchase. SURPRISE! They didn't have it, and were rude to him. We now order online only.

As with all Ulta stores, the selection of different brands they carry is good. This Ulta, however, lacks in the experience that many others strive to bring. None of the sales people were even in sight when I went in. I was purchasing one item and had to wait 30 minutes in line as they only had 2 people ringing customers. One of the cashiers didn't seem to care about the line and was chatting away with the customer she had while the other clearly had no motivation to move quickly. Definitely will make the drive downtown to Sephora for all make up purchases.

Don't really like coming in here; the sales associates are always catty and in their little cliques and aren't that welcoming, especially if you're shopping alone and not really buying anything. Plus the lines are always insane with just one register working and the register girl explaining the whole Ulta rewards to each customer which is fine but it literally takes hours to check out especially with a huge line. Plus the product inventory isn't that great and out of stock of a lot of things.

This is for the salon at Ulta, not the store itself. 

I rarely write bad reviews, but this Ulta is just not the place to get a haircut. I am new to the area and so I got two haircuts at Ulta before deciding that the convenient location and low price wasn't worth it.

For both haircuts--with two different stylists--they told me that they "preferred cutting dry" and so didn't wash or blow dry my hair. This doesn't reduce the price, however, and I feel like it's just a convenient way for the stylist to get out of the time-consuming wash and blow dry. Also, on my first visit the stylist asked me if I wanted it straightened and since I do normally straighten my hair I said yes. When I went to pay I noticed she added a $10 charge to the bill! So, she didn't give me half of the haircut (the wash and blow dry) but added extra to the total price. 

For both haircuts I wanted a normal cut with long layers just to make it lay nicely, and both stylists did a crazy amount of layering in my hair that I definitely didn't ask for. The first stylist mentioned that I had a "mom haircut" and talked about all the crazy things that happen in IV where she lives. The second stylist told me that my side part looked like "TV anchor hair." Who are these people? 

Anyway, both haircuts left me feeling deflated so I finally found a new salon (Cutting Edge Hair Salon in Goleta) and I couldn't be happier.

I love the location of this store (good parking, around other stores/business I frequent), but that is about it. The shelves are always half empty and the stock is very disorganized. The staff does not seem to have answers to any questions and seem unfamiliar with the products, and oftentimes rude.

Most annoying is this experience: they have been out of two very basic products, and in both situations, told me that they weren't getting anymore, and that the product had been discontinued by the manufacturer. I then went to Sephora, and they had the products and found it odd that Ulta said the products were discontinued as they had heard nothing about it. After contacting the actual manufacturers, I found out that this was completely untrue. Fact of the matter seems to be that the staff at Ulta don't know the answer as to why they don't have basic stock, and doesn't feel like looking into it.

Save yourself the trouble, just go to Sephora, or a drugstore if it is a cheaper item.

Went in for a simple question: what makeup, especially eyeshadow, should I wear with this formal outfit?" And was given wonderful service that exceeded my expectations. They spent an hour explaining how to apply products and what would look best given my budget. Keri worked with me to create a great look and recommend fantastic products, and Celeste made my eyebrows "on point". They have expensive products as well as drug store products and are all happy to help.

I had a great experience the time i went. Lauren assisted me when i was trying to color match concealer and powder to my face (super friendly!). Then  Jackie was just the best at clinique. She not only helped me match the new workout foundation, but she also helped me get some face cleansing products to start. She helped me and my room mates and she was just the best. Definitely will go back when needed and not hesitate. The line was busy but my transaction was fast as well.

I guess you could say I am glutton for punishment....Every single experience I have had in this store has been Bad-Horrific-Horrible. The lack of customer service that these employees have is unbelievable. I keep trying to give them another chance because I literally live 10mins away. The employees either are gossiping with one another or hate each other and make it very apparent with the attitude that they give each other. I have four sisters and we have bought thousands of dollars worth of make-up/skin/hair items at this store and that is how much this Ulta store will be losing from us. I literally am at the point to stand in front of this Ulta and have all potential customers that are about to come in know the lack of customer service that they have so they'll turn right around and not give them any business!

I've been a frequent customer of this location since opening weekend (they were giving away gift certificates and goodie bags that weekend, so I went twice!) Anyways, I'm not sure if my experiences are common for all Ulta's , or just this one, as I've only ever shopped here. The positives-- they have a lot of diversity between various lines and price points. If you want a black eye liner, you can spend $6 for a great one from Prestige, or $20 for a good one from Urban Decay. Same with hair care products, which I generally avoid because I'm terrible at doing my hair.

The negatives-- this store is really slow to receive new product. I've been checking for weeks to see when they will get new shades of L'Oreal Infallible e/s. I finally gave up and visited a few local drugstores (Rite-Aid, CVS, and Walgreens) until I found the new color in stock. Ulta, as of today, still doesn't have the new collection! Uhg. Also, they are slow to put out new collections. They had mailed out the free Clinique lipstick mailer *before* unboxing and setting up their new Clinique counter. What the heck? I had to wait a few weeks before returning and redeeming my free lipstick coupon.

Also, the sales people. Oh, the sales people....they are nice at best. Most of them are not informed and don't have much training. It's probably not their fault, but the store. I know Sephora has a lot more training for their employee's, so if I actually want to bother asking a sales person about something, I would go to Sephora or Nordstrom's, *not* Ulta.

The best part about Ulta's is their coupons. You can use a $3.50/off coupon (minimum purchase $10, drugstore items only, not prestige cosmetics) and a 20%-off one item coupon in the same transaction...mix that in with some of their buy one, get one 50% off deals and you just saved yourself a pretty penny. I love their sales, coupons, and other deals! Now, if only they could train all employee's to a higher level *and* get new products/collections in stock and on display within a reasonable time!!!

I love coming to Ulta for all the drugstore brands and hair care because of the lack of Targets/Wal-Marts in the area. I usually come in and just look at everything and I can't say a time where I really needed any help. However, I was in here just the other day and I was asked by three different people if I was doing okay or had questions which I liked. I will admit that every once in a while their inventory can be low for mostly the drugstore brands and NYX. I was looking for dupes and they didn't have the NYX setting spray I was looking for. All in all, this place is good, not the best Ulta but I've never had a bad experience coming in here.

Worst customer service! I went to return an item I bought online and they said they couldn't refund me Because I had no receipt, even though I had my order number and confirmation on my phone! I called customer service and they emailed the receipt to the store and the lady on the phone said "by the way they could have looked up your receipt with your order number! Wow that's all I have to say..... Not shopping here again!
This place is just an average ULTA. Employees are average, not great but not terrible. I do love Nay at the Brow Bar. She is awesome. She does a great job with my brows, and I go there for her.

Just stopped in to pick up a few "drug store items" I needed - wow. Amazing selection, and it seemed everything I looked at was way cheaper than Target, etc. Lots of items on "clearance" at surprisingly low prices. Grabbed a few items, paid using one of the coupons I got in my Sunday newspaper, got home and looked in the bag, remembering the clerk had mentioned something about a "free gift"....well, there was not "a" free gift - there were FIVE! - one of which was a KMS hair product (love KMS!), and one was a FULL SIZE Ulta eyeliner in the color I wear most - green. (Did she notice I have green eyes or was this simply a coincidence?) While the customer service is far lacking compared to Sephora, it was fun come home with a bag of goodies for ten bucks! 

That said, customer service needs some polishing. Never having visited an ULTA store, I wanted to peruse the ULTA brand cosmetics, but an employee re-stocking that display happened to have a bunch of boxes, etc right in front of it. I kind of felt in his way, and wish he had simply looked up, said hello or smiled. Moving on to another aisle, a woman did finally acknowledge my presence and ask if I needed assistance. (Turns out she was the one who later rang up my purchases, so perhaps they are short-staffed?) I asked her opinion on a particular shade of brow pencil I was considering - she agreed it was too dark for me. Then walked away.  At Sephora they take you to the display, show you better selections for your coloring, then offer to apply it so you can see before you buy. (I never did purchase one...)

I guess it just depends on what it is you are shopping for - sometimes you don't want a lot of attention -  just want to "treasure hunt", find bargains, or try new products without a huge investment - ULTA is just the place!

Deborah at the salon did such a wonderful job on my hair!! She accommodated us last minute on New Year's Day! She is so funny and listened to what I wanted and gave me an easy to manageable cut which is exactly what I wanted! Thank u Deborah!!

I'm a fan of this Ulta--it's new, clean, and spacious, and it has a lot of different lines to pick from.  Plus I get coupons to use there regularly, which is nice.  If you're one of those shoppers who likes to be left alone until she actually needs help (like me), you'll like this place because the employees don't seem to be quite so all-over-the-place--as much as I love buying makeup from Sephora and department store counters, I sometimes find myself hiding when I see employees because I'd rather focus on the makeup than making conversation!  Also, the location is pretty convenient because I was tired of having to drive all the way downtown for more upscale makeup lines, and it's easy to pop in while I'm on a Costco run.  All in all, I'm pretty excited that this Ulta is here now!

I was so excited to have Ulta open up near my house so that I wouldn't have to trek downtown to Sephora or order things online anymore. But this place is ridiculous. I typically know exactly what I want, grab it, head to the registers, and then wait for at least 20 minutes in line, no matter what day/time it is. Even if there is a small line, somehow every transaction takes forever. SOMEONE HELP ME UNDERSTAND THIS. 

There have been a few times when I've literally stood in front of the product I wanted in the store and ordered it online right then (not from ulta) rather than wait in the line. I now only go there for cosmetics emergencies, and it gives me so much anxiety. I often have my small children with me, and standing in a line like that is a nightmare. 

This could be a great store - I do love the spaciousness as compared to sephora, and the fact that I can get some drugstore brands there in addition to the high-end brands. But I do not want to spend 20 minutes of my day reading the text on every bottle of poo-pourri on the impulse shelf.

Long story short I went to get my eyebrows waxed here yesterday and they burned my skin pretty badly. I called today asking for a refund or just any help in general and the manager 1. pretty much blamed me for what happened and accused me of using products that could've caused sensitivity, 2. didn't apologize, and 3. wouldn't give me a refund but told me she would give me a product to help my skin heal. I went in today and the manager wasn't even there but the clerk gave me a used & almost empty bottle of aloe gel. She also didn't apologize or seem concerned at all. Thanks Ulta.

UPDATE:
A different manager called me a few days later and was very apologetic and embarrassed for what happened and how it was handled. She gave me a full refund and some free products and handled it much better than the first time.

350th review! Times flies when you're eating well... (or shopping, or getting screwed by the worst post office in the history of the US Postal Service: Lenox Hill on the Upper East Side of Manhattan). 

I visited Ulta in Orange County a few years ago, long before we got one in Santa Barbara. And no words capture the wonderfulness of this large, immaculate, shiny palace of beauty. 

I don't go much as it's out in Goleta by Costco and I have no reason to schlep out there. But PUR is the last tinted moisturizer I will wear for the rest of my life. If they go out of business, I will buy 20 tubes to hold me for a decade until a product comes to fill the void. 

It's 34 dollars and provides all the coverage I need at this point in my life. 

I bought a curling iron in the OC and it's terrific. And they have an enormous fragrance collection, from Escada to Burberry to Coach to Dior. The only fragrance they don't carry that I know of is Tom Ford. 

And the service is unequalled. The girls are so friendly and they know their stuff intimately. I bought for  64 dollars 1.7 ounces of Burberry Brit Sheer. It was only 12 dollars more than the 1 ounce: nearly double the quantity for just a little more! The woman also showed me an atomizer (refillable and washable) you can take on the plane for just 10 dollars. 

Unlike Sephora, which is rushed, cramped, and loud with often very irritating clubby music, Ulta is a joy to visit and they have all kinds of cutesy impulse buys at the counter. On your birthday month, you receive double points. And you don't have to mess with parking in Paseo Nuevo as you do for Sephora. It's not that the girls at Sephora aren't nice, but they are understaffed and at Ulta, you can really explore and ask questions. 

I cannot say enough for this store and do not understand the low Yelp rating at all. 

P.S. I bought a cute polka dot travel electric toothbrush for 15 last year. I lost it but I loved it and for 15, you can't do better.

My top favorite things about Ulta in Goleta:  
1. Reasonably priced shampoo/conditioner in liter bottles with ongoing promotions  
2.  Good Ulta Rewards program where you can actually redeem points for credit toward salon treatments and beauty products (signup free online) 
3. Cynthia at the Salon is great for haircuts and is very speedy and precise  
4. FREE eyebrow waxing on your birthday

I'm updating my review 8 months later! I have to say the staff has changed for the better! They are more welcoming and willing to help! I particularly want to talk about my experience today with Jackie! She is amazing and so knowledgeable, she helped me get a whole new skincare regime and I'm so happy! I definitely recommend going to Jackie with any of your needs! Id like to add because I had a budget she worked extra hard to find products that were $20 or less I got all of this pictured below for $100 which is amazing!

The supply is great, and even though I prefer to be greeted when I walk in a store (especially when I am the only customer and there are at least three employees in the section in which I am browsing...), I have no problem flagging down someone to help me. The thing that got me tonight was that I was trying, SO HARD, to spend money, and no one seemed to care. I asked about 7 different questions, looking for specific products or asking about conceivable alternatives/suggestions, giving a dozen openings for upsells or suggestions, *trying* to get help, and no one bit. When one thing I wanted was out, all I got was a shoulder shrug and a "sorry." I ended up finding a couple of things just fine (after wandering around myself), but the only reason I didn't leave and go to sephora is lack of time. So much potential, ULTA, but your customer service needs a boost.

It's not a problem with the number of products they carry or the brands of products they carry. It's not a problem with parking. What I have a problem with is the lack of staff on the floor to help customers. You go into Sephora, and there is one staff person every couple of feet. When I go into Ulta, I can never, ever, EVER find anyone to help me. I will stick with Sephora!

I was just here this morning and honestly had the best experience that I've ever had at a a makeup store. I typically go to Sephora but the kindness shown to me here makes me want to switch over. Everyone I interacted with was patient, knowledgeable and kind. Makeup can be intimidating and the people here make it fun and accessible. Thank you so much!! Well worth the little drive up from SB :)

All the people working here, a mega long line, and only two cashiers. The outsole just put their stuff back and left. This would never fly in Seattle.

Then one left a line of 15 to go talk to a sales reo.

Celeste at the Benefit Brow is amazing. She does a great job on brows. She really enjoys her work. She takes the time to educate you on how to apply the makeup your are buying. I always feel good after I see her.

I would avoid this location if I could.  This store has no services and disorganized.  Waited in line for over ten minutes and I was the only one in line.  Two staffs at the cashier was chatting with one customer for over ten minutes!  When it was my turn the cashier just said "whats your phone number" that was it.  No greetings, no thanks for waiting and not even a thank you.  Such an opposite from the previous customer.  The customer before me even got extra samples from the cashier.  Maybe I didn't buy enough or I was not chatty enough.

This place is a hit or miss, sometimes they have full stocked shelves and other times they're empty. I only come here when I'm in need of my drugstore brand items. Many times I have been interested in purchasing bare minerals but there's no one around to help me. I would only suggest coming here if you already know exactly what you need. Ulta isn't the place to explore a new beauty regimen because the associates are unwilling to help. I suggest sephora for that.

I've been shopping at this ULTA for a while now and it's so nice to see that they've hired new staff that seems passionate about their job. Now, I know a lot of reviews have said they spend too much time in line or can't find any associates, and I know that this is an issue for two reasons: 1, it's Goleta and there are so many entitled snotty people living here and 2, they've never worked retail and don't understand. But, I've definitely noticed a change at this ULTA, staff is very knowledgeable and helpful and especially the two handsome young makeup wearing men that work there (that I have seen), as well as the nice lady with the pretty eyeshadow at the brow bar. I came in for a foundation but they helped me find so much more and I feel more confident with my makeup practice. Also, they've improved so much with the visual quality of the store. So happy!!!!

When there's a sale, the workers usually charge you for the regular price. Yesterday I came here, and a lot of items were not in stock and there were empty shelves. You're better off buying it online! Some of the shelves were a mess and unorganized. There's a lack of customer service since no one greet me or offer for help. And the cashier wasn't friendly. This place is usually understaffed, and has a long line.

I went to Ulta to get some eyebrow makeup that comes in around container by Smash Box. I asked the girl if they had this product and she said no just the pencils.
