I mean yea, it's ulta. If you've ever been to an ulta this one is the same as the rest. I felt this one was extremely over priced, but It had the same prices as online so I guess I was just stuck buying it at that price. The service was fine, I didn't really like how the store was set up, just in terms of where stuff was in proximinty to other sections, but whatever.

Just wanted to  say thank you to Christine For the service I got this morning One the most of professional service person I have ever dealt With The facial I got was just what I needed for the redness on my face due to attic work all week She takes her time with the Client and does not Rush  is very concerned about the client Idea what customers every day with my job and I know how difficult it could be Few times I have gone to see her It's been a great experience Aita should be Proud that someone who works for them  is so professionally she is frist class And a great representative of your company

I am a huge fan of the salon at Ulta.  I was nervous when I first came in to get advice about adding hair. I was expertly guided through the process of adding extensions to my thinning prone to breakage delicate hair. The Redkin color is gentle and natural looking and my hair has never looked better since the extensions were added.  Now I am complimented whether I wear my hair up or down. It's fun to browse the store while my color developes and they have a good appointment confirmation by text message system.  And, BONUS...dollars I spend earn me dollars to spend in the store.

I personally prefer Sephora. Just because I can always leave with 72752916539 free samples, and they actually will walk around with me and help me with my selections. 

I mainly go to Ulta to by NYX products.

Tracey is my Hair Guru! She's been cutting, coloring, styling my hair for 3 years. Not only is she talented, she is honest. I send her hair pics and she will tell me yes or no, depending on my face shape or aging look. I moved out of the close area and still travel to see Tracey.

I just wish they had more in stock ! :( 
Every time I go they never have the NYX Matte lipsticks but other than that this is my number one store .
They're make up artists are terrible. I ended up looking like I did my own make up drunk and left handed. I told them I was unsatisfied and they wouldn't refund me. DO NOT RECOMMEND!!

I love this place. The location is great and easy to get to. The ULTA products are great quality. The carry a large variety of beauty product and even have a salon in the back. I wish they carried more products for natural, non relaxed, hair. The prices are on the higher end. The staff is always pleasant and happy to help!
Nope this is the place where no one helps you. I rather go to Sephora and if I have to go to ulta is cause it's a too faced exclusive

The selection is good but compared to other Ulta stores I have been to in the mid-west this one does not compete.  Customer service lacks and the staff just are not as friendly as they should be.  Another note to add I cannot redeem the money I earned with the point system.  The lady that was checking me out had no idea what I was talking about and looked as if I was stupid.  One of the other staff members came over and  said that this Ulta did not sign up for that but she thinks that a one in Orlando does do the dollar for every point... I am confused, chain store.. shouldn't it have the same policies etc?  Overall, this is a very close location to my home and I will continue to come due to fact that they have what I need.  Like other reviewers do not expect the staff to go out of their way to help you.

My review is based on my experience at the Benefit brow bar.  I had heard very positive reviews and results for Benefit's brow services although I had never tried them previously.  My brows were in need of some TLC and I researched where the closest Brow Bar was located.  Behold they have a location right down the road from me in Citrus Park.  I booked an appointment around lunch time today and they were able to fit me in this afternoon. My appointment was with Arlette.  She performed the brow mapping to help reshape my brows and make sure they were giving me the right shape for my face.  She was extremely friendly and took her time which put me right at ease.  Her knowledge of what eye brow shape would work on me and recommendations on their products that would work with my skin tone and hair color were very impressive.  The service and pricing is very reasonable and comparable to other waxing salons.  I will definitely be going back and may even try their brow tint service.

Gina is by far the best stylist they have. She doesn't just do hair, she knows color, she listens to her clients and that's why people come to her and will continue coming to her. She's a true artist not just a follow the fads kind of girl but a starts the fad, a true leader. That is all.

I tried the Ulta Salon for the first time and I'm very happy with the results!!! So glad I tried it and will continue to go back. My stylist was Natasha and she did an amazing job. She is very knowledgeable and knows what style and color is perfect for you. She works with you to make sure you love your new do. I'm very satisfied!! My hair looks great!

Through some girlfriends and a recent move, I discovered Ulta. It sounded similar to Sephora and being that I am a huge fan of Sephora, I had to check it out. 

Not as glamorous and offers more economic offerings and has a salon inside the store, the experience is mediocre. The store is for your deal hunter or coupon clipper since they do have coupons (through emails and mailers all the time). The thing to be cautious of, many of the brands I buy are not included (Bliss, Philosophy).

Just wanted to  say thank you to Christine For the service I got this morning One the most of professional service person I have ever dealt With The facial I got was just what I needed for the redness on my face due to attic work all week She takes her time with the Client and does not Rush  is very concerned about the client Idea what customers every day with my job and I know how difficult it could be Few times I have gone to see her It's been a great experience Aita should be Proud that someone who works for them  is so professionally she is frist class And a great representative of your company

These Ulta employees act like they just can't be bothered if you need some help or have a question. Also, messy, unorganized displays. They're not that low in price, kind of steep on most things actually. And they were out of what I came there for - Ulta brand foundation and Primer. Go to Sephora instead.
Natasha did my hair cut and I'm In love, not only did she know how to deal with my thin hair but her cut gave me lots of volume. Thanks Natasha see you in six weeks

These high-end cosmetic stores really know how to tug on a girl's heart strings. Ulta may not be quite as nice as its competitor Sephora, but I think I might like it better because they have high end brands, middle range, and drug store brands. I cant afford to buy ALL high end brands, but I love treating myself to them. I'm a HUGE fan of BB cream, as I'm not a huge foundation person and just need light coverage. I picked up Benefit's new "Big Easy" bb cream and I'm in LOVE. It was 38$, but honestly the quality and staying power completely justify the pricetag. With some of this stuff you really get what you pay for. I also ordered a type of Benefit "starter kit" from Ulta's website full of deluxe samples of their best sellers, which is a great value as I can determine which items Id actually purchase a full size of instead of wasting a ton of money. Cant wait for that to get here, in the meantime I'll be enjoying my new fancy Bb cream! Yay Ulta!

Have a facial done on March 17 by Christine very professional and caring told me step by step want she was doing treated me like a person not just a Clint she made me feel comfortable and relaxed let me know what to do to help the redness on my face would recommend her to all my friends male and female was stright forward on want she was doing Ultra to be very proud of the service as she provided will use her again

This location gets the 2 stars for selection, they have a benefit brow bar and the employee at the register was friendly.  However, I walked in on a Saturday morning soon after they opened around 10:20am, needless to stay the store was nearly empty. I stood with my child right in front of the benefit brow section, clearly needing help while at least 5 employees stood near me, doing something I guess, just not helping customers obviously. One smiled while walking past me and as I was about to ask for help she walked away. Finally, I had to literally walk over to another employee and "make" her help me. Ultimately, I left the store spending $65 on 2 makeup items which is no chump change because I really needed those items otherwise I would have walked out. I find that type of customer service unacceptable. I don't know why I was ignored nor do I care to speculate. If you work in customer service, your priority should be to provide that service, especially when it was so early in the day and the store was empty. I won't be shopping there again.

I've been to many salons and I can truly say I love thier work here. I've been a loyal customer for about a year. Love how honest they are. My stylist is Ms.Tracey and she's an expert in getting the ashy look. I'm a dark Burnett and to go from dark to light without the brassy look is extremely hard to accomplish, however, Ms.Tracey has consistently delivered all the way. Thank you! See you at my next appointment:)

I had never been to an Ulta before this past weekend.  I am thoroughly impressed with the selection of hair, makeup, and almost any other beauty item you can think of.  There was a great deal on eyeliner.  Even though I don't normally do much eye makeup, I took this as an opportunity to buy a few different colors and play around at home.  One of the other things that I appreciated is that it was very spread out and the rows weren't narrow and overcrowded like Sephora almost always seems to be.

I found out they do facials yesterday when I was getting my hair done. I had some time so I stopped in the Citrus park location. Chana was able to take me as a walk in right away. They have a room off to the side of the salon. I have only had spa facials at resorts or day spas. I would say this was very much a similar experience just more convenient. I really don't feel like I know what is up with my skin, just I'm not happy. Chana asked me questions and had me fill out a card with info about my lifestyle... Suntanning, medications, etc. The typical things they ask you at spas before treatments. 

After that she got right to it. After cleaning and looking at my skin she suggested I try dermabrasion and since it was my first time I should start with the introductory service. I've always wanted to get dermabrasion but I have been thrown off by this price. This seemed reasonable so I was excited to try it out. I barely felt a thing as she was doing it. I would compare it to rubbing an eraser across my face. On top of that there was the entire facial with a mask and aromatherapy

I thought my skin was worse than it was but Chana let me know it was more that I was dehydrated. I guess the one downside is that my skin felt so good I wanted to buy the whole dermalogica line. I will definitely be back!

The staff is very friendly, as they been on my multiple visits, and the store is very tidy. 
Ulta at Citrus Park is my only destination for hairstyles, relaxers and color treatments. My stylist, Kanisha, is brilliant with all hair types and textures. She's done my ombré, relaxers, cuts and styles for years; I've no need to complain about her work. I rave and recommend her at every opportunity that I get. 
The carry a variety of brands such as NYX, Benefit, Urban Decay and NAKED. I love earning points from my hair appointments to get high end flat irons and styling wands. 
The salon and store prices are slightly above average, in my opinion, but you have to pay for quality. So in the end it all works out.

I have never walked into an Ulta before and not had somebody ask me if they could help me with what I was looking for. I'm trying to switch from Clinique to bare minerals, and a group of 4 workers were just chit chatting and not paying attention to anyone else in the store. I asked 2 girls to help match me and both said they didn't know what they were doing. Needless to say, I walked out and I'm now headed to another Ulta to buy everything I need.

THIS PLACE IS COOL!  Ok, First of all, NEVER walk in there with two teenage girls! This is a like a MEGA mart for make-up, perfume,  hair stuff and anything else a girl could ever want to look good!  It is a bit expensive but they have everything from Elizabeth Arden to Cover-girl
Paul Mitchel to Aussie!  I have gotten my hair colored and cut there also,  Nichole in the salon is very good, she listened to what I wanted and did it. Be sure to sign up for their reward points! You get lots of freebies!  (Free Haircut) They will also mail you a monthly catalog with coupons!  I really like this place.  Of course the girls were in heaven! Smashbox, Urban Decay, Bare Minerals etc.
It is larger than Sephora.  
Their Ulta brand works very well too! Less $$

I went to Ulta today with a coupon and of course when I was ready to pay was told I could not use the coupon on the item I was purchasing. Of course I wasn't surprised. I also read the coupon before going up to the register and it did not say I could not use it on that item. I'm so tired of getting coupons that can only be used on 4 or 5 items in the store. Also when the sales clerk rang me up she asked for my phone number. I thought she asked for my ZIP Code and I gave her that, she then gave me a snotty look and replied that's your phone number? I said I thought you asked for my ZIP Code and she said no your phone number. I then declined because I'm sick and tired of giving my phone number out. First of all it's completely unnecessary for someone to have my private information and most places like to sell your information. So I don't want random sales calls on my phone. She then told me I would not be allowed to return my item if I don't Give her my phone number. Which is completely ridiculous! The only thing I should need to have is a receipt and the item should be returned in the amount of time given to make a return. I told her that was a violation of my privacy if I choose to not give you my phone number and that there are many people who have unlisted numbers. She shrugged her shoulders and said oh well. I won't be shopping here anymore.
Had a facial with Cori she did a great job my skin feels so refreshed. Debony is awesome to I always feel welcomed.

I consider Ulta to be a Sephora wanna be. The stores are not laid out as nicely, the aesthetics aren't as pleasing, and their staff doesn't seem to be as knowledgeable. 

What I do like is they carry dermalogica products and this one isnt located at the mall so it's less of an ordeal to get in and out. 

If you need some cosmetics or hair care, Ulta is a good option but don't expect to walk into a Sephora

4 stars because they've got everything. Hair care, nail polish galore, a salon, prestige brand cosmetics, and drugstore cosmetics. I docked one star because the place is just... dirty. I don't know about you, but I value sanitation when it comes to cosmetics. This store apparently does not. I docked one more star because customer service is nearly nonexistent. No product knowledge, not very friendly, just basically your standard, disinterested cashiers. But I keep coming back cause it's close to my job and momma needs her nail polish.

I love the products that Ulta carries, however my experience at the Citrus Park location today was not good. I was in the market for a new foundation, concealer, and brush. I spent a great deal of time testing many different shades and brands. No one offered to help until I had already chosen a foundation and concealer (20 minutes later), when I was offered help, the lady asked me if the foundation I had on was the one I had chosen to buy. I told her it was. She then proceeded to make a disgusted face and told me my face looked yellow. I told her that I didn't think so and that I really liked what I had chosen, she then went on to tell me it looked bad. Another employee came over and before knowing what had even happened complimented me on my makeup, the other lady  then appeared embarrassed by the statement the employee made (that my makeup looked good) and said "well I'm just going to walk away". The other employee apologized to me after I told her what happened and told me the rude lady was not a full time employee. I spent the rest of my day looking in the mirror wondering if my face looked bad because of the comments this women made. After spending over $100 on makeup, it is a shame someone in the store made me feel this way.

I have been going to Ulta for over 15 years. This is my hometown location where I have been getting my hair, facials, and eyebrows done since I was about 16 years old. I am now 32. My mother and I are loyal patrons, loyalty card holders, and repeat salon clients. I skip Aveda, and Sephora, as I have always preferred Ulta for their prices and quality of services. At this location, Donna did my hair for over 10 years, and since her departure from the store, I have entrusted my problematic locks to the talented Gina for about 2 years. I used to even wait until I would be in town from Miami to get my haircuts! 

Yesterday evening I was in the store shopping and saw that the brow bar was empty so I requested a wax service and was told they had immediate availability. I can honestly tell you that the associate's skill level was questionable (at best) from the beginning, although she was completely polite and professional. She put the wax on far too delicately for it to cover correctly. She also didn't use enough wax, and spent too long pressing it in. (by the time she actually pulled the strip off my face the wax was likely completely cool) I didn't say anything because I figured everyone has their approach and I am a brow bar loyalist (I trust that they are properly trained). She was well into applying concealer (incorrectly) when I myself reached for the hand mirror, since she had not offered to show me my brows at all, post-waxing. I was mortified. Not a single hair that I walked into the store with that evening was missing. It looked only like someone had made my brows red, not that I had had a wax. I showed her the many, many hairs that she missed and she reapplied wax and tried again. Again, too little wax, pressing too light and for too long, and the hairs remained. I pointed it out to her, and she said she would get her manager. That took an easy 15 minutes so I just sat there with the exact same eyebrow growth I had when I walked in. Frankly I didn't know what else to say to the associate. She clearly didn't know what she was doing, and I didn't want to risk any skin over this by allowing her to apply a THIRD attempt. It was awkward, as these encounters can be, but she really was sweet and I think she expected the manager to handle things appropriately. 

The manager, Lynn, came over and told me that the hairs were too short for the wax to "catch". I've never heard such a dismissive load of BS in my life. I have had my eyebrows waxed maybe 100 times in my life. At this Ulta location, several in south Florida, and plenty of private salons and spas. The hairs were not "too short." That is an outrageous thing to claim. A good wax job should get ALL hairs; long, medium, short, baby, and fuzz. I have gone in to that EXACT location with LESS brow growth and come out with clean, hairless brows. She kept repeating that I could just have the associate "pluck them." EXCUSE ME? Um...I can pluck my own eyebrows at home, and believe me, do a better job with tweezers than this associate. I came for a WAX. I was being charged for a WAX. The associate mentioned to me twice that she was new, and apologized, and frankly I don't hold her ultimately responsible. She does need better training, but the decision to charge me all but 20% of my service was left to the unprofessional manager who just lost a lifetime Ulta customer over a pitiful $15. 

I spent over $130 on products yesterday, and a fortune over the years. I even brought my bridal party to this location on my wedding day for our hair services. BOTH cashiers at checkout 100% agreed with me that my brows absolutely were not waxed correctly and they both extended their condolences. They had no choice but to charge me what the manager instructed. I was ultimately charged $15 for my $21 service and not only are my brows WORSE  than they were before walking into Ulta, (since now I'll have to wait a few days to get them waxed correctly) but I am completely turned off from this brand. Every gal knows you can walk into any corner nail salon and get a decent brow wax for about $8. I chose to pay the Ulta premium because it has always been my experience that their brow bar associates are suedo-experts in the trade and the Ulta brand takes care of its clients. I have requested to be reimbursed by corporate, but this taste in my mouth will be difficult to overcome. The economic temperature in America right now is not such that business owners and managers should take the liberty to make clients feel so devalued. I live in Channelside and drove across town to get to my favorite little beauty store in Citrus Park. When someone is making that kind of effort, and spending this kind of money, you only have to disappoint them once. Hope that fifteen bucks was worth it, Lynn.

Such a convenient location, and carries a really great array of brand cosmetics and haircare. Staff is always available to ask questions or help find the perfect product.

I especially like their Urban Decay and It Cosmetics displays.

"there might be a lot wrong right now but the important thing is that my hair looks fabulous!!"dyeing your hair doesn't mean your hair is fake but it means you are a artist and your hair is your canvas"I think the most important hing a woman can have - next to talent, of course - is her hairdresser." 
Thank you Kim 
I love my hair style

If your wanting extensions Evalise and Kanisha are the best. Christine is the skin therapist and the microdermabraisian has changed my skin to be more youthful. Come visit I have had almost everyone in salon do my color and cut and had a great experience every time.

Why two stars?  Well, they started at 4 stars for having a nice selection of drug store brands rather than only high-end cosmetics like Sephora.  I will never be able to bring myself to spend $30 on an eyeshadow - like EVER.  And then Ulta loses 2 stars for always having an amazingly crappy selection of higher end nail polishes.  Half the time they don't even have displays for the latest Essie, OPI or China Glaze collections and when they do, they are always  1/2 empty, picked over and just sad.  While they send out great coupons, my savings are usually lessened by having to go to 2 or 3 locations just to find $10 or $15 of product I actually want so I can use the darned coupon.  If I could rate them 1.5 stars I would, because I find it absurd that you have to carefully check each and every nail polish before you buy it as there are frequently  1/2 empty bottles in the racks.  Because yeah - it fills my frugal heart with glee to spend $8 on a used,  1/2 empty bottle of polish.  Oh Ulta -such promise and yet you mostly piss me off.

"there might be a lot wrong right now but the important thing is that my hair looks fabulous!!"dyeing your hair doesn't mean your hair is fake but it means you are a artist and your hair is your canvas"I think the most important hing a woman can have - next to talent, of course - is her hairdresser." 
Thank you Kim 
I love my hair style !! 
see you soon!!!

Yesterday I went to ulta and got a bunch of stuff. Lots of eyeshadow palettes, nyx matte lip, and some skincare stuff. Half the nyx colors had no testers and most were out of stock. Everything was pretty messy and out of place. I was pretty disappointed but managed to find most of what I was looking for. However, if more testers had been available I probably wouldn't have had to return some of those products today. I did some price matches with the Amazon app and found some that were cheaper here and some cheaper on Amazon. Sometimes it was a big difference so you might want to get the app. Speaking of apps, ulta's is pretty good. I got a coupon for $3.50 off a $10 purchase! Before I went here yesterday, I signed up for their rewards club. Get 1 point for every $1 spent. Spend $450/yr get 1.25 points for every $1 spent + you get some free gifts. When you make returns, the points earned on those products are deducted from your rewards balance. I made my return on four items today and had no problem at all. Great return policy: you can't have used more than 25% of the product and it has to be within 60 days of purchase. The ONLY reason I gave a 4 star rating instead of a 5 star is because the aisle I was in was so messy and so many missing testers and lack of stock. If they kept up better it would minimize returns and earn one more star from me.

I hate to drive out to this one since there's one closer to home, however this is the closest one that carries Mac cosmetics.  I love me some Ulta although they can be quite pricey on certain items.  I like their Ulta brand cream eye shadows, good quality and easy to use.  The staff has always been friendly no matter location.  I do have to say that the order pickup process at this location is better than the Dale Mabry location -- staff seemed to be more organized with the process and was able to get me in and out fast.

I have never tried any of their salon services, so this review is just for the store and merchandise.  As far as Ultas go, this one is just fine. They have a good selection of brands - both high end brands and drugstore brands, although certainly not as many selections as a department store would carry.  I feel like one of this store's biggest problems is that whenever I'm looking for a specific color, they always seem to be out of it.  It makes me think the person responsible for ordering does not check the stock on a frequent enough basis.

I will say that during my most recent visit, when they were out of a color I wanted, a store representative made the excellent suggestion to get the particular shade I wanted in an eye shadow version, as it could be used as an eye liner (which they were out of), and she was 100% correct.  I never would have known had she not stepped up, so I really appreciate it.

Check out was very speedy my most recent visit, and of course, I love getting a free sample with checkout!

I was scheduled for an appointment with Brooke to have my hair highlighted.  My appointment was at 5:30 pm.  I left work early and got there at 5:20pm and the receptionist told me she would let Brooke know I was here.  Well at 6pm-still waiting.  Not one person -Brooke (who I have no idea who or what she looks like) or the receptionist came up to me and let me know the reason for my wait or apologized for the delay.  I went back up to the receptionist again and asked her how much longer.  She said she would ask Brooke. Finally at about 6:10 pm I left the salon. They did call me as I was walking to my car.  I called the next morning and spoke with a gentleman who said-You left and they called you.  I explained I waited for over 40 minutes and know one came up to me and explained or apologized for the delay.  He then told me the manager of the salon would call me.  Well this never happened.  Stay away!!

I made an appointment on Friday the 20th with The Salon - to have a Facial with Christine and my Hair with Max.  This was my first encounter with ULTA BEAUTY in Citrus Park.

I had EXCELLENT service with both Face and Hair!

Christine was amazing and made me feel at ease - explaining all the procedures - step by step whilst doing a very professional Facial with Microdermabrasion.
My skin looked fantastic afterwards and I have decided to have another one in 02 weeks time.
I can highly recommend Christine. What a wonderful Beautician!

I then had my hair done with Max.  
Max is very gentle with hair -- and colored, treated  and blow dried my hair exactly the way I wanted it to be done. What a pleasure to not have a Stylist that treats hair in a nice fashion... Max is very friendly and does an excellent job!
Next time I visit I might just do some highlights too!
My hair felt great! 

Everyone was so friendly and helpful in the Store: LOTS of positive energy!

The Store is very clean and organized: slightly congested as they display a lot of stock - but  overall really a LOT of FUN to browse and Shop!
All the latest Cosmetics and Perfumes etc etc ... Mmmmmmmmmmmm

Just have to LOVE Ulta Beauty!~

I couldn't remember why I disliked coming to this location and now I remember why after this visit today. The staff follows me around the store like I am going to take something. They are super obvious about it to. I purposely started moving to different areas to see if the same person was following me. Yes I am still doing ok after a minute ma'am! I'll stick to Sephora.

After the renovations this Ulta store isn't too bad. The checkout counter isn't in the middle of the store anymore, so the line is a bit more orderly like at other Ulta locations. It's only a 3 min drive for me, so when I need makeup, perfume or hair care items, this is my go-to place. 

I can't say I've had the best service here or the worst. It's standard for what it is. Sephora or the Mac counter at dept stores give a much better makeup advice, but Ulta has a bigger variety of everything beauty, so I can do a lot of shopping here at once. The Ulta private label brand isn't bad either...I at least like their lip glosses.

I must say I will never get my eyebrows threaded there again. The dude did a horrible job that I had to live with for 2  1/2 weeks.

It gets really busy in this store around the holidays, so there are a lot of items that I can find at the newer Clearwater location that I can't find here.

I do wish there were a Benefit counter here...I loved the way they fixed my eyebrows in New York. 

I can't review any other salon services, but I will say that I'm afraid to use them...seems too commercial with turnover.

Oh what a fun shop it was. First time I shopped at this Ulta. It was spacious, clean, well-lit with ample parking. The selection of cosmetic and skin care items was enormous and varied, and well- priced. The staff were extremely helpful, fun and friendly. At check out I signed up for their loyalty program and received a sample mascara . Oh and we just LOVE samples; keep them coming!
I was able to purchase an item there that I could not find n Westshore or International Plaza so it was great not having to order on-line and it was priced competitively . I'll be back ...

Terrible customer service.
Every person we encountered was rude and unhelpful. 
The cashier ignored me when I asked a question about an item and acted disgusted when I wanted to use a coupon.
I also tried to buy a few single eyeshadow pots that were clearly marked "CLEARANCE $3.20" but rang up $6.00. I asked why it rang up differently and the manager that was just standing there snapped that it was only certain colors, then the cashier finally spoke and asked if we wanted them or not. Wow.
On the way out we walked by the display and the colors I had picked were definitely marked $3.20.

I understand that these are stressful times but wow. Everyone there needs to be retrained, including the manager. Or is it a requirement to be nasty to work at Ulta?

The only thing that keeps me going back to Ulta's is that it has a benefit brow bar inside. However, over the past few years, I've noticed that the benefit brow bar experience tends to always be better when they're inside a Macy's or department store than an Ulta Beauty. 

This particular Ulta is right by my house, which is the only reason why I've given this place a try. I've tried to call and set up a brow bar appointment no less than at least 10 times and have never been able to successfully reach someone at the brow bar to set a time. Finally, I just gave up trying to call and showed up to try and get a walk in appointment at the brow bar.

I walked in, no one greeted me, and then I stood and waited at the brow bar while they were finishing their service for about 10-15 minutes, and then someone walked up before me while I was standing there and cut in for a service, and was then "put in line" before me. I then promptly approached the brow bar and let them know that I had been waiting for them for the past 10-15 minutes for them to finish up before approaching them, even though it was obvious that they had noticed I was waiting the entire time, and still said that I would have to wait until after the next person who just walked up. It was absolutely infuriating. They mentioned that I should have made an appointment, to which I let them, I've tried relentlessly, but had never been able to reach the brow bar, and had been on hold for 15 minutes at a time before I just gave up and took my business elsewhere. The associate at the brow bar wasn't the most friendly and was sick as well. 

When checking out, the associate asked if I wanted to use anyone else's Ulta membership when checking out, even though I know it's store policy as well to use other peoples reward accounts because it's supposed treated like "using someone else's credit card". 

While this store is one of the larger ones that I've been to with more high end options like MAC and so forth, the customer service is just abismal and I will continue to take my business and brow needs to a different benefit brow bar elsewhere.

This is my local Ulta, and while I don't pop in here all the time, it's my go-to for my shampoo and conditioner (especially when they send me a coupon in the mail). 

The store is pretty cramped but easy enough to navigate. The salon is toward the back left and is always booming with customers. Everyone in there seems to be having a good time. The floor associates are always courteous and quick to ask if I need any help. And I mean really quick. I know exactly where my shampoo is, make a beeline for it, then pull a sick 180 toward the cash register. And they still manage to get a word in.

The registers are my only problem with the store. Think of a HomeGoods or Marshall's line of registers without the defined queue. This results in customers who, shall we say, think less intuitively about queue flow, and force the line down actual store aisles instead of snaking it around where it should go. This could be easily solved by adding a roped-off section specifically for the queue. The store is so packed full of end caps and shelves anyway, that removing something toward the registers would solve two problems at once.

While I don't go to this store more than about twice a year, it's not an experience I dread. They always have what I'm looking for, and they deliver coupons semi-frequently. Not a bad place to physically shop for beauty products in Citrus Park at all.

As a side-note, one irking thing about Ulta in general is that they press you for your phone number more than any other business I've been to. They say it's for returns, but they can be very aggressive about it. I just give them my mom's phone number (which they already have), and she gets the points, just so I can avoid the minor confrontation.
Place is awesome for make up and gifts for your women in your family! My girlfriend loves this place and the quality and price is good.

I'm not a real woman. I think we're supposed to shriek and fall to our knees with happiness at these places, but I just don't get it. I keep thinking that no matter what services and products the girl in the chair gets, it will never even begin to address her real problems. I'm amazed at the hustle and bustle at this store. I come in once every year between Thanksgiving and Christmas out of sheer need. l make a list to help ease my disgust and anxiety, then paperclip a coupon to it. I walk in and ask for shampoo. The always helpful staff walks me over to a wall of shampoo from floor to ceiling. Some of this hair stuff ranges from 10.00-85.00. Wait, that goop is actually a conditioner. Oh, the coupon won't work on the high end stuff either. That one contains rare oil. What? I've lost my resolve at this point and leave the store trying to conjure up a different gift idea. ANY other gift will do. The staff is a-ok!

I visited Ulta yesterday to pick up some beauty items and take advantage of a 20% off total purchase coupon I got in the mail.  I also wanted to buy some shampoo and conditioner liters that were on sale for $15.99.  This store was going through some modeling as was disgusting!  Several of the product displays were covered in dust, and items clearly opened at tested.  The store was also out of stock on every liter I wanted to purchase.  The line to checkout was 14 people long with two cashiers.  Very disappointed. This place was better prior to the renovations.  Also, the usual exclusions on the coupon applied, making it virtually worthless.  I went to Sephora instead.

5 minutes in the store and my presence is not even acknowledged. I actually needed some product assistance and my gut have waited if at least someone had told me they'd be with me shortly. 

5 minutes in Sephora the next day got me the help I needed, a suggested option with timeline for new shipment of my product of choice, and in line to pay. $40 lost sale for Ulta and guess where I'll go first next time...

I came to this location because they have MAC products.  The employees were nasty and none were helpful.  Check out was a terrible experience.   The girl wouldn't even speak to us.  Several items did not ring up correctly and when we asked about it the response we got was "do you want them or not".  We also wanted to use a $3.50 off coupon and she acted disgusted about that.  Definitely would not recommend this location.   Employees should be retrained and provide at least some level of customer service, or is it a requirement  to be nasty to work at Ulta??

Can I just say I love Kanesha! She is the best when it comes to giving me a protein treatment in order to make my hair super healthy. She also listens and educates you on your specific hair type. I was definitely someone that said they would never go natural but I now love it! I'm interested in adding some color soon and she's the only one I would trust to do my hair. The women are friendly but kanesha makes me feel right at home. I have gotten my relaxed ends cut by her and my hair is now healthier than ever! I cannot wait to book my next appointment with her!
Literally the worst costumer service I've ever received, I'd give negative stars if possible

I had recently been to Ulta beauty to get my signature haircut done. I had asked for a pro, but after reaching there, they said the pro I had asked for is not available; instead i got someone who felt like a rookie. I didn't say anything about it. She asked me if I wanted to wash my hair (signature haircut does come with the shampoo and conditioning). She  didn't seem to put in much of an effort to cut my hair and neither did she give me any suggestions as to which cut will suit me. She just added one bang which I asked her to do. Within 10-12 mins, she was done cutting my hair. I don't see any layers added to my hair and there is no change in my hairstyle whatsoever. I am very disappointed by this. Will never go back to her. On top of all she didn't even take any efforts to style my hair.  My past experience with Ulta is that their stylists always go the extra mile to make my hair look good. This experience was quite disappointing.

I've been here a few times after becoming disillusioned with Sephora(their lack of sales and their blah reward system) and overall I like what they offer, but wish they were more aware of how their store looks. The girls are really nice and willing to offer help if needed, though unfortunately I feel like some of them are not fully trained. Love that I can get both drugstore and higher quality cosmetics in one place, it saves me having to make the trip to both CVS and Sephora in one day.

I went in today to get a new foundation and a few other things, and the one thing that really stood out to me(making this 2 stars) was that there were soooo many messy and gross displays. There were at least 5 items I wanted to purchase but they were down to the last item with the package broken open and obviously used. When I got home I opened up one of the things I got(a box containing a few different goodies) and one of the products inside had been obviously used. Really? Never happened at Sephora or even at Target, CVS, etc. Thankfully it was just a powder so I can scratch off the top layer and sanitize it with alcohol, but I'll never buy anything that isn't SEALED from them again. Sometimes at Sephora I feel like the girls are hovering over me or following me, maybe the girls at Ulta need to get it together and start doing that so people stop being gross with their products. Catch them in the act and tell them to stop, seriously. I'd rather be followed around than be unable to buy products because they're used. The store is pretty big and I just really don't think they have enough people walking the floor.

Also today a man(maybe the owner?) was going around screaming about the renovations and complaining about people swatching nail polishes on the displays. Literally I was at the back of the store and he was at the front and I could hear him loud and clear. Not exactly a relaxing shopping experience. And what about the dirty, used products all over the store? Not sure they have their priorities straight, to be honest.

I have to say the manager at this location, Maria needs to have some management training skills and the basics of customer service.  During the middle of a transaction she came up to the young attendant helping us and told her go on break "I'll help them" Maria didn't even introduce herself as Maria the manager  she just rudely in the middle of the transaction told the young girl to go on break which was very rude.   I've travelled all around the world and seldom have I seen a manager that lacks basic basic customer service skills .  I'm sure most of her employees are afraid to speak up.   Perhaps a liability for the company's bottom line.  Definitely has lost potential customers.   I do not and will not recommend this place.
Asian lady accused me of stealing and took things out of my hands. I won't ever come back! Ghetto

This review is long over due! I went  here one night late after work, feeling down about how my makeup had been appearing due to all the breakout I was having thanks to my diet allergies. I felt extremely self cautious at first when I arrived because literally everyone in the store has flawless skin. I started walking around the aisles of the up line makeup brands (I normally stick with drug store brands, but I needed a change!) Right away, a young girl with a beautiful smile came over and asked if I needed help. I felt at ease right away. I explained to her my situation about not getting coverage when I have an allergy outbreak and right away she belted off brands that would have full coverage yet it wouldn't make me look like I caked on a bunch of makeup to cover up. She had me sit in a chair while she searched for the right color. It took about 3-4 times to find the right shade, but my skin never has looked happier with makeup! For foundation, we went with Urban Decay All Nighter. It's waterproof but easy to wipe off with either makeup remover or a wipe. The setting powder is loose and it's by Tarte. My concealer is amazing and hides everything from a blemish to bags under the eye. This product is by Tarte as well and it's the shape tape. I wish I knew this girls name because she is good at what she does! This has been my best experience with this makeup store. Ecstatic with my purchases!

Extremely disappointed with the level of service my husband received at this location. I placed an order for pick up and added my husband the secondary person to pick up my items. We received an email at 10:30 AM stating my order was ready. Around 2 PM my husband stopped by to pick it up. Upon his arrival he received no greeting and when he asked the  guy  at the register in the front for assistance he was told rudely, "You'll have to wait." He waited for 30 minutes for someone to help him. Really? This is extremely unprofessional and unacceptable. I'll be contacting corporate about this poor and inefficient interaction.

This was my first time in this Ulta and I was not impressed and probably won't go back. I was in the area where all the high end makeup is and walked by multiple employees and didn't get a hello, can I help you find anything, nothing. I would much rather drive to sephora then go here again.

The WORST. I have been in there 3 times now and each and every time the employees treated me terribly. Today, I went in and asked for waterproof makeup, the girl recommended PUR foundation (which isn't even waterproof)- when I asked her to show me a brand that my friend recommended, she said "we don't have any more testers of that, have you tried it before because it's really thick" I told her that I had tried it before and liked it and I showed her the ones her store had and she just said "yeah but we don't have any testers" and walked away. Completely unprofessional and very unhelpful. NEVER going back.

Pretty decent beauty store, I like how they have drugstore brands as well as premium brands.

The coupon situation is kind of a nightmare, they almost always have coupons available but you can only use it on certain items, which seems to be less than half of the items in the store. Almost every time I try to use a coupon, I can't. 

The associates at the store are super friendly and very helpful. My mom was looking for a specific product and the lady on the floor helped us find the product, plus other alternatives of different price points.
Our cashier was Ariel and she was so stinkin' friendly and sweet!

Rudy was very helpful! I've been to ultra hundreds of times both here and in California. I was really impressed with Rudys customer service he asked if I needed help after browsing for a minute or two but was still looking around and normally I'd have to hunt down a sales associate after letting them know I wasn't ready but he came back after a few minutes to check in. He wasn't pushy and didn't hover, definitely knows his stuff and made sure to find the right shade of foundation for me... thanks again!
The staff was friendly and helpful. The store had a great selection of products. Would shop there again.

This Ulta Beauty location offers all things beauty.  They have Lancôme and Clinique.  The have a full service Dermologica  private skin room. They also have a full service RedKin salon.  They have Prestige line cosmetics and everyday mass cosmetics.   If you need some help with color matching your foundation and color.  This is the place to go.  The crew is friendly and eager to help
Best brow bar. Lane did our brows this time and my daughter and I loved our results and will definitely ask for her next time. Thanks, Lane, for the great brows

I called to set up a salon appointment ASAP! I had toned my own hair and left it on to long and turned my hair orange! I panicked!! JULIE B SAVED MY HAIR!! I walked out feeling confident and liked it more than the original balayage a different salon had done!! She was honest with me and did exactly what I was looking for! Seriously could give her a million stars! I will be going back just for her!

This was my first time going into Ulta today. I went to the one in meridian in stead of going to the mall for my makeup because it's closer. I walked in with my one year old in my arms I went to go get my bare minerals makeup, both powered foundation and mineral veil. They were out of my skin tone on the floor, the chick working in that  area was doing some girls makeup and wouldn't acknowledge me and I stood there awhile. So I had to go find someone to pull one from the back for me. Then I tried finding the mineral veil and asked the chick doing the girls makeup where to find it and she pointed me to a used one they use for testing and went back to working on the teenager girls makeup. There was none in stock on the display. So I had to go find someone again!!! who could get me one. She was a very unhelpful, snobby cake faced worker. So disappointed and felt very mistreated.

I have a love hate relationship with this store.  I really want to love this store as it carries a lot of the brands of cosmetics I love, both high end/drug store, it is a large clean store, and the employees are less self impressed than those at Sephora, and much more willing to help.  My 2 biggest complaints is I would say a good 80 percent of the time I find their stock to be very low.  Especially anything that is new or has a lot of buzz around it.  I would have to guess that this has to be the buyer is not ordering enough product to meet the demand.  But it isn't just high demand products, many items have very low stock as well. I expect this to happen from time to time, especially with a new store, but this a habitual issue. 
  The other issue I have is the last time I went in there were a lot of promotional displays that were blocking pathways and this was made worse by three female employees congregating right in the middle of the walk path to the registers and exit while they laughed and joked, completely obvious to anyone else around them.  Too many promotional displays really start to create congestion and deminish the shopping experience.

I went in to purchase perfume for my mom as she likes a certain perume I can only find at Ulta, macy's or now Amazon.  I want to support local business so I purchased here but when I purchased they wanted my phone number which I'm not giving out as I don't want to be on a marketing list and get texts all the time.  The sales lady didn't like this and proceeded to tell me I will not be covered if the bottle is broken.  I told her will keep the receipt and will take the risk. They seemed very agitated as I wasn't giving them my phone number.   All in all a bad experience.  Next time I will just purchase on Amazon and get twice the size for the same price.

Came here today and had a very UNUSUAL  experience..
The 4 stars are for this store being well stocked, clean and having a fabulous selection of merchandise. 
On to the tea...
OK I'm not sure what happened today at this Ulta. I was doing my usual rounds, taking pics of products for my IG, testing new items and grabbing my must haves. I've been in the beauty industry for over a decade so nothing really shocks me anymore, I even own a small indie brand StinaFace (find me on IG @stinaface, bet you liked that little plug right) So I am definitely familiar with the retail sector of the industry. Anyway today I was waiting in line to make a purchase, my hubby walked in with my 1 year old son and they walked over to me to stand with me while I waited in line. Thats when it all started... 
I heard a loud voice yell from about 15 feet away "YOU READY?!" It was the cashier closest to the entrance. I politely said yes and walked over. At first I just assumed maybe I wasn't paying attention, or maybe I didn't hear her the first time even tho I was actually In a hurry to get rung up because my little family and I were headed for the corn maze. When I reached the register The cashier didn't greet me, she said in a very stern manner "do you have a phone number on file?".... that's when I knew whatever this attitude was, it was directed intentionally towards me. I said yes and gave her my number. I also had a digital coupon on my phone, she saw it and scanned it and gave me a pretty annoyed look. She handed me my bag and that was it.... but man this girl threw so much bad energy my way I felt like I needed to run home, burn some sage, pray to Jesus, take a spiritual bath just to get whatever she threw on me off. Even my husband was like "what was that about" ... Maybe I'll never know..
it was some twilight zone stuff for sure.

I had an amazing experience at this store. My baby girl is 9 months and I haven't been able to get my hair cut or trimmed for about over a year. I baby wear my baby and don't have anyone to watch her. I went in to the Ulta salon and Stephanie had no problems cutting my hair standing up while I wore my baby. She even interacted with my baby. To all the mothers out there you know just how much this means to a mother. My hair looks so much better and I was able to get it done with my baby and all. Thank you so much Stephanie! To top it all off every single employee that walked past me while I was waiting asked if I needed help and even had a conversation with me.

Allyson Doll is amazing at what she does as well as an amazing person. I took my 16 year old daughter to her for color and after Allyson was done, her hair looked exactly how she wanted it. My daughters hair was already dyed black and she wanted to change it to a dark violet. (I wish I would of took a picture of her after it was done.) I even had an appointment for blonde highlights and have no complaints. We will definitely be going back. I would definitely recommend Allyson to anyone. She knows what she is doing.

Today was my first time in this Ulta. It was very clean and decently stocked (although Black Friday had wiped them out of tons of merch). I specifically went in to get a replacement for my Anastasia Beverly Hills contour kit and a new primer. I only looked lost for about ten seconds before an associate asked me if I needed help. I stated what I needed and then a beautiful (and I cannot emphasize this fact enough) boy helped me not only find what I needed, but got me signed up with an account and helped me get product they were sold out of even delivered to my door. Rudy was so sweet and helpful, seemed knowledgeable in not only what they carry but clearly knew makeup personally as his face was FLAWLESS. Eyebrows on fleek. I'll definitely be back. Thanks guys!

I had been looking for a hairstyler for 7 months now. I had 3 bad experiences with bad haircuts. I scheduled an appointment for last Sunday. just for a trim. ( I was concerned again about how my hair will turn out )!.

I had the most amazing experience this time.  My hairstyle was done by a Kat.

This young lady was exceptional and caring. I left w/  a pleasant and happy experience. Kat is an amazing hairstyler. I scheduled another visit for October. kudos Kat!!!! Job well done. I found my hairstyler!!!!

I stopped by Ulta today for 2 reasons:
1. To get my free birthday gift
2. To try out the It Cosmetics brand. 
I browsed around the store looking at all the make up goodies & scoped  out the girl who had the best makeup application on herself. I found Rachael.  I explained to her that my skin has become totally strange since moving to Idaho 8 months ago. I told her that I was interested in the It line, but I was also open to other brands. We discussed what I needed as far as coverage as well as the overall condition of my skin.  She told me that It would be a good brand for me.  She asked if I wanted her to apply some to see how it looked & I happily accepted. She used minimal amounts of the make up & made my skin look gorgeous in less than 10 minutes.  She answered ALL of my questions without a hint of attitude. She was very knowledgeable of all of the product lines & I appreciated that a lot! 
After she finished applying the makeup I looked in the mirror and was floored! It looked great!  She didn't use a ton of product & she explained everything she was doing as she applied it.  I'm pretty confident that I will be able to replicate what she did. I love how my skin looks and feels. 
This is truly a great Ulta location! If you haven't been here before , I highly recommend going out & checking It out.  I also recommend asking if Rachael is available to help you out.
Nikkay in the hair salon is the absolute best! My hair always looks fantastic when she's done, her service is friendly and she is excellent at what she does!
Customer service does suck.  I was looking for about an hour and no one offered help. I found what I was looking for none the less.

Surprisingly,  this was my FIRST time an Ulta store! The bright lights against the white monochrome decor had me hypnotized as I wandered through aisle after aisle of beautiful makeup and skincare products. I wanted it all! Luckily, I had visited the Ulta website earlier in the day and came across an amazing Free Gift with Purchase offer with $88 that actually had some really great stuff in it, and in colors I will actually use!!
I wenr in at 8:40pm, and although the store closes at 9pm, I didn't get any sort of attitude from any of the 3 employees that said Hi to me and all very politely and professionally asked if I needed help finding anything.  At first I was fine and didn't need help. Right up front I spotted the Ulta Brand and laid eyes upon the gorgeous warm toned neutral palette by Miss Fabulous, a YouTube beauty blogger that made this particular palette as a collaboration with Ulta! I grabbed that and one of their Ulta Brand Automatic Lip Liners in "Rose", which is an awesome rose pink that I would consider "nude" and can be used as a liner with many different lip product shades. The eyeshadow pallete was $20 and the liner was $8. Fair prices for the Ulta Brand. 
I love that there are an abundance of testers out!!
I suddenly remembered that I have been wanting to get a Beauty Blender! Yes, the little pink secret weapon of girls, boys, and Drag Queens everywhere!  I asked the very sweet girl behind the back counter, I think it was a makeover/spa counter of some sort, if she could just point me in the direction of the Beauty Blenders! I would have been cool with her literally pointing in the direction or even just telling me the aisle number! But this top notch Ulta employee WALKED ME ALL THE WAY OVER TO IT! And it was on the opposite side of the store from us, too! 
Unfortunately,  Ulta does NOT carry the original, actual Beauty Blender brand of makeup sponge. However, being a "Girl-in-the-Know", I was aware that the "Real Techniques" sponge is the closest dupe and that's just what they had! The Real Techniques are $10.99 for TWO blenders, unlike the original Beauty Blender, which is $20 for ONE! Also, the RT blender has a FLAT side, which seems like it would press that foundation in Tony our skin better, and it has a sharper point at the top for really getting that concealer right up against your under eye area! I've yet to try the RT sponge, but let me know if anyone reading this wants an "update" as to how the RT makeup blending sponge or anything I purchased worked out!
So, I qualified for their FGWP and received a cute little makeup bag with $88 worth of Ulta Brand Makeup in it for FREE!! And it's in colors that I will actaully use! I can list what was in the bag in an "update", too.!
I was so excited and overwhelmed by my shopping experience that I completely forgot to use the $3.50 Off purchase of Ulta Brand worth $21 Or More that I had printed off from the Ulta website earlier in the day. 
Thr girl at the register looked up my "Ultimate Rewards" card info by my phone number as it wasn't pulling up on my cell phone. You get One Point for every $1 you spend, PRETAX!!! 100 points is worth $3.00. That's a pretty generous rewards system! She was also very nice and helpful and I enjoyed chatting with her while she rang me up. She was even nice enough to show me a whole chart that shows the scale of your Rewards and what they are with dollar amount wise. I wish I would have asked and/or remembered all of their names!! Since I came in 20 minutes before closing, I really did expect to be treated with a sour attitude and not receive any help. I am beyond satisfied and impressed with how each employee treated me and when they found out it was my first time in an Ulta, they were even excited for me, joked around with me, and we briefly discussed our mutual love of all things makeup!  What a great staff at this location!
I will definitely be returning to this particular Ulta to make future makeup and skincare purchases for the foreseeable future!! 
I highly suggest that before going into the store,  take some time and look over the Ulta website and check out their sales,  new arrivals, and special offers and FGWP!! I wouldn't have known about the free bag of stuff if I hadn't visited the website!  And, USE YOUR REWARDS CARD!!! Earn points and benefit from buying higher end makeup, it all adds up very quickly! 
I am super stoked I FINALLY stepped foot into one of the two Makeup Meccas! 
We will see if the other store can even hold a candle to the wonderful employees here! I will most definitely be calling the store later and informing the Manager of my positive experience here!

May your eyeshadow not fade, may your concealer never crease, and may your eyebrows always be on Fleek! 

I highly recommend shopping this Ulta location my fellow Makeup Addicts!!




Happy Yelping!!#

I went to the Ulta Salon in sparks on Oct have Sharla cut my hair. While she was friendly I was shocked to see the back of my hair when she was done. It looks like Moe of the 3 stooges. Right in the mid back of my hair it looks like a bowl cut! I brought her several pictures of how my hair is cut and she went wild with the back. I hate the back of my neck and always have the back of my hair the same length but she cut it up high with the sides hanging down. It is uneven and I am so embarrassed I don't want to leave my house!

Husband booked me an appointment today for a relaxing facial before our anniversary, I want to start off by saying Jade was amazing! I have never gotten a facial done before today and I will definitely be making it a regular thing. She was so sweet and easy to talk to, but also let me relax and enjoy the silence! So if you're thinking of getting a facial, definitely see her! Also want to acknowledge Mercedes at the brow bar, she's amazing at what she does and such a sweetheart! Thanks ladies(:
I still like to shop here. They have some great employees and of course some bad apples.

This review is for Mercedes as the Brow Bar. After having a horrible experience at an Aveda salon in the same shopping strip I was glad to find Mecedes at Ulta Brow Bar. 
She fixes my brows and made them look the way they should have been. She gives good tips on make up and how to do your brows.
I guess my only complaint is that a few weeks ago on my first visit she wanted me to grow out a certain part of my brows. Then on my most recent visit she waxed all the new growth off!  I know she sees a lot of people but it would have been nice had she kept consistent advice. I will be back because she does a stellar job!

Went in for hair dye. I'd highly recommend Nicole. She is a great and a very friendly stylist. She gave me the look that I wanted. Keep up the good work! :)
Jade gives the best facials. I got one done after a long time and it was totally worth it.

I LOVE having an ULTA close to my house.  They have so much to choose from and they are always sending out great coupons.  They also have a membership where you can get free items every quarter.  I always get a cool little eyeshadow or something.  The more you spend, the better your little free gift is.  One time I even got a free Coconut Body Butter from the Body Shop line.  I was pretty stoked.  

The only reason I give this place four instead of five stars is because sometimes in their mailers they advertise a product that they do not even sell in the store.  That is really frustrating.

This is a nice, clean store with good customer service.  I started going to Mercedes a few years ago to get my brows waxed and she is amazing.  She does a fantastic job and is super friendly.  She always gives my daughter samples and will help us find whatever we need.

It's always a nerve racking experience to find a new hair person/dermatologist/nail person/doctor.....I think you all will get the idea.

In this case it was hair.  I had just moved up from LA and had been in town for only three weeks.  I had a second interview coming up with a high profile tech company and my fine, curly hair was looking pretty ragged.

My last hair dresser, who I had been going to for around 10 years has hair that is similar to my own, so she got me.  Plus, she became a good friend.  She had also styled industry people on set at the Golden Globes, cut hair for actors/models, but mostly high level celebrity's assistants/attorneys/publicists.  My point: she is amazing.

Back to my situation- I didn't have much time.  My mom's hair always looks nice and she has a great head of hair (no extensions) for being a senior.  I chose to go to her hair dresser, Raquel.

It turns out Raquel has thick, wavy/curly hair too.  She is great at what she does!  She touched up my roots, did a conditioning thing and a blowdry.  I got 3 compliments before I even paid my bill!  I loved that she trimmed my ends just the tiniest bit, as I like to keep my hair long.

I'm not taking off a full star, but more a quarter: we were both feeling kind of tired and stressed, so the energy was a little low.  Next time, I'll make sure I have caffeine with me.

She really is amazing and does listen to you.  I highly recommend her.
Don't let Amy wax your eyebrows!! She made one of mine shorter than the other and said I could fill it in with make up til it Grows back.

Friendly and very helpful associates. When I came in they didn't readily come to your aid which was ok. When you approach them and ask questions, they're very helpful. The lady at the cashier even offered to inform me if they get more of the promo stuff, because at that time they didn't have my shade. Will definitely come back to this store.

Eyebrows are jacked up so thin. One arched way higher than the other. And shorter than the other I've never got bad eyebrows done like this. Even my boyfriend noticed that they were messed up and he never notices anything.
All the women hairdressers are fantastic. All very professional and sweet. They do amazing things with hair. Years of experience pay off there. You will be satisfied

This review is for the 2nd Ulta location in NNV, close to the Sparks Costco.

I joined 'Ulta Club' a couple of years ago to get a discount.  Just like other retail buyers' clubs, I get discount coupons and savings certificates based on my volume of purchases.  

While the Ulta store location on S. Virginia St. is a lot more accessible for me, there have been many times I went there looking for one specific item, and found they either don't have it on their racks, or they are sold out of it.  Two weekends ago, I went to the Virginia St. location, hoping to use my $5 off of $15 coupon, but both items I was looking for were not there.  Hallelujah at the Sparks location, they had both items, I used my discount, and walked out of there a happy-camper.

ive shopped here a lot. and overall i like it and this will be my beauty place. what i love is the location, bogo on products, and customer satisfaction. i normally have success in finding beauty products however occasionally i have allergic reaction to certain formulas. what i love about ulta is they understand if the product does not work out for you they will go 100% to make sure your happy and this makes my purchases easier to make knowing if its truly unsatisfying they will exchange/return for you. im also a rewards member and enjoy the perks.

*** read updated review not so happy customer anymore***

I shop at this ulta twice a month at least but the closing manager on November 23 was rude. I made a small purchase and as I was leaving my purse pur went off. As I was shopping she found an empty box of an item she saw me looking at (that I put back) she shuck the box in my face asking where the product was I told her I put it back and wouldn't steal from a store I frequented often. I even opened my purse and shinned my camera light on so she could see in. She told me she would check the camera and I hope she does. If I was stealing as soon as the alarm when off I would have been out that door instead of staying and opening my purse.
Apparently ulta sparks store cannot follow their return policy and wouldnt return a product i got a allergic reaction too. So much for having a great customer experience today.

I cannot praise Ulta highly enough for going above and beyond in helping fix my hair that had been dyed too dark, with gray highlights.  When I called the next morning, the manager said not to worry, they would get me in and fix it all.  The stylist Vanessa, tried everything to tone the color down, and when that wasn't working she re-did my entire do.  She was very busy, yet made the effort to give me what I wanted.  The manager of the store, Lisa C, said there would be no charge and I left a very happy camper.  Ulta has a loyal customer for life - I am more than pleased.

Not usually one of the stores you'd catch me in, but I was always told never judge a book by its color, you should try New! Things... But here is my thoughts on this location. Not knowing much about make-up nor any of this stuff. Ill try to write a review that everyone can relate to. 

My thoughts of "Ulta" it's very clean floors, walls and well everything looks like it's been wiped down throughout the day. They offer numerous brands, and different salon specialists items. The Staff is helpful but not many approaching me asking if I had Any questions but it's fine, I really wouldnt need help here. But im happy on how they asked my wife on certain questions she had. 

Thank you, Ulta.
Great place to get some good makeup at a pretty reasonable price point. I usually get my eyebrows down which always come out great. The team there are good too. Check them out

I just wanted to write a quick review to say that this Ulta has stepped up its game and has become a really nice place to shop. In the past I had less than stellar customer service experiences but over the past 6 months employees have gone out of their way to help me find elusive products and have been really really knowledgeable. This is now my favorite Ulta anywhere.

Mercedes is still there and does amazing brows at the Benefit Brow Bar. She is also fabulous at helping me test out products that are new to me. I highly recommend stopping by the Benifit counter to chat with her.

There is a new Clinique counter which is wonderful! I love the way it is set up and I find it much more user friendly than the counter at department stores. There are LOTS of disposable applicators so you can try pretty much everything! Love it. 

One more rave. The gals at the salon are wonderful and helping you navigate through the bazillion and one professional styling products to find the one you need. I don't have time to read every bottle so their assistance has been fantastic.

Customer service is hit-or-miss, mostly miss lately. The Bennefit brow gals are wonderful and consistently good. The salon is fine. My most recent issues have occurred during check out with employees who need better customer service training, especially processing coupons and/or returns. The advertised gifts with purchase are often forgotten or misunderstood by checkout staff. I typically shop at this store once a month. However, customer service has been so bad lately, I have started driving across town to the Ulta off Kietzke or opting for Sephora instead.

This is a short five star review for Leslie, who works at Ulta Beauty in Sparks. If you want your hair done by a girl who knows her stuff, who is professional and a fun person as well, give her a call.

I've never been in the store, never had my hair done by a beautician, but I'm a wedding photographer and in the course of my work, I've met and photographed a lotta beauticians as they're doing a bride's hair and that's how I met Leslie, as she was doing Brandy's hair on her wedding day.

She was fun to be around and she did a gorgeous job with Brandy's hair, which you can see if you check out my photos.

Had eye brows waxed.  Freaking out.  I like a natural look.  After she did her thing, she used a brow pencil on me.  I've never had an aesthetician di that before.  After I washed my face, I knew exactly why.  She had taken off nearly half my brows.  And one side is shorter than the other.  I was trying to do something nice for myself on the spur of the moment.  I really wish I had thought more about it.  :(

I am a fan of both Ultas in Reno.  But since my normal hairstylest left the one On VA street, I tried this one.  And yes, Kimmy is a jewel. She cut my hair just how I wanted!!!  Now I will be coming back to this Ulta to get my hair cut.  

LOVE IT.....

I discovered Mercedes and the other ladies at this Ulta about three years ago. I have not let anyone touch my eyebrows since meeting Mercedes. Her charisma alone would be enough to stay loyal but the expertise she brings to her art is amazing! I travel ALOT for work. I sometimes go weeks without having my brows done. I will wait the weeks. I don't even care. She is THAT good. Not to mention the manager and all of the ladies spent hours with me over a years time finding makeup that would not upset my skin. As well as finding the perfect look for my wedding last year. The service here is beyond top notch. Now when I travel back east I have to quadruple check that I have what I need before I leave. I no longer have to worry about going to a new Beauty bar to find people who can understand how picky my skin is. I LOVE everything about his location and these amazing ladies!

I like Ulta, it is a great place to find all the "beauty " products I need.  The best part of going to Ulta is the Salon.  LesLee is amazing!  She is very upbeat! Since I have had my hair done by her the last few years I get great compliments!  She charges fairly and now for gifts I usually ask for an Ulta gift card.  Way to go Leslee!

This ULTA beauty always has what I'm looking for . I might not look like the typical person to come shop here but i do love the brand and most locations have what i need . I just don't really appreciate being hovered when I'm browsing for the right thing for me , last time I got asked by like 6 different employees if I needed help lol

So Ulta advertises in store right next to the perfumes, that if you refill your perfume in store that you will save $30. Therefore on my $100 of perfume I should have only paid $70 plus tax. They have charged me $85 plus tax. Absolute bullshit false advertising pisses me off.

I love the Sparks Ulta. Have been to the Reno store and was pretty treated as invisible. Unless your under 30, no one wants to help you.
The Sparks store is very welcoming and I love that they employ all types of people, not just on certain type. They seem to know that "women of a certain age" are the ones with money and we want to spend it, a concept the Reno store doesn't.

I bought my daughter a new palette (pirates of the Caribbean)  when we brought it home, more than 1 of the shadows was cracked and broken. Sadly, we had some medical issues and were not able to return it for an exchange it until today. When my daughter went to go exchange it she was greeted by an uneducated manager cary (kari sp?) and was treated like garbage. My daughter was told when you buy make up its like buying a new car and you are responsible for it. My daughter felt like she was treated like a second class individual. Mind you WE HAVE NEVER RETURNED ANYTHING. After all of the headache, hassle, and rudeness my daughter was given a new palette but without a box. I called and spoke to Brittany who is a manager and all she did was say thats not how we handle things. Well, regardless we wont be going back there to buy make up or anything. I guess online is the way to. Awesome job Ulta on keeping up your business and customer service. I guarantee, if i were the one returning it, as an adult i would not have been treated so poorly. Rip ulta

If you are in need of beauty supplies, this is a great place to get them. However, they are over-priced and their services are either a hit or a miss. I've had friends go to their salon and receive terrible haircuts. I've had my eyebrows done there a few times and it is usually fine but most recently they did a pretty bad job. They have a great selection and their cashiers are friendly but this isn't a place I would go to unless I really needed something. Most of these same supplies are available cheaper somewhere else and I don't think their waxing or salon services are reliable.

I booked an appointment for a facial.  After being shown into the room, I was asked to fill out a form.  I did and the person doing the facial never looked at it.  While I was getting the facial, the person's phone kept going off and she kept having to go deal with it. She explained that she was usually off work by then and her friends were calling. For Pete's sake be professional and turn the darn phone off.  Basically, she was just doing the minimum for the facial.  The room was less than inviting and it was really off putting.  I couldn't wait to get done with this.  I would rather pay more money and get a professional experience.    

On the flip side, Mercedes did a simply wonderful job on my eyebrows and even showed me a product that would do a better job than what I was using.  I bought the product and love it.  She's a professional.

This place is absolutely terrible! There is a girl specifically who I do not recommend her name is Carly and is somehow the manager of the Clinique counter, which I don't understand. I needed help finding a foundation for dry skin I said maybe there's something in Clinique and she said no there's not.... Then she continued going on by telling me how pale and white I was! It's winter hello, but even in winter that doesn't make it okay to call people pale what if I was sick!? All the girls there don't know their products and are not trained in customer service.

I had a face wax done after signing a waiver. After the visit my face broke out all over with bumps. Because my faced felt burned and itchy I went to a urgent care doctor who gave me prescriptions to give me relief. I then returned to this business to inform them of the problem I had hoping they would like the information to prevent other customers from having the same experience. Their response was, you signed a waiver, and after a pause, the person said what do you want me to do about it? I was so frustrated I turned and left the premises.

I purchased the dermablend full coverage cream foundation on black friday along with the medium coverage powder, however, when I received the products I was sent the wrong color foundation. The powder was the correct color It was just a mistake on their part. I went in to the ulta store with receipt in hand and asked to do an even exchange because I was sent the wrong color. I brought the correct color up to the counter and explained I was sent the wrong color, how I never touched the product and needed to exchange them.
