I noticed she wasn't checking my hair or looking in the mirror, or checking with me so I was ready to take off the cape and walk out because I was getting nervous.  I was honestly a bit intimidated by her antics.  Unfortunately I stayed in my seat.  And then "it" happened.  She grabbed a chunk of hair without looking and took 2 inches off where it shouldn't have come off.  I could see on her face she realized it too.  She spun my chair around and showed me the other side and said I was done. So dishonest! No apology or effort to blend it in.   I was burning up but didn't want to create a scene.  I went to pay and was asked to leave a tip.  I wish I had asked to speak with a manager, but instead I tipped her and left because I was so uncomfortable.  I had a stressful day ahead, I decided not to sweat the "small stuff"  But it has bothered me every day since then that I have a chunk of hair missing because it was more important for her to brag to everyone about her trip than to take care of my hair.  I had to get this off my chest and warn others.  It's time for another cut and I will not be going back - surely management has had opportunities to see this side of her and did nothing?
Came in today and Jeanne dyed and waxed my eyebrows- it was very needed! Thanks again, they look great!

DO NOT GO TO THE HAIR SALON HERE!!!!!
This Ulta has been going downhill for a while. It's always messy and unorganized, there's bins left on the floor in the aisles, the employees on the floor are rude and will point out flaws in your makeup, it's not clean or well kept, the employees seem miserable, and they're always out of stock of popular items. Me and my mom had a terrible experience at the hair salon in particular.
Last year we went to get our hair done here because we've always liked buying makeup at Ulta and figured we would have a good experience. I wanted ombré with platinum ends. My hair was chocolate brown. My hairdresser explained to me she wouldn't be able to get my ends all the way to platinum in one sitting and that I'd have to come back probably one more time. I didn't know anything about bleaching hair at the time but I was okay with it and wanted her to do what she could to get it as blonde as possible. My senior pictures were the next day so I still wanted it to look nice. She asked me if I wanted a solid ombré or this choppy style ombré she had done on other clients. I specifically said solid ombré and had a reference picture. I ended up with an orangey gold, unblended, I don't even know what to call it. I think she tried to do the choppy style ombré with streaks that she had done on other clients when I specifically asked for solid ombré. It looked terrible. There was a line between the brown and the orangey gold. There were parts that were so patchy they looked like hot topic patterned hair extensions. I even showed my hairdresser as she was leaving and she acted like she didn't see anything. My mom's hairdresser saw how bad of a job mine did and ended up blending some parts more with toner for me because my hairdresser left. I don't know what my hairdresser used on my hair but it didn't look good at all. I've seen good hairdressers take brown hair to platinum in one sitting. A few years back I had the same thing done at Fantastic Sam's in Sun City and they got my ends to platinum without major damage, and the ombré was nicely blended. It was much cheaper than Ulta, which ended up being about $200 each for me and my mom. My hairdresser at Ulta could have at least blended it nicely and toned it right.
My mom had a bad experience too. She wanted a balayage and had dark brown, almost black hair. Her hairdresser claimed to be the best colorist at the salon. She ended up taking forever on my mom because she had to strip the box color first, then work on the balayage. She took on another client about halfway through and worked on them both at the same time, which was a problem. She was rushing on my mom's hair and we didn't end up leaving until after 9:00 at night (started around 4:00). She wouldn't even style her hair at the end! My mom had to style it herself and this other hairstylist gave her an attitude when she asked for some hairspray. My mom ended up with red and orange streaks on the back of her head. Needless to say, when we walked out of there we were not happy.
We talked to the manager about the situation afterwards and she wouldn't refund us; instead she offered to "fix" our hair for free on another day. When she did my hair she was really nice and apologetic about it, but I don't think she even did anything but tone my hair because it looked the same, just gray, and the ombré wasn't fixed. My ends eventually faded back to that orangey gold color a week later. My mom's hair looked the same too, just slightly less orange.
This salon doesn't have top notch hairdressers. Don't waste your money here.

I can't say I'm a fan because I only shop here maybe once a year. They have a great "Buy 2 Get 1 Free" sale on hair products. It's a great deal when buying name brand items like Redkin, Matrix, and others. I also like receiving the 20% coupon that is sent out periodically to ultimate reward members. There are many other good deals which is why this store is very popular. 

Unfortunately, I don't go very often because it's so difficult to get in and out of Regency Square because of the traffic situation. Also, I don't think I've ever had any of the sales staff volunteer to assist me with anything. In fact, the staff at the register rarely smile or say much of anything except when asking for your phone number to add your reward points. The service is more friendly at Sephora.

I am highly disappointed with my latest experience at Ulta. It's ridiculous that on a Sunday no one is really working there. I figured I would try out their benefits brow studio as I was told on the phone I could try popping in if I wanted to get them done. Well I did no one was in the section to help me and apparently only one woman works there on sundays despite many chairs and she was out and no one could find her. Usually if a place can get me in even if I have to wait for a bit I will stay and usually means I will buy more because I'm waiting but it was chaos and off putting I'm sorry but if you need your brows done your not waiting a week for an appointment that's absurd. I usually go to sephora anyways, I like this place for its ability to have other things but if you can't pop in and be helped relatively fast with someone whose section it is many people won't ask they will just leave. I probably won't be back unless necessary

Just the rudest staff I've EVER experienced, anywhere. The place was a mess, terrible disorganized. They had testers in wrong places for different brands.  On top of the staff that looks like they wouldn't know the difference between eye shadow and lip gloss, just avoid this one in general. Rude staff. Dirty store. Fitting.
Alisha is the best hair stylist in the universe, and that is, by no means, an exaggeration! I leave every time, looking and feeling like a freaking mermaid!

Luckily the staff actually let you walk around freely without an escort like Sephora, however, when I went to pay I didn't have my wallet and asked if I can give her my card numbers. She said no unless it was an Ulta card. I never had this problem pre-covid anywhere including here. Very condescending and annoying because regency plaza is a nightmare already and having to go back was annoying. There were 12 people in line behind me so I didn't make a stink about it, more like "where the hell is my card?" But if I was alone I would have asked for a manager cause I've been in this pickle in their store before. I guess I just need to be more organized. Two stars still stands, this place sucks and you're better off going anywhere but here

The only ulta around for miles, usually pretty clean inside. Staff is mostly friendly. However I do run into the problem of the store not being stocked on popular items and/or trying to find an associate can be very frustrating. Usually when I find an associate, I have to ask them to check their stock because some will look at the shelf and just tell me there's nothing there without looking in the locker drawers below. Check out lanes do take a while be it the line is long or short with one or two people. Prices are decent but I stick to ulta brand and/or NYX which are heavily shopped in my area. It'd be nice if they kept it stocked on the floor or have backup stock, especially during sales.

I've came here twice in the last 2 months and both times were not that great. I will say both women were very kind but I won't be coming back again.

First Appointment: I got a very basic trim and some layers but the women was very rough on my scalp. I should have said something in the moment when she was parting and brushing my hair (so i take fault for that). I realized when i got home that i had minor cuts on my scalp. 

Second Appointment: I decided i wanted to color my hair and get some highlights along with a minor color correction. The full color is fine but the highlights are thick like Britney Spears from he early 2000's and are warm toned when I obviously have cool toned skin. The picture I showed her is very subtle, cool toned highlights which she said she could do. I paid $200 for this and am very unhappy with the result. I should mention that she was also very rough on my scalp.

I'm not sure how to get any form of a refund.

I got my hair cut here as I've never had a problem getting it done at any other Ulta location I've been to, even in different states. I left with a blow out and my hair looked fine, not usually how it looks but I could tell she didn't add layers like I asked so I figured that was the problem. 20 minutes later when I arrived at home and the blowout had fallen and it looked like she took a weed whacker to my hair. I even went back to have her fix it and it was still so horrible I had to drive to a different location to get my hair cut (since I had been there before and loved it). Will never be going to this location again for salon services, -10/10 do NOT recommend.

If I could leave less than one star, I would! Worst Ulta I have ever shopped in! I'm providing this opinion based on multiple visits. The customer service is terrible! The employees are on some kind of make-up knowledge power trip! Most of them all have the same shitty personality too. I wonder if there is a test or something they all had to fail in order to get hired there. Hmmm...

Made an appointment on a whim to get my hair cut and instantly regretted it. Asked for a shoulder length cut, got that. Asked for the blonde in my hair to be darkened, got that. Asked for the ends to not be so blunt, kind of got that?? Then the stylist said she'd do some face framing which I was okay with.....until she did it. She saw I was looking at the cut and reassured me it was not the cut that was bad but the previous balayage that made it look that way. 

When everything was said and done, she gave me a blowout and somewhat curled it. Needless to say the cut added a good 10+ years on my age. I was speechless and lied about liking it because I'm not one to hurt someone's feelings, so I paid and left.

Awful customer service to the woman who answered the phone to tell me they close at 7 now. Rude with an attitude. Not sure why her day was so bad but if you're going to be a sales associate you should try to make customers want to come in. Should have gotten her name!!

Had gone to someone to get my hair cut and colored for an event and ended up with a horrible chop job. I called and was able to get in with Alisha~ all I can say is thank goodness for happy accidents! Alisha was able to salvage what hair I had left and had me looking myself in no time at all! That was two years ago! Since then, she's consistently done a phenomenal job which is no easy feat with my coarse and wavy hair! She even found creative ways to color and highlight my hair following a major chest surgery so I could feel as normal as possible! I can't remember the last time I had a someone I was able to count on with my hair~ and I truly love the personal connectivity! Thank you Alisha!!!

Mixed bag: got my eyebrows done on a whim here and was disappointed.  They were uneven and not the same "height."  She was very helpful with finding a product my daughter was looking for, though, and went above and beyond to accommodate her needs.  I'll probably shop here again but will never have anything "done."
Always does a great job, never been disappointed with the services. All the stylist are professional and courteous. Highly recommend.

Had a hair and makeup appt in king of Prussia ulta. 2 hours before my appt the salon called to tell me they had to cancel as my stylist to do my makeup and hair got a bad case of vertigo. While the salon was extremely apologetic they did not have a back up or anyone to be able to do both but she was trying to "call around." FAST FORWARD past that annoying incident which pulled me into panic mode- I called ulta in collegeville and immediately Amany Dewes who is a master stylist said come in now and I will take care of you! ALL of the stylists were wonderful and accomadating. Amany- thank you for a wonderful job! I am so happy! Made my day- THIS salon is the one to go to!

I went to Ulta today with a very bad perm, (frizz fest on my head).. looking for advice on what I could do to make it look better. I met with a stylist there named Heather. Heather cut my hair, layered it and straightened it and made it look absolutely beautiful. I would recommend any ladies out there wanting an awesome hair stylist to go see Heather at Ulta.  I went in hating my hair and came out loving it!! Thanks Heather!!

I had a very very complicated exchange that I needed to make at this location. I did not know if we were going to be able to accomplish the exchange, but we did.

I want to take a moment and personally thank the Manager named Heather for doing what she could for me. Thank you Heather, you are the best! I look forward to visiting your location again in the future.
Spent 15 minutes testing fragrance. No one greeted me much less asked me for help. Hope it's not this way all the time.

Don't bother going here.  We made an appt for a haircut.  They were 30 mins late and didn't even bother to apologize or let us know how much longer we had to wait.  We walked out. No one even noticed.

Lauren gave me the worst up-do and hair cut, she ruined my wedding day, I asked her to put clip on extensions because I wanted my hair longer, she put the clip ons and after that cut the extensions and Mu hair, I wanted to leave there crying it was so horrible, please don't go see Lauren. Brianna was great and did my make-up I love her! She saved the day.

Very disappointed with my last two visits, won't be going back :(
Cut, color and highlights $212.00, and I keep my hair very, very short.
My daughter said "what happened to the back of your hair, you look like a calico cat"!! 
The back of my head was all spotty. I couldn't believe they allowed me walk out looking like that after three hours of being there. The last two times my color faded within two weeks.
Great makeup selection when they have it. The ladies are somewhat nice, but they are definitely knowledgeable. I would recommend because it is in a great location and it is perfect for makeup lovers.

Drove 40 min to an eye brow apt to find out the benifits brow girl called out. They said the called me and my answer machine said mail box full, I said that's weird bc I don't have any saved messages, then the story changed to well is this your number and I said no, and they said well that's what we called.... Ulta customer service is horrible to begin with, this is just the icing on the cake for them.
Strange vibe at this store , staff seems uneducated about sales in their store. This has happened on several occasions when I have gone there , and when asked about it they almost seem annoyed .

My sister came here to get her eyebrows done. She's had them waxed many times, without issue. This last time they ripped off her skin on BOTH EYES. What's even better is they tried to blame her, asking if she has dry skin or is using a product that would cause this. After calling the manager they asked if we wanted to reschedule. HAH- good one. Had to ask to get a refund, they had the gall to not immediately offer. If she scars, let's just say, a refund is going to be the LEAST of their worries.

Had a great make up experience with Imani from the salon. She's an artist and takes make up seriously. I felt glam for my event and she couldn't have been nicer. She even did my make up after her hours were over bc my original stylist was sick.

I made an appointment with Lisa. I wanted to dye my hair to plum purple but my hair color wasn't even close to what I wanted. 

She cut my hair good but bummer about the color. I wouldn't return here again for hair dye. 

This place is ok ok. If you want your hair just to cut then this place is good. But if it's dye. Don't, waste money.

Wierd vibe at this store. The stylist in the makeup area never greet me, never ask if I want to sample anything, I bought the devacurl hair care, if you spend $30 you get a free gift. As I waited in line the women before me had bought 2 things, the cashier asks her if she would like a free sample. She offered things like face cream,sun block, lip care etc. I got up in line and get through with my purchase and I asked for the free gift that was advertised all over the devacurl section. She told me no, they are out of the free gift. I asked her if I could have a sample then of what the lady before me got, she told me no, that lady bought basically nothing.. I think this place is rude and I get the "I'm better then you" atmosphere.

Unprofessional especially the General Manager, Kelly. The salon manager after two weeks on site did not have the "tools" to do my hair. She said she couldn't do my hair. Alexis stepped in and made biased comments. When I requested to speak to the GM, Kelly arrived with an attitude so I left. This is a horrid location. Always has been. Don't waste your time or your money.

Do not get your eyebrows done here! Every time I went I would tell here to not make them thin and she would almost wax the entire thing off each time going pencil thin.  The lady whose always there has horrible makeup and overplucked brows that was in style 10 years ago. If that's the style she wants that's fine but don't make your clients look like that.

1 Star is too many. The whole staff is dumb and unqualified to make decisions. Their benefit brow bar privilege should be revoked and whoever works at it will have to pay the price. They are incredibly difficult to reason with and I'm boycotting the place because of it.
Staff could not be LESS knowledgeable and less helpful. Trying to find something in this store could not be more frustrating. Worth the time to drive over to Sephora or Mac.

I just had an awesome facial with Emma. She was super knowledgeable about the products she used and did an amazing job. I would absolutely recommend her for any makeup or skin care needs. I would have bought every product she used if I had the money at the time. My skin looks and feels awesome. Thanks Emma.

Staff is rude and pestering, I know what I want and where to find it when I enter Ulta. If I say No to your help, do not follow me around and keep asking. Also, the cashiers at this location are very rude and as an Ulta customer who uses the app.. I should not have to ask if i have Ulta points to redeem... the cashiers should let that be known upfront. This is not an isolated event, this has happened at multiple locations at Ulta and has taken me many years to finally get to the point that i have no choice but to go online hoping for change. It's not that hard and has been getting worse and worse. I will go to Sephora instead

Hello, I went in to your Collegeville pa store for an appointment to go blonde. I walked out with purple roots, orange banding, balding, loss of hair. I have been coming to the ulta salon for years and had fantastic experience. I decided to try someone new because my usual stylist was booked for the holidays. Not only did the stylist not inform me of my hair falling out (I had to point out the top half of my head was an inch long now) , my scalp is now burned and I went home in tears. This was an absolutely horrible experience and I feel truly violated. I am unsure of what to do moving forward short of shaving my whole head. This just isn't right and I will be scarred for years because of this. DO NOT GO HERE. They will blame the customer for their ignorance.

Okay-let me tell you about my girl, Jenna. She's like this magical hair wizard who can perform miracles. I came in wanting extensions-I lost about 80% of my hair due to illness and my hair was a little below my chin length wise. As far as thickness and color, it was a mess. Of course, I was devastated. I missed my thick blonde hair and was willing to give my right arm to have it back. Now enters Jenna. Not only did she nail the color of the extensions-she placed them so perfectly that you never would have guessed I had extensions in. This is how awesome she is-she picked the color of my extensions before she colored my natural hair and was able to get my natural hair and extensions to match PERFECTLY. Who does that? Literally no one. It was so perfect that I nearly cried while in the chair. She's also the best to talk with and so so sweet. In reality-all the girls at this location are so sweet. Jenna is a hair master, so if you're needing quite literally anything done with your hair, ask for Jenna. I'm SO glad I did.

This place has been a life saver! My daughter had issue after issue with hair and makeup scheduled appointments for prom.  This place totally saved the day and I highly recommend going here for all your beauty needs. We will totally use them next year.

The store is bright and clean. A few displays needed to be restocked as they were empty along with a few shelves. The store staff seemed somewhat knowledgeable, helpful, and friendly. I had called ahead to make sure they had an item in stock because it was sold out online. I was informed it was available without being put on hold. I normally shop online or at the Fashion Mall Commons location, but I'd visit this one again.

We went here for the first time and it literally smelled like a port-a-potty & was very hot in the store. I don't know what was up with that, but it made it unbearable during the visit and we don't really want to go back because of it. Shelves were kinda messy in the hair care areas.

I wear makeup once every two years - I'm going to be in a wedding next week so it's that time again. 
So, as someone who doesn't wear makeup, picking and buying makeup is nauseating to me. Before I came in, a friend recommended some products and told me questions to ask the staff. The staff was so helpful - I think there were four people working and all four asked if I needed help during my visit. And I did. So they were all super helpful pointing me in the right direction, color matching me for foundation, and recommending products. 

I had my toddler with me and noticed upon entry that they don't have carts (understandable for a store that sells mostly very small things) - so my little guy was in his stroller the whole time. When I left, someone grabbed the door for me and I really appreciated it. 

Thanks Avon Ulta!

I went in looking for a particular item they carry. It took a while to find it. No one working asked if I needed help. They seemed to be hanging out with each other. However the cashier checking me out was super sweet. She helped me with my birthday item and was very nice.

Not too impressed by this location. Staff wasn't friendly and a lot of products that I've seen in the Plainfield store was not at this one. Smaller. I wish we could get a damn Morphe store already. Probably won't go back to this location for my MUA needs.

First time that I have been to this location. The store was clean and well lit. I went at a time where it was pretty slow. 

I was able to locate what I was looking for. I saw associates walking around but I was never approached by one. 

I was essentially in and out with no problem.

Visited this store a few days ago. Very impressed with all the products! It's a woman's candy land and also dangerous for my wallet. Lol There were several ladies there who were very helpful and knowledgeable about the products. I was looking for a particular hydrating eye cream that they did not have. However, two ladies did show me the products they use and I purchased one of them. I've been using the Benefits potent eye cream and I love it! Of course pricing is a little higher than what we women would like to pay but if I love the results I'm ok with that. They also have make up and skincare that is less expensive than their prestige products so there is something for everyone in your price range. Nice layout of the store and great staff. This will be my new "go to" for makeup and skincare products.

I felt criminalized in this store shopping with my daughter. Multiple employees followed us around while we shopped. I frequently make purchases at Ulta multiple times a month (I rack up so many points that I come back to redeem them) I've never had any intentions of shoplifting but when I shop in Ulta stores I feel criminalized and it makes the shopping experience extremely uncomfortable especially shopping with my daughter. I mentioned it to the cashier and the security officer and they both laughed in my face- the cashier said "Well people are always stealing". This has happened at multiple locations. I've never felt like that going into any other beauty store- they have better tactics to loss prevention than Ulta, the whole watching like a hawk, pretending to help tactic sucks. Your store staff should be re-trained properly.

If it were possible to give this Ulta Beauty location negative stars, it would be richly deserved. This location has the rudest, laziest and most incompetent sales employees ever.  Being asked by customers to help find a product gets in the way of their social time as they stand around chatting with each other.  Go somewhere else for customer service because this place is worthless.

I enjoyed my time here. They just opened up! So I came on my lunch break to get my eyelashes done (individually) which usually takes forever but was able to make back to work on time. I don't remember his name but the MUA was very professional and gave me the box of lashes with a price breakdown so I wouldn't be confused. I'll be returning for my refresher :)

A little high with hidden deals!

So my gf drags me in there to shop. We go in the Gallery side [fashion district my arse], as we are walking about I notice this make up case covered with those colour changing scales. At 60% I could not resist, she loved it. My cashier Hiba was awesome, I might come back.

Disappointed. I get it that they just opened up not too long ago but the staff here is uncaring. I spent about 15 minutes in the store and half the time was me looking for staff to help with a product. I ended up face timing someone at the other Ulta to help me out. I explained this to the cashier and she just shrugged it off. I'll continue to visit the Walnut street location. This one isn't worth the trouble.

Store manager did not have a pleasant demeanor. She aimed to be politely curt and condescending by correcting my speech. She tried so hard to get a reaction. Not sure why!?!. People in retail are a little off any way. She claims Phy-to is pronounced Phe-to. Being a smart ass made her look like a real dumb ass. 

Next time humpty dumpling lol

I was really disappointed with my experience here. I was just browsing through this fairly new mall and decided to pop in here for some brown eyeliner and lip gloss (can you tell I've decided to immerse my face in a new colour theme?)

From the time I walked in, I did not feel welcome, got some pretty hostile stares from staff. I found an eyeliner I liked but had some issues with the lipgloss..I guess brown isn't popular nowadays. Well I basically walked through the entire store swatching things on my own and after 30 minutes someone asked if I need help...I say yes...and she points me in the direction of a gold gloss (I don't want gold) then a pink gloss (also not quite what I want) but then all of a sudden she dashes off to help someone else...ummm. Ok. Bye I guess. I felt very unvalued. 

I mentioned I was swatching before on my own. Turns out this is quite difficult because the stations are poorly stocked with makeup remover and alcohol and each station is completely different and random. One had a spray bottle of alcohol, brush cleaner and hand sanitizer. Another had a jumbo hand sanitizer bottle and another had a spray bottle of water (not sure when I would use water alone but hey). Was also difficult to find trash cans around the store to throw away the applicators used for testing. 

All in all, I feel like I probably should have left instead of sticking it out and gone to another location.

I went to the store to sample a fragrance I was looking to purchase, I love fragrance and purchase many. As I was sampling a couple I got staff eyeing me and the tall linky security guard constantly staring and than he moved to the outer aisle near me the longer I stood there sampling fragrances, which was quite annoying and then two of the staff members one asked if I need help while the other just happened to walk up and have a "conversation" right by me! So my fragrance experience was soured and the security guard still proceeded to eye me as I was standing by the aisle to use the hand sanitizer. I heard that Ulta profiles black people but its really difficult to take when it is done by black staff and security, the majority of the staff today was black and I am sure they have all experienced how crushing and angering it feels to be stared at as if your a criminal because of your skin color when all you want to do is shop. They should be ashamed of themselves especially the black male security guard

I dont know if it's a Philly thing but I was definitely made to feel uncomfortable while walking in this store. I cant even say it's a race thing because the guy who followed me around trying not to look obvious was black. It's a shame because I have money to spend I literally came in with multiple bags from shopping and I had on a Mackage coat ($1200) with the matching mask & balenciaga's. So there was absolutely no need to follow me around but eff em. I'll spend my money elsewhere. After I peeped him in the mirror behind me I put all that sh*t down & walked out! Im from NY & I have NEVER experienced that in my life!

Let me preface by saying that I work in customer service in downtown Nashville. This is why I know that there was no excuse for the way I was treated yesterday at this Ulta location. I went in because I needed new foundation. So I went to go pick it out and the specific color I needed, was not on the floor. (This happens frequently at these stores, all you have to do is ask someone if they have any somewhere else or in the back) So I looked around to see if I could find anything within the same brand that was similar because I had my 6 month old infant and mother with me and I didn't want to hunt someone down to ask. But finally I gave in and I decided that I needed help. There was a girl working in front of the MAC products. So my mother kindly asked if she could see if there was anything she could do to help, and the girl responded by very rudely by saying that what's on the floor is all we have. And then she turned her back to us, and completely blew us off. I mean we didn't get a smile, a nod, she was straight faced and looked annoyed with us. And she wasn't assisting anyone else, so it's not like we were interrupting. I was actually shocked. I started looking around again and I probably looked pretty thrown off by what just happened. Then, a different woman walked over to assist me and asked if I needed help. I told her a little bit of what happened and she looked slightly Confused and said "well maybe she was
Misinformed." I actually thought it was nice of her to cover for her coworker. She then proceeded to go in the back and then she came back with exactly what I needed. The girl working in front of the MAC products just didn't want to take any time helping I guess. But to the lovely lady who helped, thank you! I believe Her name is Sherleigh or something close to that. I'm so
Sorry if I butchered Your name, but you were so
Helpful! I rarely write reviews but I felt compelled after this experience.

I really like this Ulta! I feel like it's always clean and items are in stock and organized. The employees are always kind to me and eager to help if I ever need anything.

The only thing that I don't enjoy is how pushy some of the employees are getting a store credit card. I don't mind being asked, but after I politely decline - they keep asking and pushing. I understand they are most likely trying to reach quota goals, but it's just a little too pushy for me. 

Besides that - this Ulta is pretty great and I would recommend stopping by if you want a relaxed shopping experience with helpful beauty advisors.

Went in to spend gift cards, and the women decided to give me their opinions (I.g, I hate that foundation) after I asked for a color match. Then, after using gift cards the cashier was shocked I had purchased from there before- assuming I only came because I had gift cards. I will drive to 100 oaks or shop at Sephora from now on.

The manager that assisted the staff which assisted me is top-notch! 
Staff are friendly and helpful, which is always appreciated! 
They made the shopping experience easy & informative. I will definitely be back.

A friend and I had some skincare issues and questions about what products would help us solve them. The products we used to use just weren't cutting it as we age! Another friend recommended Lane as being extremely knowledgeable and helpful, and they were right! Lane listened to our issues (different for each of us), asked a few questions, then took us through the store for products to address each issue. He even mentioned a few complementary products that we might want to add to our new routine later, understanding our budget and time constraints in building a new routine. He color matched us both for concealer & foundation on the first try, and the products looked natural on our skin. He made sure we got the right products for our skin (and budget), as well as the right shades. We got the essentials this time, knowing we had a few products still in use that we will replace on our next trip to see Lane!
Terrible experience at this Ulta store. Poor customer service to lackadaisical attitudes. I will not be returning to shop at this Ulta location and will be sharing my experience with my daughters.

I have always loved coming to this Ulta until today. I came later in the day than I normally do and figured they wouldn't have as much staff there but I didn't think there'd be a problem getting any help if I needed it. There was a huge line at checkout with two people checking people out and one girl working the mac station. The girl working the mac station was the only person on the floor to help people and instead she was carrying on a conversation with a friend and wasn't looking around to see if anyone needed help. I couldn't find my shade of foundation and I needed some help to see if they were in the locked drawers underneath. I felt bad to interrupt her but I really needed help. I stood there until her friend noticed me and she was very polite but the Mac girl tried to still ignore me. Finally she acknowledged me and I asked her politely if she could help me just whenever she could I didn't mean to interrupt. She looked at me and said to go up and ask the front because they can look it up on their computer... there was a giant line.. did she want me to wait for someone to help me when she could have or did she expect me to skip the line? I just said ok and walked away grabbing a different product instead and going to checkout. I get to the checkout lady and asked her if she possibly had this in a stock and she had to go look in the locked drawers for my product. She was extremely helpful and kind and I felt really bad. The girl who worked the Mac area tonight was unhelpful, rude and didn't work to help her coworkers. Instead someone else who was already working hard had to pick up her slack.

Will not be back to this location. Painfully unhelpful and inefficient location. Been in 3 times and have been ignored or dismissed every time. Whoever the manager is needs to take a look at what's going on in there
Thank you so so much Sharia for your help today. You found me the perfect color without even being able to use the samples . Love your personality, stay beautiful

DONT GO HERE!! The security guard racially profiled my friend and her sister, making them completely uncomfortable. My friend brought this to the manager on duty's attention and the manager was completely unfazed. The security guard heard my friend complaining and blew up, raised her voice saying it was her job and she was tired and shouldn't have to be working. Thats an absolutely terrible excuse to make. Ulta get your employees and do better!!
My favorite Ulta !!! The store is always clean and less cluttered. The staff is great and the line always moves fast!

My girl Tanya McKee just started here she is a color genius. She is also funny and interesting and took the time to really consult with me about what I wanted. Also asked me questions about my beauty regiment so that I could recreate. I will be driving out from the city to follow her because I have never  my hair do much!

employees standing talking ignoring customers for over 20 minutes. only girls at register came back to help. employee shouted from the side if store..yeah..what do you need?  Not impressed with Clinique at all here

Got a horrible hair cut at the salon next to Ulta today and had to go get it fixed. Denise at Ulta's salon knew just what to do with my mess and did a perfect job giving me the look I originally wanted! Would definitely recommend to my friends...and the prices aren't bad for a quality job. I learned the hard way!

I LOVE this Ulta!  Clean, airy and open upon walking in.  They always have what I need in stock and the staff is often helpful and kind.  I've frequented their Salon twice and got a wonderful cut from Kae!  Both times she worked her magic and I will be going back to her in the future for more cuts!  Kae is very personable and cares about what you want. This Ulta is always a fun shopping experience and their Salon is top-notch!

My first time getting any salon service at Ulta.  Karen gave me a Diva Curl Haircut.  She taught me how to maintain my curls.  I purchased the Diva Curl Shampoo, Conditioner, Mousse and the spray to use in between washes.

My hair has never looked so good.  No frizz whatsoever.

Thanks so much Karen!!!

Seems like a cool place if you're into makeup! My niece was in heaven- I on the other hand thought it was insane to down $27 for a small makeup item. But I don't do makeup like that really so it's not a huge deal for me. The place just opened so everything was clean and shiny. The staff was friendly and seemed to be knowledgeable about the products.

This store has all the products you need, just like Sephora, but at least this place has coupons and sales every week. BUT the Ulta's near me have been notorious for being sneaky and not giving you the sale that they promote when your products are ringed up. My best friend used to go here a lot with me years ago. For example, if she would get a products that was "Buy 1 get 1 free" she would be charged for both items at ringup. She would either have to correct them at the register, or wouldn't notice until she got home. When I went last week, I decided the $55 hair curler and $30 eyebrow kit I got wasn't what expected, I returned it. I noticed at the register when she was doing the return that the curler scanned at $47 back to me. I told her it was more than $47 when I purchased it last week and she said, "oh, its on sale right now" but then turned to her manager next to her and asked to make sure that I just get the sale price back. Luckily her manager corrected her and said, "no, she gets the full price back if thats what she paid, sale or not right now."

I don't know if Ulta just prefers girls who don't know what they're doing, or maybe someone at these locations isn't registering all the sales into their computer prior to advertising the sales. Another thing is that the customer service and help is almost non-existent. An associate applying makeup to a customers face was approached by another woman who asked for help in finding a product. The associate said she would help her after she was  done doing the makeup for this other woman, but when the customer asked a different question nicely, the associate rudely said, "I said I'll help when I'm done here" Very rude and very unprofessional. There also was no one else to help this woman. I don't know if Ulta is understaffed or that their associates jsut like to crowd in a corner and chat for $8 an hour. I mean, that's what they're suppsoed to do, right? 

I was very frustrated by my two trips here and won't be back unless this is my last resort. I found the hair curler for $20 cheaper on Amazon. I think I will stick with Sephora, as I am never ignored or jipped of money there.

I'm typically not a huge ULTA fan, but I was in search of a O.P.I polish... I'm giving this place 4 stars for holding a pretty nice selection of O.P.I colors and they had Paz-itively Hot in stock!!! Which was awesome, they have a pretty large selection of benefit cosmetics as well.  The only down side to shopping in these types of beauty stores is, there are always teenagers in there trying on the 10 dollar nail polishes that are NOT samples... so your left with buying a used product eh...

Tanya just gave me a great haircut! I had a haircut 5 weeks ago which Tanya said was actually quite good BUT the stylist did not listen to me. Tanya did! I told her i wanted some of my over-processed ends cut and more volume at the top etc etc. The salon was VERY busy but Tanya really took her time in fact she was so careful and attentive I just cannot say enough great things.  The next step would be to have my color done...i am long overdue and Tanya suggested photos.."bring me pictures" because everyone has a different idea of shade within the color. The other great thing is they carry all the latest colors within the Redkin line which is the ONLY line i can use  because of allergies. I am so glad i found Ulta and thrilled how cutting edge they are!!! Thanks Tanya!

I hope I have the right person.... Jason helped me here today. He was nice and he was funny. I asked for a mascara recommendation, without any sales pitch, he showed me one and I was on my way. He did ask if I needed anything else but there was no pressure, no sales tactics which I appreciate. Ask for him. I hate going in any store where I feel pressured to buy everything. He knows his stuff without being pushy. I'll return for him for sure.

I moved to this area almost the same time last year and since then I see no hairstylist other than Karen. I have a curly hair and have done so many treatments that damaged my natural hair and I was so sad loosing my curls for good :( until I came across a review by Jocelyn (THANK YOU FOR YOUR POST!) it was so helpful and you would never go wrong if you have the same concern!

I have been going to Ulta for blow drys only. Today, I went to have a blow dry with someone new to me who had an opening. She did an ok job. However, when it came time to pay my bill I was shocked. I was told $55.00 for just a blow dry. I've paid $35.00 and also paid $40. I was told it depends on who blows your hair??? The $35 blow dry by Jaclyn who was my favorite by far did an amazing job, then I had a manager blow dry my hair and he did a great job, $40. After the shock wore off and I paid my bill plus tip, I walked to the back of the store and asked why was my blow dry $55.00?  I asked the person at the desk In back where the salon is to look up my blow drys and account which they can look up by your phone number. She apologized and said, "I'm sorry she should have told you, she's a master stylist". I replied I didn't get a hair cut. That is outrageous!! I get my hair blown dry in center city and paid $40.00. I go to Sorelle Hair Studio , in Dresher, for hair color, "the best"where all their operators are master stylists and I pay $40 for a blow dry. To pay $55.00 is outrageous.  She should have told me but she didn't say a word. I have to say, it was not worth it. I am really angry and feel I was taken advantage of. 

Warning to all!!! If you want a blow dry at Ulta you must ask what the operator will charge. Don't go for a "master stylist", you'll pay a lot more and trust me she wasn't worth the extra $! Btw, my hair is just a little past my shoulders. Rip-Off
Mandi is my girl. She's literally a genius with coloring and cutting curly hair! Not only is she incredibly technically skilled, but also the sweetest girl around.

The store itself for buying makeup is decent. However, had a very negative experience at the salon. After asking for bayalage highlights, I came out with my whole hair dyed darker (did not ask for this) and minimally noticeable highlights. My question is why the stylist would dye my hair when all I had asked for is highlights and my hair had never had dye in it before. Essentially putting in highlights should have been easy without the hair dye. Went back in for a redo, and the highlights were not "bayalage" nor were the noticeable at all, essentially no difference to my hair once again. After paying a hefty price for my "bayalage highlights" I would not return nor recommend this salon for any coloring services.
Disappointed in the customer service. Came in Thursday night and employees were fixing up their own makeup instead of asking if I needed help.

I really do like Ulta - and I would give the Salon 5 stars. I'm not high-maintenance with my hair, and so I appreciate getting a good cut that doesn't break the bank. I first tried Ulta when looking for a place to get a haircut on a Sunday. I think my choices were either here or the Regis in the mall. I was pleasantly surprised by my service at Ulta, and I've been back routinely for a year now. 

Everyone at the store seems helpful and friendly, and they have a lot of cosmetics, from department-store brands to pharmacy-store brands, and you can almost always bring in a coupon or find a sale.

Had my first hair service at Ulta today, so I figured today would be a great time to review!

I booked my appointment online, and chose Tanya as my stylist after seeing so many great reviews here. She was so great! She knew exactly what I was looking for with my color, she was funny and personable, and had my foils done in no time flat! My hair turned out exactly as I had hoped. Ulta isn't cheap, but I will absolutely be back because of the great experience

I have also visited the Benefit Brow Bar at Horsham probably 4 or 5 times now, and Melissa always shapes my eyebrows better than anywhere else I've been! I am blonde with almost invisi-brows, so the first time I saw what a difference a good arch can make, I was a very happy camper. 

Thank you ladies!

I had an appointment with Jessica and it took nearly three hours to cut my hair unevenly and add some highlights. This haircut is what makes me so mad BC it is shorter than we agreed to. And it is completely lopsided and not in a modern way. When I tried to tell her after the three hours I was so frustrated she needed that long in the first place that I said something quietly and she couldn't even see what I was talking about. This is the worst haircut I have ever received I really did not want to pay but I did anyway.

I went back to the salon the next morning and Tanya the manager was a lifesaver. She did a great job at correcting my color and cut which is all I wanted. I would return for her. Great job Ulta!

I give this place 4 stars for hair products, and 3 stars for everything else.  If you can't find your hair products here, they can't be found!  Great selection and the staff there really knows their stuff about hair care products if you have a question.

Make-up and fragrance selections are, ew.....hit or miss.

Nobodys never around to help, they only ask if u need help if they walk by you. Its never a line at the cashier. This was my second time being there and they act the same. The best part is nyx cosmetics and all the cheap lipgloss . And the kardashians stuff. I got beauty blender here for like $4 instead of $19 at sephora real cheap. Cheaper on ebay if i say but i needed it bad so thats fine.

Rating
a 2 for customer service unless u kno this store

A  4 for items in the store

Regularly go to salons in city, but was home visiting family and was in desperate need of a trim. Off the recommendation of some friends and family I popped into Ulta. I was nicely fit in and Kae was able to help me. I have long hair with long layers throughout. All I wanted was a trim to clean up my ends. Within a few minutes of being in her chair I knew I was in trouble. She had a razor out and hair was flying. I politely spoke up resaying all I wanted was a simple trim and long layers if possible not chunky layers. Well chunky uneven layers is what I got!!! She turned the chair for drying and insisted on curling my hair which I said wasn't necessary but allowed her to anyway. Well the chair turn and curling was to hide giant chunk she took off the left side of my head. Looks awful and have no idea now how long this will take to grow out. Very disappointed in the experience and it will never be repeated again!

Had a very bad customer service experience at the salon (rude on the phone, made me wait for an hour after I arrived for my appointment, then charged me wrong.)

On top, I then got one of the worst haircuts I've ever had, to the point where I need to go get it fixed.
Had my hair dyed by Tanya M at Ulta. She is truly an artist! She takes what you think you want and then does it better.

I love going to Ulta and I have been to this location a handle full of times. I typically go to the location in Center City Philadelphia or Warminster. This location is my least favorite, probably because they have some of the brattiest, snobbiest, stuck up employees out of any ulta I go to. Definitely not helpful and lack customer service skills completely. The cashier barely looked me in the eye and gave me several eye rolls when I in quote "didn't wait for the blue light before swiping my card". It would also be really nice if they had some sort of policy where their employees don't smoke directly outside the store. At all times these size zero, 6ft tall model want to be's stood outside and smoke when I walked in and walked out of the store. I don't care if you want to smoke, but Im walking in with my daughter and don't need her breathing in your second hand smoke. There is plenty of space for your to move off to the side, and smoke so its not between a corner bakery and a babies R Us...

This is perhaps my favorite Ulta location probably because it is the first Ulta I have really ever gone to. I used to go to this location way back, before they moved, and were situated closer to Willow Grove in the shopping center with Barnes and Noble. I was disappointed when they moved here but I have since gotten use to this location and enjoy it. It's king of hit or miss though with the drug store brands I like and whether they're in stock or not. The people who work here are very nice and for a long time, up until recently, I'd see the same faces which was nice. I have never used the salon here so I have no opinion of that. I normally come here and am able to get everything I need. There is ample parking and I like the location.
Cintia at the Benefit Brow Bar is a brow wizard! See her every month and always looks great!

I was in on June 4, 2019.  The "sales" associates are so rude and unhelpful.  I have never seen such unprofessionalism in a workplace setting before. When you ask for assistance they act as if your are bothering them!  They also are not as knowledgeable about their products as their competitors.  Even if you don't know every product, if a customer asks you then you say "I am not sure but let me find someone else who can better assist you". Not just asked annoyed that I asked them a question and huff away.  Will be only shopping at Sephora/Target from now on and I highly suggest that anyone considering shopping here do the same!

Done with this place. They never remember  my gifts with purchase although the register beeps,  when  I ask I've been told they are out (so too bad for me!) 
Always rude,  always dismissive,  never helpful.  I surrender, I am finished with this place.  
I remember a gem of a gentleman back Xmas before last,  now that was service,  they need to revisit that type of employee and dump these rude young ladies.

I had no idea this Ulta had a salon in it, but I saw it today and decided to give it a shot. I'm so impressed with it I'll definitely be returning! Marlene did a fabulous job on my hair, and every employee I spoke to in the store was pleasant and helpful. I don't normally write yelp reviews for things like this, but that's honestly how impressed I am with my cut and the service I received!

This review will be based on a service I received here today. Made an appointment for a 60 minute customized facial. I've never gotten a facial before and pricing was reasonable here. 

My appointment was for 12:15pm. By the time we got started, it was 12:25pm. My esthetician's name was Aaryn. She confirmed I was getting a 60 minute service. I was asked to fill out a form regarding my overall health and skin type. Aaryn made small talk in the beginning and discussed my top 3 skin concerns with me. She descended the chair to the lowest position, told me to get comfortable and put a blanket over top of me. It was cozy. 

What I didn't like about this experience was that Aaryn didn't go over ANY of the products she used on my face. She could've put anything on my face and I wouldn't know because nothing was said. 
Another pet peeve was the fact that she kept getting up and walking away. She'd leave me in the chair with the product on my face and go elsewhere. She turned on a machine that released steam and I felt the heat and steam mist onto my cheeks. 

When she was done the facial, it was 12:59pm. Definitely not 60 minutes... I felt like I got ripped off because she was in a rush to finish the service. One of my concerns was redness in my cheeks. She handed me a mirror to show me the finished look and I felt like I had more redness than I did when I first got there. I asked her about a cool tingling sensation in my face and she explained that it was an exfoliating product she used that could be causing the feeling. 

Went up to the cashier to pay and Aaryn was nowhere to be found. She didn't go over any aftercare with me and I had to leave her tip in an envelope with another employee. It was kind of unprofessional. 

2.5 stars for this subpar service. Probably wouldn't get another facial here, but will still stop by to purchase makeup.
The brow girl that has done my brows is no longer there , luckily I found her at a salon in hatboro , salon Limon , she's a brow goddess

I was trying to start wearing make up as I normally avoid it so I went to Ulta hoping for some assistance. Well I got none! No one would help me and when I was walking around instead of helping me they helped everyone else around me. I will never recommend this location to anyone.

Just want to say a huge thank you to the young guy who recommended and then found the very last Lancôme monsieur big mascara for me today (Saturday). I haven't found a mascara I loved in a long time and now I'm completely obsessed w my purchase. Give him a raise now!

I really like Ulta. Used to prefer Sephora, but I feel Ulta has better quality products and they almost ALWAYS have a coupon (you have to ask). The ladies at this location are very helpful. The stock is okay. They didn't have the scrub I wanted a few times, so I had to go to the location in North Wales to get it. I took one star away because the last time I went, I asked about a brand of exfoliant and the woman had no clue what I was talking about. I actually had to find it myself.
Tanya is the best! She always knows just what to do- and does it fabulously! Whether it be color or cut, she nails it everytime!  Thanks lady!
Mary is an amazing stylist.  She perfects my color, cut and style every single time.  I would never go anywhere else.

My haircut earlier this week was really odd. Paid for the haircut with deep conditioning, unknown if that even happened? I don't think it did & my stylist said nothing about the products she was using so I don't know. Beyond that, when I got there, my hair was very very thoroughly brushed out, cut dry, washed, completely blow dried & straightened and then trimmed again. I've never had my hair cut dry and there's tiny pieces of hair seemingly all over me, even though I had a gown over. When I went to pay, the coupon I got - from ulta, that should work (it was my fist time at the salon, it's not expired and the service was one that was allowed) didn't scan and I wasn't really told why. The haircut isn't that good, is shorter than I wanted & I paid $75 with tip. Really bummed.

I had my hair cut at Ulta a couple days ago. I had read many reviews about how Tanya did wonders on others and was fortunate to have her do my hair as well. My hair was pretty long when I came in and I had wanted to take off 4 inches for a long bob. Tayna was the first stylist to really understand my hair (I have very thick hair) and she did an amazing job on it. I was very happy with how my hair came out at the end and I'll definitely come back to see Tanya again!

Ulta Salon in Horsham P.A. has great talent. The salon has award winning stylists and was named the 
 "Salon of Excellence"
MARY, COLLEEN & CANDACE are the top stylists that
 I would recommend. Their cutting and color skills are superior and they are always in trend with the latest styles. They also have been with the salon at Horsham the longest. 
The salon is highly trained in Redken cuts and color. Not only have they won Salon and Personal awards,  they ALL have won a visit with *Sam Villa* who personally visited the salon location to congratulate the entire team and give them his expertise. 
The salon is clean, inviting and prompt. Make sure that you make an appointment with any one of the 3 girls that I recommend ahead of time because they will never disappoint you and they are always booked.

100 Welsh Rd Suite 102, Horsham, PA 19044
215-659-1816

I went into the salon a few days ago for a haircut. I just wanted a trim and explained to the woman working on me some concerns I had. Now, my hair is extremely curly and I was impressed by the techniques she was telling me about styling curly hair. I felt like I was in good hands and was relieved because I have been very unhappy with my hair recently. She washed me hair and then began to trim, and trim, and trim. I had explained to her what parts of the hair I wanted trimmed and I just wanted an inch or two of dead hair off. She let my hair dry and then tried to style it dry... which is a big mistake with curly hair. In addition to this crucial styling mistake, she brushed out my hair multiple times

If your looking for Tanya McKee she is working at Lather Hair Studio located in the Fairmount area by the museums.  
Lather Hair Studio 
in Philadelphia 
http://www.latherhairstudio.com 
I look forward to hearing from you.

I went today to make a small purchase.  I was asked for my phone number as soon as I walked up to the register.  I wasn't even greeted with a hello.

I was informed that I needed to be a rewards member in order to return merchandise.  Their website does not say you need to be a rewards member to return merchandise.

I did not join the rewards program.

I e-mailed Ulta and the response I received was so poorly written.  In addition, my complaint wasn't addressed.  I am asking for a manager to contact me.

Avoid this store at all costs.

Went to this Ulta location yesterday and usually all the reps are busy and unavailable to help me right away but I got lucky this time which was perfect since I was in a rush. Right now, they're having their Gorgeous Hair Event (til 6/1) and the Revlon One Step Volumizer Hair Dryer is on sale for $47.99 online, which is usually $59.99. The rep who helped me, Christina was so excited to show me where it was because it's one of her favorite products. She even gave me a tip on how to best use it. When we get to where the product is stocked, I notice the sale price isn't listed and I ask if they match the online price which she said unfortunately they don't. She offered to order it online and would have gave me a free shipping coupon as well but she wanted to price check it up front just in case. Luckily it was on sale for the same price as online and I was able to use their 20% coupon (on their website and valid til 6/1) on top of it!! The final price after tax was $41.46! Even my friends who already purchased it haven't been able to get it for that low. Super happy with this store experience and I hope  to meet Christina again.

The sales associates in the high end makeup section seem ill informed about the product lines. My experience in asking questions to two associates about missing products was met with blank stares. As an avid shopper and past sales associate for Sephora, I found this experience underwhelming. I will shop there for necessities I can find on my own, and as a side note, the music is too loud.

This place is terrible.  Not very helpful at all on what products to buy.  Wanted to find a good matte lipstick. Was sent all over the store.   Probably would have purchased other products but I did not like the way I was treated.

This was my first experience going to Ulta for a facial. I had Gillian and she was awesome! Very knowledgeable about the products she was using and what was good for my skin type. Asked what I wanted to focus on for the facial and what my problem areas are. I'll definitely be going back to her. She was amazing!

At first I wasn't a fan of this location always saying they don't have free samples inpatient and customer service was just off to me !. But yesterday they won me over with GM Tiffany ! She is the bomb pleasant nice patient and knows the store well! Thanks Tiffany because driving to Horsham was killing my gas tank !

Don't make your appointment online.  I made an appointment online just like the website encourages.  I made on a Saturday for the following Thursday.  Went into Ulta walked to back where they do hair.  Said to the person standing there that I had an appointment.  She said tonight?  Then asked Oh did you make it online or talk to someone?  I said online she said well we don't have anything listed and then mumbled something else possibly there isn't anyone here.  Then just starred at me blankly.  Never said another word.  She didn't offer to make an appointment.  I walked out totally perplexed.  And you can believe I won't be walking back in there again!

I had a first time appointment with Kayte. I wanted to got a lighter blonde ombre with my hair. After 4 1/2 hours it was a disaster. I've had this done before at other salons and never saw anyone use the techniques she did. My hair had no transition, no blending at all and was a horrid color. I asked her to thin my hair which she did before anything else and she went way overboard. I have chunks of hair missing in sections. I called and the Manager Tiffany was very nice and refunded me. I went back to my original salon to fix me. I would never go back here again. Horrible experience.

Got my hair and makeup done here last week and they did an awesome job I will always come back here whenever I need my makeup done the girl who did my make up was amazing I believe her name was Kate. I told her what I wanted and she knew exactly what I was talking about. I highly recommend them.

I travel from 30 minutes away to go to this Salon. I always see Kayte
She colored my hair beautifully. I saw her do someones make up for prom and it was stunning! Everyone is very down to earth and caters to your needs . Highly recommend!

We'll last year my husband bought me an$100.00 gift card for Christmas and now i have enough makeup. I love makeup. This store has everything from makeup to fragrances, to makeup sets, to gifts, to Hair care, hair dyes, and etc..., i give an 5 star  for best cosmetics ever. Everyone's entitled to look beautiful no matter what age they really are

Pam at the salon is the best! I recently relocated from California and was really sad to leave my hairstylist at the Ulta in my hometown. After having a horrible experience at the KOP location, I went to this location without any knowledge of who would be doing my hair. Pam did not disappoint. She listened to me, looked at the pictures I brought, and delivered the exact result I was wanting. She's also so sweet and genuine and great at multitasking. I will definitely be visiting again. Thank you Pam!!

First time coming to this Ulta and had a terrible experience. As soon as I walk in the security guard, who was just standing there before I walked in, starts following me around. I had one bag from Marshall's that was tied tightly as I bought 2 wrapping paper tubes, I was dressed in jeans and my raincoat. There was nothing "suspicious" about me for him to follow me and not the rest of the people walking around the super crowded store. Guess I'll stick to Sephora.

If I could give less than 1 star I would. I was so excited when I realized this Ulta was so close to me but it's literally my least favorite Ulta. The associates don't really want to help the testers are AWAYS a mess.

During my most recent and what will be my LAST visit to this store, the NYX foundation testers were so dirty foundation shot everywhere all over my coat and inside my eye. Anything going in your eye is a serious matter, no one seemed interested in helping me. 

I was looking to exchange my foundation for a different shade and possibly by more. Since no one wanted to help me with foundation in my eye, I decided this location won't receive anymore of my money. So instead I just did a return. During the transaction I tell the associate about what just happened and suggested they wipe Dow the testers, instead of asking if my eye was okay she just says thanks for the suggestion very smug. Horrible customer service and filthy testers. 

It would only take a makeup wipe to clean, its pure negligence.

Argh i can't believe I'm going from having a great experience to a horrible one! Ulta is usually my backup to Sephora because Sephora carries everything I use while ulta doesn't. Unfortunately Sephora didn't have the products I was looking for at the time so I called 2 Ulta locations asking to see if my shade in the Becca foundation and Too Faced concealer was absolve - this location and Horsham. After calling both locations and verifying the reps on the phone told me BOTH products were available I decided to drive to this location since it's closer to my house. Unfortunately when I get there, my Too Faced concealer shade was not available - this is after waiting for 20 minutes to see if someone could locate it in the back since it wasn't on the floor. After receiving this news, I was clearly annoyed since the whole reason for me to go to that store was because they told me it was in stock. The rep who told me it wasn't available was practically laughing in my face - maybe it was a nervous tick but this just agitated me more. She did try to help me find matches in other brands but apparently Ulta doesn't release samples? This is very bizarre to me and I never heard this but I was basically out of luck with this. The rep I was working with then pulled her manager over and she just made excuses for whoever answered my call ie maybe they got it confused with the foundation - even though I specially requested the concealer on the phone, or maybe stock numbers are not correct because of theft issues the store had. The best she could offer me was a free shipping promo code/offer to make an online order and ship the item to me for free. At this point, I had to leave so I took the promo code but haven't purchased the concealer yet. Hopefully Sephora will have it in stock by now!

I recently purchased an item on 12/2/18 & later decided to return the item. Although, I had my receipt and the item was purchased with a new Ulta credit card (I was coerced into signing up for) and not previously returned, it took these people 45 minutes to figure how to return my money. There was no rational explanation for their inefficiency and stupidity. I will never shop in this store ever again and caution others to be careful in case you need to return something. I contacted Customer Service and they were equally helpless while I had to wait in the store and kept my composure and not raise my blood pressure. NEVER AGAIN.  BEWARE shoppers. If I could give them zero stars while writing this review, I  would.

I went in and had the head stylist do my hair. I a6aked for mushroom brown color. 
My hair was currently reddish with strawberry blonde highlights. The stylist was completely confident she'd nail the color I was asking for. After 6 hours of her coloring my hair over and over she blows me out and turns me to reveal my color. It was still reddish!!! Not at all not even close to what I asked for! She says to me "see I NAILED IT" The only thing she nailed was ruining my hair! All of that and it cost me $330 it took literally 5 months to get a refund.

I have never felt more uncomfortable.. I felt like I was bothering the employees by asking where something was located in the store. None of them responded to me until I asked a third time and got a horrible attitude. I'll stick with Sephora. Thx

My trip to ulta was honestly uncomfortable for me. I went in looking for a product that i was unable to find. I asked an associate for help at the front just for her to treat me as if i was unable to afford any other product then the ones in the isle you find drug store brands. I bought so much product just to go home incredibly dissatisfied and no longer wanting the products i was sold. And i never really shop at ulta because Sephora always has what i need, now i know to stick the the devil you know best. Dont think ill be shopping here again.

Love this store! 

There are so many products to choose from and they even have a clearance section which is always a good thing to score a nice deal. 

When I came in today I spent a pretty penny, but ended up leaving out with a new shimmer powder, some face masks, a makeup palette kit for my daughter, a face primer, Tarte concealer and some new makeup sponges. 

The customer service was on point and the staff were very friendly and helpful when I had any questions.

For the most part I can find what I'm looking for, so in that sense the place is good. However, the staff needs a refresher course on how to be social and not snobby. If I have to say hello first and flag someone down just for a simple question, then there's something wrong here. When I finally did flag an employee down, my question on a product seemed like such a burden for them. I think I'd rather drive the extra distance to the park place, or Oro valley location next time.

Love Ulta but hate this location. They always give me a hard time or never have what I came there for. I always leave with an attitude. Like it's my bday, give me my damn gift! They definitely don't treat u this way at Sephora.
Ulta is awesome. But I needed help and it took me awhile to find someone to help me. But other then that my experience was good there; and I bought what I wanted.

I've been here several times because I got a gift card. I am not impressed. I never get any service when I'm on the floor. If you go to Sephora in the mall they always help you. They only have one person at the register or even a manager but they don't come help bring people up I don't get it I have nothing positive about this store.

This location has terrible customer service!! Their employees are rude & have an attitude problem. Don't waste your time or money here go to sephora. I would rather spend a little more money for better customer service

50% is still an F

So--for presentation, layout and cleaniness, I'd give this location a solid A.  For helpfulness, kindness, caring or basic humanity--I'd give this location a 0.  We found the staff and management to be rather snooty and unhelpful.  We were returning from the lake and had on lake clothes--apparently, the fact that you arrive on a Monday afternoon (labor day weekend) and stop to pick up a few items is lost on them.  Granted, I had on baggy swim trunks and a tank top--but we still spent 150.00 bucks which I would think is higher than their average ticket.

I picked up some Ahava hand lotion here that I saw on their website to save $ on shipping. They have the same special as online. The store looked clean and it looks like they have a great selection of products. Friendly staff.

LOVE Ulta.  They do a great job at luring your in with the coupon they send in their weekly flyer, usually $3.50 off one item.  It's an epecially fine day when you get the "20% Your Entire Purchase" coupon in the mail...woohoo shopping time!  I get almost all my beauty supplies here including, shampoo, condition, hairspray, Bare Minerals makeup, perfume, and OPI nail products.  

Be sure to become an Ulta Rewards Member, they will give you a card to use when you make purchases (kind of like a Frys VIP card).  This card is used for their quarterly incentive program.  The more points you rack up on your Ulta card, the better rewards you get!
Ulta is a great store, this one didn't really  give me any sort of warm fuzzy nor am I partial to come  back to this specific location.  The employees seemed distracted and the line was long.

Not sure why this place only seems to hire the rudest workers. Not even a "hi" or "welcome" or "can we help you find anything" when you walk in or they are standing right next to you. All the workers seem to judge everyone who walks in. When I went to the cashier and had a coupon for a free sample, the young worker ripped the sample out of my hand saying it was the wrong one. Super sassy. Go to Sephora at the mall, at least they know how to treat people.

I just want back today trying to give them another chance. Two separate coupons you can't use in here the coupons I don't even know why I bother going here the sales people are so rude nothing's changed I need to get in my head just to stay at Sepora

So this is the second time this has happened i got my favorite face wash from the clique take the day off balm and someone had there finger in it and it was dirty from makeup.  I know they had makeup on there finger. Nasty!

Not a fun shopping trip at this Ulta. I have seen everything here from men breaking out in a fight to no toilet paper at all in the bathroom to sales associate saying they are out of a product when its on a display across from them. I have been in a couple Ulta's and this one is the worst. Only ever stop in here if I am in the neighborhood and HAVE to run in for ONE thing.

The Ulta in Oro Valley is amazing!!!

I wandered in here today in search of some oil for my expanding, pregnant tummy. I asked a woman who worked there if they had anything and she grabbed a few she thought I might like. Based on a review from another employee there she said to stay away from a specific brand. We got talking about my pregnancy and she was so friendly and courteous! Many people act interested, but she was sincerely happy for me and we even talked baby names. She didn't ring me up, but she was at the register next door. I could tell she really enjoys her job and helping people. I wish I had caught her name!

If I could give this place negative stars, I would.  As far as the particular store and the ULTA chain are concerned, they do have great variety ... a good mix of high and lower end ...  although it is somewhat overpriced and I'm too lazy to deal with their point system customer card thing. 

The customer service, however, at this store, is a nightmare. I was surprised by the other review that mentioned that customers are approached so often that it can be irritating.  Because I would have been thrilled to have been approached.  Even once.  Just once.  Pretty please?  As far as I can tell, the staff spends most of their time draped across the counters regaling one other with "OH MY GOD, Becky ... "-esque gossip (and woe to the person who interrupts and is on the receiving end of one of their withering looks), or avoiding who I can only assume is the manager, who constantly berates them in front of the customers. 

No thanks.  Sephora is right down the road.

Not my favorite Ulta. I mean Ulta has it all and the services are amazing, I'm just very disappointed on the final price. I have never spent that much on my hair at any other location !!! I know I didn't need a full highlight since I just got one 8 weeks ago, but she insisted my hair needed it(of course cause it's $143, whereas a partial is $78). Unless other locations did me a favor, I was never charged for toner and cream. Which, I'm just surprised that she didn't ask me if it was ok before doing it if I was going to be charged. My other hairstylists never charged me, maybe for return visits, I don't know. I raved about the salon and the stylists to my dad so he could come along and made it clear he was a new client and he didn't even receive the 25% off discount that clearly says new customers get. For new clients I'm shocked that this is the service I received. I feel used. Just disappointed. I loved Ulta in California but if I have to spend over $250 to get my hair done every 8 weeks they just lost a valued customer.
I just had my haircut by a wonderful stylist named Sam! Not only did he do an amazing job, he was so much fun to chat with:) I'll definitely be coming back to him!

The customer service is the worst. I enjoy shopping at sephora instead because the girls actually want to help the customers find what their looking for. The girls at ulta will just look at you but never ask if you need help

This is by far the worst ulta I've gone to.
The only greeter is the cashier,which is the only cashier. 
There is a line of 8 girls easy and growing. 
No one cared to help and when I did get help I was told to go to sephora for what I need and or they tried upwelling something to me that had nothing to do with what I was needing / looking for. 
Also just tempted to check out the tarte samples and I came across everything being slime like and clumpy. 
They also don't have their trial size area stocked at all.

Like many of the reviews here I can attest to the lack of friendly customer service and basic knowledge of products by the employees.
