I go to Ulta for my hair care needs and I have generally had pretty good results. However all that has ended.  The stylist was not very confident in his capabilities.  He offered a service and told me the wrong price. It was in fact $10 more than he quoted.  Then came back and said he didn't charge me for the additional color he had to use because I have thicker than normal hair. I didn't know they had an additional charge in the first place!  And lastly, I was going to use my points for some additional products I wanted to purchase but the system was broke so I couldn't.  I just couldn't.  No discount, no nothing.  So I left disappointed with my hair, paying full price, and drove the hour and a half back home where I didn't get any compliments on my new hair color.  Very disappointing.

I love Ulta because I can get the makeup I want without setting foot inside of the mall. This Ulta especially is super easy to park at.

Ulta is also the only place that sells my favorite face wash, the Queen Helene Oatmeal'n Honey face scrub. It's not pricey but nobody else seems to sell it.

The few times I've asked for help the employees have been really nice and directed me to the type of product I was looking for. 

Basically Ulta is clean, organized and convenient.

I love ulta because there's a wide range of products and services and the employees are nice. Unfortunately that was not the case here. It seems they're going through some sort of re-modeling and everything is scattered. There were empty shelves and products without prices.

     No one would approach me to ask if I needed help. I had to go up to someone working behind one of the counters and she looked me up and down. It was Sunday evening and I just wanted one product that I wanted their opinion on. Instead of then helping me find that product she pointed in a general direction and said "check there". 
     I'm not sure if their demeanor was a result of it being Sunday evening, but they were more than hospitable to other customers that were dressed nicer. My money is just as green as theirs. 

It is safe to say I will not be coming back here. I wish I could say otherwise.

Wow!!!!! My daughter in law and I were in this store yesterday and were helped and advised by Robert. We were so impressed by his knowledge and eagerness to accommodate us. Our shopping experience was exceptional!!! Thanks again, to Robert, Jacob and " the brow guy "!!!!!!!!

I came in here Saturday and had the best experience possible. I was looking for a foundation and an eyebrow product. They weren't carrying the foundation, but I was able to get the brow pencil. One of the girls working in the prestige section asked if I needed help almost as soon as I stepped in the door. She helped me get the right shade and put it on my brows so I could see how it would end up looking. I had previously tried to get help with that at Sephora but it seems like they are constantly busy and there is never anyone available to help. 

Overall, this location is great. The staff are very friendly, it's clean, and it wasn't too busy either which is a plus.

Had a great experience with the staff at this store today. It was Sunday, close to closing and everyone was in happy mood- maybe because closing time was near- ha. 

I had some questions about products and needed advice and felt like I received some honest feedback. Staff even volunteered information on how to earn more ulta points. 

Also noticed a huge clearance section I've never noticed at an Ulta before- maybe have just never been there at the right time. Wish I would've had more time today to check out the deals. 

Overall good experience- I go in primarily for the IT line. 

I'll go to this location again.

I had the best experience at the hair salon at this location! My stylist, Pearl, was absolutely brilliant! She gave me amazing recommendations, she was very professional and friendly! I would highly recommend her to anyone! I will definitely be booking with her in the future. Thumbs up!!

I got my hair cut at this salon last week and the stylist did not cut my hair evenly.  When I got home, I noticed that the hair on my right side seemed longer than the hair on my left.  After playing with it for a few days, and straightening it to check for sure, I had determined that the right side was significantly longer than the other.  It was very noticeable because the hair was cut to sit at my shoulders on the left and was dipping below my shoulder-line on the right.  I went back today to ask what the policy was for getting a haircut with mistakes fixed.  They agreed to fix it at no charge, and honored my request to see a different stylist tonight.  The second stylist, Valerie, was great!  She not only fixed the length issue on the right side, but went above and beyond to check the entire haircut and fixed issues she found with the layering from the original haircut.  I definitely recommend Valerie if you are making an appointment here for your hair!

I'd give less stars if possible, poor service. A separate in store benefits bar with no employees working. Not one person with a warm and inviting personality. Out of stock on every bare essentials items, not worth the time. Stay away and go to sephora instead.
I only go to Ulta when I have a coupon to use. The staff here (besides the hair stylists) are not friendly or helpful.

Associates were not helpful. It didn't seem like they wanted to even be helpful. I picked up a product that was mis-stocked so when I thought i had picked up my shade, it wasn't. Mostly, as many of these reviews mention, they only have one register open. Whatts the point of even having 4 registers? It would be fine if the girl Savannah was actually competent at her job but literally, slower than molasses...not cool......it was excruciating watching her ring people up and pull people's change from the drawer. I come from service industry and this kind of service is UNACCEPTABLE. Why don't you guys actually hire people who can function efficiently so you don't keep pissing people off and losing their business??? Step it up! People spend way too much money at this place for the staff to be this god awful. I really hope a manager reads this and FIXES this because I'm just very very upset as many others are also voicing.
Lizz in the hair salon is amazing! She's friendly and most importantly, Knowledgeable and great with hair! I've always been happy with my cut and color services from her!!

EGH! What can I say I have never been happy at this location whether it be customer service and now to add to it the hair salon. Shopping there is horrible and I have already written the company several times regarding my experiences. I find that no one is ever available to assist and when they do shade match a foundation for example they totally are off guard when it comes to the shade match. Let's talk about the salon! I have had my hair cut and bayalage and my previous salon is now having to fix the mistakes the Ulta Salon made. They overprocessed my hair and damaged the ends!! Which I have never had done before. Not going back!

....H....O...R...R....I...B...L....E..... period. 
This store could "look like the Taj Mahal"~  BUT ITS the CUSTOMER SERVICE that should condemn it! I gave this location a THIRD chance the other day when it was more convenient than Sephora... NEVER again.

 I asked the girl if she could show me an angled eyeliner brush, to which she pointed at the display a few feet away. and went back to talking to her coworkers who were doing a makeover on someone. Since she was not doing the makeover I asked her, "Excuse me, is there any others besides this one?" To which she pointed ALL THE WAY across the store and said---" YOU can look over there, there might be some!" and snottily turned around AGAIN to watch the makeover. 

SERIOUSLY!!!!!-- I began walking over "there" and when my path crossed with the door, I tossed all of the things I was going to buy, DOWN, and WALKED OUT!

10 min, later walked in Sephora, without explaining ANYTHING about what had just happened, the girl SMILED, ((There's an idea)) Asked, "Can I help you find anything today?" ((Again, another bright idea)), and then PROCEEDED to take me to each of the things I needed. ON top of the fact that as I was, checking out she brought another product that she thought I might like! And this whole ordeal ended with a """""HAPPY CUSTOMER!" IMAGINE, that! Will never step foot into U-L-T-A---which Ive labeled as " You -Love-Terrible-Assistance! Not even worth 1 star!

Not the best prices on drug store brands.Sorry but I will only shop here if I have a coupon...because all of the drugstore type brands are way over priced here!.(like Maybelline , really pricey here)..so with a coupon you pay regular drugstore prices, kinda sneaky , eh. Sometimes the sales are good. I notice at this location they are always out of a lot of popular items...seems like this store could predict which items are gonna fly off the shelves...especially the NYX cosmetics. I don't know of any other place in Tucson that sells NYX...so yeah , stuck going here...because I don't like shopping online for cosmetics...I like to be able to hold and see the item 1st. ....Customer service is kinda weird ....they always ask if you're finding everything okay...EACH AND EVERY EMPLOYEE has to come over  to each and every customer  and ask this, I guess....I find it annoying , mostly because they really don't care what your answer is. I like the return policy , no questions asked , most of the time....but more  and more other places are doing this , too.

I enjoy shopping here it makes it much easier to find things then shopping at a grocery store.  

I also like that they have samples of shampoo products that you can purchase to see if that is the right one for you.

The skincare staff know what products to suggest if you have a particular question.

They also have a great rewards program that lets you save on some of your purchases.
No one helps you.  Several young people standing around just gossiping.  Samples out are clearly destroyed and the bathrooms are a mess.

I used to get my hair cut at Beauty Brands with Angelica, and I LOVED how my hair came out every time. But the Beauty Brands store recently shut down. There is an Ulta by my work, so I made a hair appointment at the Salon with Jessica? I think her name was. She was very friendly, had great customer service, finished the hair wash, cut, and style quickly. I didn't do a NEW hair style at all, just asked for a couple inches trimmed off so I can be at the shorter length that I like. At the end of the appointment she offered to curl my hair to make it look beachy, which I thought nothing of at the time. It felt a little shorter than I desired, but I thought- it's hair and it will grow back, not the end of the world. But the next day when I straightened my hair, I noticed that it looked really choppy. I thought maybe she parted it different when she cut it, but no matter where I part my hair it looks so bad! It's embarrassing! I have to wear my hair tucked behind my ear until it finally grows out. Needless to say I will be cancelling my next hair appointment that I made with her in April, and will be going elsewhere. Seriously not worth the $50 that I spent on that hair cut, I could've got this hair cut at a great clips somewhere for $10.... I know $50 isn't that expensive, but I would expect to be a lot happier... 

On the up side, I also got my brows waxed at the brow bar by Angelique. She did an amazing job!! And I will be returning to see her for another brow wax soon! 

1st pic is of my hair the way I used to get it cut at beauty brands. Last 4 pics are what Jessica did to my hair...

I love my makeup it was a color off and I took it back and Got a different color.
they will call a make up stylist to match the color perfectly to your face.
 tarte face tape foundation is all over You Tube. Don't even try to guess what color you are have one of the women "Marissa" choose the exact color for your face.
 I am so thankful. They're very good at returns as long as you just try it at home and bring it back. I vote Yes and I guess everybody else does because for some reason there's such a long line at the cashier's

The store is nice and the customer service is good. But I think they need to pay more attention to their restroom. The Women's restroom had a large roll of toilet paper sitting on top of the dispenser, the toilet sit was broken, the faucet was al broken, and the paper towel roll was just placed on the sink counter and the bottom of the roll was wet. It's the little things in an establishment that can make or break them.

Went there in early evening and found what I wanted. They also, now, have people walking around asking if you need help...that's good. However, I left my products on the counter and walked out after standing   on line for about 12 minutes; the line NEVER moved. I was probably the 10th person to be waited on next. It was so long, it formed an L shape from the first cashier, almost down to the end of the aisle over. There were 2 cashiers working. What a poorly managed store; did it ever occur to them to bring up more cashiers? Are the cashiers actually 'trained' to move so slowly? I usually am not in a hurry but tonight I was. I only go there for convenience sake but how frustrating can a shopping experience be? They need better management, in my opinion.
Haircut was ok. I really expected more from Shay. She does not use a razor but uses thinning shears which left my hair flat. Not worth the $38 for the cut. I'm not going back.

I have gotten my eyebrows done with Jacob in the past and absolutely loved it! He is very knowledgable about makeup, super friendly and way helpful. I came in again recently asking about contouring cause I'm helpless and was blown away about his knowledge and how much he went above and beyond to make sure I was happy about my purchases. He took over 30 minutes of his time doing my makeup to show me how different products work. I would have been lost without his help and would have ended up leaving with nothing. Thanks Jacob!

This business has the WORST customer service I've encountered in years. I have never had a salesperson come over to ask if they can help me find something as I wander and wander from aisle to aisle. When you do ask someone for help, they act like it's a bother. There are many salespeople milling around; they should notice people wandering aimlessly. The only reason I go here is so I don't have to walk through the mall. Now that my back is better, I will rethink this.

this is the worst ulta. they have a good selection of items but the service is just horrible. they are very unprofessional when coming up to you asking for help and the line to checkout is the worst part. it takes me a shorter amount of time to find what i'm looking for than it is to wait in line. they have 5 registers but choose to only use one when 10+ people are waiting in line? doesn't really seem right?

I came here after a disappointing Sephora visit for a foundation in my shade and I wanted it to be matte and match my neck was the main focus. 

Anyway I came in on a Saturday in April and walked around the aisles and found myself in the It Cosmetics aisle asking my fiancé if the foundations I picked were good and she walked over to a woman who introduced herself, Stephanie. 
I told her what I wanted and she mentioned the colors she recommended and then  she lead me to Dermablend and matched me perfectly. THIS HAS BEEN MY HOLY GRAIL!! ALSO STEPHANIE WAS so nice and talked to me through the whole process and gave me tips and other products. She has been the main reason I continue to keep going to Ulta. Most of these beauty stores I hardly get great service but this was the best so far!

Every time I go to this location I end up leaving angry and say I will never go back. The customer service is terrible. The sales associate are unfriendly and barely help you. One associate started helping me and then was called up to start ringing at the register. I will not go back.

Was never greeted or helped.  Sales people are too busy talking to each other to help customers.  There was only one person behind the checkout counter so I had to wait ten minutes to checkout.  This is the second time I had poor customer service.  I won't go back, which is a shame because ultra has a great selection of products but lacks customer service.

Wish I could give 0 rating to this place! Customer service is awful. This place will go out of business soon provided they hire staff like what they have. May be they should go take a look at nearby Sephora and learn about how well they manage their customers. Pathetic and disgusting staff. Makes me never wanna shop there again. Absolute shame that this place has some great brands but such mediocre staff.

The manager at this location is incredibly rude, stuck up, and needs to have a course in customer service skills. I literally will not shop there if she's there.


UPDATE: 
Since that horrible experience, I decided to give this location another try, months later. To my pleasant surprise, the nasty manager was not there. Instead, an incredibly friendly and courteous young man helped me check out. Much better experience!

As it turns out the product didn't work well for me and had to return it. :(

Very nice customer service, friendly and took her time with me. Unfortunately they didn't have the color I needed. Ordering was a breeze and it will be shipped to the house free. :)
Very nice customer service, friendly and Naomi took her time with me. Unfortunately they didn't have the color I needed. Ordering was a breeze and it will be shipped to the house free. :)

Coupons make Ulta worth shopping at. I have never, and will never, step foot into an Ulta without a coupon. They always have one available online (usually $3.50 off a purchase of $10 or more) and while they do restrict what you can use on them at times, it's still a nice little discount. 

On my recent visit to this Ulta, I had a different coupon. This one gave 20% off almost everything, including the high-end makeup brands that are usually restricted!! The cashier mentioned that Ulta only does that type of coupon a few times a year so if you happen to see it, don't waste it! 

My mom and I picked out some great items with the help of a couple ladies working.. Yes, we needed to get their attention, but neither copped any kind of attitude when we asked for assistance. I needed a new eyeliner and I was pleasently surprised when the salesperson pointed me toward a brand I had never used but that was a few dollars cheaper then the brand I was considering (and I am very happy with, now that I have it home!). Another salesperson was happy to apply some makeup for my mother so she could see if she liked it. People that have a hard time getting help may just need to speak up!  

Bonus: The cashier gave us 20% off everything even though the coupon said it wasn't valid on clearance items! :)

I was not greeted by the cashier. She only demanded my phone number. When I checkout out I noticed that an item that had a clearance tag did not ring up at the specified price. So they went to check and acted like I moved a clearance sticker to from a different place! I'm not a thief, and I don't appreciate being treated like one.

The staff is never friendly. I personally prefer to online shop but with shipping being delayed I had to go in and grab a few gifts. I spend a good amount of money at Ulta but It doesn't feel like they appreciate my business.

My salon visit was just perfect! I went in on a week day to get my hair done and the stylist was very comforting and honest! She explained all the possibilities and outcomes, even gave me a list of all the options I had and of course her professional opinion. The first session was great! Veronicas work was so fantastic and exactly what I realistically pictured, as well as what I was lead to believe it would be. Not to mention she also gave me a lot of genuine and helpful tip and tricks I could do to keep my hair healthy and vibrant. I will definitely be returning to Veronica for my next session! 
UPDATE: 
My second session was great! She really took the time to figure out what would look and feel best for me! My hair is almost where I want it, and I'm so excited to go back!
Love benefit brow the employees there are awesome. My problem is with the cashiers they are extremely rude and they are always out of the free samples you get with promotions

Disappointed that the website says they're open until 9pm but when I arrived about 7:30, they were closed. Especially disappointed because I had a curbside order so was hoping it would be a quick trip but instead will have to come back tomorrow. Please update your hours on maps. I also saw three other people go up to the door as well.

Honestly love the employees here most the time really nice, but I was in the store for like 20 minutes MAYBE today just getting a couple things and I had like 6 employees come up to me. I understand making sure everyone is getting the attention they need but literally 6 times! Some people just want to shop. Kind of made me feel like I was being targeted too or just watched and it made me super uncomfortable. So yeah for the most part employees are lovely and nice but chill out just a little bit. I get people steal all the time I'm sure but seriously just relax just a little.

Went in today and was not inpressed at all had a sales associate hold me in regards to buying a mascarra it got to the point tgat I told her I would come back when I got off work . All I wanted to do was look around. I will take my money elsewhere.

Some rude caked face b**** employee put down one of my friends because of her skin!! Instead of trying to help she just put her down and made her feel like shi* such a sh*tty place to go for makeup like aren't we suppose to be hype one another up and and not make each other feel like shit!!! I wish I can put 0 stars :/ do not go here !!! Just go to the one on Broadway instead!!!

I love this Ulta location and prefer it over the others who lack customer service skills. I always am greeted when I walk through the doors. Employees come around and ask if I need any help and even offer to grab me a bag. I typically shop the sales and use coupons as needed. A lot of the stuff sold here is the same price or cheaper than its competitors. The bonus side is that once you become a platinum member the coopuns and extras are greater. 

The salon is very friendly. I am always skeptical when someone new cuts my hair. I took advantage of Ulta's October haircut special. I was skeptical when they informed me that only a Level 1 or Level 2 hair stylist could cut my hair for the special. The levels go by the number of years a person has worked at Ulta. I was scheduled with Sam. He was very nice and made sure I was satisfied with my cut and style before leaving.  For the 1st time ever I am truly amazed with my new hairstyle. I always wear my hair up but, since Sam cut/styled my hair I wear it down now. Truly impressed!!!!! Also, he is the 1st guy to ever cut my hair!

Went to the brow bar for a wax and was burnt! I called and they said i "signed a waiver" which I NEVER did. They also said it was something in my skin other caused it. I don't do anything to my skin besides wash it? Only reason they deserve a star is because the shape is beautiful! So disappointing otherwise. The photos are only the morning after. So i'm assuming they're gonna get worse.

My salon visit was just perfect! I went in on a week day to get my hair done and the stylist was very comforting and honest! She explained all the possibilities and outcomes, even gave me a list of all the options I had and of course her professional opinion. The first session was great! Veronicas work was so fantastic and exactly what I realistically pictured, as well as what I was lead to believe it would be. Not to mention she also gave me a lot of genuine and helpful tips and tricks that I could do to keep my hair healthy and vibrant. I will definitely be returning to Veronica for my next session!

Veronica was the best!! Jacob and another lady who's name, I didn't get, we're also incredibly helpful!! My daughter got the best cut and style from Veronica- at the last minute!! We will definitely be back - in 6 to 8 weeks

Always a pleasure to shop here. Customer service is excellent always someone to answer a question or help you find what your looking for.
Been going to Ulta for years and plan to continue.

I went in for what was supposed to be a 10 minute appointment, but it ended up lasting over an hour. I love ulta for the products they carry--especially since they have both drugstore and high end options--as well as for the membership offers they have in addition to their frequent sales. I'm a platinum member and ulta credit card holder. I spend my money here frequently; in fact, I probably spend too much of my money here. And this most recent experience has me reevaluating  whether I should make sephora my primary make up store, instead of ulta. 

Even before today's experience I have always found the customer service experience at ulta lacking. Today was no different. I had an appointment at 2:15 for a 10 minute face fit facial. I had never been to the salon at ulta before and I only made this appointment because I had a coupon. 

I checked in at the salon desk and was greeted quickly, told that my facialist would be ready soon, and was provided with a bottle of water. So far so good. But when 5 minutes go by, I am getting impatient. I return to the desk and am told that she might still be with her previous client; there's no confirmation though and no employee seems concerned enough to double check;
There's also no apology. 10 minutes later, she finally finishes with that client at 2:30 and my face fit treatment starts at 2:35-20 minutes late. The face fit treatment itself was truly wonderful and She gave me many helpful pointers and insiders. I would rate that experience highly; however, it's the ancillary issues that are really aggravating. 

I not only had to wait longer for my appointment than it lasted, but then I also had to wait more just to check out. My facialist gave me my bill and told me that I needed to pay at the front. So that's what I did. Well 20 minutes later and I was still not checked out. I don't know what the deal is but every time I go to ulta the line is horrendously long because they only have one cashier, who is operating at a slow pace. This in addition to the coupon I had really got everybody mixed up and confused--because no one knew how to redeem the coupon--and it took forever to finally pay. It was ridiculous. It shouldn't be this complicated to use a coupon for your store. I was also told that I was supposed to pay at the salon desk; what the heck?! I don't work here--I'm just trying to be a patron but they made it really hard.

Again I love ulta, but I don't expect anything beyond  what I see on the shelves because the customer service is seriously lacking.
Very helpful and kind service provided by Mateo. He made no judgements just relayed positive energy and exceptional customer service! Kudos
I was not greeted by the two cashier. I did not receive good customer service. I do not know if it was because i am Mexican.

It's like a candy store for women who love beauty products! This place has grown on me and now every time I come I just get happy!!

Mind you I'm not a big fan of product...at least not a LOT of it. But when I'm at a loss as to what to do with what, the staff here usually can help me and seem fairly knowledgeable. I like the fact that you can get both low end and high end items all in one location and when talking to the staff, they don't necessarily send you to the $25 product when they know the $3 one will work just as well.

I bring my daughter here to get her eyebrows waxed. That can sometimes be hit or miss depending on who is doing it, but they're always very friendly. You can get a free shape on your birthday!!

One last bit of info, their rewards program is great. I've received multiple subscriptions to some great magazines for free as well as significant discounts and free product. Sign up! It's worth it!

I wanted to write a review today because I had a pleasant visit unlike a few of the other times I've been to this Ulta, which is why I'm only giving 3 stars. 

I came in today to purchase a bottle of foundation that I've been using for a while, though it may be time to do a color match again since I've tanned a bit this summer. I mention this because the last time I was in this store, I asked for help with a color match and got an eye roll; after about 15 minutes waiting with no one actually coming to help me I left that time. I mention this because I am not the prettiest woman for sure, and I don't wear a whole lot of makeup so I have felt intimidated and sometimes unwelcome by the staff. 

Today was different in that a very nice (and intimidatingly pretty) woman came up to me as she saw me searching the shelf and asked if I needed help. I mentioned my issue of not being able to find my foundation shade on my previous two visits, and she was beyond helpful- she looked, and when she also didn't find it, she offered to have it ordered and shipped to my house, and went further to offer to grab me a sample of the foundation so I would have some in the time it took to arrive. 
As someone who also works in a customer service job, that's what I call going above and beyond for a customer.

Usually when I go into Ulta, I am very satisfied as I am a die hard rewards member, avid bargain hunter and like to occasionally splurge on a high-end beauty product or two. The past few times I have gone in I have noticed some things that affect my rating.

1) The Benefit Bar: This is a wonderful idea and selling tactic for the brand but at this local, it looks unkempt. The products (testers) look as if they have been out too long and not sanitized (I wouldn't DARE even swatch them). The artists who are Benefit trained to do waxing, etc, don't seem to keep a very good schedule as I have seen lines of people waiting  for their appointments on numerous occasions. I have also seen these employee's neglecting customers as they chat and test out products themselves. I like some of Benefit's products, but this turns me off from trying anything else.
2) A few of the newer associates at the register are not too personable. There is no connection between associate and customer when I've come up to purchase. No general "How was your visit?" or "Did you find what you were looking for?" from many of the ladies.
I understand that people have bad days, but some seem to have a bad day, every day.
3) I feel as though some of the associates do not know their stock. I have come in asking for specific products and have received blank stares. I have considered applying to work for Ulta as I love Makeup and it's a huge part of my job as a performer. It is amazing to me that those who are already employed are not up to date on latest trends or current releases. 

I will still shop at this Ulta because of it being so close and because of the rewards program (it's a lot better than Sephora), but I feel that some changes do need to be made.

Curbside pickup: Called Ulta to get info on how to do the curbside pickup, I was given simple and easy to understand instructions on how to go online and place the order for a specific location, so I placed an order. After driving 45 min, I get to the location and call in my order for pickup, but the manager Mary says the order won't be ready until the next day. I received no email regarding a time it would be ready, but just the confirmation number and location hours. Manager Mary didn't give us any compensation or sincere help but instead just exclaims, "that's the way the system is". Bottom line, ALL EMPLOYEES SHOULD TELL CUSTOMERS THIS because people are driving for items that cannot be given to them.

Location: 4368 N. Oracle Road
I had a great experience with the workers and finding what I need! The manger was even better! Will definitely recommend this location!

Today I can say I am a fan.  Usually when I go into an Ulta store no one really comes up to you and helps with any sort of enthusiasm but today was different.  I was in the market for a lipstick.  I knew what type of shade I was looking for.  Two lovely young ladies were both just rushing around the different counters looking for lipsticks for me and taking the proper precautions in setting the lipsticks so I could try them on.Wiping them down and sanitizing as needed.   I only asked one of the ladies her name.  She was Maria Martin and worked specifically at the Calvin Klein section.  She and the other young lady both were actively helping me.  Maria had a great sense of humor and even put some extra make-up on me.  I was a bit disappointed because my $3.50 didn't apply to the lines of lipstick I was looking for.  So much for any bargain.  I know you always have the read between the lines on these Sunday coupons.  I was happy today with the service I got today.

Went to this location with my bonus mom to find a shade of L'Oréal eyeshadow she was running out of. She had previously learned the color was discontinued, so wanted a similar color to replace it. 

A young woman asked if we needed help. My mom explained what she was looking for and we followed her to the L'Oréal area. She looked through the eyeshadows and eventually found two similar colors, one was considerably darker and the other had more red in it. Nevertheless my mom found one of them acceptable when applied to her arm, so settled on the color. The young employee searched through the bin for some time and did not find the color in stock. She said perhaps it could be shipped to home, then spoke briefly to a co-worker. When she returned she said there is a new way the ship to door (or whatever the method is called) is handled and that we'd need to go through the line and the person at the register would determine if the eyeshadow is available to ship. Immediately I wondered, why must we go through a line potentially to be told this eyeshadow is unavailable?!  Shouldn't one of the numerous workers here helping no one be able to tell us if this is available without standing in line??  Who makes you wait in a line for the opportunity to learn if you can get a product by mail?  Possibly the dumbest thing I've ever heard but my mom wasn't bothered by it and we got in line. Thankfully it wasn't long but once we got to the cashier she also had to confer with a co-worker or two for several minutes to determine the eyeshadow we wanted to buy was not available. Soooo, why on earth is there a product on the shelf that is not available in store or by mail?  I suggested they should remove it from the shelf if it isn't available. A co-worker pushed back that it should remain there as it could become available later. 

So now we've waited in line for nothing and, mind you, not one of the four or five employees involved ever thought to show my mom a similar color in another brand. Not one!!! Instead they let us walk out without making a sale! Incredulous.
Did curbside pickup and when i check my bag in the car my order was not made correctly and missing items please be aware of this. Employees always leave stuff out and never double check.

Asked if they had a specific cologne and was told they don't carry it. I walked over to the shelf picked it up and showed the employee the placement. Strange their staff don't know what they carry or where they are held in the store. Embarrassing to be shown by a customer what you carry, Sephora has more informative and knowledgable staff.

I went in for the first time today to return a few items that I purchased online. I was immediately approached by a beautiful young woman named Kayla that works for TARTE cosmetics. I love TARTE, but haven't used their products in a while. She walked me through a couple of different products that I had questions about and made me feel not only comfortable, but beautiful as well. THANKS, Kayla! I'll definitely be back. PS She was also super sweet to my 3 year old that was going crazy!

I like this place. It's not as good with customer service as Sally's but they typically have all the brands I'm looking for. The salon is great. I had my hair done by Dawn and she did a wonderful job.

Never have in stock what I'm looking for (Ulta brand makeup items), employees are not helpful ("We may have that tomorrow." - why would I want to come back in if you "may" or (probably) won't have what I'm looking for?), and the makeup section was a wreck. I'll go elsewhere.
I love this Ulta and all the employees are always super helpful. They always have in stock what I'm looking for-- the bad reviews I guess we're from before I started going to this one! I recommend it

Love this place. The employees are always ready to help and suggest products! This location always has a great clearance selection too, which is a nice bonus. I've also had my hair colored and cut in the Ulta salon at this location and they did an AMAZING job! The salon has deals going on a lot of the time so be sure to ask. I have received nonstop compliments since having my hair done so I'll definitely be back!

I usually go to Ulta in Glenbrook shopping center in Hendersonville TN on Sunday afternoon.  I love the products and displays.  I always find employees gathered in the front of the store talking to each other. Obviously It's their social time and they're there to collect a paycheck.  When you need to ask a question you feel intrusive.  Attention Ulta management, you need to monitor your employees!!  Shandi a cashier has a great attitude and very approachable and friendly.  Hire more like her.
Very good products, and prices. The customer service was super friendly, and they are all so helpful and sweet. I definitely will be coming back here!!
Finally found my shade of eyeshadow here and it is the smoothest application. Always helpful.

This location is pretty good. They usually have what I need in stock unlike other area locations. However, it's probably not the best sales technique to aggressively walk up to me and point out my flaws to try to sell me sh$t I don't need. Online for me moving forward.

I went here on 9/14 to look for a lipstick that matched my lips and was all day wear. Brian greeted me. He was fabulous, he helped me for 30 minutes, trying on different lipsticks, he never got frustrated with me, he was kind and helpful and just really pleasant to deal with. Ulta is lucky to have him!

I arrived 15 minutes early for a haircut w/ style and all over highlights. This was my 1st trip to Ultabeauty and I was excited. I only have my hair done every 6 months since it's so expensive. I arrived with naturally curly hair that reached my bra strap in the back. 
 I was left alone several times
( more than 3) for my stylist to answer the salon phone and once for an extended personal call. It was like i had arrived at Great Clips or some other walk-in salon. It took over 3 hours and 20 minutes for my services because of this delay, along with 20 minutes for her trying to get the color right with toner. 2 different tries.
 I needed to leave for a movie, but told her not to skimp on my hair because of this. I expressed this twice.
First thing that alarmed me was her saying she was only going to cut 2 inches ( since i told her i wanted to keep it long), but with her contined "trimming" which I thought was "shaping" ended up to be more like 4 inches once i really put my hands through it. I entered the salon with the length at my bra strap and now it is barely below my shoulders.
 This made me really really sad to say the least. 
It's like she had never been educated that curly hair shrinks when it dries.  (????!!!!)
Her skills contined to shine (sarcasm) ....To start the "style" she began blow drying my hair on high power and heat without a diffuser and proceeded just to straighten the front with a round brush, and scrunching the back. Let me tell you. That's not a good look. She asked why I kept putting my fingers through it, and I told her I didn't like it fuzzy. However, she didn't do anything about this, she just jumped into scheduling me again in 3 months. 
I wanted to sit there and demand she do things over, correctly, but at that point and time, I had been there over 3 hours and 20 minutes, and with a movie previously scheduled with my family at 4pm and being in pain sitting there for so long (putting off another back surgery) it just wasn't an option. 
I literally wanted to cry when I got the $210.00 request for payment. 
I got out my debit card to pay at their register, but was told I couldn't pay at the salon, I had to pay up front. Up front was a line of 15 people waiting to check out. 
This was the cherry on top because there was only 2 sales associates working to check these (now 16) people out, while I counted 7 sales associates just lazily walking through the store with a tool belt full of makeup brushes asking through their nose if they could help you.
Too many ridiculous things happening in a row for me to ever return to this joke of a salon. I'm spreading the word so no one I know goes in to pay hundreds of dollars to stylists who act like they've never worked with anything but straight hair, and have all their hair unexpectedly chopped off that they've been working so hard to grow.
 1 star is too good for this place. I would give it a negative star if I could.
First time getting my hair done in years. Breanna S was phenomenal and so sweet, and my hair looks AMAZING. Will definitely be back!

Had my hair colored and cut by Dawn. There was a wait time of approximately 5 whole minutes. Dawn was personable and professional. Since I'm not big on perfection or expectations, I basically said, I want my hair reddish, don't cut too much length and do what you want. She made suggestions, we agreed and moved forward. I loved my hair. The aesthetician (I forgot her name- she was an adorable blonde with tattoos) on duty came by to talk and I made an appt with her right after the style. That was amazing too. There was no pressure to buy or add products or services. I truly enjoyed my experience and will come again.
I will add this though- the front register cashier was not to keen on helping me when I asked if I can tip them both (rather than 1) on the same ticket or use my points. She figured out the tipping part but not the points part.

AVOID THEIR SALON FOR COLOR! I went there for all over color(I asked for a natural dark brunette) to get rid of old ombré and was left with a decent root color but completely black tips... they agreed to fix it( because the woman that originally did it wasn't employed there anymore) and now I have a weird light brown line going all the way around my head about 4 inches from my roots. It looks so trashy, I can barely stand to look in a mirror. Such a waste of time and money. I'm livid. They're not equipped for anything more than a simple cut. DO NOT GO THERE FOR COLOR. I assure you will regret it.
I went in for a color and cut at the ulta salon today and my hairstylist was named channel. She was so sweet and did wonders on my hair. I recommend her because she did such an awesome job.

This location is always super friendly and helpful. The store is clean and well stocked, although half of the testers are missing. Love the selection and atmosphere of the store. I wish they carried more like the cool springs location but the building here is significantly smaller than cool springs.

Poorly lit store with displays that looked like a two-year old dug their fingers through everything. Aw surfaces were dirty & desperate need of restocking. 

Two staffers were phenomenal. They guided me to products & made suggestions. When I selected a product I asked another male staffer, "is there a mirror available?" (I wanted to hold product near my hair to see if it was a decent match). He responded with, "Gurrrl NO! We can't have customers all up
In here touching things and pulling down their masks!!! Ewe.(awkward pause)... I guess you can hide somewhere in the store and check...".  

Unprofessional. Lacking training to deal with inquiries such as mine. I'm 46, and "Ma'am" is most appropriate. It was so tacky... I will find a better customer experience elsewhere. Our Walgreens had cleaner, more organized products. I'd rather go there.... "gurrrl" (SMH).

I have been to this location several times.  It is just your basic Ulta, but last week I called my usual salon only to find out my usual stylist didn't work there anymore.  I remembered Ulta had a salon so I booked an appointment on my phone.  Carolyn did a basic cut/style and she did an amazing job!  I have already booked my next appointment with her.

An Ulta like any other, minus one thing: this location has a Lancome specialist named Ravin. She is engaging and always helpful. You can tell that she is a makeup artist as she knows everything about everything in that store. I think that my favorite part is that no matter how long it has been since I have been in the store, she remembers me and the last thing that we talked about. Ravin alone makes me keep coming back to this location (the staff being down to Earth and happy helps a ton too).
Love this Ulta wayyy more than the one in Coolsprings! the cashiers are so much more friendly and everyone is so sweet!

I came here to get my brows done at their brow bar, and man was it a good choice! Jenna was working, and she is absolutely fabulous. Seriously can't sing her praises enough. She took the time to map out my eyebrows and really define an arch. She showed me everything about them before she did it, and just did such a great job! She then colored them in, and they looked great. I will definitely be going back in the future, and am so glad I found a place that does such a great job!
This location is always clean and nicely stocked. I had my hair colored by Abbie and she was wonderful. My hair turned out wonderfully.

This is by far my favorite Ulta location and I am a frequent (maybe too frequent lol) customer here. The sales associates and brand ambassadors are always more than willing to help locate and suggest items even if that means going out their way or to the back to look for them. I have never had a bad experience. The store is always super clean and the workers here are all very friendly and nice!

Love this store location! Went here recently to get a new straightener and protective spray. The staff was very helpful and they had almost everything in stock that I needed. The only thing I wish was that the store was maybe a little bigger. I normally go to the one in Cookeville, and this location seemed a bit smaller. Overall great.

I love Ulta stores, and their products are amazing! However, this store has the rudest employees. Now I'm not talking about the managers; they seem pretty friendly. And I can't speak for the ladies in the salon because I haven't used it. But several (not all) of the girls on the sales floor and register just seem like they hate their job and don't like helping customers at all. I'm a pretty introverted shopper and prefer to do things myself, but on one instance I asked for help picking out a shade of new foundation. She acted like she was so annoyed even though all she was doing was walking around the store. It was completely dead. They dont smile when they're checking you out, and I go in there a whole lot. It's always the same experience. I don't know, it's made me not enjoy going in there at all, but you can't keep me away from an Ulta. Even though the one in Murfreesboro has way nicer employees!

I had my first appointment here today. My appointment was scheduled for 10:00. I arrived at 9:55. Two women were standing in front of the doors, when I said "excuse me" and attempted to enter, the doors were locked. One woman looked at me and said "It's not open. We work here". Then went back to her conversation. 
The doors opened at 10:02. I walked back to the salon and waited. A staff member came by and took my information, seated me, and went to get my stylist, who still wasn't there. 
After sitting for about 5 more minutes, I asked the same staff member if there was someone else who was there and could do the cut - it was my first visit and I didn't have a stylist preference. She again went to find my stylist. 
The stylist finally came over, she was friendly, but did not say a word about starting late or apologize for keeping me waiting. 
We went ahead, and the service was average. Nothing stellar, nothing terrible.
I definitely will NOT go back. The haircut service did not balance out the unprofessional start.
I would suggest that they don't schedule services to start when the staff hasn't yet arrived and the store isn't open.

Omg I am so happy and excited and I owe it all to Bella!! I was visiting my family back in my hometown of San Diego California. Me and my sister and niece were out doing Christmas shopping. My niece saw a lipstick by Beauty Bakerie that she wanted. I stealthily slid behind her and snapped a pic of it. Later I went back to get it but they were all out. Not only was the two stores near me out, the entire area of California was too. I went online and it was out so I decided to wait till I arrived back in Tennessee. I called store after store. Finally someone told me I could just do store pick up online and they would show the stores that had it. I did and talked to Bella and they had 1 left!! Thanks to her I am going to have the coolest Christmas surprise! Thank you Bella!! You have no idea how much you made my Christmas!

I live in Nashville and drove 20 minutes to this location to get a few things before I left town the next day. I needed help at the brow bar and didn't see anyone around, so I waited or about 5 minutes. The first person I see(a manager), I asked for some assistance at the brow bar. She told me they didn't have anyone working the brow bar that day. I said can someone else help me? She reiterated that they didn't have anyone working the brow bar that day. I guess nobody else in the store knows anything about the brow bar-not even the manager. To drive 20 minutes to a store because I trust they are professionals to just be turned away by a manager who either couldn't or didn't want to help me is very disappointing and upsetting. You're in retail and you're a manager. You should be able to assist and cover in ANY department in the store. That's part of being a manager. I now go out of my way to shop at the Hundred Oaks location.

I got my eyebrows shaped, waxed, and tinted at the Brow Bar and this is the best they have ever looked!! The person who did them took their time and made sure I was satisfied! I got there right before her lunch break and she postponed her lunch to take care of me! I wish I could remember her name, but it was TWO names and unfortunately she said she was moving back to her home town :/ makes me sad because I would go back just to see her because of how well she did. 
The staff behind the check out counter was very friendly as well!

General manager is great, truly a professional who manages a strong store which reflects in their business. The salon and brow bar are full service. Very clean and organized store! The shopping center has great shopping, lots of parking, and some great eats nearby. Easy to find and right off the interstate.
Janna at the Brow Bar was so professional and nice today. She did an excellent job with my brow tint and wax!

I would give it 0 stars if I could. I have shopped here for years, and shop in other locations and online-very loyal customer.  Today I went to this store w my daughter and the beauty consultant watched us walk in, watched us testing several foundation colors on our forearms and jawlines-no offer for help. Walked by us several times. Waited on 5 or 6 other people while my daughter and I tried primers, Foundations, highlighters.  I bought 4 products and politely told the representative at the cash register about my experience and her response was 'hmmmm'.  GOODBYE EXTON ULTA
Melinda did my eyebrows today and they were absolutely amazing . She was super sweet and friendly! Definitely will be back

The management at this store need to be more consumer friendly. Manager refused to return an item saying it was final sale and represented that it was posted even though it was not posted in the area that I had selected the item and not posted on the day that I purchased. Even today when I went into the store, it was not printed on the receipt nor posted at the registers.  This store is definitely buyer beware and they will not support you if there's an issue with the product.  There are plenty of other options so I will take my business to Amazon, Sephora and directly to their product manufactures website.

Wow...went in to find hair extensions to use in my hair for my wedding. The stylist showed me where they were, and I asked for clip-in, and a recommendation for color. (I've been to another place, and they had been able to match me with a solid color--not a blend. They just didn't have the right length.) First I told her my stylist said to get human hair...but she pointed me to a synthetic that can be curled, and didn't really listen when I was trying to say I'd prefer the human hair...which they had. She was showing me a color that was a blend (several different colors...similar to highlights), and I said, "This one looks like it's different colors-- I'm looking for one solid color, since my hair isn't highlighted." Her answer? "Well realistically your hair isn't one color." My response, "But my hair doesn't look like that (meaning what she was showing me)....would someone with my hair wear a blend?" (I mean...I don't know anything about this, so a legitimate question). Her response, "I was just opening this box to show it to you"...but said with the most RUDE delivery I have ever heard from a sales associate. Then (annoyed) she went on to say, "Didn't your stylist tell you where to go or what to get?" (I thought I'd been clear I wanted human hair...a solid color...which they did have...) I started to leave...we talked a little more (about where I could go)...then I left...in a hurry. Went in at 11am on November 12, 2015...won't be back.

This store's employees are very unreliable with the information they give you. I once signed up for a class at the counter, only to find out on the day of the class that it wasn't at 8am prior to the store opening as i had been told but it was a free makeup consultation sometime during that day.
Another time I called for eyebrow shaping appointment and was told to come at 11:20, only to find out then that my time Slot was given away to somebody else. The manager needs to get the team more organized or better trained.

This is a good place to spend $100 on four items in the matter of minutes. I got a gift card for Christmas so I convinced my friend to go on a spree with me. I was looking for a good facial cream to get rid of scarring. I found a lady in my section to give me a hand but she didn't give off the vibe of an expert. She recommended a resurfacing cream that I've been using for three weeks and have yet to see a result. I did go for a second opinion to the dermatologists there but of course she only recommended the most expensive product there. I guess at this point to find what I want I needed to see a professional because the products I purchased didn't have the advertised effect. 
I did walk away with an overpriced nail polish and makeup brush cleaner. Teeth whitening strips and biore strips. A hydro facial spray that I really like. And of course a Kylie lip kit. Afterall that, my $200 gift card was empty.

I am leaving this review mainly for Laura in the Lancôme section. She could not have been more pleasant to me. She made me feel at ease trying to figure out the right product for me, was super patient and friendly too, as I decided I needed to try a different product after she showed me the first one. I got the clear feeling she enjoys her job and was happy to help me and that made my shopping experience positive. She is truly a gem at that store for a customer experience and also has a ton of knowledge about the products. I was able to find the products I needed to today because she was so willing to show me.

This was my second time at Ulta Salon. Kelley did my cut. I have curly hair, kind of difficult to do a good cut on. She did an excellent job, again. Listened to my suggestions and created the cut I came in for. She's a young and talented stylist who knows what she's doing. Definitely coming back and recommending to friends. Thanks!

Everytime .. i go to this Ulta  (twice in maybe 5 months .. online shopper ) there has been this one women in this store that looks at me like shes going to murder me .. or she casting a curse on me .  Shes mayve 5'7 witj short brown hair . She stares at me with this look . I dont know if its a fluke or if she works there . The staff is great but i cant come into a store and feel freaking scared. Last time i had kid with me abd shes 7 and got scared too . I get looks sometimes .. im heavly tattooed and very pale . NEVER HAVE I FELT LIKE THIS EVER . If she works there .. she should be let go ....

This location just recently opened adjacent to the Wegman's food store in King of Prussia.  Right next door to the new REI store.

It is a really big well lit store and probably has anything you are looking for by way of nail polish, makeup, shampoo, beauty products, etc.

But considering that I was the only one in the store when it opened for the day you'd think that I'd have a salesperson walking alongside of me asking if I needed help.

There were 4 salespeople, one manager and 1 Clinique exclusive representative there.
I had to find a salesperson 3 times to direct me to the product I was looking for.  I did ultimately find what I wanted and then I had to find a person to ring me up.

I do not shop here on a regular basis-  I came in because I wanted 2 items like "now" rather than waiting for them to come from online shopping............

If I'm impatient I would surely come back, but anything sold here can be found online

I stopped in here today and surprisingly for a weekend I got an immediate appointment for the benefit brow bar with Jen. She was awesome! Not only did she do a great job on my brows but she showed me how to enhance my brows and eyes after my wax. I'm so grateful I stopped in! I will definitely be going back to her. This store was full of helpful associates constantly checking in to help me. The store is new, clean, well lit. The parking was tough with the Nordstrom rack being next door but that's to be expected. I normally go to the Plymouth meeting location but this one is way better! I'm only giving it 4 stars because I can't buy all my favorite brands here, such as Bobbi Brown, NARS, Laura mercier, but that's how it's always been.

I walked in a few months back looking for some lip gloss, an eyebrow pencil and green cover up and walked out a new person. While looking for a way to enhance my botched eyebrows, I was directed to Jen at the Benefit Brow Bar. Jen is the reason I now drive on the Schuylkill during rush hour. I was skeptical to try waxing because I had broken out from it in the past, however, Jen assured me the Benefit wax is gentle. And so she started the process of reshaping my brows after years of threading and a brow casualty. After ONE visit the difference was so obvious. She enhanced my natural brow shape and made my face look more symmetric. After a few visits (because I never broke out from the wax) I am still a super happy customer and plan on many more visits to her. Apart from her amazing skills as a brow guru, she also happens to be one of the sweetest people I have met.

I recently stopped in to try and find a pencil to help shape my brows and Sarah from benefit brow bar was awesome. She sent me home with a great product, but also helped to shape and wax and give me a mini lesson on application. I'll be back in a few weeks for round 2!

I switched to this Ulta so that I could avoid dealing with the Sephora/KOP mall stress and as a bonus this place is a thousand times better. Larger, brighter, less crazy, and the staff is really nice and helpful in a way that's not just an attempt at getting an up-sell. I needed my eyebrows done so I tried out the brow bar at this location on a whim and I can't remember her name right now, but the blonde woman who does the waxing at this location is an absolute wizard, not to mention a total sweetheart. Highly recommend.

Great place to get makeup. I always try and go with a coupon and watch out for deals in their circular.  The staff are pretty nice and really want to help you find something you love. I do prefer Sephora over ulta, because they spend more time helping customers find, test, and bring home samples of cosmetics, perfume, and skin care products. Ulta seems to have more rules so staff are limited to what they can do.  I wish the staff at Ulta would offer to do more make up tutorials. They seem to need more staff in the store as well.  Again, they can have great deals, so if you know what you're looking for watch out for coupons and sales.

jackie at the brown bar is literallly a brow queeeeennnnn. she's already started to completely transform my brows with just 4 appointments. i don't think i'll ever let anyone touch my brows now, she's the best.

I can't say enough nice things about the girls at Ulta. Jackie who works at the brow bar has been doing my eyebrows for about 3 months now and they look amazing. All the staff here are awesome and I never feel pushed to buy something I don't need or want.

Kelley has been doing my hair for years now and it's not a surprise to say that specifically come to this location because of her. Kelley and the rest of the staff are always so helpful to help me find anything I'm looking for. I've been introduced to so many amazing new products just from talking with the staff. My beauty regime has really stepped up its game since coming to ulta. I shop her multiple times a month and wouldn't have it any other way.

Our appointment was booked for 7 ppl started at 8.10.
If they don't care about customers time they should not have saloon opened here no one around. Left and came back.

had my first hair appointment with Rini yesterday and she was amazing!! she really listens and cares about what you have in mind, even tho i only had a general idea, she walked me thru step by step and always stops to check if everything is good so far. i am very pleased with the final result. would recommend her to everyone who is looking for someone to cut your hair!

Super store, it's much better than my collegeville Ulta.  This Ulta  is bright, clean and organized.  I bought a couple Burt's Bees lip shimmers.  I also found a very cool item from Pacifica , Gem serum radiant drops. I'm excited to try this product out.  Again the parking for any of these businesses is absolutely horrible. If your in the area enjoying a nearby restaurant, and you love cosmetics- visit the store!

I'm so glad I stopped in today to get my eyebrows done! Jacque is amazing! She is not only a great specialist but she is a very nice person too. My eyebrows are just perfect now! I will definitely be going back to her. This is now my go-to place to get my eyebrows)

Malika is amazing. If you need any help with skincare or makeup, she's the person to go to. Not only is she a consumer herself and tries all products but she has been trained in the whole department so she's not bias to specific brands. She's honest, kind, and knowledgeable. 5 stars. She actually changed my life, and taught me how to "bake" my makeup to create a beautiful look! Thank you so much!

I have been getting my hair done by John for about 3 years now, and will follow him wherever he goes. He is FABULOUS at what he does. My hair always looks amazing, and he is able to deliver exactly what I envision (even if I'm unsure of just what that is when I walk in lol). This particular location is large, well lit and stocked with friendly team members and in a beautiful and convenient center. If you're in the KOP area and looking for a truly remarkable stylist, John is your guy!!!!

So I almost didn't even leave a review because Rini was amazing and I want her all to myself  but I had my first experience at this ulta location and I'll never go anywhere else. First of all I had a 2:15 appointment that I had to postpone as I'm 8 1/2 months pregnant and having contractions. The salon called to confirm and when my husband answered they were very polite and assured him if I was feeling better later I was more than welcome to come in. I called and came in at 6pm, expecting to get rushed out the door seeing as it was late. Quite the opposite, Rini was AMAZING, she did exactly what I wanted. EXACTLY. I had a lot of damage and was getting 7 inches cut off and my roots blended. She knew exactly what she was doing and took the time to make sure it was perfect, even thought it meant we were there until 10pm. I can't remember the last time my hair looked this good and healthy after a color. Highly recommend!! Prices are a tad bit high but lower than a luxury salon and I knew what I would be paying before she even touched my hair. 5 STARS!
Jackie did a fabulous job on my eyebrows! I was feeling insecure and nervous about my brows but now I love them! Thank you!

I love going to this Ulta ( KOP).
The Ulta Salon is straight back from where you walk in.   The Hair Stylists are very professional,  personable and have more continuing education  then most high end  salons.   I love to get my highlights there and walk around the store while they are processing.  Speaking of highlights,   My girl, Deja is excellent.     She took my very long  dark brown hair and added perfect blond highlights.  She is really sweet and  talented.     Bonus, I ended up with 250.00 in rewards just from going to the salon a few times.   Salon is double rewards on Ulta rewards card.   I look forward to my hair appointments here.

I found this Ulta a bit tricky to get to and by that I mean from the Wegmans parking lot I could see the building but the road leading to it was not as direct as one would hope.

That aside the store was well stocked as it should be for a relatively brand spanking new store. This is perhaps the only time I have seen  Ulta's own brand fully displayed and well represented. Which is a good thing because their house brand is pretty damn good and the price point can't be beat.

A friend of mine who lives within walking distance introduced me to Jackie at the brow bar a few months back. Today was my second visit, and she is amazing and truly gifted at her skill! It's worth not touching your brows in between no matter how much you want too, because she shapes them and will get them perfect! It's a process, but this will be the only place I will go from now on! She gets pretty booked- so you can call and make appointments too! I live an hour and 20 mins away- and drive past several Ulta's and will always go see Jackie!
Thank you NEENA for styling my hair as i came in at the very last minute and needed something done to face a wedding in 90 degree weather! You are a rockstar.

Sarah from the Benefit Brow Bar is the eyebrow queen! She is kind and great at what she does. I will not be getting my eyebrows done anywhere else. I usually get them threaded, but Sarah waxed them and I was very pleased with how they turned out! Great service! Thank you!

The older lady with the blonde hair in the Clinique section was extremely rude to us tonight. As we were testing out some products she grabbed them out of our hands very aggressively after previously being blunt and rude earlier in our shopping trip. All other workers were helpful and kind - but try your best to steer clear of her.

Marcia is amazing. If you need any help with skincare or makeup, she's the person to go to. Not only is she a consumer herself and tries all products but she has been trained in the whole department so she's not bias to specific brands. She's honest, kind, and knowledgeable. 5 stars.

Let me tell y'all how the Lord himself specifically picked Jacque to hold the all might power of slaying eyebrows! She took my eyebrows that were scarce (don't judge my word choice), missing a tail, thin, and just sad (thanks to a previous person) and Cinderella'd the h*ll out of them. She took her time to get them right and gave me tips on how to get then to grow and be thicker. I have very thin hair in general but omg y'all, my eyebrows have never been better. I even left Philly for 3 months and refused to let anyone touch then (thank you makeup gods for concealer). Jacque is just that amazing! Now I have moved and feel an empty void in my life. I might just have to fly back to get my eyebrows done by the best!

Unprofessional. Especially the salon. Cancelled appointments without my knowledge.  They did not attempt to make the situation better. No even an apology. Don't waste your time with this low rung chain.

Deja did a fabulous job on my makeup! She was kind and accommodating. When I went to checkout I put the tip on my card. I stated I wanted to leave a $12 tip to my $75 bill. The coordinator who checked me out proceeds to say "oh well...your service was $75" basically tip shaming me. It was very uncomfortable. I turned to my friend and asked how much she tipped, which was the same as me for the same service. She told me after we left the coordinator made the same comment to her, asking if she had enough cash back to leave a good tip. 3 stars for the odd tip shaming comments.

Ulta over Sephora every time. The fact that they carry NYX and always have deals and coupons, it makes having a makeup hobby all the more easier! I went today and spend $140 on new makeup and I got a free shampoo and setting spray as well as had a $7 coupon off if any purchase over $15. They're also super lovely and not pushy like the Sephora employees and let you go through the store without feeling stalked

Not impressed. From an inventory perspective they have a lot of options for makeup, hair, skincare, etc. From an employee perspective, not helpful at all. As I walked in, employees were gathered talking to each other, no one greeted me, acknowledged my presence, or asked if I needed help. Even at one point I was looking for a product and the employee asked me to move over so she could show another employee a product she recently tried, once again never acknowledging the customer. Typically I don't even make a purchase from places that don't acknowledge or appreciate me as a customer but was on a time constraint so proceeded to the front desk to purchase the item. There were two ladies at the cash register and a line of 4 and the other employees still having a conversation in the middle of the floor. The lady who helped me was rather rude, never asked if I was able to find anything, didn't smile, and looked like she rather not be there. Needless to say I won't be back. I refuse to spend my money at places where I am not valued as a customer.

The review is on service not the store itself.  (01/12/2020) ~3:00 pm

I should have known it wasn't a great location when I walked in past 3 employees and was not acknowledged in any way. 
As I walked around shopping, I found an iPhone on a lower level shelf next to products. 

I picked it up and immediately walked up front to give to a clerk. I stood at the side where you can pick up online orders and patiently waited. Two women at the register, one working and one seemed to be organizing. Both made eye contact but said nothing. As the one organizing walked past me to leave the register area, still saying nothing, I spoke up. Rudely she asked if I was picking something up. I stated that I was not however I had found a customer's phone and wanted to give to someone. She grabs it and says "it's not a customer phone but an employee, I know who it belongs to" as she rolls her eyes and walks off hastily. 
The other young lady shrugs and goes back to what she's doing. 
Rude, dismissive and lacking of customer service at this location. I placed my items on the counter and left. I can get the same products from another Ulta or even a Sephora. 

I've shopped this company in other cities and states, I've never had an experience like this one.

They are all so nice I have been there only twice first time I bought make-up, loved it and just today I had gotten my hair cut and hair peroducts Lena cut and helped me pick out my hair peroducts. She was absulty wonderful and did an awesome job on my hair. I finally found a hair styles that i love thank you so much Lena. The other young lady working with her was just as fabulous and kind. I absolutely love their products and services. If you haven't been there you need to trry them out. They also have great deals all the time and its worth it. I love love them. Thank you guys for making me feel comfortable and important....

I went there to buy a chelating shampoo to help with the hard water buildup on my hair. Ended up talking with a salon manager who was very knowledgeable and I ended up coming back to get a cut with Jessica. I also got a clarifying treatment which totally fixed my hair! My cut is awesome and I'm very happy with her and will be back.

Ulta is the best of Sephora and Beauty Brands.

Like Beauty Brands, they have a salon and hair products. They have $3.50 off $10 purchase coupons available online and in mailers. However, they're quite a bit larger than Beauty Brands. 

Like Sephora, they offer lots of premium makeup. Unlike Sephora, they're not located (inconveniently) in malls. 

They also offer some brands that are available at stores like Target. I really like this because it saves me a trip to Target. 

Be sure to join the rewards program and earn points on your purchases!

I was like a kid in a candy shop when I found out that an Ulta was opening in Fenton, which is now the closest location to me.

If you go here and walk away without buying something (or being able to find what you are looking for) then honestly we need to have a talk.

Ulta is the mecca of beauty products.  They sell their own brand, which you can get at a great price or get a steal of a deal when combining their coupon with their advertisements.  You can also find your normal name brand cosmetics here and they almost always have a great deal on them as well.

They have you covered with anything having to do with anything with beauty.  You will save money by shopping here and you will continue to come back.

There is a point system so you can accumulate points for every dollar you spend at the store.  These add up quite nicely.

Be sure to browse their sale aisle, you're sure to find that last something you might need to make your day complete!

This place is beautiful! I have been trying to find someone who can do a good perm...I found her. Tara just did my perm and it looks fabulous! She also made it seem like she really likes to do perms. Usually people give me the feeling like they really don't want to do them which can result in not so good results. Been there but not this time! She did awesome! She was super cute and friendly as well. If it wasn't so expensive I would go here for all my beauty needs...but I will definitely be back for a perm with Tara.

Can I live here??
Goodness. I just dropped by after work to pick up some sulfate/paraban free products for my extremely high maintenance skin and I ended up standing in one aisle smelling all the products I've never even heard of before??

Now each and every smell of the MOR product line is on my Christmas list.
Actually, just get me a gift card to that place.

That'd be a very Merrry Christmas indeed.

I have to say that I had a wonderful experience at Ulta! I had a short haircut that needed shaping and I was afraid to lose more hair. Julia took the time with me to look at the pictures that I had taken of the hairdo that I wanted. It was going to take me some time to get there, because it is a longer cut, but Julia shaped it up as a shorter version of what I wanted! ! I also wanted to have a silver, blonde and purple color and they absolutely rocked it! I took three times coming in there to get the color the way that I wanted it, but Julia and the manager Alicia (hope I am spelling that right) would not give up until I was happy! I have not gone to Ulta before because I had heard that they were expensive. They may be more money, but they are worth it!

The Manager for the Salon Alicia called me and spoke to me about my issues and offered me a refund and was very friendly and apologetic.  Alicia and the district/regional manager were there when i went to get my refund yesterday.  Alicia was again very nice and professional.  The other manager seemed to not be so friendly and made some comment of how strong my daughter was....idk if that was in reference to her going to therapy both speech and physical and not really believing what i said to be true but it sure felt like it.  My daughter is strong because of the work we've done for 5 months and can move her head any direction now thank you and chokes alot less now but still has to have a procedure done thank you but she wouldn't know anything about that since what my daughter has is very rare so maybe she should just stick to working at Ulta. Alicia was the best part of this experience.  You can tell she is genuinely nice and cares about the clients. I hope she moves on to even bigger and better things. More people in this world should be like her!

So far it is not getting better.  I emailed a complaint to corporate which they say you will hear back within 24 hours, yet I have not heard back through my email nor a call.  I decided to call this morning and it keeps ringing for the operator and nobody ever answers.  The service is just getting worse!

I absolutely love this store but the customer service at this location is horrible! I had to wait in line for more then 10 minutes and their wasnt a single person ahead of me! When i attempted to return their product they said i couldnt even though it was well within 30 days of buying it. Also the cashier was horrific. She was snooty and just plain ol mean. I love the product quality at ulta but I will not be going back to this location!

I was on a mission to pick up Mega Babe Rosy Pits deodorant. According to the Ulta website all of the St. Louis stores have it in stock. WRONG! Only one store had it and it was this one at Gravois Bluffs in Fenton. When I called the clerk told me they had 2 left. Score! I'll be back!

Yay! They finally opened an Ulta in my neighborhood! I wanna say I'm literally here 3 times out of the week (not even to buy, just to look!). 

Looking for nail polish? They got it. Premium brand cosmetics? Yup. Hair appliances or perfume/cologne? Yup and yup. I love this store, it's like a once stop shop for beauty products. Sign up to become a member, trust me, I've saved a LOT of money. For every dollar you spend, you accumulate points that you can redeem anytime. Prices are not different front other drugstores, but bring in your coupons you receive in the mail and then it's worth it.

I went to Ulta in Fenton last night to have my hair colored and cut.  I ended up getting the dimensional which I guess I was wrong with what I thought it would be.
