I am sitting in work feeling amazing about my skin! She makes honest and highly educated suggestions about products for each specific customer. I purchased a serum and a spray per her recommendation and it has completely changed the way my makeup looks. Great experience at this store, will be back to pick a new concealer soon!

New-ish location in Deptford next to David's Bridal and Old Navy makes this store easily accessible.  The layout is large, clean and bright with a nice selection of salon quality goods.  

There is also a full-service salon located in the back of the store to make this a one stop shop.  The hours are very convenient & the prices are maybe a little above average for the area but still competitive considering the products they use.

My sister went in today with her 3 month old infant in her carrier in a cart. The employee was extremely rude saying no carts were allowed due to COVID. Frustrating since there is a child involved, but understandable. HOWEVER, another employee was standing there without a mask on during this. If you're going to enforce something, be consistent. You can't pick and choose which rules you want to enforce. Rude staff.

Real nice place- very big actually and a big selection.  They carry everything from makeup, hair supplies, nail polish, perfume, and they have a salon in the back.  Very reasonably priced items, and friendly staff- I decided to sign up for an Ulta card; pretty sure you get some sort of free gift your birth month, and I'm all about free stuff.

My girlfriend and my son were kicked out of the store because she was using a mini shopping cart from Home Goods to keep my son in one confined area while she shopped. An associate told her she couldn't have a shopping cart in the store while a lady with a multi terrain stroller barreled through got no grief. I didn't realize that Ulta was doing so well that they could turn away customers and to top it off my girlfriend used to work for Ulta where there was no such policy! Thanks for saving me the money she would've spent there but needless to say WE WILL NEVER VISIT YOUR STORES AND WILL TELL OUR FRIENDS NOT TO EITHER!

Employees act very stuck up and annoyed when you need help finding something. None of the employees are on the same page either. Each one will tell you something different from the one before, if they even acknowledge you at all. I had to ask at the register for help after hopelessly wandering the store without assistance for over 20 minutes. 

One employee was extremely condescending when I asked if they carried the ClarityRX line. She said, "oh is that a drugstore brand? I've never even heard of that."  I hope afterwards she googled the brand, because her skin was pretty rough and could use the help. 

Seems like unless you're dropping $200+++ on the latest trendy makeup, no one in this store cares to help you. Sephora is such a better experience. 

In conclusion, ladies: please stop acting like you're professional makeup artists working for Beyoncé and Rihanna....because you're not, you're in Deptford with the rest of us peasants. Get a grip.

This is probably one of the Ulta's with the worst customer service. 2 times I went to this ulta in one week and the employees are just overall rude.
The first time I let it slide but this has happened twice in one week. I may be young but my money spends the same as anyone else. The first visit, I asked an employee where this certain brand of makeup was she didn't even look at me, didn't say anything to me, and asked another worker to take me there. Seriously? The second time was when all of the workers were in little groups talking and goofing off, I go to a group because I cannot find a single person working by themselves and ask my question and everyone except for 1 person looked at me and just walked away. I think I've met about 2 nice employees at this location.

I went shopping at the location in Deptford, NJ. The store was clean, the products were nicely displayed and the staff were friendly. As it is the holiday season there was a line to check out (which is to be expected) but the cashiers did a great job with checking out customers in a timely matter. 

I don't typically shop here but I will return because most of their products in store are cheaper than if I purchased them elsewhere.
This is a new Ulta that has opened in the past 4 weeks. I'm glad they opened here because its really convenient area and super clean store and great staff. I will reutrn soon

I went to the Ulta salon last night for a balayage with Andrea. She took 2 hours just to apply the bleach on my hair so of course when she was done 2-3 hours later my hair is completely fried. She was a nice girl made me feel at home but she has completely ruined my healthy hair. I am devastated. Please everyone do not go to her for a balayage. Will not be returning to any Ulta location ever again. 

Oh and top it off instead of charging me for a partial balayage she charged me for a full head of highlights.

Wayne Collins is my all time favorite stylist. I've been going to Wayne since 2015 and he never disappoints. His keratin treatments last longer than other stylists and that is because of his meticulous, thorough approach to the process. My hair always looks great when I schedule with Wayne and he is a pleasure to be around.

The customer rep no longer asks if you want to apply your points to purchase. After I was checked out I asked if I had points to use. The rep said it's my responsibility to ask prior to checking out which is completely new to me. I've always been asked. She was reluctant to check and expressed frustration with my question. I had 9 dollars to use and asked to return purchase in order to get 9 dollars applied to purchase as I load up on cosmetics only twice a year and this was a significant purchase. Once I returned and repurchased the amount of points went to 3 dollars because of the purchase/ return. Manager would not honor the original 9 dollars and said it was up to me to notify them that I want to use the money I've earned toward the purchase! I will be purchasing my cosmetics online direct from the manufacturer from now on. This store has lost my business

Went in to purchase some shampoo. It was supposed to be on sale for half price. Got to the register, it rang up incorrectly. They wanted me to walk them to the sign and point to it, which I did. Then we walked back to the register and the checkout girl called her manager over to adjust the price. The manager asked me to show her the sign also. To which I replied, "your cashier just told you what the sign said, and so did I. Do you think we're both lying?" Her reply? Never mind, I'll check myself. Poor employee- your boss doesn't even trust you to read a sign?!?
She then went to the sign and instead of honoring the price, said it was a mistake and they could not help me. Talk about terrible customer service and rude to boot!

The problem I feel with this location is when I return something I get treated like I'm some kind of thief. I returned the Tarte Tartlette eyeshadow palette, I only used maybe a tiny bit of one color, and it would not blend for my life, I used a great base, and tried my Morphe brushes and my make brushes so I returned it. The palette was $48.00 that's a lot of money for something I am not going to use. So I returned it, the girl who rung me up says " your returning all of this"? I said yes just the palette as I did not like it, I then started asking her some questions about which brand has great shadows and she acted like she didn't hear me and I had to wait a very long time for the transaction to be approved by a manager as it was over $40 I basically felt like I was being treated like a thief and it made me feel extremely uncomfortable. Then after I was done the transaction I went back and purchased Benefits porefessional primer and I got the same girl in line & she did not say a word to me at all.it was a very unpleasant experience

OK, I'm a HUGE fan.  The staff is helpful, the selection is awesome and the coupons are the best part!  Sign up for the frequent buyer program.  It costs nothing and they send you coupons!  I just bought an amazing make-up kit for next to nothing and 20% off.  My husband says I've become a make up tramp...I'm ok with this.  The salon and brow bar seem a bit pricey for me but eventually I hope to try both.  All my favorite drugstore and high end make-up in one spot?  YES!!!!!

Walked around for 15 minutes didn't get any help.   Finally found someone who worked looked like she was cleaning so I asked if "we could get some help" her response rudely was "not at the moment, there should be plenty of people to help you"  I was SHOCKED to say the least.  Any time in there I'm welcomed, but god forbid I need help they are nowhere to be found.

Of the many times I've stopped in this ulta to look for something or pick something up, the staff has been really friendly and very helpful if I had any questions. They have some pretty good sales during the holidays and I always managed to find something. Always easy parking. 

The reason why I'm giving this 3 stars is because of their inventory. They are always out of stock of something, never fully stocked, and the products are a mess. Very unorganized. I can rarely ever come in and find something if I'm looking for something in particular. Better off going to cvs or walgreens for the drugstore make up.

It took me months to figure out what Ulta was, and it is a women's dream.  Beats having to drive to the a mall to get high end (and even low end) makeup, toiletries, etc.  Products seem to be priced the same as they would be at Macy's, Sephora, etc.  there is a hair salon in the back of the store and beauty advisors that will apply the products for you in store, which helps a lot when you are trying to pick between the brands that you're not too familiar with and will also give you good tips, which helps the non-beauty experts like myself!   They also have a "frequent shopper" card and you earn points for each dollar you spend to get additional discounts, which is always a plus!

First of all, the people here are absolutely lovely.  The salon folks hooked me up with Tiffany, who gave me an amazing facial.  It was my first facial ever, and I really didn't know what I needed.  Tiffany explained what the different facials did and made a recommendation for my hyper pigmentation and lines.  It was a wonderful relaxing experience, so much that I was ready to fall asleep in the chair!  I did not know a face massage was even a thing you got with a facial, shit changed my life!  The best part was that my face looked amazing after...my lines in my forehead faded, and I was glowing.  I didn't even put on makeup that night.  Thankyou Tiffany!  Can't wait for my Go and Glow on Thursday!

The store has a smaller selection of brands than Sephora, (hence the 4 stars) but I'd go here over Sephora any day.  You still have Tarte, Clinique, UD, and some obscure drugstore brands, not to mention Bareminerals, Pur, and Dermatelogica.  For me, it's all about good people and customer service, and the men and women here make this store what it is-amazing.
Waited in line 10 minutes for gift cards at salon and the man took care of a lady that just walked up . Take my business elsewhere...
The staff are so friendly and willing to help you with any needs. I am in love with the ulta brand it is affordable yet at a high quality product!

Although I prefer being able to get all brands @ Sephora, this is my frequent go to for items due to location.

Made an appointment before hand because I wanted some help & had questions.  Nobody could find my appointment & put me with someone from the Brow Bar who pushed lots of Benefit items on me.  

Seems hit or miss with service recently at this location.  Guess changes in Managers.....I spent a ridiculous amount of $ loading up on everything I was out of.  Had to exchange some items only to find out that their was special upcoming events for one of the lines I purchased 4 products from.  Also, never received one sample after spending so much $.  Think I'll stick to the experts & only stop in when I have to.  Sad, service use to be great here.

Meynor at the Benefit Brow Bar is the best! He always does a great job in waxing my eyebrows. If you're going for full, bushy eyebrows, then you must book an appointment with him. I always leave Ulta feeling satisfied. Too bad he said he's moving back to California this April. I hope they hire someone who is as good and friendly as he is. I've been wanting to try their facial because I heard Tiffany is very good and is almost always booked. Can someone please leave a review on the Dermalogica facials? I'd love to hear about them.

I have been to many salons and seen many stylists, but I can genuinely say that I am willing to drive over an hour each way just to see Britt at Ulta because she gives me the absolute best experience. Highly recommend her!!

I've stopped in the Ulta at Clearwater Mall numerous times and they are always out of the Bare Minerals foundation that I use. I stopped in yesterday to grab a few other non-Bare Mineral items in order to save myself a trip to Macy's and they actually had it in stock, but their systems were down and they couldn't process my transaction. I understand stuff happens, but I've never been able to purchase what I need there. It's not even worth going, just go north a few exits and hit up Macy's. Same prices, better selection, better service.

Ulta is my go to for makeup, hair supplies and perfume.  The points rack up so you can splurge on yourself.  I go to Shantelle for my hair.  She is great.  Always leave her chair feeling like a new woman.

After moving from Chicago, and no longer having those awesome boutique brands at my fingertips at Marshall Fields, I started wondering, "What's a girl to do?!' Enter Ulta.

They have everything. There is just no other way to put it. Smashbox. Urban Decay. Tarte. And the 'Ulta' brand is awesome for trying out new styles or looks as they are decent quality and super low priced. Plus, they have regular sales that make their name brand products $1-$6. Crazy talk. 

Styling equipment, travel size perfumes, every shape application sponge. I could go on. But you should just go. And sign up for their club. Freebies GALORE!!!

This Ulta is very small, and not very organized. I couldn't find anything that I wanted, plus the make-up selection was minimal. I rarely go to Ulta anyways, but If I do then I'll make the drive to the one in Tampa.

Thomisa is awesome! (Sorry if I spelled her name wrong) 
She asked me what I wanted and gave me exactly it! I would definitely recommend her if going to this ulta's salon!

I went to the salon at Ulta in Clearwater for the first time this week, for a hair cut and style with Thomesa. She did an AMAZING job. I usually struggle to articulate exactly what I'm looking for in a haircut, but she totally got what I was going for, and gave me the perfect haircut. I definitely will be coming back. 
I also like this salon because they have many options for appointment hours. I work a late shift, so it was nice to easily book an appointment online at a time that worked for me, even if it was late evening.

It's Ulta, they should call it the ultimate!  All the brands you want in one location!  The rewards program is pretty nice too!  You can never go wrong with giving an Ulta gift card as a present either!

The customer services on the floor are so bad and most of the ulta employees does not have any experience on the product. I rather Google the products and look up on the reviews.....Hey manger/supervisor why don't you give your employees a quiz on a products every 3 months...

Brittany Cooper in the hair salon is wonderful!  She has been doing my hair for several years now.  She is a master colorist/stylist and will always steer you to the right choice for your hair!  You can't go wrong with her!

Great product selection. Jessica is a very attentive, smart and talented stylist who has high-end technical skills; she listens to my concerns, and cuts/styles my very-difficult hair into a totally manageable state... I'm always getting compliments on her work.

Love me some Ulta! Everything you need under one roof. That's the way to shop! 
Salon is terrific too! Very talented stylists there. Do yourself a favor, and give them a try!
The retail side feels short staffed at times, but hey, it's retail. Payroll budgets being what they are.... These folks do the best they can with what they are given. It's not the stores fault...they ALWAYS try to help even when they get overwhelmed with guests. Cut them some slack, and check it out. You'll be glad you did.

Meynor at the Benefit Brow Bar is the best! He always does a great job in waxing my eyebrows. If you're going for full, bushy eyebrows, then you must book an appointment with him. I always leave Ulta feeling satisfied. Too bad he said he's moving back to California this April. I hope they hire someone who is as good and friendly as he is.

Went in to re-stock on some items and also looked for some new products.

Staff knowledge and application was hit and miss at different counters.  Some had very limited knowledge or couldn't even put the product on.

However, I was very happy to have someone assist me throughout all my purchases and not leave me fumbling around trying to find my way.

One disappointing aspect...the staff is not knowledgeable on all promotions, etc.  I would recommend that you do your own research online before entering the store.  Also, if you are in need of a sample to test prior to purchase look elsewhere.  The staff has told me "just purchase it and return if it doesn't work".

I am used to Sephora, with way more selection. This was my first time in here, and I really expected unique and hard to find items, not basically CVS under a different name! 
So many perfumes they didn't carry. The idea of a salon in the back is really sort of weird too.
Only plus was CLARISONICS in the back with a nice selection of replacement heads.

Would I come back? Only if I really had to.

My mother decided to stop in to Pick up a small pallet of urban decay makeup another makeup artist who was a older lady came up to her to ask if she would like to see some make up that didn't age her. After being insulted she graciously said no thank you she knew what she was looking for and the older makeup artist made another snotty remark and turned to grab another client. You would think some one working in the beauty industry would have poise but obviously has none and lacks any respect for another. I am discussed by this treat meant this makeup artist only cares about a commission or reaching some kind of a number to hit a goal. Obviously she does not care about the reputation on the store or the brand she was representing. If your looking to purchase makeup in this area I would look into Sephora or MAC makeup as the makeup artist don't just see you as a commission.

I went here on a Saturday and it was sort of busy. I was looking for makeup brushes. On the right side is a brush display but all the brushes are mixed up and I couldn't find what I wanted. One of the makeup girls asked if she could help & I mentioned the mess. She just said "that's what you get with self serve." I grabbed a $50 brush kit that I thought I might like and walked around looking at the rest of the store. On the left side of the store is the "cheaper" makeup and the have more brushes and makeup supplies. I ended up buying a bunch of EcoTool brushes (I had read good review for these) for about $35 and I was able to choose the ones I wanted. 

They also had a huge amount of NYX makeup. A less expensive brand that a lot of YouTube tutorial makeup artists use. I ended up buying some brightly pigmented powders and some fun liquid liners.

I really hate false advertising. I had an offer for 20% off of nail lacquer in-store at any Ulta and when I tried to by nail lacquer the cashier said she know's nothing about the promotion and can't help me. A long ride in traffic, time to pick my colors and time waiting in their long checkout line with only 1 cashier for nothing. I'm heading to Sally Beauty across the street instead.  Perhaps they should train their employees on the promos and not hire employees who act like they don't have time to figure out how to enter that promo in the computer. See the offer that I had for Mother's Day weekend that the refused to honor in the uploaded photos.

Super friendly customer service. Everything nice and neat. However, I was looking to purchase a foundation and when I opened them to see if anyone else had opened to swatch it, they were all opened. So I ended up not being able to get a clean bottle of foundation.

Out of all the Ulta locations in the bay area this one is my favorite! The staff is just amazing and helpful without being overbearing. You know how some beauty store harass you to buy something super expensive, you won't experience that at this location. If you ask for help someone is always there to help you with a smile. The best part about this location is the selection, they always have popular brands in stock and everything is super organized and clean. The only downside is that they put more staff members on the floor than at the register so check out time can be a little long and sometimes annoying but that depends on the day and time you go.Other than the occasional long lines I never have any issues at this location.

Messy, over priced and horrible customer service. I was given a lotion as part of a gift and wanted to return it . I had no receipt but, the website says if you do not have a receipt you will get store credit. The person working the register said the item I was returning came up as $0.00 , meaning since someone in one of the Ulta stores has received the item for free I could not get store credit. This made no sense and contradicted their website policy. I left the store and returned shortly to suggest the cashier look up the phone number of the person who gave me the lotion since I had no receipt. As I was in line, the same cashier had a customer in the same predicament and suggested to her that they look up the phone number since she did not have a receipt. This should have been an option for me but never was given as one. I'm not sure why anyone would shop the items can be purchased elsewhere for much cheaper.

I have been to the store a few times and each time that I go I am never greeted with a "welcome to our store" by anyone. But listen as they greet others walking in the store after me.  While I'm in the store no one ever approaches to ask if they can help me, even when I'm wondering around as if I'm looking for something I can't find.(But I see clerks asking others if they can help them find something).  When I get to the checkout, i'm usually greeted with attitude even if I smile and say hello! (That makes me sad, it's just a common courtesy to say hello)  I believe my money spends and helps this business thrive just like the next person's dollar!  If businesses continue to hire people who can't control their personal opinions of others to do their job and don't correct the issues when they see there are bad reviews (not just one or two) that's an issue in it's self!  I fretted over giving this review because I typically hate giving bad reviews!  However, my last experience in the store made it the last time for me to enter the store! Since I am not welcome, neither is my money!  There are many more places where I can purchase the same items... where they appreciate both me and my dollars! I hope they pay attention to some of what is being said in these type of reviews (not just mine) and correct the issues for others who may be feeling like me. However, I'm done.

So far The worst Ulta Beauty store I have been at. They don't greet and they don't offer any assistance. I was looking for a shampoo and conditioner but wasn't sure which one would help me to restore my hair. I saw some staff walking by me but they even didn't try to ask me if I needed anything. Very disappointed in Ulta Beauty. This place should be about assisting people to find their beauty but not ignoring them!

I'm so glad to have an ULTA on my side of town. It is a solidly stocked store...you can find your "drugstore" makeup items, as well as a selection of designer brands. I do wish the staff were a bit more helpful...the couple of times I've been in the store I have been greeted at the door, but after that I haven't had anyone offer to help me find something (even when I've been standing in one of the sections for an extended period of time). If I know what I'm looking for, ULTA is a great choice, and the fact that you can use coupons for discounts is a plus! However, if I need assistance, I might go elsewhere (like Nordstrom, perhaps).

Excellent service! 

Elisabeth was my hair stylist and she was AMAZING! 

I have curly, dark blonde hair and when I walked in it was long. I wanted a medium cut, and Elisabeth went above and beyond! 

Elisabeth listened to my opinions, gave me hers, and talked me through everything she was doing. I felt very comfortable the moment I met her. 

Friendly, honest, experienced service. 

Very clean studio. 

Has online scheduling. 

Feel confident in this choice!

This Ulta is located in Clearwater Mall next to the Dollar Tree. I came in here looking for a mineral powder and ended up buying a new mascara, eyebrow gear and mineral powder which were all on special. The lady was very helpful and even assured me that if the color didn't match i could exchange it. well I did have to exchange it for a darker powder to match my skin tone. There are so many options so one can easily lose track of time in here (As i did!). I did however like that she gave great recommendations so that helped narrow things down.

No one acknowledged I was there. My appointment had to be moved to the next day because whoever booked it, put me in the wrong place. I show up early and my appointment was 20 minutes late. I felt very unwelcome. I usually go to the Ulta in tarpon springs and I regret coming to the Clearwater mall location. I was also quoted 65 dollars or so and was then charged 120. That is literally the point of a consultation, to talk about what you are doing and how much it would cost. Especially for your new clients. I will not be going back.

They've got the hookup for any beauty supplies you need!  Great selection and pretty average prices. Some things I've only seen here, I think they take advantage of you, so you have to be careful. You want to be beautiful, good stop though!  It's clean and well stocked. I went in to this location looking for a certain type of lip gloss and the lady looked at me like I was crazy. So I'm not sold that the salespeople really have a clue of what they know the product. I found the product on Amazon instead.
Janelle gets five stars! She is a skin care specialist that knows her stuff. If you need make up suggestions, or a bridal make up artist she is your girl!

Go to Britt for your hair services! 
She is super down to earth and  takes her time to give you what you want! She is a senior stylist and truly fantastic! Check her out for yourself! 
Instagram: @UltaBeautyBritt

All the times I have been to this Ulta I have had an amazing experience. The store is big and very well laid out. The staff is amazing and very helpful. I visited the salon for the first time yesterday and my stylist Debra was the best. She did a simple cut and style all while I had my 8 month old in my lap. I will definitely be using Debra as my regular stylist now.

Oh what a fun shop it was. First time I shopped at this Ulta. It was spacious, clean, well-lit with ample parking. The selection of cosmetic and skin care items was enormous and varied, and well- priced. The staff were extremely helpful, fun and friendly. At check out I signed up for their loyalty program and received a sample mascara .

They also have dermalogica products. Once I got facial done. I really liked it. I also got my hair done once for an event. They did a great job. My hairstylist is really good lady. Customer service is good. They have different brands like urban decay, nyx, naked etc. I love shopping there.

I was able to purchase an item there that I could not find n Westshore or International Plaza so it was great not having to order on-line and it was priced competitively . I'll be back ...
Got my brows done with Kelly. She is awesome!  The only thing I didn't like was that the brow bar is in the middle of the floor where everyone can see you.
This place is a joke, lack of selection, 0% customer service,  music so loud in place you could not think- take my advice go to cvs or walgreens instead

I set my first appointment up with Jessica Pawlowski (she has super fun green hair) and absolutely love the layers and lift I went home with. She recommended some excellent products to help remove some build up I had from EEG glue left on my head. I got exactly what I asked for and couldn't be happier with my new cut  thank you for sending me home feeling fresh!

They are always out of most of their "Ulta" make up items, The store is kept in pretty bad shape in terms of cleanliness and product stock. Product displays that should be showing off items are left bare and dirty. Tonight they had a line that was at least eight people deep throughout my whole visit with one cashier working and the rest standing around talking. 

"Samantha" came up to start cashiering and was less than pleasant. They really need to work on their store appearance and customer service at this location.
Do not buy the Ulta brand make up. It's crap. It's worse than wet n wild. Even if it's on sale don't waste your money.

This review is for the AMAZING recommendations and service I've gotten here. The ladies in the "prestige" makeup section really listen to your questions and give great suggestions. I was lost on what brow makeup to buy since I drastically changed my hair color -- and I was provided with several follow-up questions on my preferences for formula, price range, color, etc. They even thought to bring me up to the store window after application to really get a look at the colors in different lighting. Five star experience.

I recently went in for a hair cut with Hali - she was super sweet, easy to talk to, and almost had a sixth-sense about what I wanted. If you're looking for salon services, I highly recommend her!

Aside from the fabulous service, you can't beat the coupons and huge variety of stuff available, from drugstore brands to high-end.

I have been going to the Clearwater Ulta Salon and getting my hair done by Brittany Cooper/Bishop for about a year now on a regular basis. Britt is truly passionate about what she does and it shows that she enjoys her career as she is constantly taking the time to learn and progress to become even better than she already is (if that's even possible!). She really will go above and beyond for her client from what they would like done to their hair to easy scheduling. Britt is perfect to go to for any hair need such as cuts, colors, and even hair extensions. When you are in the salon chair with Britt, it's like hanging out with a friend. She is truly a genuine person. After going to Britt the first time after going to other stylists at various high-end salons in the area, I knew I never needed to go through the search of finding a stylist who would fit my hair needs and budget. I have very long hair that I want to keep long and healthy, I trust Britt 100 percent as she is always on point and delivers more than you walk in expecting every time.

You can check out her work on social media at @UltaBeautyBritt

I LOVE THIS ULTA!  I drive from Tampa to go to this store because everyone is so knowledgeable, nice and helpful.  I like this location way better than the one in Citrus Park.  I had an issue with my Rewards card and they went above and beyond to get me all fixed up.  They always give out cool freebies.  They are always have cool events & givaways.  They are never too busy to help you out or answer questions.  I have spent so much money in there already just because they always help me pick out awesome stuff!

I went there for a simple shampoo and trim. Never realizing it was going to cost me $47. I could have lived with that if the person I had was not so condescending and rude. Her name was Jessica and it was the worst experience.  I asked about the rainbow color under my hair and just said I just found out about it. She pointed out it had been around for years but never asked if I wanted to know more. Then I asked before I left about just getting my hair colored and the length charge because my hair is long. Once again, she told me no one had called it that in years and told me it depended on how many tubes they needed to use. To me it was the same difference but it seemed to make her feel better making me feel stupid.  She never even smiled or said we hope to see you again. I went up front to pay and when the cashier asked me if I wanted to leave Jessica a tip I said no. Never an inquiry why. When she mentioned enrolling for the rewards program I told her I would not be back. Once again, no inquiry why. When I worked retail this would have concerned me but apparently not them.

I have been going to Jessica for the past 7 years at the Clearwater Ulta Salon. Jessica does a fantastic job and I always get compliments on my hair styles. I have moved and still travel 45 minutes to see her for my hair service. Totally worth the trip !

I had to add this review for extraordinary experience I had at this store yesterday. I have shopped here in the past but not in a while. There has been a transformation to the attitude of the employees or there is a new team. They were so helpful and went above and beyond to wow me. I was planning on placing an on line order but went to the store to check a color for a lipstick that was an on line only sale. The staff was so kind and helpful I made my purchase there. Ulta has the best reward program and is a great place to shop. Kudos to the leadership team at the clearwater store.

I like ulta because it has high end products as well as drug store brands and products. I don't like ulta because of their shelfing and product organization. Can't find anything. Staff was friendly enough but that doesn't make me a happy customer when I come and can't get what I'm looking for because I can't find it or it's not in stock.

Britt is everything you could want in a stylist. Not only is she talented, which obviously... look at her work, but she is also HONEST.
I value that more than anything. She cares about the condition of your hair and wont agree to do something that will damage it. Even if someone else told you it could be done, believe her if she says it's a bad idea. Britt won't make promises about your hair that aren't physically possible. She isn't going to mislead you just to take your money.
If she tells you you need a treatment... you need a treatment. If she says you need a cut... you need a cut. She isn't shy about taking a photo to show you exactly what shes talking about. If anything, you'll need to reevaluate your friendships after she shows you what they've been letting you walk around with 
I'd 100% recommend making an appointment with her if you want to be satisfied with someone who has your hair's best interest at heart. I think she's also in the running for Best of the Bay... vote for her!

Was in Ulta for about 20mins and no one asked if I needed help. I was by one of the make up stations that has all their products and 3-4 employees walked by and didn't ask if I needed help. There were 3 customers who came in after me and were approached by someone.

If you're looking to get your hair done go to Niccole, she is amazing. I've gone to her at other locations and she's brought my hair back to life after another stylist damaged it. She's always great with advice. The products they use here keep my hair feeling great. 

Outside of the salon everything is organized and easy to find and so much variety. Very well managed. Everyone's nice at this location.

My only complaint about the salon is I wish it was more closed off to give you more of a salon relaxation feel but at least it's all the way in the back.

I have only been here a few times. The first two times was just exploring the store, didn't feel like it was much of anything until my third time when I met Heather. She's a make up artist there and wow she is so knowledgeable about not just make up but what products will look good on you along with what fits with your needs. She was funny and energetic, really knew what she was talking about. She recommended me the right kind of make up for what I needed. I told her I'm sensitive to certain brands and also love the more natural look. So she walked around and picked up products for me to test and voila, I walked out feeling so happy and confident about my purchase. No buyer's remorse because I have concealer that matches my skin. An eye palette for everyday use that is easy for travel with. And a nice kit for skincare to illuminate and soften my skin. Anyways, love going to beauty stores with staff that knows their stuff. Find Heather when you go there, she's like the girlfriend or sister you always needed to teach you about the do's and don'ts about makeup. She has a keen eye for color and will be real with you if something doesn't look good. Great experience, will be coming here for makeup needs now!

Scotty was awesome, great cut and color, he is a consummate professional!!! He's the MAN!!!
Melissa

I wanted to give an update, my stylist extraordinaire, Britt Cooper, has moved onto bigger and brighter things!  After her talent was recognized by Salon Emilani, she now has an unstoppable future of growth and fantastic services!  She now has access to even better hair care products and techniques to tame even the most unruly hair.  Please go see her at her new location at Salon Emilani in Clearwater 727-755-1990 (29273 US Highway 19 North, Clearwater, FL 33761)

Jessica has been styling my hair for over 5 years. She does an amazing job and I always get so many compliments on my hair styles. I have a special needs daughter and Jessica is always so patient with her and does a fantastic job.
Ulta is a bit more pricey but I believe you get what you pay for and I'm worth it :)

I love this Ulta.  I started coming here about 18 months ago to get my brows waxed.  Maynor is the best.  He has a heart of gold and is phenomenal at what he does.  I receive compliments on my brows everyday.  I'm Also somewhat of a palette addict and they have great exclusive choices.  I also love their events and their makeup/makeovers.  It's not like Sephora where you have to buy something.  I LOVE their Dermalogica products and Tiffany does a great job with facials.  Their rewards beat The Sephora VIB hands down.  You earn points that allow you to purchase anything in the store VS picking from a few items. I like Sephora but I LOVE My Ulta!!!!!

I've been getting my hair done by Britt Bishop for a couple years now. She is so great, super friendly and really fantastic hairstylist. She gets the color right and always trims and thins out my hair the way I like it. I come every month for my root touch ups. Highly recommend her as a stylist and Ulta in general.
Britt B is amazing ! I had horrible highlights and she fixed my hair so it blended and looked refreshed! She was sweet, gentle and honest! So thankful for her! She is truly talented-

I went to Ulta knowing I was going to drop a pretty penny on some makeup. I needed a new shadow palette and contour palette. 

Number 1, apparently the ULTA in CLEARWATER FL needs a new stock team/manager whatever. Everything I tried to look at and liked was out of stock. That was AT LEAST 3 different shadow palettes and 2 different contour palettes.

Then the store associate directed me to a MORPHE palette. Iv heard of this brand but I don't know much about it besides Jefferee Star talks about it on his little channel. So I said ok the colors in this palette are nice and wow it's so cheap I wonder why? But thinking oh it's Ulta they have good products even if it's on the side cheap side of the store. I take it home not thinking to even look at the ingredients or where it's made. Today I flipped it over and I found out it's made in CHINA. NO WONDER why it's so cheap. These products everyone rave about, contain some not so nice ingredients in them that can harm you down the road. Not to mention it's not cruelty free. Especially coming from China. 

Hey Ulta get it together and train your staff better. When someone comes in looking to spend at least $100-$150 on new product and the store associate points me to the $12 product, talking about how great this brand is. No thanks.

Had a makeup appointment at 12:30pm for a bridal brunch that same day. Got there at 12:30 and apparently they moved my appointment to 1pm and changed the person who was doing my makeup. I was super shocked because I specifically requested a certain person to do it based on recommendations. They called me to confirm my appointment 1 hour before my originally scheduled appointment and because I didn't call them right back they moved everything around. Will not be coming back to this store or using the salon here anymore. Super disappointed in how they run things

This store was amazingly clean, well organized and well stocked. The staff was exceedingly friendly and helpful. I was happy to shop and spend my gift card here.   Did I spend money too? YOU betcha!  I will certainly be back!

I go to Jessica in the Ulta salon and I am always happy with her haircuts and styles. I avoided cutting my hair for years because of bad experiences but I have come back to her repeatedly. She always listens to me and takes her time. I would recommend her to anybody.

People are not exaggerating about Britt. This is possibly the best cut and style I've ever had in my entire life. It's absolutely perfect and exactly what I asked for, right down to being able to clip back my bangs when I want to. My appointment was at 7pm and she called for me at 7:03 and apologized for the wait! She apologized because I had to wait for 3 minutes!! She was so nice and there were no awkward pauses in conversation, which is really easy to do with me because I'm very introverted. She seemed genuinely interested in getting to know me and how I like to look. It was the absolute best experience I've ever had with a new stylist and she has herself a new regular client. This Ulta is a bit out of my way but it was so worth it. Thank you, Britt!! You're amazing!

II won't be going back, ever.  I  booked a hair color appointment with Staci over a month ago.  I got two text messages reminding me of my appointment.  I took off work early for my 4:15 appointment and when I arrived promptly there were 3  employees in the solon and I did not see any customers, or Staci.  They advised me that Staci doesn't work on Mondays and I didn't understand why I was there.  One employee advised that "someone" booked my appointment on HER schedule.  I advised that this appointment was important to me since I was going out of town and needed a touch up that had been scheduled for over a month.  She never offered to give me the touch up I needed.   All three just kept staring and the computer and acting like this was all my fault.  One offered to call Staci but I said what's the point?  After standing there with nothing being offered I told them to forget it and I walked away.  I purchased a product I needed and the girl at the register was just as inconsiderate as the salon employees.  I will never go back.  No offense to Staci, I really liked how she did my hair the last two appointments but the poor thing has to work with incompetent, rude, uncaring people who just cost her a client.

I went to Jessica at Ulta Beauty in the Clearwater Mall. After a not great at all cut (grew out uneven) somewhere else.  She saw the picture of what I wanted (touch up the layers, and fix my bangs).  She discussed with me what was going to work and what wouldn't. She asked before putting product in my hair.  All of these little things made a difference with me.  I felt like it was a true consultation, and on Election Day it was slow, but she didn't rush at all.  The cut turned out beautifully- the layers were defined and blended, the bangs were what I had in mind.  I will definitely be back to see her in 6 months!

I went into Ulta (Clearwater) sometime last year for a nail polish, had no idea there was a salon. After scheduling an appointment with any of the ladies available as soon as possible for root touch up, I was set up with Elizabeth M. 
A year later and I cannot be more content with this lovely lady, she's a pro at what she does!
After talking (for months)about going lighter from my pitch black hair, patiently she spent hours foiling my very thick hair. I was hesitant but "jumped" in and trusted her expertise. Thank goodness I did, I love it!!!
I had to stop in a few days later just to tell her how much I loved my new hair color, now I want to go even lighter ‍

Elizabeth M rocks!!

I've been seeing Elizabeth at the Ulta salon in Clearwater for just over a year now and could not be happier with my hair. I used to color my own hair because I have a lot of natural red and felt like I could never afford ably maintain anything that wasn't red. I was so wrong. After my latest attempt (and failure) and a big trip ahead of me, I broke down and went to Ulta with my tail between my legs. She did was so understanding and kind and actually taught me some of the science behind color mixing and just how difficult it can be when you're not trained. I admitted defeat and the outcome is this GORGEOUS look I've been wearing for the last year. My hair has grown so much faster, too, thanks to keeping it healthy and not over processing it with box dye. Do yourself a big favor, STOP using $12 box dye and go let this amazing soul work her magic on you! You will not regret it.

An added benefit is getting basically FREE makeup when you level up in your Ulta reward points. Salon services count towards that!

Called to find out if they had a certain item in stock. The lady who answered the phone was super rude but informed me that they had the product. Drove 20 minutes to go get it and couldn't find it when I got to the store. No staff on the sales floor, had to go to the register to get help. Surprise surprise, they didn't have the item. Girl bye, I'm going back to Sephora.

Where do I begin? I had a very big day my graduation from nursing school and I wanted my makeup done professionally. But I did not want to look like a clown. I went to Sarah and she did an amazing job my makeup was on point I looked natural and elegant. She knew her stuff and gave me good advice. My face was perfect throughout the ceremony and remained flawless all night.

Just had the most amazing dry cut done by Jessica P! First stylist that I have found here that will do a dry cut for my naturally curly hair! She is absolutely amazing and I can't wait to see what she does with color!

Ulta used to have way better and nicer customer service than Sephora but that's been shifting lately. Every time I come in here and have an interaction with an employee, I feel like they just wish I would shut up and leave. And good luck trying to use any coupon or explaining any transaction issue to the cashiers, they won't understand, tell you you're wrong and get an attitude. On the other hand, when I go into Sephora lately they are much more welcoming and seem like they actually have genuine opinions on products and want to help. 

Not too long ago I came in here and asked the girl for a basic, hydrating under eye cream. She recommended me a 65$ anti wrinkle cream from a random high end brand, mind you I'm 19 years old... I stated again "oh you know I just want a good hydrating one, maybe 20-30$" her response was "you should check the drug store" and walked away. Customer service of the year, folks. 

Only reason for two stars and not one is because they carry certain brands I like that Sephora/Walgreens don't carry.

I've never been more upset leaving a cosmetic store. I spent 76.00$ and would have possible spent more if someone would have helped me. I was patiently waiting for this store associate to finish helping other customers and as soon as she was done she said "excuse me" to me as if I was in her way. Instead, she should've said do you need any help. I should've put all my products back and went to Sephora.

This is Britt (stylist from the reviews), and I wanted to leave a review here because I am relocating and want to make sure that my Ulta salon family still gets some love. 

Jessica, Elizabeth M, Scotty, Amanda, and Elizabeth L are all amazing stylists whom I've had the pleasure of working with for the past few years. You really can't go wrong booking an appointment with any of them. 

Check them out on social media: @ultasalonclearwater

I'm happy to see that Melissa D at the ulta salon has plenty of great reviews, I wish I had the same experience. She reached out and told me to come in later for my appointment, then ran an hour over when she told me to come in. I came in with hair healthy enough to stand a color correction, I had a consultation with 4 other stylists & loved Melissa's energy so I booked with her. Lightener was left on my ends for 30 minutes, applied incorrectly and not close enough to my outgrowth, while she walked away to get her lunch & eat. You don't leave lightener unattended like that. Then came back and applied lightener to my regrowth & the dark, precolored spots it should have originally been applied to and let that process for an additional 30 minutes. When she finally rinsed me out, she was calm & cool until walking away & coming back freaking out about how my hair was breaking & that this was my fault bc of previous colors, insisting that I cut 4-5 inches off of my hair. I told her to tone me & stop service bc i no longer trusted her with my hair, in which she continued applying different products before finally toning my hair. I spent 35 minutes crying at the shampoo bowl bc a stylist I put faith in failed, as a stylist the integrity of hair is most important and at no point did she offer other options during the lightening stages. I was open to options if I could not reach my end goal, but she instead chose to ignore the integrity of my hair for an end goal, thanks for the hot roots. The whole experience was awful and unprofessional, leading back to her rinsing a test strand out of my hair by having me crouch next to the shampoo sink with a towel over my face & getting my face all wet. I should have stopped service when I originally was concerned, but I figured there was a reason she was doing things the way she was, although no other stylist I know & was speaking with during my service condoned any of the things she was doing. I now have ridiculous amounts of breakage that have to be cut, and a chemical burn from lightener on my scalp. The store manager said that they cannot do anything for me unless I come in during certain times, I do not live local nor am I waiting to have my hair cut to fix the damage or see a doctor about the chemical burns. I still paid, and I still tipped. I will cut my losses and accept the loss of money, because that wasn't even the concern, I was looking to be heard by management, not told how great Melissa usually is. What a way to conduct business.

such a friendly place!!! being shy it's hard for me to ask and accept help with finding my correct color foundation or asking about products but everyone is here to help. I am always offered help and usually I am very glad I accept because they always show me great service. they allow time to get to know about your skin and that helps with finding products that help you! the lady that helped me today tried 4 foundations before we found the perfect one then showed me concealer pounder and moisturizer for my skin type AND gave me a ton of free samples. always very happy with my purchases and the set up of the place is great. easy to find any brand you need

I had highlights and a haircut by Britt today. She performed a miracle on my hair, turning it from a long, frizzy mess into a thing of beauty. My hair has never looked this good. My husband loved it. I highly recommend her, and will go back again when I need her services again.

Talk about unwelcoming! When first walking through the door, no one spoke no one says hello how are you? Do you need help? Or not even a welcome to Ulta! The customer service experience in here was by far the worst. Even after walking through the store multiple times looking for someone to help me, no one spoke or attempted to direct me. Not only that, I had a sleeping 1 year old in my arms. Doesn't that scream I want to purchase and go. I literally had to interrupt an associate in the middle of her sales pitch and ask for assistance next. Although she was wearing no badge. All of the grandmas (older gray haired self entitled teenage job working females) really seemed unbothered and even seemed to  be avoiding me. I finally sat down at the makeup counter to see would someone approach me. Still no. And it wasn't a busy Sunday at all. I totally interrupted a hairstylist and asked where my product was. They no longer carry it. ‍

With all the products in that store, it was overwhelming but Rachel was so friendly and helpful. She know her products and wasn't pushy at all. She explained that due to COVID, we weren't allowed to try the products but that we could bring things back for a full refund. I really appreciate all her help. She ended up finding me the perfect products in the perfect shades so I didn't need to return a thing. I LOVE that they have so many cruelty-free, vegan and eco-friendly products. So pleased with my experience!!

Everything was ok until I tried to check out and the cashier with the pink hair was really slow. The customers before me had a lot of questions and the cashier kept talking to them knowing that I was waiting for about 10 minutes to just check out with my 2 item. Then she asked me for my email and phone number which I thought was unnecessary and asked to "skip it please" to which I received an attitude from. After paying I said "thank you"  and got no answer back. Very rude and I will not be returning. Good luck with a store where the CASHIERS are rude to people who don't want to chit chat and spend their whole day there. Completely ridiculous. Today I went there around 3:30 pm on 10/18/20. Get better cashiers and maybe your reviews will be better. Disappointing.

I've been going to this location since moving to this area three years ago.

I've never had any issues with this place. Let me tell you, join the rewards club. Secondly, they give coupons to the point that I can't use them all!

As a makeup user- I describe my usage as low to medium. I feel like the less I put on, the less I mess up, and the less I have to take off at the end of the day, lol. So that being said, I don't BUY a whole lot of makeup either. But when I do- this is my place.

Not to mention- the birthday gifts! I look forward to mine next month!

Yep, I'll be back!

God awful experience!! This store needs a better system for customers waiting patiently in line to make purchases. I waited 30 min total while the line next to me was breezing through being pregnant it made it very uncomfortable just waiting for my turn to come up. They should've brought up another person to start taking the next person in line to help out at least for a little bit. Then I make it finally to get rung up and they do not have the free product that was supposed to be at the register for my purchase of 60 or more on shampoo and conditioner. Which I did ask a clerk on the floor where it was and she Informed me it was at the register so now I was asked to wait while they looked in the back which meant having the people behind me wait even longer now. I just wanted out of there and cancelled my purchase. So disappointed I waited for absolutely nothing. Will not be back to this store.

If your in need of hair services see Monica! She's by  far the best! She's been doing my hair for years and I refuse to go to another stylist! She's very attentive to your needs and very friendly and easy to talk to! She takes her time and really goes above and beyond any expectations.

Run! don't walk to set your hair appointment with Britt Bishop at Ulta Beauty Salon Clearwater.  This talented young woman with a wide range of style capabilities is sure to make anyone's day brighter.  She does the most amazing looking natural colors and highlights to some of the most creative and funky bright colors and everything in between.  I have gotten the most compliments on my hair since going to her.
I went to her after being talked down to at the Seminole Ulta and Britt totally turned my day around by being warm and kind.  She is a stylist that gets it.  She wants your experience to be fantastic at every turn.  She is NOT one of those stylists that sits there and makes you listen to all of the personal drama and negativity.  This woman is a ray of sunshine!  She is going to go far!  Catch an appointment with her while you still can!!!
Love this Ulta. Best selection and is organized well

I cannot say enough good things about Britt! I went in needing a color correction and walked out knowing who I will be coming to see moving forward. She took the time and listened to what had gone wrong with the previous color and what I was really looking for. She was very friendly and down to earth. She didn't make me feel bad for my (lack of) hair care, but instead gave suggestions to improve my day to day routine. If you're looking for a new stylist, I highly recommend her!

I haven't been wearing lipgloss with my mask and didn't realize I forgot to bring any with me for a date until I was in route 20 minutes away from home.  ulta to the rescue!  Multiple associates not only asked if needed help, suggested brands and then colors within the brand that would work best for me.  When I told the associate I wore Buxom before but couldn't remember the color without seeing the names she guessed it on the first try.  I had mentioned I was looking for a mini or sale item since it was literally just needed for today and she helped me find an item that fit my needs perfectly!  Thanks so much to the attentive and knowledgeable staff for saving the day!
Jessica was simply amazing. She made me feel comfortable and at ease with an awesome cut. 5 stars all the way !

This store is amazing as far as products and selection is concerned. I can always find what I am looking for when I go there. The staff on the other hand are quite rude. They aren't helpful at all and all of them act and look as though they are having a terrible day. Checking out is a terrible experience. Every time I have been there the girls at the register act like they are above you. The store would be the complete package if the staff was nice and helpful.
Melissa Sunshine is the best! She took her time with my long curly hair, educated me on so many products and was super cool! I recommend her 100%!!!

Let me preface my review by saying I shop here all the time and I hope this was a "one off" experience that I had just a few minutes ago. The store wasn't busy. I walked up to the cashier. She told me to "wait a minute" and proceeded to be doing something on her phone. I waited approximately 5 minutes and she never even acknowledged me again. I finally just walked out and left my purchases there. So disappointing! I could understand if they were busy but waiting while a cashier plays on her phone is unacceptable!

Bad experience, so disappointed by how Ulta employees treat their customers.
I had a problem with my coupon that was not correctly applied towards my purchase/exchange and I came back to correct it. The girl working there did not understand the situation and wrongly believed that it was already applied. She tried to convince me, I tried to explain her her mistake...
Instead of apologizing and correcting mistake she became confrontational and started to have an attitude. She called her manager saying very loudly "I have a customer who does not understand the coupon!" (in front of everyone).
The manager came and she was also giving an attitude (I won't go into details about what else she said) but after 10 minutes of explaining them how the system works they understood the mistake and gave me the promised discount. They admitted I was actually right, but it was no apology just disrespectful glares.
I don't want to go back to this location where employees are not properly trained and are disrespectful.
I also noticed that they were out of few items that I was looking for, the shelves being empty-ish. There were no employees around to help out. I had to walk all the way to the cashiers, every time I had a question.

Please get it together and DON'T set all the product alarms off to set up your products in the middle of a busy day! The sound was so irritating for over 20 min that I couldn't take it and left with nothing. You have made shopping during the holiday season and covid worse than it has to be. Left with nothing.

I've never thought the customer service here was that great, but i enjoy being able to get my drugstore makeup along with my more professional products side by side without having to go to another location. Any questions I have asked have never been answered by staff here. I don't think they are trained beauty professionals, like sephora seems to be. I've asked if they carried a certain line and was met with a blank face and just left wandering around the shop. Coupons are sent through the mail which are GREAT! They also usually have some awesome gifts with ourchase with thier perfumes. So check it out, just know what you are looking for before going. Because they might not be much help in store.

I walked around the store and not one person asked if I needed help! 
Since most cosmetic purchases are impulse buys, why wouldn't you show a customer in your store the latest and greatest to get more money in the till? I guess not!

I so want to like this store - great location, good selection of products.  But the employees  seemed to size me up and dismiss me immediately.  The make-up woman (who took pains to tell me she doesn't work for Ulta) couldn't answer my questions and referred me to the hair guy, who seemed reluctant to approach. (Yes, I'm in my 50's, but I'm quite presentable.)  Once I finally got the hair guy (needs a shave, wardrobe consultation, and please rethink that pink hair - it doesn't inspire confidence!) to answer my questions he spoke while digging around in his ear with his fingertip, and then briefly examining the results.  He didn't really know anything about the product, but parroted a line about sulfate-free shampoos, and was not apologetic that they don't have any sample-cups in stock - shrugged as if it didn't really matter.  The checkout girl gave me an awful look when I asked if my coupon had registered (seems it only shows when they total it up).   The entire experience was demoralizing, and I'm still fuming.  Will I return?  Only because they are the only local outlet for a product line I like, although I'll certainly see if I can get it online next time rather than go through this type of experience again.  Store manager, please read this!  You need to retrain and replace employees.
Hair dresser didn't care about a 30 minute delay in an appointment after she took her sweet time talking to the previous client.

I live right by this store and have thus made countless trips to it. Unfortunately the convenience of the location is about all it's got going for it. The store is continuously disorganized with no one willing to help you sort through the chaos. Once you've finally found what you've come for, you can count on a line that's at least 10 people long... and although there may only be one person on the registers, there are always plenty of employees wandering around with seemingly nothing to do. Instead of hoping on the registers to help the line, they simply stand by and watch. Although frustrating, they do have a great selection of products. You just need to be committed to searching through the store for them.

Two stars for product selection. If it didn't have a great selection, I would award this store zero stars. I have been to several different Ulta stores, and the staff at this location are the rudest, by far. Not sure why, as this area isn't as swanky as it used to be, so there's really no need for the attitude. Unfortunately, this remains the closest Ulta store to me, so I will continue to suffer, unless Sephora has what I need. (I have actually started increasing my Sephora visits because of this store.)

If this place didn't have the products I needed I would never go back here. Unfortunately, I'm a little bit of a product junkie and sephora doesn't have everything. I don't understand why the customer service is so bad. It's extremely hard to find someone to help you and when you do they're probably put it anyway. On my last visit he line was literally wrapped around the store. When i finally made it to the register the the cashier was incredibly rude about my return even though I was purchasing several other items.  *sigh* Hopefully they build another location in the area...

My experiences with ULTA have been pretty good in terms of customer service and assistance. I even had a decent facial here once - though I will say the facial area could benefit from a makeover itself; it seems a little makeshift and not immune to the noise from the sales floor.

On the other hand, I have been let down a few times by the inventory here. Not that the store doesn't have a decent selection of brands, they just seem to be out of things quite often. And, of course, such things are always best-sellers and the exact product I am looking for. An example: the Pur Minerals color-correcting primer for red tones....I love it and it works, but after two different trips to ULTA to get it and discovering they were out, I broke down and bought the Smashbox version at Sephora. If it's that good of a product, why don't they stock larger quantities of it? 

I do think, overall, the staff at ULTA do a better job of keeping displays and testers presentable - and useable. I also find them to be more eager to offer advice and application assistance than the Sephora gang. ULTA also has the cheaper, drugstore lines so you don't have to make another stop to get some fresh GreatLash to go with your Stila shadow palette.

I have come into this store three times. Every single time I have left upset. 

Today I came in looking for a specific Eyeshadow palette. I didn't see it so I asked an associate if they were sold out or if they simply were online only, or had not gotten it in, and the employee shrugged at me and didn't say anything. I asked again and she said she didn't know. 

I then went to check out with a few small items I didn't really even need, and the associate helping me used my ulta rewards points without asking me if I wanted to. He said something about not having the birthday gift and threw "next months birthday gift" in instead. 
It is literally the second day of the month first of all. Second of all if they had said they were out I would have told them I didn't want the item and would have waited til the end of the month to see if anything else came at the tail end. I had my card on the table and he swiped it and was talking a mile a minute about it being the end of the night. When I saw he used the points, I told him I didn't want him to do that. And he got really disgruntled and then spent a few minutes returning and repurchasing the item, and after that said I would have to call customer service "to fix my mistake". Ok. 

Everyone has a bad day, and it was the end of the night. I get it. He seemed really nice just desperate to leave and there were still like 6 people in the store. But there is no reason to be pushy and act like your customer is putting you out when they are asking for something the store itself offers. I don't know it just really rubbed me the wrong way. 
From now on if I have to order from ulta I'm sticking to online orders. Every time I visit this location it stresses me out, but maybe someone else will catch them having a better day.

This review serves to warn others before you spend your hard earned cash here under the impression that you're getting "deals." 

After pricing a few frequently used items here, i.e. make-up, shampoo and conditioner, perfume, I've found the items are no less inexpensive and all can be found online for a more reasonable price. The quality of the products are questionable, as well. I purchased a bare minerals make-up brush that shortly afterward the brush hair started falling out and the handle came completely unglued. The cherry on top was finding out it was exactly the same price as the brushes you can purchase at the BM store in the Fashion Mall. 

In my experience, when I have asked the staff questions about products or for help in the store in general, I have been met with passive attitudes and annoyance in their tone of voice. I have also noticed the lack of cleanliness and organization on their display shelves. This could be for a number of reasons and having worked retail before, I find this to be blatant neglect. 

The ulta rewards card is hardly rewarding. I do not consume enough beauty products in a condensed amount of time to cash in on the measly $7 - $10 cash back after spending upwards of $100.

Ulta has pretty much everything you could want when shopping for beauty supplies. They have both salon and drug store brands. NYX is a really good cheaper brand. Some of my other fave brands are: Urban Decay, Macadamia Professional Hair Care, Buxom, Too Faced. Easy to shop in store or online.
Ulta is a great place to find fun and inexpensive makeup..as well as quality brands!

I stopped into this location for the first time recently, and I am incredibly unimpressed. There were several employees hovering around me as I was shopping, but not one of them asked me if I needed help in the whole hour plus that I was in there. Meanwhile, every other person in that store had been asked if they needed assistance. In fact, as I browsed the high-end cosmetics, I was sort of pushed out of the way so they could help others several times. Perhaps I have a suspicious face and I look like a lipstick thief. Could be. 

Lucky for them I was feeling particularly generous that day and still spent $80. They do have a decent selection of items I otherwise only have access to through online vendors, such as NYX and Essence. Will I be back, though? Nah. The customer service was a real turn-off and their testers are a gunked-up mess. Their competitor's too close by for me to bother with a wannabe Sephora again.

The store is nice and when browsing have found a few neat items in sample sizes so I don't have to commit to a $45 bottle of some new shampoo. I really like the online option because the prices are much better than in the store. I found the store carries everything I can find cheaper in local retail stores. Nothing particularly wowed me. Sales people were nice but not overly knowledgeable.

I visit this location frequently, and I've always experienced a friendly, helpful staff. The recent remodel has greatly improved the layout, and makes it easier to find specific brands or items. I'm glad that this location finally has a brow bar, but I've yet to use it.
Free testers/samples of practically everything!  Not too much for guys, mainly for women.   There's a little salon in the back, but it's kind of pricey (for men anyway).

The staff need to be more cheerful and ask customers if they need help! I hate going to those kinds of places and feeling neglected, or even like a nuisance when I do finally ask for help or go to check out.

To me, Ulta isn't any cheaper or better-stocked than Sephora, and with a decidedly lower-scale feel. The white theme gets easily and visibly dirty, and some of the products smell rancid at times. Plus, the Ulta brand repeatedly disappoints me. The powder has that chalky look and not true-to-skintone colors; the lipsticks, while prettily shaded, tend to smell like old cosmetics. 

As far as I've seen, the prices for the upscale stuff are more expensive that at department stores. They wanted like $40 for Sugar perfume here, when I've bought it for $35, I believe, at Sephora.

This place is like heaven.. I used to work there a while back... I went in there a couple weeks ago and had my daughter with me. Phyllis..the manager followed me all through the store making sure I didn't steal anything... I was the ONLY one being followed. Even by other employees because they all wore the headset so I'm very sure that she told them to watch me.. You let me know how I'm supposed to steal with a very fussy 1 year old.. I guess I'd have to be a very good multi tasker huh? I hate shopping here...

Came here looking for a product my wife uses regularly.  Seeked to find but could not.  Approached an employee that was standing by a counter (watching us look) and asked for the specific item by name. She looked at me and shrugged.  My wife found another employee that was much more willing to help.

Unfortunately this Ulta is the closest to my house and I feel as thought the staff are almost racist . Not once have I ever been greeted by a white employee and I have even walked in with white women and they were greeted but I was not . I've also had someone leave in the middle of me talking to go help out a white customer . If you need anything you kind of have to figure it out yourself . It's very uncomfortable, so now I usually have to order online because shopping there is not fun. This store doesn't do a good job of stocking their shelves either .

I love Ulta, but this location is not great.  Many employees, including management, seem completely under interested in working, helping customers, or doing anything except stand around and seem irritated when you ask questions.  The last time I was in, there was one manager and two employees standing near the registers talking and I asked if one could ring me up.  All they said was - no, we are not on register.  Really?  

When I have asked for specialty products, they seem to have no clue whether they carry items or not and are downright unwilling to do any leg work to find out.  The last time I was there, the salesgirl literally said, "I don't see it where I thought it would be, so we probably don't have it." Me - can you check and make sure. Her - I don't know how I would do that. 

I go here because it's cheap, close, and the selection is pretty good.  I wish there was a better managed one near me.

I spent a half-hour here and was not greeted or assisted by a single employee. It wasn't busy, and there were two of them talking to each other towards the back of the store and a couple more stocking near the front.  I made a purchase and paid cash. I did not care for the product (a little guidance might have been helpful), and when I went to return it, they wanted my name and number. They sure didn't need that when they were taking my money! Spend a little more if possible and go across the street to Sephora.

Was not greeted when I walked in. Don't ever come here so I had no idea where anything was, so assistance would have been appreciated. 
It took awhile to find an associate to help me. Once I did everything was easy from there.

As I was approaching the check out line, I saw someone with a coupon on their device, so I googled a coupon a coupon and found one!!

So I recommend ALWAYS at least googling to see. Who doesn't like to save money?!?!?

Convenient location and hours. All the beauty supplies I could ever need, along with drug store brands. Clean, professional salon staff. Affordable services. Kelli did a great job on my hair, sad to hear she's leaving!

I'm new to Indy and have never been to this ulta before. I walked in and was not greeted, but a white woman walked in after me and was greeted by both the women behind the counter. I asked, I assume the manager, for help. She helped, but as if I were an inconvenience to her and not a guest. I will not be returning although this is the closest ulta to my home. I didn't feel welcomed so I'll take my business else where.

This isn't a store you'd typically find me in. However, it was mum's day so we did what mum wanted.

So, we rolled int Ulta with this mission in mind: find mom all new makeup...turns out ten year Clinique isn't doing the trick any more. Mom sat down with Tia and rolled through everything from foundation and lips to mascara and moisturizer. Tia did a fantastic job of educating and offering hands-on tips with each of the products. Nothing felt rushed throughout the experience. 

The store itself is filled from top to bottom with hair masks, shampoos, lotions, fake eyelashes, hair accessories, liptsick, you name it. They've got it. It was both overwhelming and fun to explore this uncharted territory. I tend to hold on to my makeup until its on its last leg and only update when necessary. This certainly gave me a glimpse into the world of intense makeup. 

Be prepared to spend a boatload. But note that they have a decent amount of products highlighted in the clearance sections in the back. They're easy to spot.

I go into the salon pretty regularly and get a cut, area highlight and occasionally low lights. I ALWAYS see Micheline. She's such a sweetheart and so easy to talk to. I have loved every cut I've gotten from her and my highlights are so close to the scalp is amazing. I've had previous stylists before who try to highlight as close as they can to the root, but it usually ends up streaky or bleeds. They can't come close to replicating what Micheline does. I've seen some of her other clients leaving and they are just as thrilled as I am. Definitely go see her! It's worth it.

Emily here at store 168 gave me the best customer service I have ever had at an Ulta. I am a diamond member and have been with Ulta for a while. More times than I can count I will spend 30-45 mins wondering around without any assistance, or a hello. (This was only my second visit to this Ulta as it is out of my way)Emily was very sweet she gave me answers to questions I have wondered about for a while. She matched me with a perfect prestige foundation. I went in there to test out some drug store options and she set me up with those too. I was so impressed with her customer service skills I assumed she was a manager. So I asked her if she was she replied that she is not. Employees like Emily is why I am a firm believer in internal promotions. I do not live close to the store I had this experience at. But for that kind of customer service it's worth the Extra drive. I hope one day to find that Emily is as appreciated by the Ulta family as she is by the customers.

Let me start this post by stating I was nervous going to new hairdresser. I was feeling spontaneous on Monday, and decided to get my haircut on a whim. Nothing fancy, a few layers, a little shorter, it can't be that hard right? WRONG. I left the studio with a large drop in length on one side, while the rest of my hair was one length.
