In Ulta I felt like I was on my own and most of the employees couldnt give a crap. Though I will say the one girl who helped me find a replacement lipliner was nice. But I wont be back unless its necessary.

Every time I go here, the staff is beyond rude. The salon also isn't so fabulous. I had gotten my nails done and the polish peeled off the next day. I went back to see if they could fix my nails and was turned away.

Every time I stop in here for a wax, no one is working the brow bar. It's really disappointing! Ulta and benefit changed things about a year ago so that walk-ins would be easier to come by... well, they're definitely not easy to come by when no one is working! Sucks, because it's hands down my favorite wax.

Updated review because as awful as the manager below is--is as off the charts STELLAR as the district manager who called me the next day . She was amazing . I still can't change my stars (yet) because the first experience was beyond the pale , but I hope this prompts a change .


How do you spell "worst customer ever ?"
"C-A-R-M-E-N."
Went in with my Mom today to treat her to some nice perfume and dr Brandt 's eye depuffer.
We were pointed to the "back of the store "
We were clearly looking around as 2 women talked amongst themselves --both obviously spotting us--both ignored us completely . Guess the conversation was more important . Stood there for about 20 seconds while they talked and then finally walked up and ventured to ask--the one girl finally helped us and was pretty nice --this Carmen chick , as her name tag pronounced --turned on her heels and arrogantly clicked away .

Fast forward to me purchasing said items for mom at register and more clueless looks from mindless automatons . My Mom asked nicely if they possibly had any samples (you would have thought she had asked for their first born child)

Rude rude rude .

Fast forward yet another time in the same DAY because I had sprayed a perfume I loved and wanted to return and buy it and figure out what it was .

Walked past the counter where not 1, but FOUR to FIVE sales associates were congregating and shooting the breeze. I was about 2 feet from them for at least 5 minutes obviously looking for something and still not one of them asked if I needed help .

Ask again --same girl , Carmen, Rudely turns on her heels while same sweet girl (wearing a head scarf ) and another associate help me.


See Carmen blandly poised at the register where she looks severely put out that she has to deign to lazily ring someone up.

I asked the girls who were helping me "
Is that your manager " (knowing that sometimes the manager will have better things to do than answer questions (not really !) and defer to the associates .

Nope . Not a manager . Just a brat .

And to top it off the whole back of the store is a hot MESS and jumble of racks that need to be Re shelved.

Wonder if these girls could be doing something useful .

I will return because it's right by my office , but not for the awful and rude customer service .
 I'd rather give my money to sephora if I van

Do not buy a gift card from the coked out cashiers in this store. The experience to purchase the gift card was questionable when the cashier repeatedly failed at activating and processing the transaction. Selling a gift card is retail 101. This cashier was clearly too high to manage that. I was uncomfortable witnessing it. The drama as only escalated as I have repeatedly and unsuccessfully tried to cope with the horrendous Ulta corporate customer services team who is incapable of rectifying the worst transaction experience ever. When you don't pay your staff, they get coked out trying to work 3 jobs and steal from store customers in the process. I'm grateful that there are so many other beauty stores, drug stores and salons within a 3 block radius of this store. I'll never shop here again. It's too scary of an experience to put myself through that again.

My review is solely on the Brow Bar. I had some free time on a Monday so I called for an appointment. I was able to get right in. Being behind on the trends, I am not big on brows and get waxed every 3 months or so. I was scheduled with Christina who was warm and friendly. The waxing did not hurt at all. She gave me a great shape and after showed me how to pencil/tips for creating an arch. Will be going back.

Not a single person approached me in the store. Employees would rather talk to each other than help other customers with products. I only use Ulta because points turn into money instead of gifts, but the service at Sephora is much better and the employees are actually knowledgeable about what's best for your needs.

Went in to see if there was an opening at the brow bar earlier in the week, she said no she had an appointment in thirty minutes. Which seemed odd to me because no one was there, and many times they will squeeze someone in if the next appointment is not for 30 minutes. I said I would come another time. Went back today, and three staff were talking in the front. I asked if they had any appointments and was told she was going to get the book. Again she had an appointment 30 minutes later and would not take me. I went across the street got my eyebrows done, and peeked in Ulta on my way back, she was still talking with the other employees and did not have a client. This Ulta has lost my business.

This location is hit or miss...you are usually better off if you know exactly what you want and limit your interactions with the employees. Awesome selection of products but I've been greeted by too many people that make it clear they are too busy to answer my questions.

My first experience I went to buy a new hair straightener and wanted advice on a good brand in my price range. Who would be better to ask than one of the hairstylists? Well she obviously didn't share that same enthusiasm because she was annoyed that I was even speaking to her, but that didn't make me stop because I needed something and I wasn't leaving until I was satisfied with my purchase.

My next experience I went to get matched for some makeup since I had recently started a new job and wanted to feel a bit more polished. My roommate told me Ulta would match me to foundation and even show me some makeup tricks to apply them... well here's my luck, I asked if someone could help me with this little makeup tutorial but I was told they weren't doing that at that time because they were "too busy this time of year".... let's keep in mind it was about noon on a Wednesday and I was 1 of 4 customers there.....they ended up hurriedly matching me to some makeup and sending me on my way.

Alas, I return because now I want to get more, I'm a little puppy eager to learn new tricks! I approach someone and ask for a suggestion on a liquid eyeliner and listed my needs. Employee points me to her favorite.... which didn't fit any of the criteria I specified. Thanks for taking the time to let me know what you like, not what I want! Love that! 

Oh and to top this all off, website hours said they were open until 9, I arrive at 7:55pm to pick up something and was greeted by a slammed door in my face by security saying they were closed. I knocked on the door until finally the manager came up and she was SO RUDE saying that it's not her fault the website says 9pm. I would think someone in a manager position could push to get that fixed..

I will say I have had a few interactions with employees that are incredibly professional and knowledgeable, so I will be back, but I wish I didn't have to feel like I'm walking on glass whenever I'm here.

Sigh...please hire more customer oriented employees and this review would get bumped up in no time

I've had mixed experiences at this Ulta.  The staff are sometimes so eager to help (when the store isn't busy) that you can't get them to go away when you just want to browse, or sometimes are nowhere to be found when you need help.

I came in here looking for a specific concealer that was a part of their 21 Days of Beauty promotion, only to find that they didn't carry it in-store.  I felt so pressured to buy an alternative full-priced Stila product by a rep in the store, that I felt the need to walk away with the product, browse around and then returned it to the shelf later.  I don't need that kind of anxiety while I'm shopping!

I recently had a great experience with Lauren at the Salon.  In late May they were running a promotion for new Salon customers - $25 for a haircut and style (normally $45).  All I was looking for was a trim, and Lauren got rid of my split ends and I left with a head full of curls for way less than I would have at an expensive Center City salon.  

Five stars for my Salon experience, but overall Ulta is still a solid three for its inconsistent (and somewhat awkward) service.

Great products. Terrible staff.

I am a 20 year old, Asian female.
I walked in here on Christmas Eve morning to get some last minute stuff. 
Nobody said hi to me despite the fact that there were two staff standing at the doorway. Nobody asked me if I needed help, despite the fact that I was looking all over to find something. I usually don't mind if staff people don't come and try to help, I actually prefer it that way if I don't actually need help. But the problem was that they were being selective with their customers- they would say "hi how are you? welcome to ulta! are you looking for anything in particular? we also have blahblah on the third floor and blah blah in the lower level... etc etc.." to every other woman in the store, except me! (WOW)

I also like to touch and try everything before I buy something (might as well if I'm paying for it right?) and instead of asking me if I needed help, some blonde chick with heavy eyeliner (she is the manager- i found out at checkout) sends the security guard over my way... (WHAT?!) 

Needless to say I was pretty offended and did not feel welcome AT ALL in this store. 
It's unfortunate that the store should be judged on the employees but hey, that's a huge part of the whole shopping experience. I will not be buying my cosmetics from this store anymore.

Love the Ulta Salon; so excited we finally have one in Philly! If you're looking for a hair stylist Kara is great with color and styling. It's been hard to find a stylist in the Philadelphia area with an eye for hair trends; have a great creative vision; and actually listens to my needs/wants pertaining hair care, until now. She never cease to amaze me, and I love leaving with suggestions and tips.

I hadn't gotten my eyebrows done professionally since someone burned me about 5 years ago. I recently was wanting a little more shape than I was able to do myself at home, and had heard good things about the Brow Bar so I was happy when I called and got a same day appointment. I wish I remembered the woman's name who did my brows because she was super friendly and did an AMAZING job giving me the shape I wanted!

Lovely selection, nice, clean store in a great location. 3 levels of beauty!! I usually always find what I need here. They seem to always have some kind of deal or special going, and I've never one seen this store look anything less than pristine. What I really Love? The sales associates are not overbearing like Sephora. They let you shop in peace but are always around if you need them. Competitive prices and way more options than the competition.

Wish I looked at the reviews before we scheduled an appt because it seems like TERRIBLE customer service in their forte.  Grab a cup of tea and settle in for this story...

 My sister and I brought our mother here for a full makeup makeover as a birthday gift. We were hoping for a MUA who could give a brief tutorial so we coud purchase ALL the products and she can do it later herself.

 Upon entering the store we were told to go upstairs to check in.  We were RUDELY spoken to by a hairstylist who didn't even look up when we asked to check in and just curtly said go downstairs, we told her we were sent upstairs... and she SCREAMED for another woman to come help us... (who happened to be sitting in the corner just watching, not even attempting to help)  She then denies we have an appointment, until we show her confirmation and she just goes "oh your right here"????  Makeup artist was completely unprepared for us.

This doesn't seem that bad, but when your mom gets all dressed up and excited for  a rare moment of pampering...... !!!!  It just STARTED the experience off on a bad foot, oh but wait.


Finally she is seated for her makeup, the girl is nice but honestly it doesn't make up for the rest of the s*** show:

1. The makeup area is by what looks like the workers break area, thats fine, but its not fine when there what looks like day old chinese food and trash everywhere. I added a picture.
2. She applied moisturizer and primer with HER FINGERS.. EWWW, and I didn't see her wash her hands IMMEDIATELY before.... again my mother is being pampered im not going to interupt and make her feel grossed out.  She used brushes from a big tuberware container full of makeup and other things for the rest of the appointment which is again unsanitary
3.  The originally rude hairdress... proceeds to chomp on doritos about two feet away from my mom getting her makeup done and just watches?  in what world is this not annoying and bizarre.... then washed her hands without soap  and went back to the girl who's hair she was coloring =)
4.  A random customer came up out of nowhere and started asking questions, and the makeup artist left my mom sitting there for 10 minutes while she went to help her....where are the other workers?  It was a saturday evening!? 

Overall, her make up looked ok.  Nothing I couldn't do myself but its extremely frustrating that they got 300$ from us (again for the sake of my mom and her gift we didn't raise hell).  My sweet mom tipped her, and the makeup job was 45 dollars, plus the product that we bought.

Do better or atleast try to give any effort at all. You are in Center city.  I would love a reply from any person that was in the salon that day or a manager to answer to these multiple crimes.

Bethany is the go to for all things hair!! I have extremely high expectations when it comes to hair and Bethany exceeds them. She's very knowledgeable about what styles and products make different types of hair beautiful (mine being thin). I have been going to her for over a year for cuts, treatments, color, etc. Recently she did balayage and it looks beyond GORGEOUS  and HEALTHY. Bethany is the cutest and invests a lot in her clients!!

I came here often and I liked the service here.. except today (5/25/14). My friend who's visiting me from Asia wanted some american makeup products so I took her to Ulta. She was excited and happy how big this beauty store is and literally wants to buy everything she sees, until she noticed that the security guard has been following us for the past hour. I brushed it off and tell my friend to ignore him and we walked away to see another brand.

I finally got ticked off when I catch him checking every makeup packaging to see if we stole anything. He literally opened every package that was on the stand we were at a minute ago and see if the package was empty. And he continued to followed us. (creep) 

As we were in line to purchase our stuff, my friend told me she wanted to switch another shade of a foundation. So I went to the basement floor real quick and change the shade. When my friend was in line, she noticed that the security guard was whispering to one of the register lady and he pointed at my friend and pointed down (assuming me, because I was in the basement floor at the time). 

As we were heading out, he walked beside us and perhaps expecting for the detector beep. But guess fucking what? It didn't. 

I personally think it was very rude and unpleasant of him to follow us to every corner of the store and assume that we were stealing. I come here a lot and wandering around to find the right kind of makeup is pretty normal. But for him, it didn't and made us look suspicious for no good reason. My friend felt uncomfortable and made her experience at Ulta horrible.

Update: I read another review and this reviewer (20 yr. old asian woman) claims that the manager sent the security to escort her to the door and they assumed she was stealing. 

jesus christ ulta, you're fucking racist. I was once a loyal customer, but I guess I'll be Sephora's loyal customer now.

My love affair with Ulta began a while ago but I'm glad there's finally one in Philly! Yes they have great makeup and products to beautify yourself, but my favorite part is THE SALON!!! Everyone is talented but my favorite is Kara! If you go, ask for her! My hair came out better than expected. I went in with an idea and Kara incorporated what I thought I wanted into her expertise as a master colorist and I came out with the most amazing color of my life! I get complements on my hair EVERYDAY! She was working on me (a black girl with natural coils) while also finishing up amazing color on a white woman and a karatin on a Indian girl. I appreciate that she can do ALL types of hair lengths and textures! A true renaissance woman when it comes to hair care! I definitely suggest you make your appointment if you want your hair to look fabulous and be healthy as well!

I've been waiting for an Ulta to open up in Center City!! This location was definitely worth the wait. Its a beautiful, bright, clean store w/ three stories:   high end makeup on 1st floor (street level), hair products & salon on 2nd floor, & less expensive drug store brands downstairs in the basement. 

Their products are great, but their customer service here is hit or miss. You'll either get super nice & helpful, or rude & unhelpful... no middle ground. Definitely worth a visit, but don't be surprised if you have to find everything yourself.

I got a great blowout by stylist Bethany Blessing; she did an amazing job, was pleasant, and very knowledgeable about what kinds of products work best with different types of hair.  She knows her craft! The week before I had her do my hair, I was looking for a dry shampoo and she happened to see me testing out a few and took the time to come over and help me find one that worked best for my hair type (Living proof is my new go to!). Based on that encounter, I decided to book an appointment with her rather than go to my usual places. It's the first time I ever walked into a salon without pointing to a photo of what I wanted, and she nailed it based on a few descriptions I stated. I highly recommend asking for her.

Had one of the best experiences at this store today! A total newbie to the brow bar, i was confused and Dianna was amazing !! I've never had such great customer service before! My eyebrows look flawless & she even assisted me on getting the right product! Worth every penny !

My review is solely based on my experience at the Benefit Brow Bar. I originally booked my appointment with Cassidy for my brows but on the day of the appointment, I got a call from Ulta saying that Cassidy could not come in. Hence, they scheduled me with Ebony. Know nothing about Ebony, I came in with an open mine; as long as my brows get a decent service. I came 20 minutes early just to be safe in case I could not find parking. On a Saturday afternoon, the store was pretty busy. Ebony came right on time for the appointment ( I was her first customer that day) amd she warmly welcomed me. She explained about the process and was very friendly. She was very gentle on my brows and the waxing process was not painful at all and I was very pleased. She diligently made sure I was happy with the tint color and that my brows shaped exactly how I wanted. I would recommend Ebony to anyone and I would come to her again for my brows. She gained my trust in brows :)

I've been coming here for 3 years now. I get my hair done and go shopping while it processes. Every time I make an appointment, I say the words "double process" and they know just how much time my stylist needs to work her magic.

Stephany is the blonde whisperer and everyone I know calls her that. What can I say? My friends and I are a gaggle of fake blondes ;) From ash, platinum, silver, she makes it happen every single time. Blonde used to be a chore. Even if I saw the same stylist for years, I walked out with lines from one touch up to the next. No consistency! That's a thing of the past here. Oh and she doesn't fry my hair. 

Everyone at the salon is super pleasant and professional but I love love LOVE Stephany! She's like the saint of my devotion lol Always has it under control. If anything goes wrong while processing she saves the day. Never gets in over her head. My mom wanted a short hair style and she was frank with her and pointed her to an other stylist who did just wonderful. I believe she's the manager? She really knows her team! Above all (wrapping up my praise here, promise!) she knows her way around blonde!

Diana did an excellent job on my brows. She was obviously very experienced and gave me excellent shape! Be sure to call for an appointment....they take walk-ins, but do tend to book up with appointments! Only reason why I'm giving 4 instead of 5 stars is because I think $20 for a brow wax in the front of Ulta is a bit high. But it was definitely the longest, most thorough brow wax I've ever had!

I'll preface this by saying that my makeup artist was a sweet woman, very friendly and accommodating. My negative rating has more to do with the overall experience. I was at the store by 11:15 for an 11:30 appointment. I was told by the manager that it would be "just a little while" until the girl doing make up on the first floor was done with her client, so I patiently waited and walked around the store.
When the girl doing make up on the first floor was done, she told me I'd be seeing someone upstairs, so she took me up there to wait...for 20 minutes. By 11:45 I went down to the manager and asked if someone would be with me soon, only for her to take me back upstairs to wait some more.

When my makeup artist was finally ready for me, we went back downstairs...after all of this running around and insanity, I didn't sit in the make up chair until 12:15. And, like most of their clients I am sure, I was pressed for time and rushing to get to a wedding. Ultimately this is unacceptable to me. You can't have stylists so behind in appointments that they make people wait for 45 minutes WHEN THEY HAVE AN APPOINTMENT SCHEDULED. Ultimately there was little creativity offered to provide better service, and I left very unhappy.
As for the make up, it wasn't what I wanted, but it stayed put and I received many compliments. I'm not sure how else to convey the look I wanted other than showing a photo and asking them to aim for it...yet somehow there was still something lost in translation as I walked out with chiseled eyebrows and dark eye shadow, after I'd requested a more natural style. Again, I genuinely enjoyed my make up artist and I think she did her best given how anxious I was surrounding the situation. 
For someone who wears minimal makeup and was apprehensive about giving Ulta a try, the overall experience confirmed that I'll never be back to this location.

Do not go in here unless you want to be ignored or if you do happen to ask a question, be treated like dirt. The workers here seem to think they are too good for the customers and act annoyed if you interrupt their personal conversations. I would have like to browse the store for some items but after being looked at like I was a nuisance (after asking where something was), I decided to not spend my money here.

I called in advance to make sure they had a makeup revolution lip topper. They confirm they did and I told them I'd be there within the hour. I arrived searched up and down for the item on my own. No one asked if I needed any assistance. Then I came back upstairs to ask for help. They explained they didn't have the item in stock. I asked "Why would you guys tell me you had it?  I traveled here just for it". The reps had no response for me.  Waste of my time. smh

3.5/5

Loved how large this Ulta was. The organization was also easy to understand. I figured out where to go right away--which is good because there wasn't much staff at all. No one came over to help either my friend or myself. I know if someone helped me friend she would've bought something. That's the type of person she is. So money lost for them.

Ulta is always a good option to have in a major city. I'd go to this one again but I wouldn't rush out there.

Finally an Ulta in Philly!! 
I went in just to look around and started speaking to a stylist named Kaila! She took me into the salon and really made me look amazing. I just was walking in off the street and she really made me feel welcomed and helped me with my hair! 
She is incredible everyone needs to book with her!

Well. I warned them that I was gonna give this place the worst review ever. 

This review is for The Salon and their service. I made an appointment online with Lauren at 3:30 pm for NYE. Then, I called to make sure that they were going to do what I wanted and also wanted ask for make up services. I wanted to get the Finger Curls. Got a guy on the phone who suggests that I book the appointment with him as Lauren didn't know how to do what I wanted.  His name is Ramon and he put me for 5 pm. 

A friend of mine asked where I was going to do my hair and I told her about Ulta. She made an appointment with Stephanie at the same time, 5PM. We both go there on time. I had been at Ulta before for their promotional blowouts and have been satisfied. Little did I know that some of them, that's all they know! I will further explain.

So, Ramon takes me after he was done with the last appointment. When I got there, I greeted them and said that my appointment time was 5 pm and that I wanted to get the finger curls. They had a manikin out with something called the Victorian Curls which was something that I did not want. So I show to him a couple of pictures so he knew exactly what I was looking for.

He washed my hair very quickly and started to "complain" by saying how much hair I had. Bla, bla, bla. But he was willing to finish with me before or around 6 PM. He knew what he was doing. He was almost done with the top part of my hair when Stephanie comes in and asks him to take her client/my friend as she wanted an up-do and she had no idea how to do it. So, he leaves me half/way and then she takes over. I was a little confused by the switch. At the end, I was there because I had no idea how to do that style myself. When I sat on her chair, though I couldn't see her face by the way of how she turned the chair, I could feel that she had no idea what the h*** she was doing. Stephanie started at the bottom, on the opposite way of how Ramon initiated it. Bottom line, I ended up getting a sort of blowout instead of finger curls. Curls were going in many directions.  I went home and fixed it myself a little bit. 

Thankfully, I have wonderful hair and it looks nice no matter what you do. I got my money back for this horrible service and I am writing this review to warn anyone that may need something fancy to be done with their hair for a special occasion - this is not the place.

The service in this store is absolutely laughable, which is made even funnier by the fact that this store competes directly with Sephora in regards to the products they sell. You would think that the salespeople weren't lazy, rude, inattentive and unhelpful. Sadly, they are much worse. This store is dimly lit, cluttered, and the basement level floor was entirely abandoned when I ventured down there to search for a product. The saleswoman I engaged to help me twice was in a complete daze both times, wouldn't make eye contact, and walked away after I asked a question. When I went back up to her to follow up, it was as if she had forgotten I'd asked her to do her job. Imagine! Just do everyone a favor and go to the trained, enthusiastic, bright-eyed salespeople at Sephora instead. Don't bother giving Ulta your business. What a shame. I wish I could tag the saleswoman in this post because her complete lack of work ethic is disappointing and is costing this store business.

How do you spell "worst customer ever ?"
"C-A-R-M-E-N."
Went in with my Mom today to treat her to some nice perfume and dr Brandt 's eye depuffer.
We were pointed to the "back of the store "
We were clearly looking around as 2 women talked amongst themselves --both obviously spotting us--both ignored us completely . Guess the conversation was more important . Stood there for about 20 seconds while they talked and then finally walked up and ventured to ask--the one girl finally helped us and was pretty nice --this Carmen chick , as her name tag pronounced --turned on her heels and arrogantly clicked away .

Fast forward to me purchasing said items for mom at register and more clueless looks from mindless automatons . My Mom asked nicely if they possibly had any samples (you would have thought she had asked for their first born child)

Rude rude rude .

Fast forward yet another time in the same DAY because I had sprayed a perfume I loved and wanted to return and buy it and figure out what it was .

Walked past the counter where not 1, but FOUR to FIVE sales associates were congregating and shooting the breeze. I was about 2 feet from them for at least 5 minutes obviously looking for something and still not one of them asked if I needed help .

Ask again --same girl , Carmen, Rudely turns on her heels while same sweet girl (wearing a head scarf ) and another associate help me.


See Carmen blandly poised at the register where she looks severely put out that she has to deign to lazily ring someone up.

I asked the girls who were helping me "
Is that your manager " (knowing that sometimes the manager will have better things to do than answer questions (not really !) and defer to the associates .

Nope . Not a manager . Just a brat .

And to top it off the whole back of the store is a hot MESS and jumble of racks that need to be Re shelved.

Wonder if these girls could be doing something useful .

I will return because it's right by my office , but not for the awful and rude customer service .
 I'd rather give my money to sephora if I can .

Hmph.

I am so offended and frustrated by the rudeness of the woman working here during my last visit. I went on Monday afternoon around noon looking to buy my mother a new brush set for Christmas. A skinny woman who had very dark hair, heavy makeup and looked to be about 40 told me she would be with me in a second. 

When I asked her where the brush sets were, she said something along the lines of "We have a company that makes great brushes downstairs" and instructed me towards the elevators/stairs. When my friends and I got down there, we were surprised to see that the lower level was all lower end cosmetics, and the most expensive, bad quality brush set down there was around 20$ max.

I am so offended that the woman was so judgemental and sent me to look at the cheap products instead of even showing me the more expensive options. I am by no means poor, and I was dressed nicely enough, but apparently the Ulta worker that was on her high horse deemed me uncapable of spending more than 20$ because I am in my 20s. While I was looking upstairs on my own, my friend heard her say something to another girl asking for help something like "Well everything up here is going to be really expensive...".. To which the girl responded "So? Could you please show me anyways?" Unreal.

You work at Ulta for a living. You are not better than any other human being, so please have the respect to treat every customer equally because you know nothing about them. I have never encountered such a rude employee. 

I ended up buying a Too Faced teddy bear hair brush set that I found on my own, no thanks to her. Ulta's products are great. I wish I could say the same for all of their employees. What a disgusting and judgemental woman.

After a very disappointing experience at the Sephora in center city, I was ready to give Ulta a try. The employees were so nice, knowledgeable about a wide array of products and patient while I asked a ton of questions. 

I also like the set up of this store. Salon on the second floor, higher end make up on the first floor, and bath/body products plus other make up on the lower level. Everything is clean and organized perfectly.
I stopped in to this Ulta to look for some shampoo and conditioner.  They have a great selection of products. The salon staff seems friendly.

Zero customer service here. My friend and I went in today to look at foundation. There were two employees (one may have been a manager even - blonde/purple hair) about 5 feet away from us talking to each other did not ask us if we needed help once, just stood there and talked while we were searching and trying to find our shade. I also had an eyebrow appointment right after which was awful. The aesthetician pulled the strips off slowly and did not even fill in/cover up my red skin after like they normally do. I will be taking my business to Sephora and finding a new eyebrow waxing location.

TL;DR: Awful customer service, horrible and overpriced brows

Do yourself a favor and never come here. Dianna (eyebrow extraordinaire) has moved to Sun Myst on 16th and Sansom as of last week. She is amazing so I see her there now. On another note, I needed to return a product that I purchased for $25. Brand new in the package and never opened. It was in the system the last time I was here and the told me that there would be no issues returning it even without a receipt. I came back today to return it and they literally offered me 36 cents for it! The manager Christina would not make an exception. They still have the product on the shelf for $25. They have lost a customer for life. Completely unacceptable customer service.  Go to sephora where they know how to treat their customers.

I love Scott he's such an amazing hair stylist he always makes me look perfect and no matter what color I want to dye my hair he always makes it look amazing. I'm so happy I found him I would never get my hair done by anyone else again I recommend him to anyone. He's just amazing

Do you care about customer service? Then don't step into this place! I went here on a Friday evening. There were not a lot of people in the store. The store employees did not seem to care, they just stood in a corner and talked amongst themselves. I was looking for a particular brand of makeup and I looked every aisle in the store for almost 30 minutes. I even went to the lower level to search, but could not find it there. I came back to the first floor to ask someone about it. When I finally found a store employee and asked about it, she blatantly said "Oh, we don't carry that brand's makeup here, we only have skincare" and walked away. I was amazed by the level of carelessness!

Now let's get to the store itself. I thought this was a decent sized Ulta and also it is in a very convenient location. The items are not neatly organized though. There is stuff lying everywhere. Clearance sections are a total mess. If you have a lot of time to kill and like to "search" for stuff, yes please go to this Ulta. If not, better stay away from it.

Went in for a blowout, walked out with my hair tied up in a bun. Smh. 

This review is specific to my experience with the stylist named Helgada.  This review is not about the store

Not sure what prior experience Helgada has, but her skills are too bad even for Great Clips.  Doesn't listen to client request at all.  

-I told her I specifically DO NOT use a straightener on my hair and she looked at me like I have 5 heads.  If you know how to blow dry hair properly then there's no need to use a flat iron to reduce frizz. 

-I  asked multiple times for a concentrator to be used on the hair dryer, she told my multiple times it's not needed and that I'll see once she's done.  Finally she tells me she doesn't have a concentrator because she doesn't use them.  

-I don't know any legit hair stylist who uses a round brush to comb out dry hair.  Are you trying to damage my hair?! No I'm not talking while hair is being dried, I'm talking about when hair has been dried, then running a round brush down it from roots to ends ike Rapunzel combing her hair.  

-Icing on the cake was finally me asking her for the hair dryer and brush to fix it.  She wanted to know what exactly I didn't like about it.  Nicest way I could put it was "all of it".  So I finally trying to fix it myself to look halfway decent.  She then rushed to the register to print out my bill.

Ended up tying it back into a bun since it was just too pathetic to walk out with.  $45 for really just a wash, since I did the "styling" myself.  

I will still continue going to Ulta, because my regular stylist in NJ works there and I know my experience at this location  doesnt represent the standard of services provided at Ulta.

I just want to say i had such a great experience when i went to the Ulta Salon on Chesnut St. I got my hair cut there by one of the stylist who's name is Kim and she was fantastic. I gave her a picture that mind you was not very clear and told her this is how i want my hair again... It was a cut i had years ago that actually wasn't really a cut but more so a style of a previous cut i had gotten somewhere else that was in its growing out stage. So not only was it not a specific style but also not a very good picture to go off of and let me tell you KIM NAILED IT perfectly. She was upbeat, welcoming, and just an awesome stylist. I will continue to go to Kim and strongly suggest others giving her a try to. I am beyond happy n KIM ROCKS!!!

Maybe it's because I don't look like I wear much make up or care about beauty stuff but I always end up getting ignored here. Regardless if I go during a busy or slow time employees just seem to disregard me or maybe they just disregard everyone! Out of the handful of times I've bought something here, I've been nicely greeted by the cashier instead of the standard "whats your number?" greeting. 

I'm also always surprised by the total in a bad way. The prices never seem to be accurate and that's pretty annoying when the shelf says $6 but the total ends up being $11 for one item. 

Could be better but I'd stick with Sephora or any other drug store.
Bethany is amazing!!! Highly recommend her. She turned my over processed hair into exactly what I was looking for and is a balayage pro!

I agree with a majority of the other reviewers stating that the customer service here is bad. When you walk in no one greets you or even really bothers to
Look up at you, not even when you walk past the employees gossiping at the checkout counter. Which is fine honestly because I hate being asked a million times if I need help finding anything. But I do notice that anytime a man comes In, multiple employees jump at the chance to greet him. Which is just funny to me because I spend hundreds of dollars everytime I go into an ulta, way more then I've ever seen a guy spend there. Guess they don't want the commission. Sephora is the same way though. I just think it's funny.

Stopped in for a quick gift purchase. It was not long after opening, the store seemed empty, but as I walked in, I was immediately greeted by two employees. I identified the product (a skin moisturizer) I was looking for, and one of them (Sammy?) promptly confirmed that they did indeed have it in stock. (I had previously checked the Ulta website and didn't see it listed.) She offered to walk me over to it (actually, down to it, as it was downstairs), and she confirmed that she was very familiar with the product and would indeed recommend it. I asked if it was very popular, and she confirmed that it is. She then offered that because it contains lanolin, it wouldn't be appropriate for vegans - something I hadn't know about the product. We discussed the various versions of this product, and I picked out what I needed. Back up at the counter, there were two customers ahead of me, but they were taken care of promptly, as was I. What could be better? Attentive, well-informed, friendly staff, and the product I was looking for - effortless shopping experience.

I used to think that Ulta was a knock off of Sephora, but I was completely wrong.  This location has got me hooked on Ulta.  They have a mixture of high-end brands and drug store brands.  I like that the sales associates are knowledgeable on the drug store brands, which is impossible to find at a drug store.  They sucker me in with their coupons, but some brands are excluded, which isn't fun.  This place got me addicted to using liquid eyeliner, which I thought was intimidating before, now I can't stop using it.  
With all of the beauty stores in the area Ulta is becoming my favorite.

I came in with my friend the other day to browse around because we're both relatively new to makeup. We were immediately greeted by the staff and asked by an associate if we needed help. Her makeup was very nice and she was extremely knowledgeable with all of the questions we had. She helped us learn how to apply eyeshadow and showed us a lot of palettes to chose from too. I think her name was Sam and she even talked to us about YouTube too because we had mentioned we were trying to learn from there and she said that's how she learned to do her makeup.

Had a make up make over with Brianna. I would highly recommend her. She had amazing skills, extremely nice and patient. Not only did we get a make over but it was a learning experience. Thank you for such a positive experience Brianna!

I came in here for a color correction and rather then try to push products and expensive services, they gave me a less expensive option of just doing a color rinse. Had I stepped into a worm hole to a beauty salon that wasn't trying to take my money?? No! I stepped into Ulta and after this experience I am a lifer! Not only was it affordable but they also styled my hair and gave me great tips on shine and how to make that color last longer! Seriously, I am not going any where else after this!

You just lost a sale. I walked in and an associate said hello and walked away to apply lip gloss. She saw me walking around the store but never asked me if I needed help. Another woman walks into the store and she's greeted and asked if she needs help by the same person. 

On my way to Sephora.

Carrie Bradshaw once said: 
"And we were dressed from head to toe in love... the only label that never goes out of style." Se had a point. She always does.
Like any other Ulta, this multi-store on Walnut Street, features a wide range of cosmetics, skin care & hair products, fragrances and a full service salon. 
I have tried the salon few times and my experience was okish. My hair did't look vey impressive nor horrendous. After my third time, I didn't go back to the salon.

Three floors of makeup, it's women heaven on earth.
Three Yelps.

Bri/Bre? was so helpful on the phone - I was trying to make a makeup appointment online but the system was down. She took my info and called me back asap to confirm it. I know it sounds like a little thing, but to me it meant a lot and I just wanted to say thank you! :)

So I figure "Hey me and my wife are getting married why not get my eyebrows on fleek?" As ladies we always want what's best for our eyebrows so for $20.00 we figured it might be one of those pay for what you get kind of situations. It was awesome because we just did a walk-in on a quiet Tuesday morning and was immediately taken care of. Kelli was nice and she took her time. But after me and my wife left, I realized one of my eyebrows looked like a boomerang and the other was flawless...not too happy with that. On the other hand, my wife left with a generous amount of skin taken off from under her eyebrow. For 20.00 bucks I should have symmetrical brows and my wife should still have the rest of her skin. Not worth the 20 but we also fill in our brows so it can be fixed.

Generally speaking there is no comparison to this chain and Sephora because the employees do not have deep product knowledge. In the Walnut St. store today I tried to buy something but apparently I was invisible to the cashier (Shortish brown curly hair, caramel skin) who did all she could to avoid looking at me, i.e fiddling with "stuff." When I asked her if she would ring me up she looked at me as if I'd asked her to wipe my bottom. I left without making my purchase.

Not a great experience. At all. 

I called a month in advance to schedule an appointment for a hair donation, and I asked the lady on the phone (whose name I unfortunately can't remember) if my haircut would be free, as many hair salons do free haircuts when customers donate their hair. I also asked if Ulta would ship my hair to donation organizations. I was told yes and yes. One month later, I came to Ulta unprepared to pay for a haircut, but I kept five dollars cash in my pocket to tip my stylist. 

When the stylist cut my hair, she didn't use my natural part. In fact, she didn't use much of a part at all. My hair's new natural part is a crooked middle-part-gone-wayward part, and I have not used it since because of how poor it looks. After cutting my hair, the stylist washed my hair, did some more trimming with the same part, and then sprayed a few things in. She tried to blow out my hair, but I told her I don't like heat.

I nearly left the Ulta but was then handed a $70 bill (with a 20% first-time discount) and a plastic bag with my hair to donate (I had to send it out myself). 30 minutes of time and zero styling does NOT cost $70. Also, I was told on the phone that my cut and the shipping of my hair would be taken care of. 

I talked to the manager and she eventually lowered the price to $30. She said that *I* misheard the woman on the phone, and that the woman on the phone must have meant that Ulta will ship out my hair for free. Oddly enough, Ulta was not shipping out my hair for free anyway, so the manager's refutation was nonsensical. When I asked about adding the 20% first-time discount to the $30 fee, the manager said that going from a $70 cut to a $30 cut WAS my discount. That is not a discount. That is me paying the appropriate amount for the cut I received. 

I paid for the cut, and I kept the cash I set aside for a tip in my pocket. One could say that just like how a $30 cut WAS my discount, a $30 cut WAS a tip. I will not be returning to Ulta for any beauty needs whatsoever. The customer service is ridiculously horrible, practically nonexistent.

SALON REVIEW
So balayage is all the rage right now and I wanted to change up my hair. I did some Yelping and Ulta did it the cheapest compared to other salons so I thought I'd give it a try. Making an appointment was easy, they have evening and weekend hours. I was set up with Kelly. The salon is conveniently located in Center City, clean and has ceiling/floor windows so you can people watch which is nice. 


Ok, so the fact that none of my close friends can really tell that my hair is different after I paid some decent mula, is a little disappointing. I never said I wanted it to the be super subtle. Obvi balayage is most subtle than ombre/highlights, but it should still be noticeable. It doesn't resemble anything like the pics I showed her. So I feel like my hair is just damaged from the dye but without color... fail. 

I paid $80 with tip (they give 20% for all new clients which is good. They also frequently have random deals, so just look online)

I LOVE that Ulta carries drug store brands like Covergirl, Maybelline, but also high end brands like Nars and Stila. So it's your one stop shop for trying new things, picking up a ton of stuff, and comparing whether or not you want to splurge on that oh-so-in fuschia lipstick. Plus they have hair products including shampoo/conditioner/hairspray stuff and also straighteners/brushes/clips.

With regards to drug store brands, they have almost those brands' entire collections so a lot of colors you won't find at the drug store. And fun fact: NYX is super cheap but owned by Urban Decay! 

The first floor is fragrance/skin/high end makeup, basement is drugstore stuff including body lotions and top floor is hair WITH  a salon. Haven't tried it though.. 

So that's all fine and dandy and I can spend hoursss playing around and dropping some serious bank. 

My hesitation for giving a 5 star is because I don't find the people very helpful. When I ask them something they seem to just rave about the product without giving me an honest opinion and more than just "Yeah it's fabulous!!" I want to know what other products are similar, the price range, how long it lasts, can you try it on me? I also a little hesitant because a lot of them don't even have their makeup done well.. 

Sign up for their mailing list and you will get amazing coupons though! I got my makeup done by Stila for free on a Saturday!

I wanted to update because I had another great experience here.
 
I had just seen a commercial for the new Almay masacara "Get up and grow" which promised longer, luscious lashes in about a month or so of continuous use. I figured Ulta would have it so I came there.

Pros: 
Jackie was able to give me some input (although it was based off of what she's seen customers buy and not what she's tried herself)

Cons:
They don't carry good body scrubs anymore
Sale marketing can be confusing (for example: Buy 2, Get 1 free on eye products excludes mascara)-They did end up honoring it for me anyway though!

So I had helpful associate recommendations and good customer service; keep it up Ulta!

Ulta is a supermarket for beauty products. It is a more affordable Sephora. They carry a wide selection of make up from Maybelline to their own brand to Hard Candy. You can also find a wide variety of hair products, including Chi flat irons. They also have a salon in the back, although I have never let them do my hair. Ulta is a must for any fellow makeup enthusiast on a budget!

GUILY OF FALSE ADVERTISING - Twice now I was enticed in to purchase my "It's a 10" products with a "bonus gift" of a 2 oz leave in conditioner only to be told they were already out. Mind you the sale had only started that day and I was there at 10:00 am. When I inquired about them giving me the very same 2 oz that was on the shelf for sale, I was informed by the Manager that it had a different SKU# and could not be substituted. I was also told I could drive to another store to see if they had any available however they wouldn't call around for me. Not a big deal in the scheme of my life, I will purchase the product elsewhere. This is an old marketing technique that they use to bait you into the store.

Had my hair done by the salon manager Andrea have to say the worst experience I have ever had. 1st all she did was talk about how good and experienced she is to the point of giving me a headache.2nd the worst color and cut ever had to go somewhere else to get it fixed. 3rd and final over charged me paid for a glaze and color why two different colors when she only applied one color. So I say stay away from her and I was there for 4 hrs because she wouldn't stop talking had to pull out my phone to get her to shut up and then she started to talking to the other girls working there and she is very inappropriate in every way possible.
So be warned STAY AWAY FROM ANDREA

I just read all these reviews and they are terrible! I agree with most of them which is even more horrible. I was in there last night for about an hour and half and with in the first 1/2 hour someone finally realized I was trying to figure out the color I needed from dermablend. I could just tell that she really didn't care and agreed with whatever I said, same went for the powder I picked out, now I have to return them both tonight. ALSO RETURNING THE MASCARA which I wasn't going to but I don't like it and I already threw out the packageing so I am hopeing they do not give me any problems returning these 3 items, I still need the correct color and I am dreading going back in there and needing help. Once there was a wonderful girl who worked there and spent alot of time picking out ageing creams with me, or facial brightners, she was awesome, I wish I new her name? She is an esthetian and new alot about ingredients and what not. She probably quit because she new she could work at Sophora. Anyway, I am walking around the store with products falling out of my arms and no one ever offered a bag. Also I am agreeing with another customer about how dusty the products are. For such high end and high prices cosmetics atleast keep them clean! I go in this store frequently and its always the same ordeal. I'm dissatified with the colors I wind up having to go back because I get no help and to top the whole experience off at the end, the girl who rung me up had no idea how to discount the my items correctly. I just don't understand why they do not read up on these postings and realize that some major changes need to be made. Infact when I'm in there tonight I will make sure I ask them if they ever read there reviews on Yelp and see what they say. Hopefully although I'm dreading this experience tonight going back in there it will come out good and my colors will be correct and the 32.00 of foundation that I buy I won't have to dust off with my hand like I did last night (I'm sure they will still be dusty) I would prefer Sophora any day but its too far of a drive after work I just want to go around the corner and be done with it. If only there was a Sophora around the corner :( Unfortunatly if this Ulta doesn't get any better I am going to have to travel to the king of prussia mall and that will really blow! If any Ulta employee or management reads these PLEASE DO SOMETHING WITH THAT STORE AND PLEASE DO IT QUICK!!!! OTHERWISE YOU WILL BE LOSING ALOT OF CUSTOMERS AND I REALLY DO ENJOY BEING ABLE TO GO AROUND THE CORNER AND GET WHAT I NEED AND GO HOME. CUSTOMER SERVICE ALSO NEEDS TO BE RETRAINED....Do not mean to offend anyone its just a bad experience going in there.

Ulta, what are you doing to your employees to make them hate their job so much? People who help with makeup here are so rude. Yesterday I was approached by a girl asking if I needed help. Her helpfulness ended there. Her tone of voice and demeanor and everything coming out of her mouth made me feel unwelcomed and like I was bothering her, even though she approached ME. I was looking for complexion makeup and she pulled a concealer and powder for me. She was so heavy handed in applying concealer around the delicate under eye area, I actually thought she was trying to hurt me on purpose and she poked me in the eyes several times. I wanted to remove my own makeup (due to the heavy handedness) and she got visibly more upset. Worst part, products she picked out for me were all wrong, but I only realized it when I got home. The concealer was shimmery even though I specifically said I wanted matte, no shimmer! The powder turned out 2 shades too dark for my skin tone. And she gave me a synthetic brush to use with the mineral makeup I was getting, even though you're supposed to use natural bristles with mineral, and she even told me that herself!

Overall this branch has very poor customer service. Initially I received some great product recommendations during my first few visits to this store and since then the customer service has gone completely downhill. I've gone at various times of the day and sales associates are unwelcoming and unwilling to engage and interact with customers. Ulta is an amazing store with a great concept; they carry so many fabulous brands and wonderful products. I just wish the associates were friendly and willing to engage over the products. You know -- talk about what's new and exciting or what just came in and definitely needs to be checked out. The icing on the cake was when I asked a question while checking out and the sales associate said "I have no idea what you just said I'm like half asleep BYE" and shoved my bag into my hand. Not so interactive but again there have been some people here who have been friendly in the past. I guess it's just a hit or miss so it's best not to ask too many questions or expect awesome customer service.

I'm updating because I had a really great experience yesterday here.

I came in looking for a replacement foundation since my bottle is getting to it's last few drops, but unfortunately had no idea on how to choose a replacement. 

I wandered the drugstore type cosmetics (Revlon, Covergirl, etc) and while I tested some of the liquid foundations to find my shade, they still didn't seem quite what I was looking for. 

When I made my way over to the center area (where the more pricey cosmetics are, including my fave brand Urban Decay), a salesgirl by the make-up vanity setup asked if I needed help with anything. I told her what I was looking for and she helped me, first showing me tinted moisturizer (which I wasn't a fan of) and then suggested mineral powder foundation.

I decided to try it although I've never really been a mineral makeup kind of gal; however I was pleasantly surprised at the results. First off, it was cheaper than the heavy foundation stuff (which ran $34+ while the powder was $25) and it seemed more natural while still providing coverage.

This was a super experience since she spent at least 10 minutes helping me try everything on to see if I liked how it looked before helping me find one I really liked. Plus she didn't pressure me to buy anything extra (She told me about the accompanying powder brush for $22 for the mineral collection but told me it would work just as well with any brush).

Now you're talking, Ulta! I'm sure I'll be back!
Love the brand new store and salon. Looks awesome!

Standard Ulta layout and beauty products. I went in specifically looking for a straightening brush that I had seen at CVS and was hoping to get for cheaper at Ulta. The brush section seemed a bit scant to me, hence the 3 stars.

Gave my sister and I a hard time about using points because technically if it was my purchase they couldn't use our SHARED account. When she went to do the transaction instead, the woman gave her even worse of a time. This was the last straw as I've had other issues with this location before. From rude comments to an employee calling me an "idiot" for color matching myself. As a die-hard Ulta supporter, literally a Diamond level member, I've since made a positive move to Sephora. 

If I ever go to Ulta, I just go to KOP. To be honest I regret not doing that this time around. Breaks my heart because Ulta is a fantastic company, but this location? Negative all the way around.

All Ultas are pretty much the same. Your standard make-up sections, hair accessories/hair care sections, body care, perfumes, and salon in the back part of the store.

I did like the fact that the employees here don't harass you when you walk in; I like to shop/browse on my own without someone breathing down my neck! The cashier seemed nice enough though.

Check your prices though. I was going to buy a gel eye mask here for $6.99 and Cucumber eye pads for $7 and over at Ross, I found both in a package for $6. So Ulta is not always the cheapest for what you are looking for; however, they do stockUrban Decay, my fave make-up brand!

While I've had a decent experience with Ulta, the customer service of the associates at the Benefit Brow Bar at this location were subpar. First, I came on a Thursday night about ten minutes before 6. I soon found the Brow Bar closed at 6, but the associate had clearly already left. I came back the next day during the hours and was not greeted. After waiting around for 15 minutes, the associate finally told me she was all booked for the day. She was not helpful and treated me as an annoyance. It was disappointing as services usually have walk-ins available and seem more enthused to make appointments and receive business.
Typically I am ignored.... but the selection is good.

I like Ulta overall, but beware of the sales reps!  I walked in for a suggestion for full coverage foundation.  The woman suggested Clinique and proceeded to color test me.  As we were talking, I asked for suggestions for a primer and concealer.  She starts gushing about how great the Clinique primer and concealer is. I asked her if she was a rep for Clinique and she said "I work with all brands at Ulta."  I must have been really gullible that day and took her word that the Clinique products were the best.  Of course, I later realized that she was a rep.  I felt deceived by her false recommendations of the products just so she could meet her quota. Also, she went on and on about how several of the products did not contain alcohol, but when I went home and looked at the ingredient list, alcohol was often the #2 ingredient listed! This is the first and last time I'll get help from an employee.  I found better products on my own. Also, I recommend ordering online because there are often free gifts that come with certain purchases, but the store has never given them to me.

I'll start by saying that I absolutely love their salon. Since I have been going there I've been getting the cut and color that I want without having to ask twice or stomp around angry for weeks because someone messed up my hair. I even had the confidence in my stylist to let her chop off six inches. It should be noted the last time my hair was to my shoulders was about 10 years ago. But I digress..

Though my shopping experience is always unpleasant in that store because everyone working there apparently takes a course in "how to be rude and alienate your customer base 101," I am choosing to focus on my latest visit. 

I'm sorry in advance for the longwindedness of it all.

First of all, the store looks like crap right now. They're remodeling, which is probably a good thing, but it is dusty, the layout is confusing and cluttered and nothing is the same place from visit to visit. Merch has dust all over it, things are habitually out of stock, and signage is worse here than it is at the dollar store.

One of the reasons for my visit was that I was looking for shampoo and conditioner pumps. I buy the massive bottles of Redken - especially when there is a buy 2 get 1 sale (more on that later) because I feel like I'm wasting money if I don't. I also feel like I'm wasting money without a pump because once the bottle is past a certain level of fullness, it becomes a bitch to get out and extends my shower to the point where I throw it out because time = money. I called ahead and asked and they said they sold pumps. I looked online and found multiple makeup alley posts about buying pumps at Ulta. Thought I was safe. I was wrong.

I asked a woman who was wandering the store if she knew where they were. She said she didn't because she was only a skincare specialist (I don't care what your specialty is - you WORK there. Know the layout of your store, it's part your job). She looked around a little and said she would go ask someone to help her. Three minutes later I walk to the middle of the store where the registers are and she's standing there trying to sell a facial to someone.

Not. Cool.

If you didn't find an answer, it's unprofessional enough to just forget that I'm standing back there (with an antsy 2 year old) and start chatting up some old woman who needs more than you can give her, but what I suspect happened..that you purposely left me back there to get some commission might be the most unprofessional way I've been treated in any retail situation - ever. 

I decided right then and there that I was Yelping, but usually when I decide that I end up forgetting. What made me remember was the fact that the 67 year old cashier was rude, gave me dirty looks the entire time she rang up my things and then refused to honor the Redken buy 2 get 1 for two of the products because two were for men (the website EXPRESSLY says that they are included, and I plan to go back and shove the printout in their face, demanding my $20+ back). I asked her about the pumps and she sighed, rolled her eyes and walked away. After 2 minutes or so she came back and said that they don't have any signage for them so they must not sell them anymore. HOW DO YOU NOT KNOW THIS ABOUT YOUR STORE AND PRODUCTS? I seriously don't understand how you can work somewhere and know absolutely nothing about what you carry, where you put it and when you no longer sell it. Sloppy. Unprofessional. Bad business.

To cap off my lovely shopping experience, she didn't ask if I found everything I needed, how I was, thank me for shopping, try to make small talk, ask me if I had an Ulta card (I had to prompt her) or seem like she gave a poop that I am spending my hard earned money in her place of employment, essentially paying her paycheck with my biweekly loyal purchasing.

Guess who just decided to pay someones paycheck at Sephora instead?

I hope management sees this and decides to retrain their staff. There is too much competition in this area (Sephora, namely) to treat customers this way.

Only here to comment on the Ulta Nail Service: do NOT waste your money!!!  I went here to try out the OPI gel nails because I had a coupon.  The girl who did my nails was very sweet but she did a HORRIBLE job.  She got the polish all on the sides of my nails and under them and it looked like crap.  Plus the harded polish stuck under my nails felt extremely aggravating until it finally came out a few days later after washing dishes.  It seemed like she wasn't a real nail professional, rather just someone that Ulta sent to the OPI workshop to learn how to apply their product.  

The other really annoying thing was that it cost the same as a manicure ($30) but all she did was paint my nails!  She didn't trim my cuticles, or lotion my hands or anything.  I even asked her to trim my cuticles (they get very dry and I get a lot of hangnails, so that is one of the main reasons I get a manicure) and she said that she wasn't allowed to do that-  HUH?!?!  I will never get a nail service at Ulta again.

If you've never gotten a gel manicure before, here's what you need to know:  Once the gel is hardened you cannot get it off- you have to start over and take the entire layer of nailpolish off that nail.  If you try to pick at a stray piece, you will just end up ripping a chunk out of the gel, which is basically like a plastic coating on your nail; pull a little piece and the whole thing starts to pull off.  Gel is not like regular polish where if they make a mistake and get some on the cuticle they can just scrape it off, even after it's dry.  It has to be applied perfectly and any mistakes must be scraped off while its wet. Once it goes in the UV dryer and hardens, that's it.  

If you're getting gel nails you need to go to someone who's a perfectionist and has a lot of experience.  If you live near Chemical Rd, I suggest Universal Nails, which is next to the Genaurdi's on Butler Pike and Ridge Ave.  Also, the nail salon in Better Health & Tanning on Butler Pike is very good too, but not open on Sundays and Universal is.

This was by far the worst hair salon experience of my life. I went on Monday at 3 PM. It took the woman 25 minutes to check me in.  The other girls in the salon were very unprofessional - one was eating a sandwich right next to me the other one was spreading out her legs on another chair. They couldn't care less that a customer was around them. The girl that cut my hair took close to an hour even though the cut that was not good I think this was the first time she ever cut someone's hair. She was very sweet but she had absolutely no skill. In the middle of my appointment another customer stopped by - she was crying over her hair previously done there. My stylist stepped out for another 20 minutes. She then came back rolling her eyes saying that this woman was on drugs and she wanted to get her hair done for free.  Next-door there was a haircoloring class happening. It was very loud and it made me feel like I was being worked on by people who had no experience.  This entire place felt like a purgatory for bad hairdressers or a scene from a trashy reality TV. This is a typical example of you get what you paid for. I might have saved $20 vs another hair salon, but I feel like I've wasted an hour and a half, I was treated unprofessionally and I got a crappy haircut so there you go. I was so frustrated with the whole experience that I left with my hair wet even though my service was supposed to include blow drying.

I went to the Ulta in Plymouth Meeting to have gel polish removed and a gel manicure done. The entire process (removal and new gel manicure) is supposed to take 45min according to their website. After an hour the employee had only removed my polish and shaped my nails - if you can call it that. I still have polish on my nails and they are no discernible shape even though I asked for round. I have been getting gel manicures for years in various nail salons and have never had such an awful experience. The employee had no experience or training. A total rip off. I should have come here to read reviews before I made this appointment.

The store is nice, clean, has a lot of products...but be prepared to do your own counseling via a smartphone or reading labels etc. The staff here is completely unreliable in the knowledge department. Even if someone tells you they're a makeup artist-follow your instincts, look it up online or bring a friend. I've gotten inaccurate advice on multiple trips to this store and I've overheard employees giving terrible advice to people who are saying they have skin problems-- seriously frustrating to watch someone give such bad advice to a vulnerable customer...last time I was here I ended up helping multiple customers with some common sense advice when I heard them being led in a skin irritating direction! I don't think anyone expects a PhD but some basic knowledge about which ingredients are going to exacerbate which skin issues should be a prerequisite!!!!

I saw nadean at the salon for the first time and her bedside manner was worse than terrible. In fact the worst ive ever seen and cant believe i had to pay to be treated so poorly. She was miserable, nasty and bitter from the moment i walked in. She forgot to greet me and was argumentative over everything. Would never go back to her. Not even sure id go back to the salon if they are any bit like her. I cant imagine why anyone would treat another human being the way she treated me.

5 days ago I purchased a body wash for $18 and 2 other body washes for $6.99 each.
They are now on sale for $12 and buy one get one free respectively.
i brought them back to the store today and they would not let me repurchase them for the sale price.That's a $13 difference.But they allow people to return cosmetics they have used and don't like!
I don't know of any other store that doesn't honor a sale price.
I will not be going back!

I'm not a big fan of this place. I will start with the one positive I can think of. They carry a good selection of products and high quality brands. Most of my go-to beauty brands are carried by Ulta. Also, the rewards program is pretty good. I hate to turn this review into a comparison with Sephora but it's hard not to compare the two stores. I will probably always choose Sephora over Ulta if I have the option of going to either. Ulta doesn't give samples, which I think is ridiculous, Sephora is very generous with the samples. If i'm considering buying a $40 foundation, I want to be able to try it first and make sure it is going to work for me. Also, Sephora does free makeovers with $50 purchase, where as Ulta you have to pay to get your makeup done. I'm not sure I would want to get my makeup done here, I don't know if the workers are even trained makeup artists. As for this location, the customer service is hit or miss, mostly miss. Most of the time, I have been unable to get any help and am ignored. Once or twice, I have encountered an employee who was knowledgable and have helped me out. Not my first choice, but if I just need to buy a specific item quick I will go here.

Great selection of products but what a mess.  People seriously destroy the testers here.  What can they do?  I just can't give this place more than 3 stars because no one ever offers to help me.  Maybe because my makeup is on point?

I generally like going to Ulta. Their stuff is pricey but it's also good quality ,but when I went to the store today, I didn't like the fact that I was followed as soon as I walked into the doors. That has never happened before and it made me very uncomfortable and I didn't appreciate it. This employee  didn't ask me if I needed any help or if I had any questions. She just came out from behind the counter and followed me right over to the eyeliner section and hovered there for several minutes.I can only assume it's because of one thing and I really don't appreciate that.

Nightmare at the salon:
Made an appointment the night before in which I stated "no newbies, I need a colorist that knows what they're doing because I'm getting my hair colored for my brothers wedding the next day." I walk in and I'm not in the "system" so someone named Ebony (no clue if she's new) said she would do it. I have golden highlighted hair and needed a toner. I told her I needed to lighten and brighten in up. She showed me the swatches and I said "I need a 9" and she stated that would be too light so she gave me an 8 which ended up darkening my whole head. She knew she screwed up and apologized and then added another toner (9) to brighten it which turned it mousey and ashy. So the balayage that I've been working on for months is ruined. I was so upset and unconvinced that she knew what she was doing to add stuff another toner that I walked out of the salon 2 hours later with my hair soaking wet, upset, and now screwed because my brothers wedding is tomorrow. Never again.

Incredibly disappointed with the dermetologica facial service. Before my appointment I told the facialist that I need a lot of extractions for my blackheads. I was shocked when my facial was done given that she never turned on the steamer and her definition of an "extraction" was using her fingers to squeeze out a few blackheads from my nose. When I expressed my disappointment I was told that she "didn't know how to use the steamer" and the blackheads were "difficult to get out"- perhaps because the steamer wasn't put on in the first place. I should not have paid nearly $50 for something I could have done in my own bathroom. I have been very satisfied with my facials at other Ulta locations.  I would not recommend going to this store.

I give this Ulta location a solid two and a half stars. It's a nice big store in the Metroplex just down the road from the Plymouth Meeting Mall. As I begin browsing I am happy to see that the shelves are pretty well stocked. Locations I was used to in Delaware were constantly lacking in certain make up brands including their own and their clearance section kept getting bigger and bigger. 

I was able to find all the stuff I wanted. The employees were all busy doing things on the floor but none of them said hello. I wouldn't say they were unfriendly perhaps just oblivious. That did change at check out. I got a real nice associate who gave me my birthday gift even though I didn't have the email to claim it. I'm glad about that because this email business is nonsense. If I give you my rewards number and you see my account and it tells you it's my birthday month what the hell do I need an email for? She gave me a mini Mac lipstick and a full size Tarte masacara. That along with my 3.50 coupon and I walked away with some great stuff for only 20.00.

I tend to only have Sundays free, which makes it hard to find time to get my hair cut. When I saw that the salon here was open on Sundays, I decided to try it.
You can book the appointment online, and get cost estimates up front, which I definitely appreciate.
Whitney was AWESOME. I have long, wavy hair that I'd been growing out after a bad cut at a $$$ salon in center city. She asked me lots of practical questions, made suggestions, and talked me through everything. The salon was super clean, and I didn't feel like she was rushing  at all. She even walked me through what she was doing as she styled and dried my hair, so I could replicate it at home. Best haircut of my life, and I paid $47 before tip for an hour and 20 minutes of washing, cutting, and styling.

I have been contemplating about writing a review about this Ulta store.  The review has nothing to do with the store itself, but the return policy of this particular store. This store would not allow me to return the Living Proof traveling kit which includes shampoo, conditioner and styling cream.  I used the product once; it was terrible for my hair. It was too heavy and made my hair incredibly greasy.  Side note: I have lupus, so my hair is already severely compromised and have severe hair loss that I hide with extensions. I mention this, because obviously, its not like just anyone with healthy hair returning a product they "just don't like."  The manager refused to give me a refund for the product because "more than 20% was missing." THESE ARE TRAVEL BOTTLES. One use of the product is 20%.  I felt myself starting to get upset because A) I have an autoimmune disease that causes me to have issues and B) her attitude/lack of empathy towards someone who is sick and just wants her money back for a hair product. I left the products there with my receipt and stated, "Well, I have no use for this so you can keep it for a sample" then walked out of the store.

I called Ulta corporate when I got home. The customer service rep stated that it is not part of their return policy that you cannot return a product if 20% or more used.  I received a full refund. I told them to please discuss this issue with the Plymouth Meeting, PA store as well as customer service skills.

If I could give this location 0 stars, I would. I used to be an employee here and was so unhappy. I love makeup and working that job made me hate it. Customer service was always terrible even when I worked there. Most of the girls don't want to be there half the time and management does nothing to motivate them. The store is always messy and nothing is ever stocked. I'm so glad I don't work there anymore and if I were you, I would take an extra 20 minutes and drive down to Warrington.

I received a facial with Candace. During my facial two different products were spilled onto my eyelid and worked its way into my eye at the beginning as well as towards the end. A third product that tastes like rubbing alcohol was dripped into my nostril twice. It ran down my throat and into my mouth. This made my throat burn and left a strong acidic taste in my mouth and throat. Due to this my nose poured mucous for the remainder of the service. My left eye was running as well - I am not sure if this is from the product in my nose or eye or both. An hour later and I still have a burning swollen throat as well as a nostril pouring mucous trying to get the product out of it. My eye burns as well and is somewhat swollen. I am left with a red hot and burning left nostril, left side of my throat and left eye. I was refunded but disappointed not offered more since I am not only in pain but also too embarrassed to go in public.
